name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Assassins
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Tyranids
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Tyranids is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This codex covers the Tyranids race detailing their history, equipment, organization, special rules and powers, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
The Tyranids are the most rapidly evolving race in the galaxy. They are super-predators destined to hunt all others to extinction. Inside you will find:

Army Lists: The complete Tyranid army list, which allows you to choose your forces for a tabletop battle. Also included are Tyranid Hive Mind powers, symbiote bio-weapons and biomorph enhancements for Tyranid creatures.

Hobby Section: Sixteen full colour pages packed with advice and tips on collecting, modelling and playing with a Tyranid army.

Genetic Modification: New rules for designing custom hive fleets, mutants and modifying Tyranid creatures to create unique species.

Special Monsters: Two infamous Tyranid creatures are described: Old One Eye and the Red Terror!

ISBN: 1-84154-013-7
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: DiceFest 2019 Promo Cards
description:
3 promo cards given away to attendees of DiceFest 2019. Contained the following cards:

Vicious Enemies (Low Threat, Promo #334)
Vicious Enemies (Medium Threat, Promo #335)
Vicious Enemies (High Threat, Promo #336)
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Fragments of Rome
description:
Locked away and forgotten, the broken and weathered Great Marble Map of Rome bears in its inscriptions the secrets of the ancient imperial city. Mere fragments are all that posterity has preserved of this once-four-story-tall map.

Yet, twenty-first century technology makes possible high-resolution imaging and matching of the crumbling marble fragments, presenting an opportunity to reconstitute this one-of-a-kind map crafted at the start of the third century.

In this cooperative tile-placement game for 1–4 players, you are one of a team of experts, entrepreneurs, and public figures tasked with reconstructing the monumental Great Marble Map of Rome. You must work together to construct an image of ancient Rome using tiles representing fragments of the map.

Yet, competition lies beneath the veneer of cooperation. Each player has an agenda influencing their work on the map. Balancing the conflicting interests of professors and politicians, real estate developers and museum curators will be as important as working together to assemble the map.

—description from the designer

name: Soccer Blast Pro Soccer Game: International Football Legends Expansion
description:
This amazing new card set was created by soccer aficionado and historian Bill Hild.

Included innovations such as "doubled qualities" for a few super-star players—which bringing added depth and realism to the cards and elevates the performances of the greatest-of-the-great.

There are 22 teams, each with 20 players and three goal keepers. A few of the world’s dominant soccer nations—Argentina, Brazil, England, for example—have had so many great players over so many years, they were allotted two teams in this set. (Rosters for each team are shown below.)
Over 500 of the greatest soccer stars who ever took the pitch, each team presented in “national” colors.

name: Island Empire
description:
You just landed on an amazing island far away from the noise of the empire. Now it’s up to you to start your own empire. But wait, there are other settlers that have also landed and want to try to claim the land for their own. Time to roll the dice, collect the essential supplies, gather resources, and gain more settlers.

In this 2-4 player roll and write game, players take the role of settler planning to start their own empire on an island. You roll the 6 dice and choose one to place your resources on a plot of land. You can choose to place either Food, Wood, or Stone. Unlike the majority of roll and writes, each player takes turns to choose one dice and utilize the value on the chosen die.

You score points by connecting 3 resources of the same type. Any unused resources go to the Waste area and you lose points for those. The player with the highest points wins. So carefully plan your island empire and beat the others.

name: FOROG
description:
Forog (which means to turn in Hungarian) is an abstract game for 2 players.

The game consists of a rubberwood board foldable in 2 and 19 wooden marbles, coloured in 6 different colours (3 marbles of each colour) + a natural wooden marble, and a wooden pot.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to place three of his balls in the opposing camp.

To begin with, each player chooses 3 colours of marbles and places them in 3 different holes on the board (which has 6 + a central hole).

In turn, each player takes all the marbles from one of the holes and deposits them one by one in the following holes.

As soon as a hole in his own camp contains 5 balls, he can select one of his balls and put it in the central hole. The other balls will be distributed normally. This is only possible if the natural wood marble is not in this hole. It is not mandatory.

Concerning this natural wood marble, the 1st player who puts a marble in the centre has the possibility to put the colourless marble in the hole he has just emptied. This marble then travels like the other balls during the game. The natural wooden ball is therefore a double-edged sword: it allows to block the opponent and forces him to redistribute his balls, but keeping it in his camp implies sacrificing one of his holes. Knowing when to keep the natural ball or when to send it to the opponent's side is therefore a determining factor in winning the game.

name: Space Station IN-248: Five Parsecs Scenario 3
description:
This scenario pack for Five Parsecs From Home can be worked into any ongoing campaign and sends you into a derelict research station to download computer files.

Space Station IN-248 offers a replayable scenario, fighting off alien hordes while trying to achieve your objectives. You may even get a new prototype weapon out of the deal.

This pack is intended for use with the current iteration of Five Parsecs From Home. To ensure the most compatible result, make sure you've downloaded the most recent update to the rules.

There is no need to restart your campaign to use this pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels – Black Knight
description:
Black Knight is a new playable character for Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels. This pack comes with the Black Knight model, Black Knight standee, 1 boss AI deck, and 1 hero/boss card.

Black Knight, as a playable hero, has a unique ability called Dark Wave, allowing him to attack players from far away! A deadly ability, as you can push heroes from a safe distance. As a boss, his special ability allows him to bounce around and keep attacking other knights, as long as damage is dealt. He is truly a worthy adversary for our heroic Shovel Knight!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That

name: Poll Mania Football
description:
Poll Mania Football is a game that simulates a college football season, by following the games and rankings of the Top 20 teams. Each week you will resolve all the games for the ranked teams, rolling dice for each team's score and adjusting the result by the team ratings. Each team has ratings for offense and defense, home and away. After each week's games are completed, you will calculate the rankings for the next week using simple addition and subtraction, to simulate a real college football poll.

—description from the designer

name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.2 1420-1783
description:
2nd volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume covers the Pike & Shot and 18th century eras.
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
publishers: Stanley Paul & Co Ltd, The History of Wargaming Project

name: The Sable Scourge
description:
The Sable Scourge is a semi-cooperative game played on an open world map. Players will use their turns to investigate areas of interest and stop the Sable Scourge and her henchmen from tearing up Bright City. Preventing these events and stopping the evil-doers can extend the game and give you more time to prepare for the final battle. Be careful though; if someone isn't at the right place at the right time, the final battle could approach faster. Use the glory you garner along the way to heal up, escape battles, and collect items. Every action can affect your renown (positive and negative), and the player with the most renown at the end is the winner.

Even though the game offer cooperation and teamwork skills, there is only one winner in the end, so don't share too much of the glory and claim all the renown for yourself to be the best hero Bright City has ever seen.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Finale Ending, Move Through Deck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.3 1792-1859
description:
3rd volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume starts with the French Revolution, cover the Napoleonic wars in details and up to the Franco-Austrian War.
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period.
publishers: Stanley Paul & Co Ltd, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Pack o' Dogs
description:
Pack o’ Dogs is a quick 2-player card game featuring unique artwork of 40 dogs and 4 cats. Both players flip their cards over for simultaneous play. Form packs on the table with a hierarchy of determining which card is best when. The dogs form their packs with dogs of the same size, or dogs of neighboring sizes in the same color. Cats are unique, befriending the smallest and the largest dogs in their color, as well as other cats.

Pack o’ Dogs has two included versions in the rules: the Base Game and the Complex Game.

The Base Game has a little less strategy than the Complex Game so it is perfect for first time players, younger kids, or when you simply just want a faster more relaxed game. The scoring is based on the number of cards you have in your score pile and the game ends when you reach the bottom of the deck (no reshuffling the discard pile). The score pad is not used for this version.

The Complex Game requires more strategy than the Base Game. It involves planning out your moves, remembering what cards you know your opponent has, and which cards have already gone past to determine the best card to play. The game consists of a best of 7 rounds (i.e. first player to win 4 rounds ends the game, but doesn’t necessarily win the game). The score pad is used to write down your points for each round and tells you which rounds give you bonus points. You get bonus points for winning streaks and for winning the later rounds, so winning that final round could turn the whole game around!

Contents:
Deck of 45 Cards - 4 colors (white, red, black, yellow) of various sizes (numbers 1-10 and a cat, for each color), and 1 treat card
6 Reference Cards - 3 for each player for quick rule reminders
1 Score Pad - 20 sheets with 3 games per sheet (60 games total)
1 Rule Sheet

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Split Second: Solitaire Firefights Against The Clock
description:
Split Second is a card-based wargame where the player controls a team of soldiers referred to as Operators in special operations and SWAT-style missions involving violent resolutions.
The game is played using cards to represent the physical components of the battlespace, dice to resolve actions with uncertain outcomes, tokens for recording some effects, and a timer to apply pressure to the player's decision-making process.

The player chooses a Mission from the Mission Dossier, which will include a roster of cards that represent the environment with pieces of cover, doors, and other elements referred to as Props as well as cards representing the opposition referred to as Hostiles. These cards are combined into small decks in a manner that uses randomization and fixed elements to form an Encounter. The same Encounter can play out differently each time it is played because of the randomization of the cards, forcing the player to think on their feet and adapt to changing circumstances. This also makes each scenario highly replayable.

Unlike most games that use a board with spaces or miniatures on a playing surface, in Split Second the playing area is abstracted using cards to represent the battlefield.
Ranges aren't measured in physical distance, but instead cards are placed into Areas that are split up by Area Divider cards.
Movement between objects isn't made in any linear measurement, but in movement points as the combatants anchor themselves to and then move away from objects in the battlezone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Most Awful Situation: 1814 in France – The Campaign of France & The Six Days
description:
The Most Awful Situation, 1814 in France: The Campaign of France and The Six Days

After the crushing defeat of the French Army at Leipzig, a series of small actions allowed what was left to retire into France; but the hostilities continued through January as the Allies pressed vigorously. In mid-February the Emperor had determined to change the conditions of the war. Outnumbered four to one, the French would go on the offensive. Napoleon conducted the most brilliant campaign of his career: The Six Days; fighting and winning four battles in six days.

The Most Awful Situation includes everything you need to begin recreating the first two phases of 1814: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Two campaigns,
Nine scenarios,
Twenty-seven maps,
hundreds of uniform images created especially for inclusion in this series and offering!


Outnumbered 4:1, bring it on…
10 scenarios covering both the initial Campaign of France and The Six Days:

Hoogstraten
1st Bar-sur-Aube
Brienne
La Rothière
Lesmont
Nogent
Champaubert
Montmirail
Château-Thierry
Vauchamps


The Most Awful Situation Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Didn't Dare Do Anything: 1812 in Russia  – The Flanks of the Invasion
description:
Didn't Dare Do Anything is the first sequel to Master of the World, 1812 in Russia!
When Napoleon invaded Russia in the summer of 1812, he detached forces both north and south to cover the flanks of the Main Army. The Russians were forced to respond by doing the same. But separated from their chief, the hesitant, and sometimes reluctant generals acted erratically. Their uncertainly made only worse by the Emperor's constant correspondence of orders, questions, and demands.
Didn't Dare Do Anything provides scenarios pitting former allies like the Austrians and Russians against each other, as well as highlighting Russian initiative vs French hesitancy. Didn't Dare Do Anything is a unique look into the problems that would snowball to plague Napoleon's 1813 campaigns.

Didn't Dare Do Anything expands Master of the World!
You can choose to play the scenarios of Didn't Dare Do Anything alone, or as an expansion to Master of the World, expanding its campaign!

Eight scenarios
Twenty-four maps
Hundreds of uniform images!
created especially for inclusion in this series and offering
Over 100 pages
8 scenarios covering the flanks of Napoleon's invasion of Russian:
Eckau
Kobryn
Yakubovo
Klyastitsy
Golovchtchitzy
Swolna
Gorodeczna
1st Polotsk



Didn't Dare Do Anything is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Código Secreto: Expansión promocional Chile
description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Chile.
This promo pack is produced by Devir and it was given as a promo.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Monopoly: Animaniacs
description:
Scene-stealing Warner siblings Yakko, Wakko, and Dot are joined by Pinky and the Brain and Dr. Otto von Scratchansniff in this reimagined Monopoly game. Players bounce around the board collecting other cast members, locations, and more from the 90s hit cartoon.

Monopoly original Description...
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Crown the Unicorn
description:
This is a fun children's tile game of search and find, suitable for anyone from 4 years old to grown ups. It's easy to set up and simple to play.

'The lion and the unicorn were fighting for the crown.' The unicorn won the crown, but the lion has chased her into the forest. As she escaped the unicorn dropped the crown somewhere on the forest path, where you have found it. You want to return her crown, but can you find the unicorn? Can you avoid the angry lion? Don't worry if you come across the dragon - he is friendly and will help you on your way.

Be the first to find and crown the unicorn.

—description from the publisher

name: Bluebell
description:
Deep forest in England.
The fairies celebrate their reunion on the Bluebell Carpet.

The player has two cards.
Play one or discard one on your turn.
Cards are stacked seasonally and returned to the deck in winter.
You will receive harvest tokens in the fall, but you may lose them.
If you run out of tokens and cannot pay, the round ends and you are the loser.
The loser gives the winner a "Bluebell" and the player who receives the two "blue bells" wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Joe Connaissant: Cinema
description:
For lovers of cinema (French)

384 questions that will allow you to showcase your knowledge.
Put your knowledge to the fore and wow your opponents! Nothing's worked out with the views guy. Stand up in front of the opposing team by answering as many questions as possible in 45 seconds.
Who wins?
The team with the most points at the end of the fifth round.


Pour les amateurs de cinéma

384 questions qui vous permettront de faire l’étalage de vos connaissances.
Mettez votre savoir en tête d’affiche et épatez vos adversaires! Rien n’est arrangé avec le gars des vues. Pétez-vous les bretelles devant l’équipe adverse en répondant au plus de questions possible en 45 secondes.
Qui l’emporte?
L’équipe ayant le plus de points à la fin de la cinquième manche.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Virus War
description:
Virus War is a 2-8 player merciless and hilarious board game. Get ready to put your friendships to the test in a very contagiously addictive tabletop game.

You’ll have to show unremitting determination to be the ultimate survivor of this viral war.

Contaminate your adversaries, get a vaccine, revenge yourself, sabotage any action of others players... The wide diversity of cards will perfectly match with your strategies to make every game ruthless and unique.

On your masks, get set, contaminate!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, King of the Hill, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: That's My Sundae!
description:
That’s My Sundae! is a dessert dreamland where everyone screams for ice cream! Indulge in your very own sundae swirl creation with this engaging, easy-to-learn card game that guarantees a bowl full of family fun.

Score points by building the sweetest sundae in the game! A crunchy waffle cone topped with cookie dough ice-cream and whipped cream will have your opponents licking their lips with dessert-envy. But, watch out for melted scoops, broken cones, or striking brain freeze which could take a bite out of your points! Save your sundae from the dessert destroyers by locking your complete sundae and keep their sticky fingers off your ice-cream with the signature “That's My Sundae!” card.

The best sundae wins the prize for earning the most points!

-description from publisher's website

Players will play two cards from their hand which could be sundae component cards (cone, ice cream, toppings) to build complete sundaes and/or action cards, but watch out, there are cards that can be played against you that can ruin or steal sections of your sundae. At the end of each turn, players will draw back up to their hand limit.

Each round will end once a player completes a specific number of sundaes (varies based on player count). Players will add up the points of their played cards each round (completed and not completed sundaes). After three rounds, who ever has the most points win!

-user summary
mechanics: Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Take That

name: Five Leagues from the Borderlands: Warband Pack 1 – Dwarf Expeditions
description:
With Warband Pack 1 you can add Dwarf characters to your campaigns of Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

Whether you want to add a single character to spice things up or play a campaign as a dwarf expedition into the borderlands, this pack offers everything you need:

Character creation,
an updated skill table,
dwarf special rules and
campaign mechanics for earning family honor (and rewards) and recruiting more of the stout, little folk.


You also receive a short essay on dwarf characteristics and personalities in the world of Five Leagues.
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wyrd: The Descent
description:
It is a Dark Age in Wyrd: The Descent, and you are Wyrd now.

Magik has cursed you with demonic possession.

The only escape from possession is death.

But your demon will not let you go quietly. You must seek your release from the Horrors that infest this world, the same Horrors you once fought to destroy.

Venture into the Hollows, the ancient and forgotten places of the world, lure out dark Horrors, and take as many of them with you as you can before they drag you to your grave. For you are Wyrd now.

Wyrd: The Descent is a Grimdark, solo, pen and paper dungeon crawl. All you need is the rules, a standard set of RPG dice, a pen and some paper.

Roll the dice to determine what Hollows you find, how many Horrors await you there, how you destroy them and if there is anything you can Scavenge from their cursed remains. The game will only end when you have succumbed to your fate and destroyed as many Horrors as you possibly can.

—description from the designer

Full rules available for free from the files section here on BGG.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling

name: Game of the Gods
description:
Players draft teams of deities from all over the world to compete in Olympic-style competition games. Players will use gold resources to draft their deities, working to build a team of five gods for competition. After teams have been drafted, players then use stats on their team to assign competitors for each event, earning gold, silver, and bronze medals for performance.

At the end of the game, players earn victory points (with bonuses for matching deities and home origins) based on the medals they have earned. The play with the most points wins.

-description from publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: MEGAcquire GOLD
description:
MEGAcquire GOLD is my next step in continuing the quest to expand Sid Sackson's magnificent ideas and get them onto as many gaming tables as possible. You can secure a new challenge based on an old, favorite, and familiar game for the price of $80 plus shipping to your location after production is complete in May 2022. Not a cheap cardboard rendition of an icon, on which the pieces slide across the board, but a tough durable plastic edition with an expanded board and hexagon shaped tiles. Double the possibilities, double the fun, and an outcome undecided until the end.

We have made a few minor changes from the production run of MEGAcquire and this next production run of MEGAcquire GOLD. The money has been changed to prepaid debit cards and the denominations have been raised to 1, 5, 10, & 50 million. Who will become the first billionaire in MEGAcquire GOLD? The rule booklet has a new cover and included in the booklet is a sample game narration to help first time players and a Stock Price Extension Chart that is used to help calculate payouts when companies are bought out and at the end of the game. We have also enlarged the tile holders and redesigned the box insert for better storage. The company markers are being made in three different shapes to better designate the difference in their starting price value and to give them a 3D effect. The playing tiles will be gold. So as the board fills up during game play, it turns to gold!

MEGAcquire GOLD is an exciting journey of strategy and luck, for three to six players, through the corporate world of building empires and wealth. Live in the world of fun and fortune as you maneuver to outwit your opponents. Build and merge companies while shrewdly buying, trading, and selling stocks to become the wealthiest player. Each player builds companies by adding tiles, and they increase their wealth by purchasing stocks in these companies. Cash flow is obtained by selling majority and minority shares through mergers. It is not always prudent to have the most stock in the biggest company if you can build and sell enough smaller companies to generate a large income. Many different strategies can be used to reach the pinnacle of the corporate world, but you will always need the “luck of the draw”.

MEGAcquire GOLD will appeal to players of any age who like the feeling of power that is acquired through achievement. It is recommended for ages 13 and up, but cannot be limited in age because of the early possession of business savvy that can be found in younger players. Average playing time is two to three hours, but shorter time limits can easily be set.

MEGAcquire GOLD is a perfect learning tool to teach younger people a sense of how the world of investing works. It illustrates how investing in stocks can be very strategic, but at the same time requires some luck. They learn how their wealth can grow as they build their companies, and how their cash flow can increase by selling companies, while subsequently using the profit to make more investments.

MEGAcquire GOLD is played on a 15" x 13" plastic board that contains 182 hexagon spaces with 182 corresponding hexagon tiles. The hexagon shape allows six different ways to connect. For MEGAcquire GOLD, the board will be colored silver and the tiles will be colored gold. Therefore, as the game progresses, it turns to gold. Each hexagon is labeled with a designation A-1 through N-13 and each tile has a corresponding designation for its place on the board. Each player draws 12 tiles to start the game and then draws a replacement tile after each turn. The tiles are used to create and grow companies. While creating and growing these companies, the players buy, trade, and sell stocks in an attempt to become the wealthiest player.

There are 14 different companies to choose from when building an empire -- seven hotels and seven corporations. Each company has a colored Company Marker that represents that company's designation. The companies have different starting values that include low, medium, & high-priced companies.

The seven hotels are:
Luster - Red - 2 million starting price per share
Teton - Yellow - 2 million starting price per share
Arcadia - Dark Blue - 3 million starting price per share
Global - Brown - 3 million starting price per share
Fanfare - Green - 3 million starting price per share
Krause - Teal - 4 million starting price per share
Regal - Pink - 4 million starting price per share

The seven corporations are:
Unity - Beige - 2 million starting price per share
Solon - Gray - 2 million starting price per share
Watts - Purple - 3 million starting price per share
Helix - Orange - 3 million starting price per share
Digital - Baby Blue - 3 million starting price per share
Quasar - Charcoal - 4 million starting price per share
Physics - Burgundy - 4 million starting price per share

The markers for the hotels and corporations are "buildings." The "small buildings" are used to designate the lower priced companies. The "medium buildings" are used to designate the medium priced companies. The "large buildings" are used to designate the high priced companies. Each marker is colored to match the company it represents.

There are 25 stock certificates for each company. When the supply has been purchased, there are no more stocks available unless a player trades some back to the bank when they are out of money or the stocks are returned through mergers.

How To Play MEGAcquire GOLD:

Players can play one tile per turn. When two hexagons are placed together, they form a company. The player who places the tile that starts the company gets to chose what company they want from those that are available. The player then receives a free share of stock in that company as a founding bonus.

Players are allowed to purchase six stock certificates of any company on the board during their turns. By receiving the free share of stock, the player who starts the company always has control of keeping majority shareholder status in that company unless they decide to purchase something else before they hold a "true majority". Since there are 25 stock certificates for each company, a true majority is attained when a player owns 13 shares. No other player can purchase more shares than the player who holds 13 shares.

Stock values increase as tiles are played that grow companies. The Information Cards are used to keep track of stock prices and shareholder bonuses as the companies grow and merge. As the companies grow, smaller companies will be merged into larger companies. This is accomplished when a tile is played that connects two companies together. The larger company always takes out the smaller company. If the companies are of equal size, before the merging tile is played, the player who plays this tile gets to decide which company will survive.

At the time of the merger, the players who hold first and second majority in the smaller company receive bonuses, and all players who hold stock in the smaller company have the option to sell their stock for the current market value. A player can choose to keep their stock if they expect the company to open again. When a tile is played that merges more than one company, the companies are cashed out starting with the smallest company first.

Companies are considered "safe" when they reach 21 tiles. A "safe" company means that they can't be taken over by a larger company and will remain on the board until the end of the game. Tiles that would connect two safe companies cannot be played. Instead, those tiles are turned over on their designated spaces on the board and new tiles are drawn. Companies can increase in value up to the level of 101 tiles.

Each player starts with 120 million. Investing this money is based on the tiles in a player's hand and the companies they can grow. When a player runs out of money and it is their turn, they can trade stocks they have purchased for other stocks that are more beneficial to their portfolio. Yet they can only trade the amount of stocks it takes to raise money for the stocks they are purchasing. Players cannot trade stocks for cash.

A large amount of money can be generated by opening and selling small companies, which creates cash flow to reinvest. But conversely, a large wealth can be accumulated by holding majority in the larger companies. The winner needs the ideal mix of investing, and a little bit of luck, that provides the greatest wealth.

It takes approximately two to three hours to fill the entire board of MEGAcquire GOLD, but shorter time limits can be set. If you only want to play for an hour and a half, just be sure to let all players have equal turns and end the game at the designated time. At that time, all companies are cashed out at the current market value, which is based on the number of tiles in the company. All players count their earnings and the player with the most money is the MEGAcquire GOLD Master.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Investment, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Phoenix Command: Civilian & Police Weapon Data Supplement
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-toman skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Phoenix Command takes to the streets.This supplement to the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System includes over 100 common small arms currently available to civilians, or in use by police forces across the United States. Included are:

- Revolvers (from Twin Shot Derringer to 44 Magnum)
- Automatic Pistols (22 Long Rigle to 44 AutoMag)
- Bolt Action rifles (Remington 22-250 to 460 Weatherby)
- Lever action rifles (20-20 to 444 Marlin)
- Semi-automatic rifles (Ruger 10/22 to Browning BAR)
- Paramilitary weapons (Uzi pistol to HK 93)
- Police weapons (AMD180 to M40 Sniper Rifle)
- Shotguns (410 Gauge to 10 Gauge Magnum)

With this fully illustrated supplement, Phoenix Command has a whole new range of uses, including police, espionage, and post-apocalypse settings.

The Revolution in Game Design continues
-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Civilian Weapon Data Supplement
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-toman skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Now the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System has been expanded to include 117 of the most popular firearms currently available to civilians and police across the United States. Included are:- Revolvers, from the Derringer to the 454 Casull Automatic Pistols, from the Walther PPK to the LAR Grizzly
- Bolt Action Rifles, from the Remington 22-250 to the 460 Weatherby
- Lever Action Rifles, from the 30-30 Winchester to the 444 Marlin
- Semi-Automatic Rifles, from the Ruger 10/22 to the Browning BAR
- Paramilitary Weapons, from the Uzi Pistol to the Heckler & Koch M93
- Shotguns, from the 410 Gauge to the 10 Gauge Magnum

This is the 2nd Edition of the Civilian Weapon Data Supplement, and includes many new weapon entries, among them the Glock 9mm, the LAR Grizzly in 9mm & 45 Winchester Magnum, the Bren 10mm, the Desert Eagle 44 Magnum, and the 454 Casull.

With this fully illustrated supplement, Phoenix Command has a wide range of new uses, including espionage, police, and post-apocalypse settings.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Special Weapons Weapon Data Supplement
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This Special Weapons Supplement to the Phoenix Command Combat System contains all the necessary rules and data for a wide variety of unusual or distinctive weapon systems, included are:- Riot Control Gear, from Tear Gas to Plastic Bullets
- Protest Weapons, from Rocks and Bottles to Molotov Cocktails
- Incendiary Weapons, from White Phosphorus Grenades to World War II and Modern Flamethrowers
- Modern Military Equipment, from Claymore Mines to Miniguns
- Archery Equipment, from the Horsebow of ancient times to the modern Compound Target Bow
- Weapons of Stealth, from Silencers for Sub-machineguns and Pistols to Garrotes and Strangulation Techniques

This supplement allows Phoenix Command players to incorporate a wide variety of powerful, unusual, or highly specialized weapons into their gaming.

-from the back cover

name: Misja Kampinos
description:
Misja Kampinos is an easy boardgame published for LGD Kampinos (Between Vistula and Kampinos association). It was distributed for free on autumn 2019 during series of local events.

Players blaze trails through Kampinos forest, visit important places, seek for the wild areas and observe animals. During the game, they learn about local nature, history, monuments and important places (NGO's, parks, sport areas). After the game they analyse their trails and can decide to follow this trails in real-life walk tours.

The game consists of draft, set collection and push-your-luck mechanisms. It's simple and fast, so you can play it either with your family or friends.

Every card shows different real place in Kampinos, that is worth visiting. Every card encourages players to visit the forest.

Game was originally printed only in Polish, but you can play it even if only one of players knows the language.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck

name: Victory at Sea: USS Missouri
description:
Only the mighty Yamato displaced more than the massive, yet very fast, Iowa-class battleships.
The last battleship to be commissioned by the USA, USS Missouri known as the ‘Mighty Mo’ acted as venue for the Japanese surrender in WWII.
Iowa-class ships saw service far beyond the Second World War and were upgraded with modern electronics, weapons systems and cruise missiles – USS Missouri was finally decommissioned in 1992 after a distinguished career.

Contents:
1 Model Ship
‣ USS Missouri
1 Ship Card
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Crosswords
description:
Crosswords is a word game in the spirit of Scrabble, on a unique grid and with some options that make it a different (and more interesting) game.


The board is an octagon-diamond grid, where the octagons hold the letters, and randomly selected intermediate diamonds indicate letter or word bonuses.
Bonuses not always in the same places, and score for each letter placed adjacent to them.
Octagons instead of squares, allow diagonal words to be visualized..


Words can be restricted to the traditional horizontal and vertical directions, or diagonal words can be allowed. Other options include playing "backwards" words, and playing multiple connected words at once.

All combined, Crosswords is a lot more varied and strategic than Scrabble. The variable
number and position of the bonuses, and the multiple use of bonuses, makes play a lot more
variable. Likewise, allowing backwards and diagonal words unclogs the grid, which can
expand in any direction.

name: Second World War at Sea: Eastern Fleet – British Carriers
description: In Eastern Fleet, there is significant historical disparity between the the strength of the British Eastern Fleet and the Japanese First Air Fleet. This supplement seeks to increase the strength of the Eastern Fleet to allow for a more head to head assault. The supplement comes with 25 new pieces (10 ship and 15 aircraft) and 4 new scenarios (2 operational and 2 battle).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Bullseye & Daredevil
description:
As a boy, Matt Murdock was blinded in an accident involving radioactive chemicals. Though he could no longer see, the chemicals heightened Murdock’s other senses and imbued him with an incredible 360-degree radar sense. With years of martial arts training under the ninja master Stick and fueled by a relentless pursuit of justice, Matt Murdock protects the innocent of Hell’s Kitchen as Daredevil, the Man Without Fear!

A psychopathic assassin, Bullseye is one of the deadliest men in the world. Beyond his superb skills in hand-to-hand combat, Bullseye was born with the innate ability to throw any projectile with lethal force and accuracy. As a costumed criminal, Bullseye has crossed paths with many of the world’s greatest heroes, but he holds a special hatred for his nemesis, Daredevil, stopping at nothing to put him down once and for all.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: The Best of White Dwarf Magazine
description:
Ever since the Strategy Battle Game burst onto the scene way back in 2001, White Dwarf had featured regular content from Middle-earth – from Battle Reports and tactica to stage-by-stage modelling and painting guides, and even bespoke Scenarios. This supplement includes a collection of the very best Middle-earth articles to grace the pages of White Dwarf over the years. Whether you're a newer player looking to catch up on some classic articles or a veteran who’s after all the best content collated into a single publication, it’s got something for everyone!

This 128-page hardback supplement includes the following classic White Dwarf articles:


Orcs Attack! (White Dwarf 263)
Flight to Freedom (White Dwarf 396)
The Battle for Erebor (White Dwarf December 2017)
The Battle of Pelennor Fields (White Dwarf September 2018)
A Clash of Companies (White Dwarf April 2019)
The Search for the Stone (White Dwarfs January and February 2018)
Duel of Zirakzigil (White Dwarf 281)
Fiends and Fireworks (White Dwarf 309)
Fatty Bolger's Great Escape (White Dwarf 311)
The Hunt for Gollum (White Dwarf 302)
Warg Chase in the Wilderness (White Dwarf September 2017)
The Bigger they Are... (White Dwarf 307)
The Brown Wizard (White Dwarf April 2018)
River Assault Rules (White Dwarf 294)
War of the Long Lake (White Dwarf April 2017)
Armies of Middle-earth (White Dwarf November 2018)
Magic of Middle-earth (White Dwarf December 2018)
Modelling Workshop – Mordor Terrain (White Dwarf 344)
Flight of the Nazgûl (White Dwarf 365)
Paint Splatter – Théoden, King of Rohan (White Dwarf September 2018)
Paint Splatter – Gandalf the White and Pippin (White Dwarf December 2018)


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Five Options from the Notepad: Optional rules for Five Parsecs
description:
This expansion pack offers new optional rules for your games of Five Parsecs From Home.

Included is

an alternate approach to close combat,
rules for adopting a defensive stance in combat,
a new (risky) option for firing while dashing,
an alternate approach to armor,
a new hit point system if you want a more RPG-style experience
and finally random AI tables to make your gun fights more unpredictable.


While designed for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition, these options should be adaptable to other Five X systems as well.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Never Say Never
description:
Never Say Never is the hilarious game of horrible hypotheticals. If you’ve ever been that friend who asks your friends if they would do something really wild or crazy for say, a million dollars, then you’re likely the type of person who would get a kick out of this party game.

The rules are pretty simple. During each round of the game, one player challenges the other players with a hypothetical scenario by playing a card from their hand. If the other players would never do it, then whoever played the card gets the point. If somebody (or multiple people) would do it, then they need to explain to the group how on Earth they could justify doing something that ridiculous. Whoever’s answer is deemed the best wins the point in that instance.

The game ends when one player scores 10 points...or after everyone erupts into everlasting laughter and judgement of their friends.

-description from publisher

name: Z/X: Zillions of enemy X
description:
Z/X (pronounced as Zeks) is a one-on-one trading card game created by Broccoli and Nippon Ichi Software where the players fight against each other on 3×3 squares battlefield using different combination of offensive and defensive strategy based on 5 different worlds.

In Z/X, the first player who makes their opponent lose all 4 of their lives win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Ramses II
description:
Ramses II is a variant based on Avalon Hill's tactical battle game Alexander the Great.
The mapboard, with a few modifications, and the game system are used in the variant. The vast majority of the rules for Alexander the Great are employed; those modified or not utilized are noted below. New game counters, which represent the Hittite and Egyptian forces, are provided on the insert of this issue. With these-mapboard,
rules, counters-at hand, one can recreate the bloody Battle of Kadesh, fought over 3200 years ago.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Monopoly: Bundeswehr
description:
Monopoly: Bundeswehr
NEW GAME FUN: For you we have linked the world-famous original Monopoly board game with the Bundeswehr life. Put together your own armed forces, buy offices, training areas and show your strategic skills. There are lots of little insiders hidden that will make you laugh. Your gaming fun gets a new fun level!
LOVE OF DETAIL: Discover the world of the Bundeswehr with detailed Eurofighter, folding spades, tanks and lots of explanations and facts! Get to know everyday life and the structures in a simple and humorous way. It makes civilians smile. Soldiers will encounter funny situations from their daily work during the game!

—description from the publisher(translated)

NEUER SPIELSPAß: Für dich haben wir das weltberühmte Original Monopoly Brettspiel mit dem Bundeswehr Leben verknüpft. Stell dir deine eigene Bundeswehr zusammen, kaufe Dienststellen, Übungsplätze und zeige deine strategischen Fähigkeiten. Es sind viele kleine Insider versteckt, die dich zum Lachen bringen werden. Dein Spielspaß bekommt ein neues Spaß Level!
LIEBE ZUM DETAIL: Entdecke die Bundeswehr-Welt mit detailgetreuen Eurofighter, Klappspaten, Panzer und vielen Erklärungen und Fakten! Lerne den Alltag und die Strukturen auf einfache und humorvolle Art kennen. Es bringt Zivilisten zum Schmunzeln. Soldaten und Soldatinnen werden während des Spiels immer wieder auf lustige Situationen aus ihrem Dienstalltag treffen!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Egghead
description:
Egghead is a deduction game where players can see everyone else's cards save for their own. Each turn players read off a question and answer it according to what they see on everyone's cards. Eventually this gives players enough information to deduce what is on their own cards and winning a point.

As their predecessor What's That on My Head? (from 1963), all 4 versions of Egghead are using the 6 letters A, B,C,D,E & G. Three versions use the headbands gimmick, but in one edition you have wooden banks to hold the colored letter cards. But unlike Code 777 (numbers 1-7) the colors are not involved in gameplay.

Similar to:

What's That on My Head?
Code 777
Figure It
Amnesia
Guess What I Am!
Coyote
Pow Wow
Am I a Banana?

name: Ghosts Love Candy: Kidthulhu Promo
description:
Promo Kid Card (100) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

5
While KIDTHULHU is in the neighborhood, turn order is resolved from lowest to highest after players reveal their selected ghosts.

name: Ghosts Love Candy: Chicken Promo
description:
Promo Kid Card (101) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

20
If the CHICKEN is still in the neighborhood at the end of the game, the last player who haunted her may take 1 candy from any kid in the neighborhood.

name: BlackOut
description:
"A difficult job needs the best worker"
BlackOut P&P, you need to find an electrical coordinator capable of maintaining stability in the electrical power system and avoiding a blackout.

name: Between the Sticks Football: General Manager
description:
This is a free PnP Game designed for the 2020 Solitaire PnP Contest. Assets available in the files link.***

You are the General Manager of a new American Football team who needs to sign all 22 starters to your roster while staying under budget. Build a balanced championship level team and win.

All players are on individual mini playing cards and have a preferred salary & stat scores for 10 critical football traits like passing, blocking, & tackling. When deciding to sign a player, you place them into a starting spot on the game board which values 3 of the 10 traits. The player's scores will generate one of 4 types of victory points (Toughness, Explosiveness, Intelligence and Skill). You win by keeping these 4 victory point totals in balance while assembling a skillful team.

With a salary cap of $500MM, you need to decide who to sign, how much to pay & what they will contribute to your overall team. Do you have the vision needed to assemble a champion?

Designed by Joe Fontana (Formulaic Games)

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Puzzle, Sports
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Investment, Layering, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Justice League International
description: 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe game. Includes Blue Beetle, Booster Gold, Doctor Fate, Martian Manhunter, Mr. Miracle, and Shazam.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Lexcorp Army
description: 6 detailed resin figures and character cards for the DC Universe Miniature game. Includes Lex Luthor Warsuit, Metallo, Lexcorp Heavy Trooper, and 3 Lexcorp Troopers.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Necrons
description:
The Necrons are a deathless race of alien androids, rulers of the galaxy in a long-forgotten era. Now, having slumbered in stasis for millennia, they are rising up to conquer it again. Clad in self-repairing bodies of living metal and wielding weapons that harness the most devastating energies of the cosmos, the Necrons are a terrifying enemy. Fearless, relentless, and utterly without mercy, they advance in serried ranks and lay down withering storms of fire fit to annihilate even the mightiest of foes. The hyper-resilient Necron soldiery are supported by murderous specialist units, techno-sorcerous war machines, mindless Canoptek constructs, and shards of shattered star gods. They are led to war by undying nobles wielding weapons of devastating power, driven by the absolute conviction that they are the rightful rulers of the stars. And if the long sleep has reduced many Necrons to mindless monsters, or ravaged their sanity and transformed them into murderous demigods? Such madness only makes them an even greater and more terrible threat.

Codex: Necrons is your essential guide to one of the 41st Millennium's greatest threats – a millennia-old alliance of ancient androids who long ago sacrificed their very essence for greater power. In this book, you'll discover the history of the Necrons, from the very earliest days of the universe, to the War in Heaven, and their awakening, all illustrated with stunning art. Once you've read the lore, you can build your army using a vast suite of rules that bring the Necrons to life, with rules for the dynasties (including ones of your own creation!), datasheets, Stratagems, and much, much more.

This 120-page hardback book contains:

The history of the Necrons – from their ancient origins to the Era Indomitus
Stunning art that brings the lore to life
A showcase of incredibly painted miniatures to inspire your own collection and colour schemes
Crusade rules that let you develop your Necron army in thrilling narrative campaigns
Special abilities and bonuses like Command Protocols for your Necron forces
Datasheets for Necrons units for your reference
Stratagems, Powers of the C'tan, and more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Existance Card game
description:
Existance the card game is a set collection game of people with jobs and what they can afford.

A 2 to 6 player game with a deck of 88 cards of jobs, people, houses, cars, assets, pets and kids.

Find the best combination of cards to make up your best existence.

Each player receives 8 cards and by making deals and stealing cards the player must get the first 5 essential starting cards, 2 Names, Diploma, House and car. After that they can add assets, pets, kids, more cars and bigger houses to try and gain the most existence points, but watch out for misfortunes they happen when you least expect it.

The game ends when someone exists with : 2 names, 2 Diplomas, 1 House, 1 Car, 2 Assets, 3 kids and 1 pet.

Player with the most points wins.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Apokolips Invasion Force
description:
Among the greatest threats Earth has ever faced, Darkseid is an ancient and powerful cosmic warlord, who rules the hellish world of Apokolips with an iron fist. With his "New Gods" ready to smash his foes asunder, and his horde of Parademons serving as his vanguard, Darkseid is a force to be reckoned with.

Includes 6 resin figures and their character cards to add the forces of Apokalips. Includes Big Barda, Darkseid, Steppenwolf, and three Parademons.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Legion of Doom
description: Includes 6 resin figures and character cards to bring the Legion of Doom to the DC Universe. Includes Black Manta, Cheetah, Grodd, Joker, Lex Luthor, and Sinestro.

name: Adventure of D (Second Edition): Upgrade Pack
description:
Upgrade pack for Adventure of D 2nd. edition.

Content:
1 Thick 2-piece box (fits sleeved cards)
3 Acrylic hero tokens
4 Environment cards
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Follow, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – Red Pearl
description:
Each Dragon will start with a pearl that will be moving alongside the body of the dragon and you will be damaged whenever the body piece with the Red Pearl reaches the head.

You can strategically use the clouds to pass through them, and placing the red pearl on top of the cloud avoiding damage for that period of time.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Linkeballen: Demarrage Expansion
description:
With this extension you get 2 extra teams of three riders.
This makes it possible to play the game to 6 players.
Have you been the expansion teams, you can play with 8 players.

In between equally sprinting away from the competition?
With breakaway capabilities of this expansion have the words tactics and strategy really meaning.
You need the basic game for this expansion.

48 Demarrage cards
24 Chance cards
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Linkeballen: Team Expansion
description:
With this extension you get 2 extra teams of three riders.
This makes it possible to play the game to 6 players.

Furthermore you get additional Linkebal cards that affect your entire team. You have the basic game needed for this expansion.

24 team chance cards
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Stardriven: Saga
description:
Stardriven: Saga is the story of a plucky crew lost in an uncharted galaxy, a crew who is barely surviving after losing most of their resources when their ship crashed on a harsh world. This crew of smugglers and misfits must band together to repair the ship and discover new worlds amongst the stars before they run out of supplies. Crew members will spend time aboard the ship and visit planets to unravel the mysteries of the galaxy and find their way home.

Stardriven Saga is a 1-6 player cooperative Sci-Fi adventure from the designer and publisher of Maximum Apocalypse. It features eight different crew classes that can be combined with different alien species to create a variety of unique characters. The game’s campaign features branching storylines and a multitude of worlds and star systems to discover.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Promotion Pack #1
description:
This is a promo pack given to backers of the Good Cop Bad Cop: Promoted Kickstarter campaign. It contains:
* Matchmaker
* Medium
* Mustache Maker
* Party Planner
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Flight from Hall Manor
description:
Flight from Hall Manor is a horror-themed escape style game played simultaneously in real-time. Players have 15 minutes to get through three levels of a haunted manor, searching for staircases and, ultimately, the way out.

Players act simultaneously, revealing cards as they move through doorways and rooms, avoiding traps, collecting items, fighting spectral predators, and surviving a fire spreading through the house.

Players can work cooperatively or take off alone and work to escape without the others. Variable character abilities, benefits for coop and solo play, and over 200 manor map combinations make the game different every time.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Untamed: Ursan Gambler Promo Cards
description:
Limited edition foil promo cards available during Kickstarter project Untamed: Feral Factions

3x Ursan Gambler - promo animal (Panda faction)

Arrive: Put the top card of your deck into your Support Area. If it was a Panda card, the next card you play this turn costs 1 less Power.

Note: This ability is different from the Ursan Gambler found in the base game. If you want to use these promo cards, you need to replace them with the cards in the core box.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Scarface
description:
Its 1929 and Chicago is in the hands of the gangsters. The police and magistrates are completely under their control, and the governor of the state is futile. It is going to take the Federal government to restore a city's ability to govern itself. Newly elected President Herbert Hoover wants to clean up the city and that means bringing down the most notorious gangster of the time, Al Capone. It would take two years, but Hoover got his wish. In June 1931, federal prosecutors indicted Capone on 22 counts of income-tax evasion.

Scarface: The Al Capone Trial, puts you in the hands of the prosecution or defense to bring this gangster to justice or remind the justice system that a kind word and a gun...is still king.

As the defense, your efforts are asymmetrical focused on using cards and dice drafting to bribe and intimidate, jury tamper and cut deals to keep Capone from being convicted.

As the prosecution, you maintain the straight and narrow using cards and dice drafting to argue that Capone is guilty of a majority of tax evasion counts.

To win, the defense must build up enough corruption to make it to the end of trial simulating winning over public opinion, whereas the prosecution must win the game before the trial comes to a close by stringing together key evidence, convincing a majority of the jurors or prove witness tampering.

This is a standalone game. It is volume 3 in the Trial Series by Green Feet Games (previous Volumes includes Unforgiven: The Lincoln Assassination Trial and Prophet Without Honor: The Billy Mitchell Court-martial).

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Monopoly: Edición Córdoba
description:
Monopoly Edición Córdoba

Buy the Guitar Festival or the Jewish Quarter while you discover Córdoba many customs and its incredible natural landscapes ...
Advance to the Medina Azahara, Pozo Blanco or the Synagogue
will you get your rent paid?

Invest in houses and hotels Patios y Cortijos in this edition) and
win the game.

The fun game for the whole family to have fun trading real estate
Monopoly Córdoba is an exceptional journey through the extensive cultural legacy and the millenary history of one of the most beautiful Andalusian provinces.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Eleven Force, Hasbro, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Minions of Disruptions: a collaborative climate game for organizations and communities
description:
Fueled by climate change, millions upon millions of minions are set to disrupt the way we live on Planet Earth: Carbions build up Disruption Scale as our reliance on oil, plastics, and the like grew; Climmies descend to organizations and communities everywhere and causes disruptions to our normal way of working and living. Some of the minions are bound for your organization. These wicked creatures are mischievous and unpredictable, The only way to bring the minions under control is to activate Zillians, the resilience superheros who provide the ultimate resilience any organization can wish for a sustainable future.

In Minions of Disruptions, you and your fellow players are colleagues from the same organization or neighbors from the same community to combat climate minions. You must work hard and smart together to activate resilience superheros, Zillians, before the two types of minions, carbions and climmies, take over with their disruptions.

Minions of Disruptions is designed to be played by multiple teams, and can also be played standalone by one single team.

—description from the designer

Visit website: dayad.org/game-day for more information!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Events, Income, Point to Point Movement, Real-Time, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Fifth Column
description:
The Fifth Column is a precursor of Schotten Totten played with a standard deck of cards. In the basic version each player gets a hand of six cards and two rows of nine cards each are placed on the table to start the players' columns. Two cards are discarded and the rest form a draw pile.

On a turn a player plays to one of their nine columns, claims columns if possible, and draws a card. The three-card column sets are ranked from straight flush down. A column can be claimed even if the opponent's set is incomplete if you can prove there is no way they can beat your set. If a column is completed on both sides and is tied, the player who played last loses it.

The object is to claim five columns.

Some variants are given:


Ignore straights and straight flushes.



Each player gets 15 cards at the start and never draws any more.



Don't place any cards in the columns initially, as in the later game.

name: Thalassophobia
description:
Thalassophobia: A deathly fear of the ocean’s depths, and for good reason. You are a diver exploring an underwater grotto when your oxygen tank springs a leak. With only six minutes of air left in your tank, can you navigate this oceanic labyrinth and return to the surface in time?

SETUP
Gather all Blinks together into a single cluster. They should appear as murky, dark-blue waters. To begin, long-press a single Blink to turn it into a Diver. Now the clock is ticking, and the game has begun!

GAMEPLAY
When you begin a game, one of your Blinks will turn white, representing your current position on the board. Your air tank, represented by the number of lights on your Blink, has enough air to last for 6 minutes.

The player’s air tank counts down from 6 minutes to 1

Any Blink adjacent to your current position will be visible, showing either open water or entangling seaweed.

The player can see the Blinks immediately adjacent, but the rest are murky

Move to an adjacent open water Blink by clicking it. When you do so, new Blinks will be revealed, and the Blinks you are no longer adjacent to will begin to fade into murky darkness.

By moving their position, the player lights more of their surroundings

As you explore, you may see a glimmer of light either in open water or on some seaweed - move onto that space to ascend towards the surface.


Keep in mind that these chances are fleeting, and can only be spotted if a space is visible, so it’s best to explore as much and as quickly as possible. If you find yourself trapped, you can always rearrange your Blinks to find a way out.

WIN CONDITION
Your goal is to get all the way to the surface and avoid drowning, which requires you to ascend a total of 6 times. Make it all the way to the surface within 6 minutes, and you win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Space Born Horrors: Five Parsecs Scenario 4
description:
Scenario 4 for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition offers up a new breed of creatures to fight in the depths of space, suspiciously silent colonies and abandoned outposts.

10 new encounters are included, which can be met randomly in a regular campaign or deliberately sought out.
Each features a new creature type with description and nasty new abilities, offering a tough challenge for a battle-hardened party of characters.

Mechanics have also been included for possible additional rewards and even follow up missions as interested organizations pay you to go back in for them.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bussin' Around
description: 2-4 Bus Drivers go head to head in a take-that, pattern-matching, strategy card game about public transportation. Get the most paying customers on and off your bus before the end of the line!

name: Tiny Ninjas: Heroes – Dragonfire Expansion
description:
(NOTE: THIS IS NOT A STANDALONE PRODUCT. Requires a copy of 'Tiny Ninjas: Heroes' to play).

CONTENTS:
4 HERO Dice, 10 HERO Cards, 24 ITEM Cards, 1 Rules Card

New HEROES:
Vampire, Princess, Alien, Dragon

Bonus HERO:
Angry Kitty (Hero Cards only)

New ITEMS:
Golden Shield, Trio's Blades, Angel's Feathers, Grim's Scythe, Gambler's Coin, Pirate's Chest, Medic's Kit, Magician's Hat, Staminana, Grappling Hook, Energy Core, Shadow's Shuriken, Helping Heart, Poison, Fire Scroll, Robot's Robobytes, Brawlcoli, Golden Shuriken
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Myth: Dawn of Heroes
description:
Myth: Dawn of Heroes is a cooperative tabletop game for 2 to 5 players. Each player takes on the role of a hero and must work together to overcome the Darkness. Using a deck of cards unique to each hero, players explore the realm, battle evil monsters, manage critical tasks, and avoid dangerous traps in order to complete quests and acquire powerful new items and abilities.

Players' avatars are called Heroes. Myth Heroes are clothed in immense power, able to reave all but the mightiest foes. However, this power must be balanced lest the Darkness take too much notice. Players must weigh their actions against the Threat each will bring, with the consequences of awakening more evil and bringing doom on the party's endeavors. And be careful they must, as the Darkness is formidable and eager to snatch glory from the valiant.

Heroes are controlled through an intuitive Hero Deck (videos for each Hero can be found in the Game Play Videos section below). Each deck plays uniquely and allows players more freedom of action and the ability to truly impact the Story each and every Act. Yet, cooperation is the key to victory and bloody fortune. Players must communicate, interact, and assist each other or surely the Darkness will cover all.

Myth is a fully cooperative game. There is no player controlling the Darkness. The Darkness is governed by a set of rules unique to each Boss Deck and is activated through Hero actions. If the Heroes get overzealous, then the Darkness pushes back by activating Lairs, spawning Captains, and punishing the Heroes with devious Events. If the Heroes take a more subtle approach, then the Darkness reacts by reducing the potential for treasure and rewards. Without the treasures and equipment to upgrade, the Heroes will find each Act more difficult and eventually fail. The dynamic nature of the Darkness really lends a more fluid feel to the Story. Players aren't being driven by properties out of their control, nor are they being shepherded by a person whose skill has a direct impact on the enjoyment of the game.

Myth is a fun fantasy romp where players feel truly heroic. In the playing of the game, the players are creating their own mythos. These stories are the ones carried away from the table, becoming myths themselves. And these are the myths, with friends and family, that we carry with us; telling and retelling our endeavors at the mead benches, earning treasured smiles and laughter.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: North South East Quest: Beyond Promo Card
description:
A promotional direction card for North South East Quest.


A direction card to take the game to other worlds! Mars? Tatooine? Middle Earth? The possibilities are endless.

If you really want to pull out all of the stops, you can take your story into SPACE! How you get there? That's the hard part. Use the hot air balloon? The train? A boat? You need to get REALLY creative with this one.

name: Space Cats Fight Fascism: Secret Meowssions
description: Secret Meowssions is an expansion that adds new elements to the base game of Space Cats Fight Fascism, for those who want to extend their gameplay and strategize in new ways. In this expansion, cats will have additional missions that they have to complete, without the fascists finding out what you are up to! These meowssions will include freeing captured animals of the resistance, seizing a fascist space station, distributing food to hungry animals, and more. If the cats are able to complete these meowssions, they’ll get major rewards, such as gaining the support of local animals, new tools to fight the fascists, extra actions on your turn, and more. But if the fascists uncover your plans, there will be serious consequences...
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction

name: Batalha Das Gerações
description:
The game that aims to be a fun game between players of different ages. Through questions, answers, challenges and competitions, players will learn a little more about the universe of other generations. In the busy and ultra connected world in which we live, Batalha das Gerações provides unique moments of family life. What is Kpop? What does LP mean? What is flopping? These and other doubts will be resolved in this game by different generations.

There are 360 ​​cards with questions, answers and challenges

name: オシリスの棺 (Osiris's Coffin)
description:
Worship the gods, prepare a coffin, and die well.

For the Ancient Egyptians, death is something not even the Gods can evade. It is fated and, at the same time, it is the beginning of a new life.

No one knows when death deems to visit, therefore as Egyptian nobility you must prepare the necessary burial accessories and make the proper arrangements for the world that awaits you after this one.

Only the player who readies a coffin of the highest value during his or her lifetime will have the privilege to share a destiny with the Great Osiris and experience a blissful eternal life.

A card game that uses simultaneous action selection and drafting mechanics. Choose gods who will favor you with various blessings and decide whether to bury treasure in your own coffin or choose to steal treasure from others. The player who collects the most treasure wins the game.

When playing with the “Short Rules” which require the usage of fewer cards, the game can be casually played in around 30 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Capitalist
description:
Capitalist is a deck-building game focused on decision-making, risk, and opportunities. The players get to be rising entrepreneurs. Players start with nothing but the work they can provide. They complete contracts, gain skills from jobs, create impactful connections, invest in the stock market and other investments to gain currency, build and upgrade unique business to complete more difficult tasks, and compete to complete grand achievements such as going to Mars. Capitalist is a race to achievement; the first player to reach the necessary achievement points wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Catch the Leader, Deck Construction, Investment, Ownership

name: Romulan Armada: Unity Edition
description:
Uncloak and Strike from the Shadows!

A meeting of empires as a famous game system joins the Star Fleet Universe. Romulan Armada was done as a joint venture between Amarillo Design Bureau and Majestic Twelve Games. This 84-page rulebook includes the Essential Starmada Rules, 37 starships (Romulan, Federation, and Gorn) and eight bases (Romulan, Gorn, Federation, Klingon, Kzinti, and Tholian), and complete rules to bring the Star Fleet Universe alive in the Starmada game system.

This fast-playing game easily handles squadrons of ships as they encounter their enemies and battle to see who is indeed the best commander.

Ships included are the Federation battlecruiser, Concordat-class dreadnought, and strike cruiser; the Romulan dreadnoughts (the Behemoth and Condor classes), heavy cruisers (FastHawk, FireHawk, and Kestrel classes), and command cruisers (Conqueror, NovaHawk, and RoyalHawk classes); Gorn heavy battlecruiser, command cruiser, and medium cruiser; battle stations for the Gorns and Romulans, mobile bases for the Federation, Gorns, Klingons, Kzintis, Romulans, and Tholians; an armed priority transport; and many other ships.

This book is complete and ready to play.

This edition unifies the previous Nova and Admiralty editions, so there will no longer be Starmada fans who cannot game together. The new rules preserve the best of both previous systems, and add dynamic seeking weapons rules that do what seeking weapons are supposed to do: force the enemy to move out of key areas or shoot his way through a swarm of drones.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Mousquetaires du Roy: Promo cards and board
description:
Published in Ystari magazine issue 1 (February 2011, p. 18).

Three new cards: De Bar (minion card), La Poursuite (trap card), Larcin (treachery card).

New board:
Each Musketeer can challenge Milady once in the game to win a bonus. This challenge can be launched from anywhere and costs one action.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Renaissance
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Two Empires
description:
Two rival civilizations clash as they expand their borders and vie for control of important territories. You must lead your people to victory, as only one empire is destined to rule the land.

Two Empires is a two-player area control and card placement game using a deck of 18 identical cards. In the game each player will take on the role of either the Red Overlord or the Blue Emperor. You will make key decisions on where to put cards on the map in order to lead your people's growth from tribal villages into a vast empire. Players will score points for Cities, Provinces, and Mines. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Missione Spazio
description:
Missione Spazio is a computational thinking game for beginners and can be used as a first approach to coding.

Children must draw a path on a game board, using a set of tiles. The path will have to solve precise and well-defined problem situations.

The game is developed on 3 levels of difficulty, which correspond to different ways of defining problem situations.

Finally the players check the solution in the booklet: if it is right they win cooperatively, if it is wrong they all lose together.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game, Grid Coverage, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Robot Overload
description:
You are the commander of a small robot army. You’ll strategically deploy your robots to fight your battles. Your stronger robots will reprogram weaker robots to fight for your side. Command your robot army, reprogram opposing forces, and become the Robot Master of the World!

Description
This is a 2 player game where players strategically select from their hand of robot cards as they attack and defend. Additional copies of the game can expand the number of players who can play.

Play
