Players strategically select from their hand of robot cards as they attack and defend. Each time a player defeats their opponent's robot, they become the attacker on the next round. The defender has the advantage of choosing how to respond to the attacker's card, and may choose to sacrifice both robots to attempt to capture the robots in their opponent's hand. When one player runs out of cards, they are defeated and their opponent is the Robot Master of the World!

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Clash of Deck N°4
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fourth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover three new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Revive, Second Wind and Leap!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Robot Overload: Expansion 1
description:
This is a stand-alone expansion to the original game, with purple and green robot teams and updated rules for more than 2 players. 2 players can play this version by itself, but combined with additional copies of the expansion or the original version of the game, more players can play together.

Play
Players strategically select from their hand of robot cards as they attack and defend. Each time a player defeats their opponent's robot, they become the attacker on the next round. The defender has the advantage of choosing how to respond to the attacker's card, and may choose to sacrifice both robots to attempt to capture the robots in their opponent's hand. When one player runs out of cards, they are defeated and their opponent is the Robot Master of the World!

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Caverns & Pits: Five Leagues From the Borderlands
description:
Below the earth lurks things best left un-disturbed..unless you are hoping for a fat sack of loot, then you should definitely go poke around!

With this expansion your campaign map will feature caves to explore in addition to the normal Threat system.
These give you side objectives you can explore at your own leisure, with a new enemy table to content with.
Additionally, you may face pits used by the enemy as hide-outs, spreading evil and decay around the world.
Leave a pit alone and you may face attacks, increases in Threat or even see the wheel turn.

This expansion is designed for 2nd edition Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pencils Down!
description:
Pencils down is an entertaining game that is an instant favorite for everyone who plays it! Get ready for fun and quick answers as players try to come up with something unique for easy category.

The categories seem simple, but the pressure is on when you have to think of examples starting with the chosen letter. You get more points for answers that no one else thought of, so a little imagination goes a long way!

A fun game for all ages, it’s perfect for parties and get togethers with family and friends!

name: England Expects
description:
The epic battle between the navies of France and Britain across the Revolutionary, Directory, Consulship and Empire of Napoleon. Annual turns and four scenarios cover a large number of events from Slave Risings to the Treaty Of Tilsit. The Royal Navy has the odds in its side in combat, but it must control the colonies of the three largest European Empires: The French, Spanish and Dutch. There are merchantmen and privateers to hunt, and all the time the French Army operates safe from most naval interventions. The infant American Republic is all to anxious to take world trade into their bottoms.

World-wide map, colony displays, each counter is 10 battleships or 15 frigates.

—description from the designer

name: Special Attractions (fan expansion for Draftosaurus)
description:
After a period of sustained success, the visitors to your zoo have become complacent and are clamoring for more. It's time to introduce some Special Attractions to your dino park! In this fan-made print-and-play expansion for Draftosaurus, players will draft cards that provide an additional way to score points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Resources War Game
description:
In this world very similar to ours, where overpopulation and human greed led to the depletion of practically all the resources on the planet ...

This scarcity of resources sparked internal wars between the nations of each continent without end.

After many years of small wars, combined with countless revolts and coups d'état, panic, fear, despair, led the few remaining nations in this world to start a war like no other! One last war. A war that nobody could escape, that would come to reach the 4 corners of the globe.

That was how the third world war started, also called by many the “War of resources”.

What will be the last nation to stand and gain control of the few resources in the world?

It is up to you to choose one of the remaining nations and dominate what is left of the world.

The objective of the game is to conquer a certain number of territories according to the number of players.

We have two types of troops, some that allow you to pass through the water and others that are only territorial.

name: Clash of Deck N°5
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover two new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Aquatic and Hidden!
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Tierra Feudal
description:
Tierra Feudal (Feudal Land) is a card game where we represent the leader of a noble house from medieval Europe. We are on a mission to develop our fiefdom better than anyone else through the recruitment of new vassals, the construction of buildings, the establishment of production improvements and, of course, the growth of our military defenses.

Starting from a few cards, we will have to manage the production of resources to be able to get better characters, buildings and nobles from the market that allow us to make more efficient and productive combinations of cards. We will have to carefully plan our acquisitions since the lack of chance in the game will place almost all the responsibility of defeat or victory on our decisions.

After the construction of a certain amount of buildings the game will end. The military and economic power, the productive capacities, the power of the church and the nobles under our vassalage will determine the victory points that we get and the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Neo-Morphosis: The Syndicate's Sleeper
description:
The Syndicate's Sleeper expansion for Neo-Morphosis allows for 5 or 6 players. This expansion adds a new mechanic - Betrayer Mode! The syndicate may have an Agent hidden in the crew with their own secret agenda! Who is the traitor? What is their agenda?

Includes two new Crew, Jasper Jackson and Akira Gozen, new alien species, the Tubers, Widows, and Borers. Plus more morphosis and the mighty Behemoth!

Comes with map tiles, item cards, emergency cards, and 10 brand new Missions that can also be played as a campaign!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Kosmiczny Wykop
description:
Galactic football from the Cosmic Kick series has moved to the game board. Together with Robert Lewandowski and the series characters, play the emotional football games full of tactical decisions. The dynamic 2-player gameplay will make you feel like you’re at Spaceball court - the Space Football Federation stadium.

—description from the publisher

name: Victory at Sea: Akagi
description:
Originally laid down as an Amagi-class battlecruiser, the stipulations of the Washington Treaty resulted in her conversion to an aircraft carrier. As a result, Akagi (赤城, "Red Castle") was one of Japan’s first large aircraft carriers. Akagi and her near-sister Kaga straddled the line between carrier and dreadnought. To keep both options open, the ships were designed to be quickly converted to capital ships. They carried turret barbettes, magazines and other equipment to support big gun turrets, and the wooden flight deck and hangar deck were designed to be quickly stripped off, making room for turrets to be mounted. However, by the mid-1930s, the admirals believed the aircraft carrier to be the equal of the capital ship and Akagi was extensively rebuilt to improve aircraft handling capacity, ending any possibility of later converting it to a capital ship.

Her aircraft served in the Second Sino-Japanese War in the late 1930s. With the formation of the First Air Fleet in 1941, she became its flagship, and remained so until her sinking. Notable actions include the attack on Pearl Harbor, the invasion of Rabaul, bombing Darwin, Australia and the Indian Ocean Raid.

In June 1942, she participated in the Battle of Midway, her aircraft bombarding the American-held atoll. However, US aircraft originating from Midway, and the US carriers Enterprise, Hornet and Yorktown attacked Akagi and three other Japanese fleet carriers. Dive bombers from USS Enterprise severely damaged Akagi, forcing friendly escorting destroyers to scuttle her to avoid her falling into US hands. The loss of four Japanese carriers at this engagement, including Akagi, was a key defeat for Japan, decisively shifting the balance of power in the Pacific theatre.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Yorktown
description:
The Yorktown-class of aircraft carrier were built in a series of three. Of those, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway, and the USS Hornet during the Battle of Santa Cruz.

USS Yorktown was commissioned in 1937, and named for the battle of 1781. After Pearl Harbor, USS Yorktown transferred to the Pacific and took part in some of the first American offences of the war around the Gilbert and Marshall Islands. She also fought at the Battle of the Coral Sea where her aircraft (along with the carrier Lexington's) sank enemy light carrier Shōhō prior to engaging the main Japanese carrier force the following day (May 8th 1942). During this latter stage of the engagement, the US carriers' aircraft inflicted damage to the IJN carrier Shōkaku, but in turn USS Yorktown suffered heavy damage. Lexington suffered worse, and was later scuttled as a result.

Returning to Hawaii, repairs were estimated to take two weeks, but she was put back to sea a mere 48 hours after entering drydock, in time to play a crucial part in the decisive Battle of Midway. Her aircraft were instrumental in the sinking of two Japanese fleet carriers. Her presence also drew the attention of Japanese aerial attacks away from USS Entreprise and Hornet. Though crippled by Japanese aircraft, there was optimism that she could be salvaged in part. These hopes were dashed on June 6th when torpedoes from the Japanese submarine I-168 struck her twice. Further hopes of repair were abandoned, and she sank the following day.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Old Friends Bearing Guns: Five Parsecs Scenario 5
description:
Scenario 5 for Five Parsecs From Home is a blast from the past.. literally, as your captain realizes an old enemy of theirs is gunning for their head.

Old friends bearing guns can be added into any campaign, though it is best suited for a crew with a little bit of experience. It contains a sequence of 3 linked encounter battles forming a small story, along with tables to generate your old nemesis.

If you do well, you may even get a custom weapon out of the deal!

This is an expansion pack for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition.

You require a copy of the core game rules. The pack is compatible with your existing expansions, but none are required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Pitch
description:
Necromantic Horror teams are right at home amongst the macabre and supernatural. What better location for a stadium than within a Sylvanian graveyard? Necromancer coaches often try to convince their counterpart to begin playing just as daylight fades, hoping the chill of the night saps the other players’ strength and invigorates their own.

This double-sided board depicts a dusky, barren cemetery pitch on one side, replete with tombs and flagstone walkways, and littered with pumpkins, skulls, and freshly-dug open graves – ready for the next victim. On the other side, the same scene but after the sun has set, with eerie witchfire in the eyes of the pumpkins (and skulls!) and the Necromantic Horror icon in the center of the field.

The package includes two redesigned dugouts for the new edition of the game. They match the creepy dusk to dawn aesthetics of the pitch – each dugout featuring Score, Turn, and Re-roll trackers, plus Reserves, Knocked-out, and Casualty boxes. You'll also find rules to represent the particular features of both sides of the pitch.

Necromantic Horror teams are compatible with the 2016 Edition of Blood Bowl using the "Teams of Legend" optional rules published by Games-Workshop.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Sylvaneth
description:
The spirit-song rises, and the Sylvaneth march to war!

Unleash the verdant might of nature with Battletome: Sylvaneth – your guide to the eternal protectors of nature in the Mortal Realms. Inside this 104-page hardback book, you’ll discover the history of the Sylvaneth, forest spirits of terrifying power who would slay any who defile their homes. You’ll discover how Alarielle was resurrected, how the great Households of the Sylvaneth are structured, and how they differ from realm to realm.

Meanwhile, a huge selection of rules gives you countless ways to play with your Sylaneth collection. Allegiance abilities reward you for fielding dedicated forces of Sylvaneth, while rules for several legendary factions allow you to tailor your army to suit your playstyle – from elite forces of Kurnoth Hunters to serried ranks of Dryads. Warscroll battalions reward you for fielding specific combinations of models, while Path to Glory warband creation rules and bespoke Sylvaneth missions are perfect for your first few games. This battletome is also a great resource for collectors, featuring tips for painting details like gleaming blades and realistic bark, as well as a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures to inspire your own collection.

This battletome contains:
- Lore and art that explores the history of the Sylvaneth, and how they battle today
- A showcase of beautifully painted miniatures
- Painting advice including examples of different bark colours, foliage, and weapons for the Oakenbrow, Gnarlroot, Heartwood, Ironbark, Winterleaf, Dreadwood, and Harvestboon glades – also includes skin variants, blade variants, details for painting Alarielle the Everqueen, and more
- Allegiance abilities for Sylvaneth, including a table of battle traits (including rules for deploying hidden units as reserves), two command trait tables, four artefacts of power tables, and the Lore of the Deepwood spell table
- 6 warscroll battalions for fielding different combinations of models
- 16 unit warscrolls, 3 endless spell warscrolls, and a warscroll for the Awakened Wyldwood
- Pitched battle profiles for all units, endless spells, and the Awakened Wyldwood featured in this Battletome, including min/max unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles

-description from the publisher's website

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Imperium Nihilus – Vigilus Defiant
description:
War ravages the sentinel world of Vigilus. Though beset by an Ork Speedwaagh! and a Genestealer Cult uprising, its crucial location at the mouth of the Nachmund Gauntlet makes it an invaluable asset to the Imperium – one that its people will fight to the last to defend. Yet this defiance may cost the Imperium dearly, for on top of all the planet’s woes, a Chaos invasion has begun, led by a warlord claiming to be the herald of Abaddon himself!

Imperium Nihilus: Vigilus Defiant is packed with exciting background and new rules that enable you to refight the events described in the book. Here’s what you will find inside:

- Background of the period leading up to the War for Vigilus
- A star map of the Vigilus system
- Descriptions of the planet of Vigilus and its military disposition
- Detailed accounts of the major events in the War for Vigilus
- Campaign deployment maps and descriptions of the battles that were fought in each war zone
- Details of the various armies that fought in this campaign
- Campaign rules allowing you to bring the narrative of this book to life on your tabletop.
- Guidance on organising and running a Vigilus campaign
-12 narrative play missions (6 Crucible of War, 6 Echoes of War), as well as additional special rules and stratagems
- Six exciting battlezones to use in your games of Warhammer 40,000
- Specific rules for using the various factions that fought on Vigilus, including datasheets for Marneus Calgar, his Victrix Guard and Haarken Worldclaimer
- 22 specialist detachments, with new warlord traits, relics, and stratagems
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory at Sea: Kagero-class Destroyers
description:
Essentially an enlarged Fubuki-class, the Kagerō-class hull design was scaled up to overcome earlier design deficiencies. As a result, the Kagerō-class was the equal of any of its contemporaries in other navies and superior to most. Only the initial lack of radar and continued poor quality of sonar equipment and anti-aircraft defences (shortcomings which bedevilled all Japanese destroyers) hindered their performance.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Liege 1914
description:
The Battle of Liege was the opening engagement of the First World War and the first step of the German Schlieffen Plan. Liege, a city protected by a ring of twelve forts, blocked the passage of the German First and Second Armies. It contained the railway bridges crossing the Meuse river that would be needed by the advancing armies. Winning a quick victory over the Belgians was critical to the success of the German plan so a surprise attack of six brigades was launched ahead of the heavy artillery that ultimately destroyed the forts.

Liege 1914 is a regimental-level simulation of this opening battle of the Great War. Players assume the roles of the commanders of the German and Belgian troops as they desperately fight for this valuable position in the line.

The 17 x 22" map shows the western portion of Belgium from the German border to Liege. The 240 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show German and Belgian forces involved in the battle.

Liege 1914 is now the second installment in the Great War Battles series. Based on the Ypres 1914 game system (the first in the series), the Great War Battles is a series of games devoted to simulating battles of the First World War. Battles are covered at the brigade/regiment level using a common set of rules. Games in the series will cover a variety of situations ranging from trench warfare to open fighting.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Thenn Warriors
description:
Most of the Free Folk’s forces arm and armor themselves with whatever they can craft along the way to battle or steal off of their fallen enemies. The Thenn Warriors are different. They have forged their own bronze weapons and armor, making them the most heavily-armed troops in the Free Folk army. While their equipment might not stand up to the castle-forged steel of the southern forces, it fares better than leather and fur shirts.

The Thenn Warriors unit box gives Free Folk commanders their arguably hardiest troops on the battlefield. Their increased armor has given them a sense of invulnerability, calling out Taunts to their enemies, causing charges to be targeted at them instead of other units. They also benefit from Set Defense, which means they ignore penalties from being charged, or attacked in the flank or rear. Coming with the unit is the Chosen of Styr Unit Attachment, whose Intimidating presence causes an enemy to become Weakened when they activate.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: TOZAN
description:
TOZAN is a solitaire game from Japan for a mountain climber. The game is very quick to play, only five minutes, and the player must ascend and descend the 8000m mountain safely. But the mountain is capricious, and the weather changes rapidly. So the climber must be prepared, plan ahead, maintain their strength, and watch for a lucky break.

The deck is 16 cards only but has variety, so the player will be able to play the game over again and again.

Some of the cards are used to plot the climber's ascent, and health. The other cards determine the weather (Kaze (Wind), Hare (Sun), and climbing conditions (Iwa (Rocky)).
user summary

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: T'au Empire
description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your T’au Empire Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the T’au Empire faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to T’au Empire Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:


Commander Shadowsun
Commander Farsight
Commander
Aun’Va Aun’Shi
Ethereal
Cadre Fireblade
Darkstrider
Longstrike
Breacher Team
Strike Team
Kroot Carnivores
Kroot Shaper
Krootox Riders
XV25 Stealth Battlesuits
XV8 Crisis Battlesuits
XV8 Crisis Bodyguards
Firesight Marksman
XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuit
XV104 Riptide Battlesuit
Pathfinder Team
TX4 Piranhas
Tactical Drones
Vespid Stingwings
Kroot Hounds
XV88 Broadside Battlesuits
TX7 Hammerhead Gunship
TX78 Sky Ray Gunship
MV71 Sniper Drones
TY7 Devilfish
AX3 Razorshark Strike Fighter
AX39 Sun Shark Bomber
Tidewall Shieldline
Tidewall Droneport
Tidewall Gunrig
KV128 Stormsurge


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Za kralja i otadžbinu: Đeneral Draža
description:
Za kralja i otadžbinu: Đeneral Draža ("For King and Country: General Mihailovich") is set in WWII Yugoslavia occupied by the Axis and their satellites, while the resistance is divided.

The basic game is for 2 players, one player acting as the leader of the Yugoslav (Royal) Army (Mihailovich), while the other leads the Communist Partisans (Tito). The advanced game is for 1-2 players - the player leading Mihailovich can play solo.

The main goal of both guerrillas is to fight the Axis and the opposing guerrillas, retain the support of the people and Allies, and control Yugoslavia after the war.

If you are Mihailovich in the advanced game, your additional (extremely difficult) goal is also to minimize Serb civilian casualties.
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Neptune
description:
Neptune operated during her World War II service with a crew predominantly composed from the New Zealand Division of the Royal Navy, but also a large proportion of South African personnel. In late 1939 she was in pursuit of the German pocket battleship, Admiral Graf Spee. In the aftermath of the Battle of the River Plate she was sent to Uruguay, however, Graf Spee was scuttled before she could arrive.

She participated in the battle of Calabria in July 1940 against the Italian fleet, suffering damage and losing her floatplane in the process, but inflicting heavy damage to the heavy cruiser Bolzano. Subsequently she participated in operations to disrupt convoys attempting to reach Libya with supplies bound for the efforts of Rommel’s Afrika Korps. She met her end on 18 December 1941, in which Force K wandered into an Italian minefield. A total of four mines were struck, leaving only one survivor, Norman Walton, who spent 15 months as a prisoner of war in Italy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Cutthroat Ninja
description:
Be the first player to build up an attack list with enough hit points to eliminate the target and claim the reward! Choose the next target and begin again until everyone has been taken out. The player with the most rewards wins!

But it won't be that easy.

You will also have to play your strategy cards wisely - because they can help or hinder you and your opponents. You might draw an extra card then have your attack list switched around. Or hire a mercenary to block your opponents' paths while they steal your combo attack! You can even join forces with an opponent to eliminate the target - only to steal their half of the reward in the very next round! It's all about being the most cutthroat ninja in the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Red Banner Northern Fleet
description:
Red Banner Northern Fleet explores the Cold War going hot on the high seas. The game is set in 1983, during the last great crisis of the Cold War, occurring before disillusionment with the Soviet system reached critical mass.

The game is inspired by the Avalon classic Victory in the Pacific. The map depicts the North Atlantic, dividing it into several sea zones. The stats are simplified to facilitate fast game play. However, until Victory in the Pacific, the rules for amphibious landing and land-based aircraft are more involved. Plus the threat of nuclear war hangs over, and if either NATO or the Warsaw Pact does too well, the losing side's government might launch.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Butcher and the Bonnie Prince
description:
The Butcher and the Bonnie Prince simulates the last and greatest of the Jacobite uprisings. It uses blocks for units to create fog of war and utilizes an easy combat system. One side plays the Jacobites, which include Scottish Highland and Lowland units as well as English and Welsh. The French will also provide units and could launch a full scale invasion of Britain. The Hanoverians include Scottish Loyalists from the Highlands and Lowlands as well as British regulars and even some Dutch units.

—description from the designer

name: Hydro Soakers
description:
Need to cool off in the hot summer sun? Splash into action with Hydro Soakers! A two player game where you compete in eliminating the opposing team.

Strategize your movement, upgrade your hydropack, and refill your water guns in this fast paced action hydration!

Play an exciting game of Hydro Soakers! Players go head to head controlling their teams of three athletes. Players will fire water guns, grab snacks, attempt to avoid getting wet by others and score eliminations. This skirmish style game makes you manage your water, choose the best time to attack and taunts you with when to grab some snacks off the buffet table.

Hydro Soakers is a fast action game where you don't want to get caught with an empty hydropack! Don't forget to fill up at the fill stations. Special events can either help you or hurt you so stay on guard. Play this unique water fight game with a friend and revisit your childhood of intense water battles. Grab your own copy of Hydro Soakers and you'll be glad you did.

- Tactical moves and strategic decisions.

- Water Management - Don't get caught with an empty HydroPack. Manage your water by utilizing Water Fill Stations.

- Chow down on snacks in order to boost your abilities on the field

- Watch out for special events. Some are good and some are bad.

name: Steady Bayonets 1756
description:
Steady Bayonets 1756 is a set of rules for playing tabletop wargames representing battles in the middle part of the 18th Century, using 15-30mm size model soldiers. The rules cover the period roughly 1740-1790 in Europe.

In these rules, battles are won with lines of well-drilled, bayonet-armed infantry delivering coordinated volleys of musket fire. Cavalry in general cannot take on steady infantry frontally and artillery is not yet powerful enough to be a battle-winning arm.

A typical game has about a dozen units per side. A game like this should take under four hours for a pair of opponents familiar with the rules to complete.

The rules work best with units of 24 infantry models, 12 cavalry models and batteries of 2-4 gun models but this is not a strict requirement.

Game setup usually involves two opposing forces facing one another across a table laid out with terrain models representing hills, woods, streams, etc.

The usual table size is 4-6 feet deep by 6-8 feet across.

Figure and Ground Scales:
• One infantry model = 20 actual men.
• One cavalry model = 20 actual men.
• One cannon model = two actual guns.
• One gunner model = 5 actual crewmen.
• One inch = 20 actual paces (50 feet).

Turn Sequence

Rally & Command
Move
Shoot
Close combat & Recovery


—description from the publisher

name: Character Pack 4: Hired Hands & Helping Henchmen – A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
Character Pack 4 for Five Leagues deviates a bit from the standard by offering a new game mechanic: Hired hands.

With these rules you can hire on helpers such as a blacksmith, torchbearer or 6 other types. Their purpose is to assist your war band off the field (and occasionally on it), allowing you to form a support staff.

You can even attempt to push them into battle in an emergency, but they're likely to demand more pay or even leave on the spot.

This pack can be added to any campaign, even if using alternate warbands such as the Dwarf warband. It can be added to an on-going campaign with no issue.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trick Shot: Towering Promo Cards
description:
A set of two cards (one for each team) with three new players!

Towering - Your players can't be hit.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Adventurers Pack.

name: Forces of Nature
description:
Forces of Nature is a simple yet sophisticated card game where 2-4 players must fight to win as the last player standing. Each turn, players draw cards and make tough decisions. Players use the available Will – a growing economy for the round – to bring cards from their hand into the Wild – the gameplay area. Once in the Wild, players command their cards and animals to battle opponents.

Animal, Force, and Nature cards with their own unique abilities may seem simple by themselves, but masterfully combining them can lead to some exceptionally thrilling matches.


Animals – like the Gorilla – can attack other animals and players in the Wild, and can also be used to defend attacks from opponents.
Force cards – such as Patience – can make opponents reevaluate their strategy by making permanent changes to animals during the game.
Nature cards – including Volcano – change the course of the game by directly impacting players and animals in the Wild.


Force of Nature is a special card that can deal a devastating blow to opponents – it removes all animals for all players in the Wild. Used at just the right moment, this card can dramatically turn the tables on unsuspecting players.

The last surviving player wins Forces of Nature.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Jutland:  Fleet Admiral II
description:
The original Fleet Admiral was designed in the mid-1980’s by Jack Greene while running Quarterdeck Games, a small part-time vanity press producing cardboard and paper war-games. The game is a highly-sought after collector's item on ebay; commanding top dollar. Fast-forward to today, and Consim Press is collaborating with Jack Greene on an all-new game to celebrate the 100th Anniversary of the Battle of Jutland. This game will represent a major step forward in WWI naval warfare, along with high production value (without breaking the bank like the ebay collector's item).

Jack Greene was approached three times between 1990 and 2010 on producing the game professionally with a full print run. Now it is to be published by Consim Press. It is occurring now because over the past two years, Jack had an epiphany in approaching the game design. This is an example where historical research led Jack to eliminate player actions that hampered play and to change various values in the ship roster sheets and combat tables (used for resolving combat) to better reflect this deeper understanding of naval combat between Great Britain and Germany in the 1914-16 period.

This game project has roots going back to the mid-80’s with Quarterdeck Games publishing about 135 amateur production FLEET ADMIRAL games (1987) and would result in the spin-offs of TSUSHIMA (S&T #130 – 1989) & TOGO: Dawn of the Dreadnoughts (2018).

Heavily modified since these earlier games, JUTLAND: Fleet Admiral results in a tight view of naval combat between the British and German fleets in 1914-1916. It represents years of research and years of playtesting. This is truly a simulation, and not a “game”, yet remains very PLAYABLE. Players may make this simulation as complex and accurate as they wish, or, alternatively, they can be playing a large action in just a couple of turns of watching the game being played. The 18 scenarios allow players to spend 30 minutes to many hours of play. The large fleet actions are best played with several players on both sides.

JUTLAND: Fleet Admiral is the ultimate battleship simulation. This game has consumed hundreds of hours of design effort spread over years; and decades of research and study. JUTLAND: Fleet Admiral was conceived as a game that allows for realistic yet playable surface combat in the Battle of Jutland era. The concept was to design a big game that would give one the sense of the grandeur and scope of the largest surface battle ever fought on this planet and yet not load one down with needless detail. Certain liberties and abstractions have been taken to achieve the overall design goal, but I believe you will find that any sacrifices in the name of playability have been the correct ones.

One of the greatest arms races in history was a primary cause of war in August of 1914. Ships would see action in every corner of the world. It was a war fought by two of the most highly trained navies in history. The Officers and Sailors of these two fleets had worked for years at honing their skills to an unimaginable extent. Both would offer up surprises to the other in the course of the war. But it also must be placed in a context where the vast majority of sailors of both nations, when they came onboard a warship, would find them working with tools and equipment that were new to them, and new to the modern world of 1914. The turbine, the radio, the telephone, powerful long-range “heater” torpedoes – all equipment that had been recently invented and perfected and was not to be found back on the farm or often not in the part of the cities where many of these men grew up.

But JUTLAND: Fleet Admiral does not stop there. Also included are a number of possible hypothetical actions, carefully researched for 1914/1915.

Product Information:

Complexity: Medium-High
Playing time: 30 minutes to many hours
Solitaire Suitability: MEDIUM
Players: 1-9
Map Scale: 1000 Yards/hex
Time Scale: 1 Turn = 6 minutes
Unit Scale: Individual counters for light cruisers & larger, submarines, aircraft & Zeppelins. Destroyers & Torpedo-boats are flotilla divisions or 1/2 flotillas

Game Components:

Six Maps (3 are 22″ x 34″, 3 are 1/2 maps 17″ x 22″)
3 3/4″x1/2″ Ship Counter Sheets (with both silhouette and birds-eye view ship counters)
1 5/8″x5/8″ Flotilla Counter Sheet
1 1/2″x1/2″ Marker Counter Sheet
1 Rulebook (88 pages with BIG print)
1 Scenario Booklet
1 Designer’s Notes Booklet
2 Sets of Scenario Roster Sheets
1 Set of Scenario Setup Cards
13 Player Aid Cards, with some duplicates (3)
1 Expanded Sequence of Play card
2 Different Colored 10 Sided Dice and 6 Sided Dice
Box and Lid set

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Communication Limits, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Movement Template, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: The Distant Marches: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
description:
Ahead of you lay a fiercely independent land of swamps, scattered village communities and hard-eyed people fighting for survival, as the fierce dusklings mount raid after raid.
It will take determination to win through here.

Welcome to a new campaign expansion for Five Leagues From the Borderlands, offering a brand new realm to explore. In a wet and rainy land, the feared dusklings are raiding ever more aggressively, leading to the call for heroes to hold the lines.

The Marches is a pre-configured campaign featuring 5 villages, each with their own special circumstance and threat levels. The battles here will put you against the Dusklings: Orc-like raiders terrorizing civilization.

The feature list includes:

Simple rules for special terrain conditions and campaign adjustments, reflecting the unique circumstances of the Marches.
Additional special rules for fighting the Duskling threat.
Each of the 5 villages you have to clear has a special rule applicable to it.
A new travel table for adventures in the Marches.
A modified Monster table, including the new Swamp Lurker.
10 Unique encounters to experience.
3 new locations to visit.
A 6 step quest adding new challenges and rewards as you play.


The Distant Marches is intended to be played with Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2nd edition version 1.03 or newer, though any version from 1.0 Marmoset should work fine.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Space Opera
description:
"Space Opera" is a game of galactic politics for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls a different power bloc striving to come out on top of the new order. Game play is character-driven and the exploits of a handful of a few, key citizens will determine the fate of the galaxy for the next several centuries.

Your goal is to bring the majority of planetary governments under the control of your power bloc. Your tools include recruitment, local elections, diplomacy, and the occasional coup d'état and assassination.

Players take turns activating one of their bloc’s citizens. When activated, a citizen may take 2 different actions; draw a new planet, replace an unpopular government, draw or play opportunity cards, recruit a population or new citizen, and travel.

Dice are rolled to determine the degree of success (if any) of each action. The number of dice rolled depends on your citizen’s requisite skill level. Skills are guile, intelligence, negotiation, opportunity, rank, and wealth.

You can push your luck by re-rolling some of the dice, but failure on a re-roll can lead to failure and injury.

Certain dramatic events, such as an assassination or successful no-confidence vote, ratchet up the tension. This is indicated by removing a clock token from a pool.

Once the pool is empty the game ends and the power bloc that controls the most planetary governments wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Posies
description:
Materials

A hex board having 51 vertices and 54 pieces (posies) in 3 colors.

Object

The player with the highest score wins.

Setup

Players take turns randomly placing three posies of different colors, one to a vertex on the board. The remaining 3 posies are used in a variant of the game.

Definitions

Group – adjacent posies. One posy is also a group.

Play

Choose a starting player, then turns alternate.

On a turn,

1) Remove 2 like color non-adjacent posies that are separated by a straight line of adjacent posies. Removed posies are scored at the end of the game or

2) Remove 2 adjacent color poises.
If a group is split (divided by empty spaces) into 2 or more groups, the moving player who caused the split keeps the smallest group. But if the smallest groups are of equal size, the moving player then decides which one of those to keep.

The game ends when a player cannot take his turn.

Scoring

Pink posies are worth 1 point each, Purple posies are worth 2 points each, and Green posies are worth 3 points each. Players add up their points, and the player with the highest score wins.

Two Variants

1) The rules are the same except that the player with the most posies wins

2) The rules are the same except that at the start three posies (one of each color) are placed in a bag. The rest of the posies are used to set up the board. Next players draw one posy from the bag making sure to keep it hidden from the other players until the end of the game. At the end of the game, players reveal their hidden posy. Total all the posies in your revealed color including the one that was hidden (all posies are worth 1 point each). Then multiply the total by 3 and add in the posies not in your revealed color to your total. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer

name: Weiß Schwarz: Sword Art Online Trial Deck
description:
Weiß Schwarz is a CCG produced in collaboration with some of the most popular animation/ video game works in Japan. Players separate the "Weiß" side which features mainly pretty characters from the "Schwarz" side featuring cool characters.

Though the title consists of various kinds of card sets, a carefully planned system and rules make it possible for players to mix any of them on each side and enjoy the game.

This Series contains cards from the popular Light Novel/Anime Sword Art Online.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: System Gate
description:
System Gate is a living card game where two or more players race to reduce their opponent's life to zero. They do this by playing monster, spell, item and finale cards.

There are three spaces on the board - left, center, and right - that monsters can be placed. If there is no monster in a player's center space, they are vulnerable to attack. Players can equip item cards to give them an edge.

There are several factions, called worlds, each specializing in a unique strategy and gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Taskmaster Game: Expansion Pack
description:
Welcome to the TASKMASTER Game Expansion Pack!

Inside this box, you will get:


40 all-new task cards to add to your Taskmaster Board Game
The opportunity to access exclusive Final Video Tasks
10 Prize Task selector cards
50 paper refill slips for your stunning self-portraits
Your very own little Taskmaster’s Assistant!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time

name: Adeptus Titanicus: Crucible of Retribution
description:
When the Horus Heresy broke out, the galaxy fell into turmoil. In the Belt of Iron, an area characterised by a preponderance of forge worlds, long-held grievances turned into outright war between Mechanicum factions, and the Titan Legions aligned with the various forge world marched in defence of their allies…

Discover the dramatic events of the Cataclysm of Iron, when forge world fought forge world, in this 96-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus. Harness the strengths of seven different Titan Legions using two new maniples, and bring the might of four Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Play out the story across four narrative missions – or create your own with new Echoes of Glory rules that provide you with powerful tools to play your games in whatever manner you choose.

Inside this book you will find:

• An overview of the Cataclysm of Iron campaign

• Background and Legion-specific rules for seven Titan Legions: Atarus, Astraman, Ignatum, Venator, Laniaskara, Kulesaetai, Damicium, and Tritonis

• Two new maniples to use in your games

• Background and rules for four Knight Houses: Col'Khak, Moritain, Gotrith, and Vextrix

• Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights

• Four narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story

• Echoes of Glory rules for creating your own missions across five mission types and three world types

name: 1914: Twilight in the East – Dragoni Variant
description:
Hypothetical variant for "Dragoni's plan for Austro-Hungarian victory in 1914".

4 page set-up folder, 2 page rules changes and designer's notes in the magazine, 140 counters.

Included with C3i magazine #26

name: Bouquet
description:
"You and the other players are floral designers, and the most popular bouquets this season incorporate a wide variety of flowers. In this game, each value on a die represents a different flower... and only the most diverse arrangements will sell for top dollar!"

This is a dice rolling game where you are locking in values, deciding if you will stop & score the locked values or continue to pushing your luck and re-roll. You bust and score nothing if you only roll locked values on the next roll. If you stopped and scored you get points; the game ends when you get to 100 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Swapportunity
description:
"Each player is trying to beat the dealer in this game of dice-swapping, but if you aren't careful you might put yourself in trouble on a later turn!"

Using 3 dice, you play a game of swapping dice to beat the dealer's pair of dice. You get 3 choices - use the dice you rolled, swap a die with your locked die to improve your score, or use all 3 dice. This results in you locking one die to a 1 for the next round.

If you beat the dealer, you get a point. First one to 6 points wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Little Fish
description:
"You and the other players are little fish, trying to avoid the fisherman! At the end of the round, the biggest fish get caught, and only the little fish survive. Compete in secret for the highest score, but when your results are revealed each round, the best dice on the table get tossed out."

Secretively roll your dice up to three times and try and get the most points scored with any dice not caught. The highest number on the table is caught and doesn't score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Six-Sided Slayers
description:
"In this cooperative game, you and other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster's lair. Kill enough monsters and become legendary heroes! Fail too often and you become a cautionary tale..."

Each player has six dice while the rest are the dice pool representing the monster. Low valued dice are not a part of the monster. Players decide and declare what role they will be - bard, wizard, warrior, etc. Then they roll their dice. They then remove monster dice if they can match the dice per their role's abilities. If they defeat the monster (i.e. the monster has no more dice), the group earns a point. If there are dice remaining though, the monster deals one point damage per die remaining. If the group can get 5 points before they get 5 damage points, they win. If neither of these have been hit, take another round. If the party ever gets 5 points of damage though - well, the tales told in the taverns won't be happy ones...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexican Train
description:
"In this dice-based twist on a classic dominoes game, players use pairs of dice to create a long train. Get stuck with dice at the end, however, and your game will derail quickly!"

You have a dice 'bone pile' that you play from adding to the dealer's lead pair, treating the dice pair as a domino. Each person in turn tries to connect a pair or pass, when everyone passes the round is over and remaining dice score against you. Once someone gets to 10 points the winner is determined.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Three-Legged Race
description:
"Maintain a careful balance as you chase three high scores at once!"

This one is a bit of a math at the end where you are trying to optimize the summed difference of scores to be the closest to 50 across three scoring columns. Each person is working to do this.

The game can be played in turns or simultaneous.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Closing Bell
description:
"In this stock market game you will invest your dice, hoping ot score big points when the market closes. Careful... you could bust and go home empty-handed!"

This game is played in rounds of 4 market phases. There is a set of market dice that are rolled secretly by keeping them under a cup. Rolling your dice and then you can choose one value to lock. Once everyone has decided, uncover the market dice. If you didn't match any of the market dice, you are now out and score nothing. Did you match an unlocked value on a market die at least once, but not the locked value? You can continue playing, but you don't score any points this round. If you match the locked dice to the market dice, you can choose to set aside these for scoring or continue to the next round to push your luck for more points.

The points scored go up each round, but the number of market dice rolled go down. Locked dice remain locked from round ot round.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Investment, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Crapsize
description:
"You and the other players are competing to contract cargo ships which will bring valuable goods to port. Staying out at sea too long is risky, as weather can endanger your entire fleet. Will you gamble on long voyages for big money, or will you play it safe and stay close to home?"

Shipping lanes are made up of 7 cards 1-6 and another for scoring. You roll dice not at sea and can choose pairs to go to sea or not. One die chooses where to start and the other is the value of the cargo.

Then you roll two dice to see if a storm shows up and whether you lose any of your ships. Ships lost are removed and can be rerolled again next turn.

Finally move your ships forward (towards the lower number), if any move to zero and onto the scoring card earning points through a multiplication; doubles can net you a couple of bonus points.

If anyone reaches the 100 point goal or more the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Amphibious Fleet
description:
Amphibious Fleet is a stand-alone game from Technical Term game company in Japan. It is an addition to Victory Games, "Fleet" series.

Amphibious Fleet is set in the South China Sea. Most scenarios involve China conducting an amphibious invasion of an island in the South China Sea, while the owners of the island attempt to resist China's efforts.

Please note that while the map and counters are marked in English, the rules are in Japanese.

name: A2/AD Fleet
description:
A2/AD Fleet is a modern air and sea fighting game from the Technical Term game company in Japan. A2/AD Fleet takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands. The game is an addition to Victory Games' "Fleet" series of games.

A2/AD is a military term for "anti-access/area denial, and A2/AD Fleet does touch on A2/AD tactics. China, India, the United States, Myanmar, Thailand, Malaysia, and Singapore are all represented with ships and aircraft. The action takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands, some of the busiest waterways in the world.

name: Wtedy kiedy: Magia kina
description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wtedy kiedy: Sportowe emocje
description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Emil i Lönneberga: Äggjakten
description: A roll-and-move game where players and Emil tries to collect the most eggs by gathering hens from around the garden. The players can also try to take hens from the hen house, guarded by Emil's pig. At the end of the game the hens are turned over and the player with the most eggs win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grimdark Future: Jakob's Path – Narrative Campaign
description:
Jakob’s Path is a narrative campaign for Grimdark Future that follows the story of Jakob, a ruthless Battle Brothers captain, in his quest to conquer the Orc world of Zeloria-M5, whilst searching for a mysterious artifact.

This game expansion for Grimdark Future takes players on an adventure across 10 missions which are tied together by an exciting story of epic proportions. Rules for unit progression are also included, so you can watch your armies grow and evolve throughout the campaign.

Even though this narrative campaign was written with Battle Brothers and Orc Marauders in mind, it is easy to imagine this type of clash to be happening between any of the other factions in the galaxy, so feel free to swap them out with whatever armies you have available to play.

Note that to play this campaign you’re going to need the core rules for Grimdark Future as well as some army lists
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Circle
description: When Jodie Wong hosts a group of her closest friends for an evening of fun, she decides the entertainment will be a game called The Circle that requires everyone to write down one anonymous fact about themselves. The group will then take turns guessing which fact corresponds to which person. She decides to make things even more exciting by having everyone type out their fact on an antique typewriter that was owned by a murderer named Nicholas Hundley. Things get weird, however, when there are more messages than participants and one of the notes reads, "I killed a person once. Tonight, I’ll kill another.” No one admits to writing the note, and everyone goes home thinking it was nothing more than a bad joke. It doesn't seem funny the next day when Jodie is found murdered in her home. Was Jodie Wong killed by one of those closest to her who attended the party? Or was the typewriter a conduit through which something sinister entered this world? Enter The Circle and find out.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Framed
description: The Valley Falls Museum is home to some of the world’s most exciting art exhibits and archaeological finds. It is also known for its wonderful ancient history curator, Albert McCain. However, everything changes when a successful heist of the museum results in McCain's death. Based on evidence recovered from the scene, authorities arrest fellow museum employee, Noah Parker, and charge him with robbery and murder. Noah is a friend and calls you immediately, desperate to proclaim his innocence and enlist your help. He is aware of the Will Street Detective Agency's stellar track record and is hopeful that you will find information that will exonerate him. Solve the mystery of the museum heist, the murder of Albert McCain, and collect the clues that could either free Parker from jail or lead to his conviction.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Museum Nocturnus
description: Summary: Museum Nocturnus is a paranormal museum dedicated to cursed objects, items taken from haunted locations, serial killer artifacts, and anything else weird that wouldn’t stand a chance of being curated for any other museum. Valley Falls’ resident group of ghost hunters, S.T.A.L.K., purchased the museum in hopes of turning a profit and boosting their profile within the paranormal community. Father Richter Casey agrees to spend the night inside the museum and perform a series of blessings on the place before it reopens. Things go awry, however, when the priest is found dead the following morning. Given the frightful nature of the place, the list of potential culprits includes both human and supernatural suspects. Your job is to investigate The Hall of Murderers, The Hall of Cursed Toys, and The Hall of Haunted Items in order to determine what really happened to Father Casey.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Restaurantrepreneur
description:
Your life-long dream of opening your own restaurant will soon become a reality. But first you must work on the menu, hire some staff, find a location, choose some fixtures and fittings and get the word out across the town. You have money in three different accounts at the bank. Use them wisely, or you may run out of money before you’re ready to open.

Play is simultaneous. On each turn, one player rolls all three dice and each player chooses how to the dice rolls on their own scoresheet.

1 die shows which numbered mini game you are playing this turn. If you choose a six for this die, you may pick any of the five games. 1 die shows what number you will use within that mini game and the third die shows the account you will spend money from in the bank.

The five different mini games all work in different ways...
In game 1 you are creating your menu - by adding elements to plates. In game 2 you are interviewing and hiring staff to work in your cafe. Game 3 enables you to choose the location of your restaurant. In game 4, you're able to select the best fixtures and fittings and create your own personal style, while game 5 helps you to get the word out to potential customers in the area.

Completing milestones within each games triggers bonuses - giving you extra turns and possibly creating a cascade of chaining actions. Players can also earn rosettes which give extra points at the end of the game.

Total up each of your mini games and add your rosette bonus to give your final score. Most points wins!

You just need 3 dice and a pen. To play, you write directly onto the placemat.

Any number of players can play the game. Restaurantrepreneur is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses

name: Maiden's Quest: Snuzzler Dragon Savior Promo Card
description:
Maiden's Quest: Promo – Snuzzler Dragon from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter

New Savior Card with one gem on the Left behind side and 2 gems and downgrade a haste on the Saved side
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Résistance: Mes Amis ! C'est La Guerre Deck
description:
Mes Amis ! C'est la Guerre cards can be purchased in-game by spending a sum of dice that is 6 or greater.
These cards give players advantages and/or allow you to mess with your opponents, adding a fun "Take that!" element to the game.

The base game ships with its own C'est la Guerre cards.
The Mes Amis deck includes new cards such as American tanks, British commandos, and Allied planes.
A big help, and big fun.

Mes Amis C'est la Guerre is a 9-card deck.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Oil Town
description:
Oil Town is a competitive, card-driven, dice-placement board game from Pio Games. It's designed by Anton Jankowski and features traditional hand-painted watercolor art by Yayoi Jankowski.

The American Wild West, 1890. After a tiring trail, you have finally arrived in Oil Town – a boomtown that attracts pioneers from all around the land with its never-ending flow of black gold. With your allocated drilling rights in your hands, you gather a bunch of helpers and set foot on the intimidating oil field. After walking around for a while, you notice the dowsing rod suddenly starts to twitch. In this moment you realize – it’s time to strike it rich!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Puzzle
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dice Baseball
description: "Dice Baseball" is a game that expresses the psychological warfare between a batter and a pitcher. It is realistic and immersive because it uses the pitcher's pitch and batter's batting method used in baseball. The batter and pitcher secretly select the card and open it at the same time. Locate the bat and the ball. If the bat matches the ball, the batter wins, the batter rolls the dice and follows the result. If the bat and the ball do not match, the pitcher wins, the pitcher rolls the dice and follows the result. Your choice can lead the team to victory!

name: Käpt'n Klabauter
description:
On a little island, there is a huge gold treasure. Every pirate has some ducates in his boat and paddles to the island. But be careful - if a storm is coming or the captain appears, everything goes worse... The goal of the game is to be the first one on the island - with a little bit of tactics and some luck.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Hold The Fort
description:
Hold The Fort is a quick-fire strategy card game for 2 to 6 players where you are the commander of your fortress and your cards are your army of heroes.

Before the game starts, players are randomly dealt a Fortress Card and four to six Hero Cards. Players then choose two Hero Cards from their hand to defend their fortress with. These cards are placed face down in front of their fortress and the game begins. On a player’s turn, they take one of three actions; recruit, defend, or attack.

To recruit, a player picks a card from the draw pile. If they draw a Hero Card, it is added to their hand. If they draw a Chaos Card, the scenario described on the card takes effect.

To defend, a player takes a Hero Card from their hand and bolsters their defence by placing it next to their existing defenders.

To attack, a player takes up to three Hero Cards from their hand and lays siege to another player’s fortress. They roll the Dice of The Fates to see if their heroes receive a boon or a penalty. The total score of all attacking and defending cards is then calculated and it is determined whether the attack failed or succeeded.

On a failed attack, the defending player wins the Hero Cards that unsuccessfully attacked them. On a successful attack, the attacking player wins the defeated defending Hero Cards. The defending player then attempts to rebuild their defence with any Hero Cards from their hand.

When a player no longer has any Hero Cards to defend their fortress with, their Fortress is conquered and they are out of the game.

The last player left standing wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: T34 Leader
description:
In T34 Leader, you're in command of a Soviet armoured company of tanks, armored cars, trucks, and armoured infantry. You may also be assigned air support and heavy weapons support in order to achieve your goals. Your goals are to take your objectives while trying to keep as many of your men alive as possible during realistic tactical missions.

T34 Leader features various historical campaigns that can be played as individual campaigns or linked to form one huge mega-campaign that follows your troops from the Invasion of Poland to the final battles on the Eastern and Western fronts.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide which vehicles and infantry units to use and which commanders are best for the mission. Vehicle and infantry commanders are rated for skill level and even personality quirks such as how well they keep their heads while under fire. Deciding which commanders are used for each mission is a major consideration. Your units will become fatigued with every mission. If you push a commander and his men too hard, his skills will degrade. Your commanders and their crew also gain experience with every mission. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep fighting with your top commanders and crew and further fatigue them to get the job done, or let the new guys fight in order to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 1
description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Wild Magic” is unpredictable

Use it as an Action, Reaction, or Modifier – your choice. Draw until you reach the type of card you want and play it. Be careful, though! You have to declare your target first, so you might get unexpected results. You might help an opponent or do harm to yourself.

“Decree” forces all players to do as you do

Raise or lower everyone's HP. Force everyone to draw or discard a card. By the way, this card can be boosted. So imagine making everyone lose 3 HP instead of just 1!

“Anarchy” lets you bend the rules

All players may ignore modifier restrictions on all cards! This card stays on the table until the next time the discards are shuffled into a new deck. Anarchy opens the door for some creative and insane card interactions and combos.

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Tzoy
description:
This game allows for 4 modes or expedition types : head-to-head, treasure hunt (co-op), treasure hunt (no teams) and solo.

Using 3 different sizes of wooden meeples, you must place them, according to the wooden die value, on one of the 6 rings of the circular board that is suspended in the center by a rope and pole.

If the board flips, you must take back all the fallen meeples.

In the head-to-head mode, the winner is the first to place all their meeples on the board without it flipping.

In the other modes, your goal is to make the most points, with each treasure tokens and meeples giving various points, while avoiding the lava sections.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Stacking and Balancing

name: You Don't Know Jack: Movies Expansion Pack
description:
This add-on set for the tabletop YOU DON'T KNOW JACK game includes 113 cards with 452 additional questions about you favorite feature films of the past & present. Like the original, each question has that wacky YDKJ twist to make it that much more interesting and challenging!

NOTE: Unlike the TV expansion, where the last card in the set has only two questions on it, all the cards in this set have the full 4 questions on them, making for 452 total questions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: 8-Bit Splatch
description: You're looking for a colourful pixeled paintball capture the flag? That's oddly specific! But hey, we got you covered! 8-bit Splatch is a game of luck and strategy. 2 players (or teams) control shooters in two different colours, as they attempt to steal each other's flags. You use your action points to move around the board, grab the flag, and send enemy shooters straight to the hospital. Beware though, as you'll have to deal with the VIP, a super-shooter who is on both teams at once. If you can dodge the hail of paintballs from the other team and the VIP, you can claim the flag back to the base, and see if it is real. If it is, congratulations, you won! If not, then its back into the battlefield you go...
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Team-Based Game, Tug of War, Turn Order: Random

name: Burger Builder
description:
Don your chef hats and prepare for a patty-flipping, cheese-melting, sauce-squeezing battle for burger supremacy.

In this fun and fast-paced card game, players score points by using colourful ingredient cards to assemble tasty items off the Burger Builder menu.

First, players draw 7 cards from the deck. At the start of their turn, players can ask other players for any ingredient card they may need, depending on what want to build. If the other player has one or more of that ingredient, they must hand one over. If not, the player whose turn it is draws 2 cards from the deck instead. They can then use the cards they have in their hand to create as many items off the Burger Builder menu as possible.

Each ingredient card can be used in a variety of meals, allowing players to be strategic in what they build and when. You could play something small, like onion rings or potato cakes, or save up your cards to build something big, like an epic burger!

A variety of power cards let you play more strategically in your race to accumulate the most points. Swap out cards from your hand, force other players to throw away their ingredient cards or even steal finished menu items. But be careful, your opponents are out to do the same to you in return. Power cards can be used at any time on your turn.

If a player uses up all the cards in their hand they get to draw another 7 cards from the deck. However, this ends their turn and they cannot play any more cards.

Play ends in one of two ways. In sprint mode, play ends when the first player reaches 30 points. In marathon mode, play continues until the entire deck has been used up and players can no longer create any food combos. The winning player is the one who has played the most ingredient cards.

And that's all there is to it!

name: Killing Cards: Mafia
description:
Only One Will Survive.

In Killing Cards: Mafia, the godfather of the mafia has just died. You are one of the suitors for his succession. The period is troubled: a Vigilante is on the prowl and each suitor is getting ready to hire Henchmen to get rid of his competitors. Your goal is to be the last player left alive.

On your turn, you will play cards and then draw one. If the card you draw is the Vigilante or a Henchman, either you have a Bodyguard and he protects you, or you die. All the other cards are there to help you hire Henchmen or avoid drawing a card that would kill you.

name: Moon Base Command
description:
The Federation has issued a CRITICAL RED ALERT to Moon Base Command to prepare for a massive asteroid assault. You as the base commander must operate the protection system and take control of the missiles and two Plasma cannons. Each Plasma cannon has a limited firing capacity, a max range and an overheating protection system. The Federation has explained that it looks as if there will be [5] waves consisting of groups of asteroids heading towards the Moon base with four waves of asteroids per group. Each asteroid will be represented by a d6 die. You must protect the moon base and keep each of the three bases from being destroyed.

Victory conditions:
Your goal is to protect the Moon base at all costs. You must save at least 1 base with a shield value of at least one. A total victory would be all bases saved with full shield values of six each.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: DIE
description:
- D - I - E -

"The Game of a Thousand Dice"

Deploy your dice, then strategically position rings within the arena to capture enemy dice when they - D - I - E - in a dice fight.

Use captured enemy dice as currency to buy upgrades and earn victory points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Flicking

name: DIE on the Floor
description:
6 dice each.
Lay out the rope in a ring on the floor.
Take turns throwing dice.
One's are wild and Two's are re-rolls (pick up to throw again later).
Throwing at other players dice to change the value or knock them out of the ring is encouraged!
Winner is the player with the most matching dice.
Only count dice that end up within the ring.
Dice value on matching dice breaks a tie.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Pharmacopoeia
description:
Set collection game, where each set you make restricts your collecting options.

Draw varying quantities of coloured tablets from two piles on the table. Each time you make a set of 5, it blocks one of your draw options for that colour. If you have any incomplete sets of 5 at the end of the round they go to the waste tray.

Complete 'prescriptions' and set up cascading combos to be the most efficient pharmacist with the least wasted tablets.

—description from the designer

name: Rogue Deck
description:
“The rogue gives chase, as the Twisted King flees into Darkness”

Play cards from your hand to:
Reveal what hides in the darkness.
Improve your deck by collecting upgrades.
Attack and defend against enemies.

Resolve all darkness cards, defeat the Twisted King and escape to the light.

Defeat the darkness enough times and at new difficulty levels to complete the ‘challenge card’.

The Rogue will die, frequently. Complete the ‘death card’ by dying enough times.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Hyper Beam
description:
HYPER BEAM
Power Force Ultra
GT Turbo

Card duelling game between two fighters stuck in a dead lock of opposing energy beams 'tug of war' style.

Draw 5 cards into your hand, top left corner denotes the cards type/ability/value, each card has two options (top and bottom).

After drawing cards, pick whether to use the top or bottom option by rotating cards in your hand so that the chosen option is at the top (these cannot be changed once chosen)

Players take turns playing cards to push the score marker towards their opponent on the score track. If a player pushes the marker to their opponents end of the score track, then that player wins the round.

Best of three rounds, wins.

-description from designer

name: Backyard Cricket
description:
Backyard cricket is a roll and write for 1 to 10 players, that takes the high scoring of runs, plenty of wickets and always some not outs, of playing cricket in the backyard. From 8 runs for on the roof and off again to 5 runs for hitting the clothes line. Roll the ball dice and the extras dice to make runs fast while watching out for those pesky stumps!

Players roll the dice then while matching numbers with their score sheet trying to skip over the wickets, play continues until some one either gets 10 wickets or finishes their 4th innings. Count up the total runs scored, the player with the most, Wins.

name: Bargo
description:
Bargo is a Go-like territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board). Each player must have access to a sufficient number of hexagonal pieces of their own color.

Each piece has one of its six edge segments covered with a wall. The outer edges of the board are also covered with walls.



DefinitionsTwo adjacent cells, and any pieces on them, are linked if their shared edge segment does not contain a wall.

A group is a piece along with all other like-colored pieces one could reach from it through a series of steps between linked pieces of its color.

A liberty of a group is an empty cell linked to at least one piece in that group.

Similarly, a territory is an empty cell along with all other empty cells one could reach from it through a series of steps between linked empty cells. You own a territory if all pieces linked to cells in that territory are of your color.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you must pass or place a piece of your color on an empty cell without causing any edge segment on the board to contain more than one wall, not even momentarily during the move.

After a placement, remove all enemy pieces in groups without liberties. After all removals, the following conditions must be met:


Your newly placed piece must be part of a group with at least one liberty.
The cell on the other side of the wall of your newly placed piece must not contain an enemy piece.
The current board position, ignoring walls, must be different from the board positions at the end of all your previous turns.


Otherwise, your placement is illegal.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins.
