A player's score is the number of pieces of their color on the board, plus the number of cells in their territories, plus a komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.



Komi and buttonThe komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button. When checking for repetitions, two identical board positions are still considered different if the button had already been taken in one of them but not in the other.



NotesLike its companion game Keil, Bargo aims to preserve crosscuts and ko from Go by reducing the natural connectivity of the hexagonal grid.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Quer durch Europa
description:
A criminal is on the run across Europe. The players work together to find the five cities, where the criminal has hidden. Each player fly with his plane to European cities and has to answer questions about these locations. If the answer is correct, the players get a new clue about the hiding place. The players win, if they catch the criminal before he can leave Europe.

For playing the game tiptoi-pen is necessary.

name: D6: New Hero Promo Cards
description:
2 new Hero cards. Text on both cards read:
Natural d4

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Peace Treaty
description:
The Peace Treaty is a two to five player area of control game where the goal is to achieve victory in a brutal civil war scenario. Begin the game fighting over the equally worthless lands of the Realm of Parabell, but vote on powerful bills that can completely change the value of strategic tiles on the map! Fight this war fair and square, or use covert operations and unorthodox tactics to gain the upper hand over your foes! You can also use diplomacy and trade to further your goals! Whatever playstyle you and your friends may choose, the Peace Treaty has it covered! But only one faction can win in the end!

The game takes 60 to 90 minutes. It can be played with 2-5 people. the game ends after 10 turns, or after 12 peace treaty bills have been drawn onto the table and 1 climax bill has been drawn onto the table.

Every turn players go though a number of phases. The First phase is the Allocate war budget phase where players will allow money to show how much they will spend on war this turn.

The Second phase is the peace treaty phase, where players will vote on bills that will change the value of tiles on the map and add or remove rules, players vote on bills by reaching their hand into a cotton bag, and at the same time drawing out coins to place on 1 of three sides.. Pass, Ban or Veto, Each side does a different thing depending on the card and the side with the most money gets put into play.

The third phase is the war phase, where players look at a list of actions which include, moving their armies, attacking other players, sending out airstrikes or even committing unethical actions~. Unethical actions are actions which in all senses are better than normal war actions but force the player to collect unethical cubes, which do nothing at the start of the game but may punish players harshly if certain cards have been put into play.

Lastly, is the income phase, where everyone collects income from owning land, 1 coin per 3 tiles + whatever card rulings after collecting income, players draw the next peace treaty card and do it all again until they reach the end of turn 10 where they will count up victory points and whoever has the most wins!

—description from the designer

name: Anachrony Chess
description:
In an alternate universe, the Paths of Anachrony are at war. This abstract, chess-style, two-player strategy game tells the story of one Path’s conquest of another, using Anachrony components and a print-and-play game board.

Just like in chess, your goal is to capture your opponent’s “King,” which in this game is represented by the Player banner—in other words, the Path’s “Flag.”

In this chess variant, the playing pieces will be your Exosuits, and the Workers you use to operate them will determine how they behave. What do you need for the next move? A Knight, a Rook, a Bishop, or maybe a Queen? Recruit the respective Worker from the Market for your chosen Exosuit with a bonus resource (like a Water or Energy core), and make your move!

Keep in mind that Workers are removed from used Exosuits after they move, so you’ll have to recruit new ones to operate them—unless, of course, you pay a Water to motivate the Worker to stay. If you have an empty Exosuit in danger or would like to move an Exosuit like a Pawn, you’ll find Energy cores are quite useful as well.

The print-and-play Anachrony Chess game board and the Rulebook are available for download at www.mindclashgames.com and the Files section of this BGG page.

name: DreamWeavers
description:
Where dreams come from...
Inside the unconscious mind of every being lives the world of dreams. Morpheus, the orchestrator of Nightmares and Paradise has filled countless minds with terror and wonder.

Over time Morpheus recruited help; he’s named them DreamWeavers, architects of the unconscious. It’s once again time for new recruits to join the realm!

Players form two teams, taking turns influencing a subject’s dream with their actions.
During their turn players will do 1 of the following:
- Draw cards and gain resources
- Play a card into the play area
- Complete an Objective
- Claim a dream (to score points)

The game progresses each time players draw a specific card (Suns). When 8 of these Sun cards
have been drawn the game ends.

DreamWeavers uses a Scoreboard as a point system. Teams will need to accumulate two types of points, (Nightmare and Paradise Stars). The Teams’ final score will be the lowest of the two types.

name: The Last Drifters: Objects in the Rearview May Kill You
description:
The Last Drifters
These rules are meant for any small scale cars made by any manufacturer (as long as both forces are of a similar scale).
The vehicles used as examples in these rules are cheap converted children's cars that you can find in most toy shops, and the games are aimed at using around two to three vehicles per side for a normal game of maybe an hour or so. The system can cope with more vehicles per side but these games would take longer to play.

The rules cover a selection of vehicles that you would expect to find in a post apocalyptic world, from fast motorbikes all the way up to heavy battle trucks. The rules also cover many different weapons and armour that these vehicles could possibly carry.

These rules also contain a selection of ways to play, plus a section containing a few scenarios like:

Resting Beside The Road - a couple of drifters are taking a rest beside the road when they hear ganger motorbikes!
Find The Lady - a VIP is travelling in one of the cars can you get them to safety?
Plus a few others.


At the back of these rules you will find a print out section with the data sheets for all the basic

Vehicles and some blank ones so that you can build your own vehicles. You will also find all of the counters for you to use in your games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Level Neo
description:
A Japanese trading card game, players can use characters from different animes.

description from official website：
版権キャラクターTCGで多くの実績を持つ、ムービックが自信を持ってお贈りする新世代TCG。様々なアニメ作品の登場人物から、自分のパートナーを1人選び、レベルが上がるごとにパワーアップする、「メインキャラ」として対戦相手とバトルするキャラクターTCGです。
Google translate：
A new generation TCG presented by Movic with confidence, which has many achievements in copyright character TCG. It is a character TCG that battles with opponents as a "main character" by selecting one of your partners from the characters of various anime works and powering up as the level goes up.

name: Rugby Challenger
description:
Rugby Challenger is a game about the sport of rugby.

Gameplay:
Players (alone or in team) need to score points in the in-goal area of the opposing team. They progress similarly to the game of goose with a dice, boxes, and trivia cards with questions on rugby, to pass the obstacles.
Questions cover the game of rugby, its history, French and international teams...
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Piazza: Public Square
description:
The Piazza is the public square in an Italian city. A piazza is where you will find a street cafe or a small vegetable market. Place a strip mall on all sides of the street, plus statues, fountains and ornamentation, and you will have a piazza.

In Piazza, the players are building up the piazza walls and ornamentation that will make this place somewhere that people will talk about for centuries to come.
The cards used in Piazza represents the workers that are supplying their resource. Various projects require a certain group of resources, others have a whole different set.
The players play as designers of this magnificent location, trying to create another masterpiece with their choices of resources. The first player to finish building all their walls will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: LG TACTICS
description:
LG TACTICS is a strategy-lite battle card game where you must outmaneuver your opponent to win. It features simple gameplay where you decide which cards to deploy and attack with.

The game is played with a single deck of cards and you can learn the rules in minutes. Players need to Recruit, Deploy and Attack with their cards until only one army remains. You can play against one or more opponents, or even play solo to test your skills. Games take about 15 minutes per person, and 1 - 5 people can play (more if you combine 2 decks).

LG TACTICS - strategy battle card game
Game cards feature a single number representing its power level. Some powerful cards have a deploy requirement in order to play onto the battlefield.

TACTICS comes with 72 cards and a rule book in a game box. Cards feature original illustrations in a minimal fantasy silhouette style.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Force Commitment

name: ReDelivery
description:
ReDelivery is a semi-cooperative, puzzle-solving, dexterity game for 1-5 players aged 8 and up. Load your truck and deliver the right packages to the right depots without dropping any parcels to become employee of the month!

The aim of the game is to work together to 'redeliver' the coloured boxes to the corresponding warehouses. If any boxes drop on your turn, they're considered damaged goods and are placed in front of you. The player with the fewest damaged goods at the end of the game wins (when playing semi-cooperatively).

Each turn, a player may do any combination of 2 actions - pick up a box, sort boxes in your truck, deliver a box or drive - but only using one hand.

Event cards are temporary effects played each turn that can either benefit you (e.g. plus one action) or hinder you (e.g. use your other hand), and players have to work around these to progress with the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Multiple Maps, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Iron Mountain: The Shadows Within
description:
Deep within the mountain a heart of iron beats. Slowly pumping molten ore through its iron veins. Shadows pray with frozen hands before the glowing stream. The iron god awoken. The iron law unbound.

Iron Mountain is a bleak and unforgiving game about fragile hopes better left behind. Players take on the roles of outcasts condemned to slave away their existence in an underground mine. Time and toil have reduced them to mere shadows flickering through winding tunnels and empty caves. But now the iron law that binds them has begun to loosen its grip. As they set out to reclaim their past lives and escape the mountain, hope quickly turns to despair. For what does it mean to be free in a world of shackles? And what becomes of a shadow once it steps outside and into the light?

The game is played over a series of turns until all shadows have either escaped the iron mountain or become lost. Players control multiple shadows, exploring the mountain by placing cave tiles, discovering items, and crafting iron artefacts. Every action causes tremors, and shadows are constantly trying to avoid triggering collapses and other disastrous events along the tremor track. The shadows must hurry to craft their artefacts and find the shaft of light before the mountain comes crashing down upon them. As they enter the shaft of light, players burn the shadow standees in a candle, hoping against hope that something better awaits them on the other side.

Iron Mountain is the second installment in the Trilogy of Lost Hope. The trilogy began with Tower of Silence and will end with Pesta.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Nakarm chomiczka
description:
Knock, knock! Little hamsters knocked on your door and their bellies are growling with hunger... What can you feed them? Take a look at the pantries and choose the best treats for your pupils!

Be quick, be careful and grab the right treat before the other players do! Place your Treat Tokens in the hamster's belly and cheeks and remember about a varied diet! Apples, sunflower seeds, carrots, clover, beetroots and more - choose wisely as the space in your hamster's belly is limited!

Crunch, crunch!

Game components include 4 Hamster Player Boards, 1 dice (D6), 6 Pantry Tokens, 4 Hamster Markers and 60 different Treat Tokens.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: 川中島 (Kawanakajima)
description:
KAWANAKAJIMA（川中島) is Japanese historical war game.

The Battle of Kawanakajima lasted from 1553 to 1564.

It is a War Game that reproduces a total of 5 battles in 5 game turns.

Players compete for victory based on the total number of area-dominated victory points that they check each turn.

This game is included in "WARGAME HANDBOOK 2019".

name: Monumentus
description:
Monumentus is a two to four player combination territory control and resource management game played on triangular tiles, with the ability to expand to 5-8 players. Roleplaying as the mangers of a civilization, players make progress across an advancement track split into four eras of time, with each era requiring a player to construct four unique buildings which either produce resources, create an engine to produce new resources, or effect the way in which those resources are managed.

At the beginning of the game, each player is given eight terrain tiles, two of which are placed at the start of the game. As each player advances to the next era, they place two new terrain tiles creating a sort of "fog of war". Over the course of gameplay each player will place 16 buildings before constructing the final monument, winning the game for that player.

In addition to the placement of buildings, each turn players draw either a "rise" or a "ruin" card depending on their leaderboard position. These cards have random effects which balance gameplay for those who are lagging behind or have snowballed ahead, which can be omitted for purely strategic gameplay. As well, players move up to two merchant pieces with the ability to duplicate the production of the building or resource triangle they are standing on, including the buildings of their opponents.

At the end of each round, players collectively take part in open trade where they are able to trade: resources, constructed buildings, rise cards, their status tokens, and can make promissory agreements for future payment which they are not required to fulfil. The game is played until the first player constructs their monument, which determines the winner of that game. The game can be continued to determined second, third, place players if desired.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Civilization, Economic, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Contracts, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Pieces as Map, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion
description:
Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion adds four new components and the ability to play one-on-one simultaneous games via the Triple. Can be played as a standalone version (using the same rules as the basic game) or with the basic game.

In Battle Mode, both players start at the same time. The player nearest the hole, plays again. Then players alternate until one reaches the hole.

New components added:


1x Triple (for Battle Mode)
1x Volcano
1x Bridge
1x Jump
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Sports

name: Le jeu des petits cyclistes
description:
With Le jeu des petits cyclistes, the Little Cyclists game, simulate all the biggest races of the season (Tour de France, Paris-Roubaix, world championships, etc...).
Retrieve the specificities of the peloton, mountain passes or cobbled sectors.
Attack (like Pierre Rolland!), Suck the wheel…
adopt the right strategy to achieve victory!

—description from back of the box (translated)

A simplified version of Um Reifenbreite.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rovers van de Noordzee: Promodeck
description:
An authorized promo deck for the Dutch market that contains a selection of 25 cards from the North Sea Runesaga expansion and 5-Year Anniversary Promo Cards.

3 Outsider:
- Invader
- Scout
- Thief

3 Hero:
- Constantin
- Girard
- Jorunn

19 Townfolk:
- Artisan x3
- Assassin x3
- Beggar x2
- Blacksmith x2
- Conspirator x3
- Farmer x2
- Thief x2
- Tyrant x2
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Zoo Cards
description:
Card kit to play with your group of friends. Agility, concentration and memory you will need to win. This game is perfect for family fun. Go ahead and buy it now!

A card KIT to play 10 totaly diferents fun family games. From 2 to 15 players

name: Pet Wars
description:
Pet Wars is a boardgame for two players that is free to print and play. Players control either the Kids or the Pets. Your goal as the Kids is to keep the house in good shape and keep the pets from wrecking the place. The Pets attempt to destroy as much stuff as they can and make a huge mess. Players only have 10 turns to accomplish their goals as best as possible.

The Pets will consist of four dogs and four cats. The dogs and cats can eat food, then poo and pee in the house, or leave muddy footprints, which all earn points at the end if not cleaned up by the kids. Dogs can break things and chew stuff up, cats can shred stuff and knock things over. Cuz Cats.

The Kids have a Babysitter, Brother, Sister, and a baby. Each kids has a special power. The biggest dog will always protect the baby, and follow the baby around. The sister likes to chase the cats, and can drive them away. The brother and babysitter can fix and clean stuff, and wrangle the dogs.

At the end of 10 turns, the parents get home. The side that scores the most points at the end wins. That's the general gist of it, there is a floorplan of the house, standees, counters and player mats to keep track of your side's abilities.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Champions Rise
description:
Champions Rise is a cooperative card game with light deck building themes. Play cards and use energy to rise, fight, and defeat an endless onslaught of enemies. You will play as a Champion with different and exciting abilities against a Villain whose sole purpose is to defeat you in the most merciless way possible in a Battlefield that can help tip the scales to victory!

The objective of Champions Rise! is to defeat a Villain while playing in a Battlefield as a team of Champions. Each Villain and Battlefield have their own sets of rules that will change the gameplay significantly. The game is won by defeating the Villain OR until the Champions are defeated by having each Champion be Exhausted.

—description from the publisher

name: Effective Detective
description:
Effective Detective is a strategic card game in which players battle their your fellow detectives in a race to solve a murder. Gather your evidence--hair, blood, fibers, fingerprints, etc.--to thwart your rival detectives and arrest the murderer.

The game is played in a series of six-card hands. Players go head-to-head with each opponent using ranked "Investigation" cards (powered from 1 to 6) to beat their opponent, or by playing an "Inadmissible" card to thwart the other player's card.
The winner of the trick gets to turn up a piece of evidence in their own evidence line-up which corresponds to the one featured on the losing player's card. The goal is to collect a series of 5 related pieces of evidence in your own evidence line-up.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Jakkob Bugmansson Promo Card
description:
From the November 2020 issue of White Dwarf. Add the famed brewmaster general Jakkob Bugmansson to your games of Warcry.

No points value and no faction runemark, meaning he can only be used in the challenge battle included in this issue.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Aös, Capitale du vice
description:
Aös is a board game inviting players to live a cooperative & competitive narrative adventure through a system of dilemmas, alliances and betrayals.

Fantasy, cyberpunk and solarpunk influences create an unconventional atmosphere in which players can immerse themselves.

You will have the opportunity to wander through the city of Aös in groups of 4 to 10. The game can be long or short, you decide!

—description from the publisher

Aös est un jeu de plateau invitant les joueurs à vivre une aventure narrative en coopération & compétition à travers un système de dilemmes, d’alliances et de trahisons.

L’univers possède des influences cyber/solarpunk et fantaisie, le tout plongé dans une ambiance décalée.

Vous aurez l’occasion de vous perdre dans la ville d’Aös en groupe de 4 à 10 personnes à travers de longues parties pouvant être raccourcies selon vos envies.

—description from the publisher (French)
mechanics: Acting, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Events, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Voting

name: Cosmos: The Galaxy Building Card Game
description:
Cosmos: The Galaxy Building Card Game is an engine-building / hand management card game for 2-4 players, ages 13+, lasting 15-45+ minutes (depending on player styles). Featuring beautiful space art. Players draw from a common deck and race to create enough celestial objects into their area of space to complete a common goal, which takes the form of a randomly selected Galaxy card. Once the goal is achieved by any player, the player with the most points wins.

Players start with 5 cards and draw 2 cards beginning each turn. Every card in the game is multiple use; play, resource payment or special discard ability. Cards are played from hand by discarding payment but each card a player controls will also generate a resource token during their turn which may be used for playing cards. The more a player controls the more powerful they become thus making it easier to play more cards.

This game is about choices and sacrifice. And with many circumstantial abilities and effects the replay value is very great. There is also a planned expansion in the works.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Space Exploration, Territory Building

name: Escape Adventures Adventskalender: Der mystische Express
description:
Escape Adventures as an advent calendar. Help save Christmas by solving puzzles. Solve one of 24 riddle every day until Christmas. Only the right solutions leads you to the door for the next day. Included are mysterious objects, digital extras and an hourglass.

Information and solutions can be found online along with a time tracker to find out where you stand in comparison to other puzzlers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: For Whom The Dice Rolls
description:
For Whom The Dice rolls is a set of innovative tabletop wargame rules for Brigade and Divisional battles in the Spanish Civil War.

The basic unit for the game is the battalion, and battalion level tactics are the foundation of the game, within the structure of one or two brigades aside (although the system will cope with more and will function for multiple divisions) .
The rules enable the early "column" period of the war to be played, as well as the more formal battles that arose as the war went on.
Troops are differentiated by their training and political commitment, to simulate the wide variety of forces that took part.

Command and control is driven by a normal pack of playing cards but is not completely random.
Players are dealt a hand of cards each turn based upon the effectiveness of their army's command structure and the willingness of the component parts to co-operate with each other.

The system enables coordinated actions to take place, but they need to be well planned and are subject to greater risk and place more strain upon the use of command resources.

The rules are intended for using with 15mm figures, based to popular game basing conventions, but will work equally well with smaller and larger sized figures.
A full description of the mechanisms can be found on the "Wargaming For Grown Ups" blog.

—description from the publisher

name: Hannibal's Revenge
description:
Hannibal’s Revenge is the second in the Card Conquest game series in which players recreate epic military contests of history in short, comparatively simple, easy-to-learn but hard-to-master games. As with the first game in the series, Hitler's Reich, Hannibal’s Revenge sets up in minutes and plays to a conclusion in one sitting of two hours (or less). These are not simulations but games, albeit ones packed with enough historical flavor and decision-making to give players the feeling that “you are there” at the highest levels of command.

In Hannibal’s Revenge, the 23 uneasy years of peace between the arch-rival republics of Rome and Carthage come to an end by Hannibal Barca. Son of the Carthaginian hero in their earlier conflict, he vowed since childhood to take revenge for his country's humiliating defeat in that war. Now the time has come to redeem that pledge, and he laid siege to the city of Saguntum in Spain. Rome, incensed over this attack on their ally, mobilizes for war in response.

It is now 219 B.C. (or in the Roman calendar 534 Ab Urbe Condita -that many years since the founding of the city). As the Senate and People of Rome, will you succeed in making Carthage pay for this insult and once again force upon them a humiliating peace? Or as the elders of Carthage, will you restore your city’s rightful place in the Mediterranean world to bring honor and glory to your people through victories gained in Hannibal’s Revenge?

Hannibal’s Revenge mixes deck building mechanisms with area control on a map of the Western Mediterranean. There are several ways players can win: by capturing the enemy capital (without losing their own), reducing your opponent's hand size to zero, or (as Carthage) holding out until the game ends. To accomplish all this, players can capture cities and/or play event cards that help them strengthen their hand—or weaken that of their opponent.

A player’s hand is composed of conflict cards ranging in strength from 1 to 13. Some of these cards have special powers, such as the ability to re-roll one or more dice. In conflict, the strength of these cards is complimented with the roll of the dice (standard 3, but up to 5 with events and leaders). Rome’s deck is divided into two “suits”: one for the Republic of Rome itself (e.g. “The Legions”) and another for its Latin Allies. Cathage’s conflict cards are similarly divided: one suit representing the core Carthaginian army and another for their Gallic, Spanish, and other Allies/Mercenaries.

Conflict cards can also be used to move leaders (e.g. Hannibal or his brother Hasdruble and a pool of Roman leaders of varying quality whom a Senate game mechanism assigns to command Rome’s field armies). These leaders represent their armies which move upon the game map—a map divided into sea and land areas (yes, Hannibal can again perform his legendary march across the Alps!) with some land areas identified as Roman, Carthaginian, or Neutral, some of which contain Fortified Walled Cities. Such Cities may be besieged…a sometime perilous and time-consuming enterprise.

Players may also use one or more Event cards to influence the outcome of the conflict. Conflict arises when a player tries to capture a territory or when he tries to acquire a new Event card from one of three available decks: Roman, Carthaginian, or mixed (available for both parties).

Hannibal's Revenge includes a built-in solitaire bot system to enhance solo play. For those who want to play with more than two, it also includes optional rules for 3-4 players.

Components:

One 17” x 22” Mounted Map
54 Conflict Cards (four suits of 13 cards plus 2 Prodotis - i.e. “Traitor”- cards)
72 Hannibal's Revenge Event Cards
16 Leader Cards
Ten six-sided dice (five white, five black)
140+ Assorted Wooden pieces, Cubes, and Cylinders
2 Player Aid Sheets
1 Solitaire Player Aid Sheet
Rules of Play manual (this booklet) -
Playbook (which includes Rules for Solitaire Play)

TIME SCALE: When both players' Conflict Card decks get shuffled, a sexennium (6 years) is complete. The game can end at any moment, but will last no more than three such sexennia.

MAP SCALE: Land Areas, Major Cities, and Sea Zones (some of which can be hazardous to traverse).

UNIT SCALE: Combat strengths are determined for each combat by card play and dice rolls.

NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 1 – 2 (with optional rules for 3-4)

name: SSTR: Tabletop Miniature Skirmish Game
description:
It's a french skirmish rules system. Players will have limited actions points to activate miniatures. Players will gain points with frags and objectives. 18 heroes who can be combined with 18 powers. 5 vs 5 combats. Fresh and unique system, streamlined rules but deep strategy. You can play with miniatures you want.

Bienvenue dans ESTR, un livre de règles pour figurines afin de revivre les escarmouches qui enchantent le public de cette fin de millénaire. En équipe de cinq contre cinq, les belligérants vont s’affronter dans des arènes de soixante centimètres sur soixante. Créez un décor selon vos envies. Les parties de ESTR peuvent se dérouler tant en décors urbains que naturels, les lieux et les races des guerriers sont aussi variés que les planètes de notre galaxie.Le jeu n’a pas de figurines imposées, jouez avec n’importe quelle marque et de n’importe quel type. Les règles d’ESTR sont originales et astucieuses à plus d’un titre. Les personnages qui meurent reviennent le tour suivant grâce aux avancées scientifiques, le jeu se déroule en activation alternée. Un système original, inédit et juste vous contraindra à un nombre limité d’activations. Usez de vos jetons d’aptitude avec parcimonie, ils sont aussi puissant que précieux. Ce ne sont que quelques exemples de toutes les particularités d’ESTR que vous trouverez dans ce livre. Jamais un jeu n’a été aussi tactique. Les règles sont fluides et claires, elles ont été pensées pour un jeu stimulant et nerveux sans complexité inutile. A vous de jouer.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Death Dome 3,000: Battle on the Waspworth Plateau
description:
Death Dome is an action strategy game where you control a team of four units inside the Death Dome battleground. The objective of each match is to use your team to capture as many control points and gather as many credits as possible. Between matches, you must equip your team with the best equipment that you can afford.

Play a quick match or a whole campaign series. Try different combinations of characters and equipment. Capture control points, collect beetle shells for defeating enemy units, and free your teammates from jail if they are captured.

Players start with 4 units in a base and get to move 2 units each turn. The match lasts for 6 turns. Each unit phase a unit can move and do 1 action, usually either capture a control point or attack an enemy unit. Players get points for each captured control point or defeated enemy at the end of the match. The player with the most points wins. Points turn into credits and can be used to buy new equipment for the next match. Players can compete in a series of matches.

Players draw cards each turn, with bonus cards for each 5 control points they control. Cards can be used to attack or defend or other abilities. Cards are only redrawn at the start of each turn so players must decide how to manage their hand of attacks and save some for defense.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: Hangry Blobfish
description:
A Print and Play card game which also can be played solo or coop. You are a skilled hunter chasing the huge government bounties available for capturing these blobfish through baiting them with their favourite foods.

To capture a blobfish a player must match the center 4 icons in the bait holder with the bait icons underneath the blobfish. The player who has captured the most blobfish wins.

Gameplay: Play a card, use the bait card´s effect according, draw a card

Content: 64 cards of which are 52 Plate Cards, 8 Blobfish Cards and 4 Bait Cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Grid Wars: Age of Cyberpunk
description:
The future is built on countless layers of existence. The virtual and physical entwine. The human mind is no longer able to determine which layer is the "original" one. The concept of "real" is way in the past.

The Grid is a dark-web of layers. Filled with millions of ongoing cyber deals and bloody confrontations. The Grid's unique encryption makes it a free-for-all for both the biggest corporations and exclusive cliques of criminals.

In no-mans-land you can be the man. One big score can change your fate forever. But it can get real messy, real fast. So carefully pick your squad, recon the objective, and shift the paradigm in your favor today!

And remember, once you get on the grid you also get on the radar...

GRIDWARS offers a new take on the hex-based skirmish game. Except for a smooth and satisfying combat system, you get a lot of possibilities to interact with the environment, hack your way through the battle, throw enemy and allied units, and even engineer and deploy powerful combat mechs to aid you!

In a single game, you get the experience of wargaming, RGP, board game, and strategy game. Here are a few aspects that contribute to GRIDWARS unique gameplay:


RPG Scenarios. The game is scenario-based. Every time you will face a different challenge that will allow different characters to excel.
Squad Building. Before the game, you will pick your squad. Every unit has a cost and each scenario a limit of how many you can use per player. It is up to you to decide if you want to focus on brute force, hacking, or engineering!
Quick-Paced Skirmish. Players activate one of their units alternately. Each time a unit can execute actions. Move, Charge, Attack, Shoot, Use Abilities, Hack, Build, or even Throw a smaller enemy across the battlefield! Order in which you activate your units and execute actions will be the key to the winning strategy.
Custom Dice. There are custom attack and defense dice. After the roll, you will be able to improve your results depending on your unit's statistics. The combat mechanics are very intuitive. No math, just choices. You will see everything there is to know on your rolled dice!
Strategy-Affecting Terrain. The terrain creates a unique setting for each encounter on the grid. You can hide inside the buildings, lock the door, or shoot through the windows, all of which will affect the mechanics.
Powerful Hacking. The semi-virtual nature of the grid makes hacking a reality-bending feat. By using the terminals located on the battlefield, the hackers can activate the sentry guns, detonate mines, and manipulate electronic objects. By directly hacking the enemy operating systems, they can instantly inflict damage and status effects.
Versatile Engineering. Combat engineers can repair or deactivate obstacles. But what's more important, they can learn blueprints and collect materials to deploy just the right combat mechs to change the tide of the battle!
Energy System. It's up to you to decide which of your units will be reinforced each turn. At the beginning of a round, you will distribute the Energy. You can spend it to make your attacks and defense more effective or to activate powerful abilities in critical situations. Make sure to impact the battle in places where it is needed the most!
High Replayability. In every game, you will face different enemies, choose different squads and compete in different scenarios. You can find new synergies between characters in every game!
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Team-Based Game, Zone of Control

name: Zombie World Order
description:
ZWO is a two-player competitive TCG. Players take on the role as one of the few survivors in a zombie-infested world. Use magic to summon zombies! The game system revolves around revival and toughness! With the toughness to survive whatever is dished out, and revival to bring cards back from the dead, the fun never dies! Battle it out with zombie minions: it’s a fight to the undeath!

—description from the publisher

name: Dragonscales: Scroll Of The Tower Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019 from Arcane Wonders.

Discard this card at any time to take 5 Dragonscales from the Hoard and then distribute them as you wish amongst any number of players.

name: Animo City
description:
Players are powerful families that profit from shady building contracts during the Spanish real state bubble. The city will grow really fast, but the rushing of projects and the high competitiveness will result in the characteristic shitty urban planning of some of our cities. Thanks to easy access to mortgage loans, the success of these deals primarily depends on the appeal of the placement of each building.

Animo City is a small card game that uses cards to delimit an imaginary board where a city will be developed.

Building cards can be played face down as building lots, or face up to raise a building on a lot you already own. Spread too fast claiming lots and you won't have many options to react to what happens next. Spread too slow and other players will take the best spots first.

At the end of the game, buildings are scored granting happiness and sadness points depending on specific conditions. Besides the name of this game being homonymous for "animosity", the word "ánimo" is Spanish for "mood".

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play

name: Stolen at Sea
description:
A handmade escape room style mystery game to play at home.

Travel back in time to 1923 as passengers aboard the RMS Aquitania. Sift through old maps, a 100 year old book, secret documents and strange photographs. Decipher Morse code and Egyptian hieroglyphics as you race to solve an exciting interactive mystery. Find hidden clues and untangle intriguing riddles to rescue a priceless jewel of antiquity in this challenging, high stakes puzzle quest!

You'll join the highly trained MI6 officers as they work against the clock to solve the theft of the magnificent burial ring of Pharaoh Ramses II that was on its return voyage to the Cairo Museum of Antiquities.

As you and the agents follow 6 passengers around the ship, you’ll discover each has a mysterious story that will provide important clues. The priceless ring must be found before the ship arrives in the Port of Alexandria in one hour. No one will be allowed to leave the ship until the jewel is returned.

This is a 60-minute escape room game in a box to play at home. Race to solve an exciting interactive mystery by finding hidden clues and completing intriguing puzzles. Locked document bags are hidden “doors” that move you through the game.

The game works best with 2 to 6 players ages 14 and older. No internet is required. It can be played again so pack it up and pass it on.

-description from publisher
categories: Deduction, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents, Travel

name: Crimibox: Dossier Macdeath – Episode I
description:
Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

On the stage the actors play Shakespeare's Macbeth, but behind the scenes another tragedy takes place. The final curtain falls for the young Maarten.

Unravel the mystery in the first episode of this gripping trilogy. With each episode you advance further in your investigation until you reach the final epilogue in the third episode.

Unmask the gruesome murderer before he strikes again!

Some of the features included in this game:
- Analyse police documents
- Watch video footage
- Send e-mails to witnesses
- Search police databases
- Scour social media for clues

And much more!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Battle of Komaki and Nagakute
description:
A game with the theme of "Battle of Komaki and Nagakute", a battle between Hashiba Hideyoshi and the allied forces of Oda Nobukatsu and Tokugawa Ieyasu in Tensho 12 (1584).

This game does not include battles in the northern part of Ise, Kii, Izumi, and Settsu, and focuses on the battles in the Owari and Mino areas.

name: SKOOT: The Do-It-Yourself Biathlon Boardgame
description:
SKOOT is a Biathlon game that uses dice for movement and a heart rate meter for strategy. The goal is to find a balance between skiing speed and shooting clean. Miss a target and go to the penalty loop where the benefits of your fast skiing evaporate! Who will cross the finish line first?

The board can be printed and glued together, and you'll need at least 5 dice (8 recommended), the manual and two tokens per player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Multiple Maps

name: Oceans: Frosthaven Piranha Pig Promo Card
description:
Deep Trait Card

Text:

+ 2 [attack] for each population

Can't be attacked by a species with a Deep card

Migration: 2
Resolution: 200
Textbox: Black = Defensive Trait

First distributed from the publisher’s website as a free promo:
“Subscribe to our mailing list and receive a limited edition promo card.
Special thanks to Issac Childres for letting us use the Piranha Pig illustration from Frosthaven, and to Christina from Blue Peg, Pink Peg for being the creative mastermind behind the BPPP mascot.
“One Pig to rule them all, One Pig to find them,
One Pig to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.”

Later distributed free at select conventions for signing up for the newsletter.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Take That

name: What Was the Question? NSFW Expansion Pack
description: The first expansion pack for WWTQ, this includes 25x questions on sex, crime, drugs, and everything else that might make it a bit awkward to play with your family.

name: Victory Line
description:
Victory Line is a 2- or 4-player trick taking card game that can be easily taken anywhere (compact form factor that fits in a pocket, pack, or purse), played anywhere (small table footprint, fitting on almost any surface), and played at almost any time (a single duel takes no more than 15 minutes). Though, while small in stature, the game is loaded with interactivity, depth, and drama—but, most importantly, focuses on the connection between opponents and teammates alike.

Facing off in a card duel against a friend or loved one is a positively intimate experience. Reading your opponent's mind, watching her mannerisms, anticipating her every move, the thrill of calling her bluff—these are all highly interactive concepts that help foster a connection between you and your opponent. This connection, and the memories it generates, are what drive Victory Line.

Develop a connection with your opponent and teammate to succeed at this quick, dramatic trick taking card game!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Interrupts, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Score-and-Reset Game, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Too Many Doggos
description:
Every player runs an animal shelter with a mission to help as many dogs as possible find forever homes. Fueled with adorable artwork, this fast-paced game is great for family and friends alike. Kids can learn strategy, patterns, addition and subtraction, while adults get the thrill from adapting to new strategies with every play.

Not only do you get to help dogs finding loving homes in this game, you'll also make some dreams come true for amazing doggos in real life!
For 3-6 players. The game includes 162 cards, dog token, manual and box.

GAMEPLAY

Too Many Doggos takes only 5 minutes to learn. Many people will visit your adoption event, and you'll do a meet and greet with them. You’ll compete with each other to help dogs find a loving home by matching their unique traits with a person’s interests.

To increase the chance of a successful adoption, give any dog an edge with positive action cards. If you don't think there's a good match for a doggo, you can also use a negative action card to block the potential adoption.


Get the most well matched dogs adopted from your shelter to win, and give many doggos the life they deserve with a loving family.

name: Siva Afi: The Fireknife Dance of Samoa
description:
For centuries, Samoan warriors have spun and tossed their weapons in dazzling demonstrations of courage and skill. The traditional wooden war clubs were later replaced with hooked steel machetes. In 1946, a young knife dancer, “Freddie” Letuli, was performing in San Francisco at an event that also featured a Hindu fire eater and a girl who twirled a baton with light bulbs on the ends. Letuli wrapped some towels around the ends of his knife, dipped them in fuel, set them alight, and invented fireknife dancing.

The fireknife dance (siva afi) is now a major feature of Samoan culture and the pinnacle of any luau.

In this game, 2-6 players are fireknife dancers. The game alternates between a practicing phase (where players improve their hands) and a performing phase (where players dance by playing cards). In each dance, the best performer earns points. The first player to score a certain number of points wins the game.

This reimplementation of Fireknife! was developed and tested with the help of professional fireknife dancers. All card text is bilingual (Samoan and English). The cards feature gorgeous art by Samoan artist Troy Safotu.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Backyard of Frutabaja
description:
Some little gnomes want to start their life as bussiness landlords in the Backyard of Frutabaja, but a monster living there is trying to scare off al clients with dirt.

Players must work as a team to keep the board clean at the same time they try to settle new bussinesses and earn money.

The winner is determined scoring points and reaching goals. But each players will lose if the Blorrrdo places each dirt token in the backyard.

—description from the designer

name: Envyra: Infinity
description:
Infinity is the utmost expansion for the Envyra game. Like with other Envyra expansions, it is easy to implement with only a few seconds needed to understand the rules.
Envyra remains the same fast and clever simultaneous action game, but now with even more options and infinite fun.

Infinity expansion is compatible with all other Envyra expansions. Not playable in ANDRENALINE MODE.

- - - - - - -

CONTENT:
1 Infinity Tile
2 Wild Tiles

SETUP:
After the tiles are sorted during the setup (step 1), mix 2 Wild Tiles with other 'S' marked Tiles and mix 1 Infinity Tile with other (Basic) Tiles.

- - -

RULES (Infinity Tile):
Infinity Tile is very special. Cubes placed on this tile are never to be returned to their owners during the game (except the situation when all player's cubes are removed from the Grid).
The player can target the Infinity Tile during Phase I only if this player is targeting another eligible tile with their second cube as well. That means the player cannot target the Infinity Tile with a single cube placement in Phase I.
Be careful not to place your cubes on this tile too early as you may have very limited capturing options for the rest of the game.

Scoring:
The player with the most cubes on Infinity Tile at the end of the game adds 8 points to their total. If more players have the most cubes (same number) placed on the Infinity Tile, they each gain 8 points divided by the number of tied players rounded down (i.e. each of two tied players gets 4 points, each of three tied players gets 2 points, etc.).

- - -

RULES (Wild Tiles):
Wild Tiles belong to all three themes (Green/Blue/Orange). The solar system symbol is unique to all three themes (the Fifth Symbol). Wild Tile could be captured by the player like any other tile.
The owner of the tile can choose which theme this tile belongs to and they can change this theme/color affiliation each round. That means Wild Tile can help the player acquire restricted tiles with different theme icons each round. Note that the Wild Tile could represent only one theme/color each round.

Example:
There are two restricted tiles in the Playing Grid. The first restricted tile displays 1 green and 2 orange icons on the right side and the second tile displays 1 blue, 1 green, and 1 orange icon. A player owns 1 green tile and 2 Wild Tiles thus this player is eligible to move their cube on any of these restricted tiles, but it can't move their cube on both during the same round.

Scoring:
During the scoring, a player can choose again which theme their Wild Tile would belong to and add a unique solar system symbol to the set of that theme/color.
The Black Star symbol with the '-2' VP mark means that the player owning the tile must deduct 2 VP points from their total during scoring.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Beau Geste
description:
"Beau Geste" is a French Foreign Legion supplement for Smooth & Rifled, a miniatures wargame rules system by Dadi & Piombo.
This expansion covers the Légion Étrangère in North Africa and Syria in the period 1920-1926

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Feljeagōr Death Bringers Enemy Set
description:
Rising from the fiery depths of the underworld, the Feljeagōr, animated suits of Thunderforged armor, march to war as the end times of Ragnarok draw near! Sounding the dreaded Fel Horns to muster their legions, the Death Bringers draw their Hel Swords to cut down gods and men alike in their apocalyptic crusade.

This Enemy set features a new version of the dreaded Thunderforged Feljeagōrs, the Death Bringers! It includes 3 new Feljeagōr Death Bringer models, 1 new Mission, and all of the cards needed to add Feljeagor Death Bringers to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Paris Deception: Battle of Gaullism
description: A wargame on hypothetical battle between NATO and France seceding from NATO. The fourth game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series and a sequel to Brothers' War 1983: East Germany VS. West Germany (series #2).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Battle – Villers-Bretonneux: 24 - 27 April 1918
description:
Firestorm: Villers-Bretonneux is the recreation of the Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux.

This battle is famous in military history as the first battle where opposing tanks met.

This is a Firestorm battle (not a Campaign), a battle of 4 days in April, 1918.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Zero Dark: Operation Nemesis
description:
This is the first major supplement for the best-selling independent sci-fi skirmish wargame, Horizon Wars: Zero Dark.

Zero Dark: Operation Nemesis tells the story of Bal Anub, a special forces team from the human colony of Venus sent in pursuit of a mystery on the surface of an Earth ravaged by a devastating asteroid strike.
This book contains new rules for Horizon Wars: Zero Dark, including new heroes and Red Force options, as well as a full 12-mission solo or co-operative campaign and 6 brand new Versus missions for PvP gaming.

You will need Horizon Wars: Zero Dark to use the contents of this publication.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 18EE/82 Eastern Europe
description:
Like 18WE/72, 18EE/82 is an operational strategy game based on Mike Hutton’s popular 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties system covering Easter Europe. It features a larger board, 21 major companies, and more offboard areas than either 18EA/62 or 18WE/72. Any player familiar with 18WE/72 will very easily be able to enjoy 18EE/82, because the rules are almost completely identical aside from setup.

18EE/82 features five regions instead of three, in which only three of four corporations are typically startable, as well as 3 minor companies in Hungary. The four non-Hungarian regions feature randomly selected subsidies at setup, out of a pool of five. These simple differences in setup present the players with major strategic decisions in what railroads to found, as well as how their companies will best be developed and operated.

18EE/82 has extremely high replayability, due to its random setup at the beginning of the game. Every non shell company is assigned a license type randomly (from expresses, freights, and regionals).

18EE/82 has a larger board than 18WE/72, covering much of Eastern Europe. The map also has more offboard areas, including the premier zones of Berlin and Constantinople. Like in 18WE/72, there is no plain yellow track. All track tiles are unlimited. Each company gets at least three track actions to determine tile placements and upgrades. The map size supports more stations which can be acquired during the life of each corporation. Each corporation may lay TWO additional tokens each operating round, instead of just one.

The financial aspects of 18EA/62 you will find almost fully intact. There are parliament rounds, mergers, and refinancing, all as players know them from its predecessor game. Similarly both chartered and non-chartered corporations function in exactly the same ways. This allows players to focus on the operational aspects of the game, without having to learn a new financial framework if they are familiar with either game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Track Movement

name: Der Mord von Kloster Wattenbeek
description:
Secluded in the deepest wasteland lies the monastery of Wattenbeek. For hundreds of years it defied the course of history and provided a holy retreat for a small group of nuns. But time does not stop at the venerable convent, and it is hard to find young nuns willing to move into such solitude. There is not even Internet! Despite great protests on the part of the abbess, the convent is now to be sold and for the first time in years there are guests within the sacred walls. The prospective buyers, who have traveled a long way, have their own plans for the monastery, but when the real estate agent Günther Hübsch is found dead in the monastery garden on the second day, the blood freezes in the veins of those present: Because the perpetrator is among them. The police are alerted and the abbess invites all the guests and nuns to the dining room to convict the murderer and then hand him over to the police.

—description from the publisher

name: Alpha
description:
Entrepreneurial tycoons in the year 3113 spend scant portions of their vast fortunes hiring unscrupulous scientists to bioengineer ferocious creatures to compete on a remote island in "Alpha", the world’s most brutal blood sport not banned by the International Broadcasting Memorandum. In this two-player hidden movement deck-building hand management game, each player will assume the actions of one dangerous predator that exists to achieve one objective: reign as the Alpha.

How do they do this? Players will choose seven action cards, each of which represents the passage of one hour of time, from their available deck to play that round. Players then take actions simultaneously, resolve them, and repeat the process until each player has one card remaining (*), which gets upgraded based on the player's current location on the board.

Player's creatures can Move around the map, Hunt the piddling local wildlife to avoid Howl penalties, and Track their opponent to ascertain their location. Players must also navigate un-upgradable Sleep and Scat actions that make it harder for them to stay undetected. Players who perform the final available action, Sneak Attack!, lay it all on the line. They either win the game, or let their opponent know exactly where to find them.

(*) Unless their opponent has located them, in which case, game over. Chin up...they've got that creature's DNA sequencing on file somewhere...

name: Aventuria: Begleiter #1 – Hunde Promopack
description:
This promo pack contains four dog companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Bornländer
Esper Saupacker
Nivesischer Steppenhund
Tuzaker

name: Aventuria: Begleiter #3 – Pferde Promopack
description:
This promo pack contains four horse companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Maultier
Elenviner Vollblut
Tralloper Riese
Warunker

name: The Inheritance
description:
The McClains are one of the oldest and richest families in Valley Falls. So when the current patriarch of the family, Edison McClain, asks for your help and is willing to make it worth your time, how can you say no? Edison was planning on naming his heir and the next head of the family. So he called together all of the McClains and proposed a game as a last test to see the worthiness of those he deemed had potential. But someone in the family had other ideas. During the family get-together, the McClain’s oldest and most prized possession, a medallion bearing the household’s coat of arms, was stolen. This 500-year-old family heirloom is believed by the family to be the reason for their wealth and success throughout the years. Without the medallion Edison can’t name his heir, and he fears the family will fall into ruin. Will you be able to find the thief and the medallion? Can you recover The Inheritance?

Difficulty Level - 7/10

name: FindOut Medieval
description:
This game will transport you into the magic and mystery of the medieval era. Choose your character, move with cunning among the rooms of the Castle and meet as many characters as possible. Let them help you find out who is hiding in the royal rooms and especially in the Princess’s room! Your Powers, together with those of the Special Cards, can benefit you but don’t let them escape and use them at the right moment… An engaging strategy game for all ages, with simple cards that will turn into squares to go through, recreating a mystery and an ever-changing story for each game. '

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Medieval, Negotiation
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Negotiation, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Predictive Bid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rätselspaß auf dem Bauernhof
description:
On the farm all the animals have escaped. Who will help catch them? The players solve fun logic puzzles and learn where the animals are hiding. By matching, comparing and combining, the educational game playfully promotes logical thinking. Where are the eggs hidden? Which animal can crow?

—description from the publisher

This game works with the tiptoi-pen and can't be played without it.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Puzzle

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Munitorium Field Manual 2021 Mk1
description:
The official guide from Games Workshop, providing points values for all units in the Warhammer 40,000 system.

Provided as a Promotional inclusion to White Dwarf #462 (March 2021)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Rilium
description:
Have you ever had the feeling of opening a book and jumping into a sea of memories?

That’s because somewhere far away, in the depths of the ocean, there is a mystical library inhabited by a girl and her family of fish. Today, you’ll be able to help her organize the books for you alone.
Who will have the greatest joy while visiting your personal underwater library?

This game consists of two parts: the first part is called “Acquisitions” and the second part is called “Reading”. In the Acquisition section, you will collect books at the library by writing them on the library sheet, and in the reading section, you will read the books you have acquired. Read, and strive to make your library experience as pleasant as possible.

name: Quarry Quarrel
description:
Quarry Quarrel is a card-collecting game that works in voting rounds: all players secretly vote on which face-up card pile they want to collect, but if any pile gets multiple votes, then no one gets it!

Outsmart your opponents so you can add to your hand or stop them in their tracks. And discard sets of 3 cards between votes to draw more cards, double your points, or even end the game early.

The game ends when the Game Over! card is drawn or when a player ends the game early. The player with the most points in hand wins!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Victory Points, Predictive Bid, Prisoner's Dilemma, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Freedom Force
description:
What happens when you give control of your deck to a band of “reformed” ruffians? The shapeshifting Mystique leads her version of the evil Brotherhood of Mutants with a cast of characters who will create law and order by any means necessary. Build your deck with the power of questionable tactics that yield unquestionable results. Freedom Force is the second issue in the Omega Level story arc and includes the incendiary Pyro, the ground shaking Avalanche and more!

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Wilderness Dice: BYOD – Domestic Expansion
description:
Expand Wilderness Dice with this standalone-expansion that adds up to two additional players, or play Wilderness Dice using any combination of animal decks. The key to expanding Wilderness Dice is making sure to include the proper number of dice. For the first two players, add 12 dice. Each additional player should add 3 dice to the total. Players will still only complete three rounds of dice rolls. This does mean that more players will have leftover cards at the end of each round.

The Domestic expansion includes both Farm animals and Pets. This collection is meant for players who want to use their favorite pets, or for families with farming roots. We hope that the domestic pack offers a wonderful selection of kids (and parents alike) favorite animals.

—description from the designer

name: Wizards and Blades
description:
An obscure fantasy adventure boardgame independently published by the designer in the 1980's.

Three players control groups of warriors seeking to plunder the treasure cavern of the "Board Master," a fourth player. Each group of warriors competes against the other groups in an attempt to steal the Board Master's treasure.

A warrior player wins by carrying the Board Master's treasure to a designated sanctuary space. The Board Master's goal is to eliminate all of the warriors. At the Board Master's disposal are three wizards, six trolls, a Golden Guardian, and an Angel of Death! Each warrior player controls four warriors. The various playing pieces are plastic figurines.

At heart, Wizards and Blades is a traditional roll-and-move style game with events and flavor provided through cards. Combat between pieces can be resolved through dice rolling or card play.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Washington DC Mystery
description: Explore the city of Washington DC, exploring the nation's monuments and museum as you track down a secret society and stop their evil plans in this at-home escape room.

name: Mythbond: Don't Wake the Monsters
description:
Various adventurers throw themselves into dangerous dens of monsters. The vile monsters are guarding numerous gold coins and treasures, the humans are no match of them – but luckily the monsters get dizzy and fall asleep! Dear adventurers, you must be very quiet when picking up treasures, and remember the other players are not your true friends!

Players use action cards to pick up treasure cards on a map built up with unused monster cards. During planning phrase, players choose (aka plan) action cards face down from his hand. Planned action cards are resolved during resolve phrase according to the speed factor on them. Also, different action cards will cause different level of noises, which accumulates and maybe loud enough to wake the monster:

Dizzy-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) it is facing
Angry-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) where it is the nosiest
Monster attacks will cause affected characters drop a lot of treasures they previously got!

Treasure cards after being picked up go to that player’s bag, so do the action cards after used. Later when you replenish your hand from the bag, you got the some unable-to-use-as-action treasure cards instead of action cards. But you can choose THROW A TREASURE at another player to make some huge noise there! Of course you can choose to put a too-valuable-to-give-up treasure back into your bag…

The monster will eventually fully wake and players will evacuate from the den. The player with the highest total value of treasure wins the game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Halfling Team Card Pack
description:
Redesigned for the Second Season Edition ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Halfling teams.

CONTENTS
– 4x Player Reference cards for Halfling Catchers, Halfling Hopeful Linemen, Halfling Hefties, and Altern Forest Treemen
– 4x Star Player cards, including Deeproot Strongbranch, Grak, Crumbleberry, and Rumbelow Sheepskin
– 16x Special Play cards exclusive to Halfling teams, 8x Random Events and 8x Miscellaneous Mayhem
– 19x Blank Player cards: 13x Halfling Hopeful Lineman, 2x Halfling Catcher, 2x Halfling Hefty, and 2x Altern Forest Treeman
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl: the Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website

name: Stack Site
description:
9-Card Solo Game

Stack cards to layout your campsite. Match symbols to score points.

Contents:

• Title Card
○ Front: Title
○ Back: Rules QR and arrows for completed rounds
• 8 Cards
○ Front: Grid of 6 symbols (includes blanks and -1's)
§ + round requirement
○ Back: Grid of 6 symbols (3 pairs)
Rules
• Shuffle cards to form a draw pile with all front (green) faces up
• 5 rounds
• Each round; stack 4 cards, drawn 1 at a time (so you can see the next card on top of the draw pile).
• Try to stack matching symbols on top of each other to score points.
○ 2 points for each symbol stacked directly on top of 1 other of the same symbol (max 2 of each symbol)
○ 3 points for each symbol stacked directly on top of 2 others of the same symbol (max 1 of each symbol)
○ No extra points for symbols stacked on top of 3 others of the same symbol
○ -1 point for each claw symbol visible at the end of the round
○ -1 point for each card back (grey) used (max 3 out of 4)
• Must score at least 10 each round
• Once the first round is complete pick one card front used to put aside. The round requirement in the centre of the card must now be met in the next round.
○ Round requirements provide a score bonus of 3/5/7 points as noted (diamond symbols below round requirement)
○ Once the round is complete (and a minimum of 10 points scored), flip the card to the back (grey) side.
• Complete 5 rounds in total to win the game (1st round + 4 rounds with requirements)

-description from designer
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: Deception/CS-Files: Thai Promo Pack
description:
A new promo pack with four new clue cards and four new means cards.

Boba Tea
Buddhist Amulet
Hand held bidet
Inhalant

Durian
Motor tricycle
Submarine
Water Monitor
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: 营火战争 (Battle for Yinghuo)
description:
营火战争 is an arena deck-building card game.

You are transported into a mysterious arena. You have to collect energies scattered around the arena to strengthen yourself.

The game consisted by six different 'genre' to play with. Every game, you can choose the 3 of them to form the main deck. Then you and your opponent take turns to buy cards from main deck or to attack.

name: Mimica
description:
Players draw a card and try to act out the pictured animal or object with gestures and / or voice. The other players guess what has been depicted until the correct answer is given.
The depiction is judged with victory points.
The winner is the player to collect the most points after a pre-arranged number of rounds.

name: Humpty Dumpty Journey Begins
description:
We all know Seven Heroes will save the world from the Darkest time. However, their adventure begins in a bar, like all the stories we know. Heroes have prepared for their secret missions. Poison for killing others, cure for saving others. No one knows who can complete their missions.

Journey Begins is a fast paced card game with cute characters. In each round, players pass Hero cards around and trying to keep Hero with achievable scoring condition. Then, players simultaneously put a item card in front of other player. That player do not know which item is received. After players used all items, players try to figure out the situation on the table. For example, which player is killed or how many players are killed. Players play any amount of the same Hero from hand. If the scoring condition is met, players take points equal to the number of Hero card played.

The first player to score 6 points wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Journeys with Jesus
description: Journeys with Jesus is a route building game set in New Testament Israel. The goal of the game is complete the journeys that Jesus took as described in the gospel accounts. You complete a journey by collecting all of the towns and places along the route. Completing a journey earns points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Calling of the Matriarch
description:
"Calling of the Matriarch" is a premium print-and-play, narrative-focused, fully cooperative 1-4 Players Role-Playing Adventure Board Game.

The game takes place in a grimmer aspect of the fantasy world Spheria, as you create a character and assume the role of an adventurer trying to survive an outbreak of monsters in the once-thriving city of the Kingdom.

You, "The Sojourner", takes refuge with the city's survivors in a haven known as "The Lith", guided by a mysterious figure known as The Matriarch, you go on dangerous quests into the monster-ridden city, alone, or together with your ally, to overcome challenges that may bring you closer to you and the other's ultimate survival, and at the same time, seek the truth of the event by acquiring information and hints throughout your many quests.

Inspired by role-playing games and dungeon crawl games of deep storytelling, adventure, and dynamic combat, as well as skirmish games with miniatures, "Calling of the Matriarch" is both a solo and cooperative game with no need of any adversary players. You may venture into the danger as a lone adventurer to create their own legend, or together with their ally, carve their way through many events and dangers to reveal the hidden truth behind the crisis.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: On to Paris!
description:
A solitaire game of the German drive on Paris in 1914, played in six turns representing the time period August 27–28 through September 6–7. The player operates the German forces and has three possible victory conditions based on army strength and unit location on the playing area at the end of the sixth turn.

German army corps move across rows of rectangles overlaid on a partial map of France (Arras to the outskirts of Paris). When German and Entente units occupy the same row of rectangles combat occurs. The player rolls 1d6 for every 2 German corps in the rectangle and adds the total result to the strength of the corps, then does the same for the Entente player. There are modifiers based on map location. Loser must retreat one row or reduce the strength of one corps. Random events may send German corps off to East Prussia or to sieges of Channel ports or Low Country towns. Other events may bring reinforcements to either side, advance the Germans’ Schlieffen Plan, result in Entente confusion or German exhaustion, etc.

This game originally appeared in World War One Illustrated magazine No. 3 and does not include the six-sided dice necessary for play. Two-player rules that were not in the magazine are included in the stand-alone game.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 英雄对决 (Hero Battle): Marvel
description:
A trading card game published by Chinese collectible card publisher Kayou.
In this game, players can use heros from Ultraman Universe or Marvel Universe to fight with the opponent.
At the start of the game, each player draw 9 cards and set 5 of them on the field, other 4 cards are their hand. In each turn, player should choose a card on the field to fight the opponent, the player who has 5 heroes defeated will lose the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pis a Pis
description:
Pis a Pis, may the neighborhood coexistence not end with you!
The first board game of the commune, with ecological, inclusive and linguistic awareness.

A block of flats has just been built and your real estate company owns half of the building. You have to decide who to rent them to, but it’s not that easy. Will you be able to have your flats occupied before your opponent?

Pis a Pis is a card game for two people from 8 years and lasting approximately 10 minutes. It consists of 63 cards, divided into 3-color floors (blue, red, and yellow), as well as gray cards with effects.

The aim of the game is to place flats playing your cards in your part of the building until you fill the 6 floors.

In each turn you can play a card or discard a card. Then you take one card from the deck (you always have to have three cards on your hand).

If you fill the 6 floors before your opponent, you win!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Pis a Pis, que la convivència veïnal no acabi amb tu!
El primer joc de taula de lacomuna, amb consciència ecològica, inclusiva i lingüística.

S’acaba de construir un bloc de pisos i la teva immobiliària té en propietat la meitat de l’edifici. Has de decidir a qui llogar-los, però no és tan fàcil. Aconseguiràs tenir els teus pisos ocupats abans que l’oponent?

Pis a Pis és un joc de cartes per a dues persones a partir de 8 anys i amb una durada aproximada de 10 minuts.

Amb una mecànica senzilla i divertida, les partides de Pis a Pis són dinàmiques i ràpides, ideals per jugar amb la família i les amistats durant les llargues nits d’hivern. Se’ns acut encara un altre escenari… Si la persona que viu a l’altra banda de l’escala et genera una passió incontrolable, ja no cal que vagis a demanar-li sucre; proposa-li jugar a Pis a Pis i trenca el gel!

Pis a Pis consta de 63 cartes, dividides en pisos de 3 colors (blau, vermell i groc), i també cartes de color gris amb efectes.
L’objectiu de Pis a Pis és col·locar pisos a la teva part de l’edifici fins a omplir les 6 plantes abans que la immobiliària oponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Ownership, Set Collection, Take That

name: Anno Domini 1666: Envoys of the High Porte – Janissaries Commoners Set
description:
Soldiers of the elite 32nd orta boluk are among the few that were not influenced by the crisis spreading in the Janissary corps.
