Our system allows for a complete interplay between air, naval and submarine combat without bogging down and killing the fun factor. The movement and combat rules are simple but they do add a level of complexity that will require some critical decision making throughout the game. Our goal was to have you focus on the critical decision tree the rules will present you with - and not fight the rules!

A scenario book covering 17 WWII naval battles is available for pdf download.
categories: Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Don't Look Back: Darkhearts Expansion
description:
Not your typical Heroes...

Darkhearts -- a sinister character expansion.

Expand your games of Don't Look Back with these 4 new heroes. Complete with printed character cards, these characters will add new fresh playstyles and tactics to your fight against The Killer.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 4 dark Hero character miniatures (Dante Darkheart, Stella Bell, The Twins, and The Cultist) and their rules to the base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Necrons
description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Necrons Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Necrons Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:


Imotekh the Stormlord
Orikan the Diviner
Nemesor Zahndrekh
Vargard Obyron
Illuminor Szeras
Anrakyr the Traveller
Trazyn the Infinite
Overlord
Catacomb Command Barge
Lord
Destroyer Lord
Cryptek
Necron Warriors
Immortals
Lychguard
Deathmarks
Flayed Ones
Triarch Praetorians
Triarch Stalker
C'tan Shard of the Deceiver
C'tan Shard of the Nightbringer
Canoptek Wraiths
Canoptek Scarabs
Tomb Blades
Destroyers
Heavy Destroyers
Canoptek Spyders
Monolith
Annihilation Barge
Doomsday Ark
Transcendent C'tan
Ghost Ark
Doom Scythe
Night Scythe
Obelisk
Tesseract Vault


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Grit
description:
In a faraway land, a hero awakens to find the world has changed. The peaceful world seems somehow less peaceful. Word arrives of a corrupting force that has unleashed havoc. Fertile lands turned to sand, animals of the woods growing large and evil and the hearts of mankind being corrupted with power. Signs of this corruption manifest across the land in the form of black splotches. Could this be the work of Tulo Tulodon banished so long ago? Can he be stopped before it’s too late?

Grit is played over a series of games. There's no set path you absolutely need to take to reach the end, so your campaign length will vary. Will you try to explore every inch of the world or crash the end game? Save your progress after each game or a series of games and pick it up at a later time.

Travel around a modular, hidden map as you meet the townsfolk and battle the evil of the land. You must end your game at a checkpoint or you will lose your progress and need to reset to your previous checkpoint.

Locations and events are depicted by QR codes. QR codes will link to 277 websites with interactions with townsfolk, enemies and the environment. There are standard codes you can access whenever, immediate codes that are forced interactions when they are revealed and dig sites where you spend a stamina to uncover hidden items.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Morlox
description:
Morlox is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty checkered square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



DefinitionsTwo stones, or a stone and an empty square, see each other if they lie on the same straight line of orthogonally or diagonally adjacent squares and there are no other stones between them along that line.

You control a square in any of the following situations:


The square sees stones of your color in three orthogonal directions.
The square sees stones of your color in two adjacent orthogonal directions and two opposite diagonal directions, provided that each one of the latter directions is adjacent to exactly one of the former.
The square is on the perimeter of the board and sees stones of your color in two orthogonal directions.


To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square not controlled by your opponent or flip an enemy stone on a square you control. If you have no moves available on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

You win if, at the start of your turn, there is a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Connections, Line of Sight, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: The Wrath of Nero
description:
It’s been over a year since the psychopath known as Nero last threatened the citizens of Thornmire County. A villain with his own moral code and twisted sense of justice, Nero doled out punishment on those he deemed guilty, mimicking his namesake, the Roman Emperor Nero, who was known for his cruel and unusual methods of torturing those who crossed him. No one had seen or heard from him until earlier today when you received a curious box from Nero, threatening the city of Hampstead with the release of a highly communicable airborne toxin that will likely kill thousands of innocent people if not contained. Nero, however, enjoys the thrill of the chase and the challenge of a worthy opponent. He has provided a series of puzzles that will allow you to pinpoint the location of the toxin as well as the means to disable the bomb that will disseminate the chemical compound into the atmosphere. He has allowed you and the other members of the Will Street Detective Agency 72 hours before the population of Hampstead is wiped off of the map. Oh, and one more thing. Nero has given specific instructions not to contact the police, the CDC, Homeland Security, or any formal law enforcement agency, threatening to detonate the bomb early if his instructions aren’t followed. This means your wits and detective skills are the only thing that stands between the town of Hampstead and a bloody, brutal demise. Discover the secret behind Nero’s wrath and do whatever it takes to save the citizens of Hampstead.
Difficulty Rating – 7/10

name: Outside: Beyond the SCP facilities
description:
Somewhere in Belgium the truth machine seems to be rusting away. Where science forgets who it was and logic calculates that it cannot do everything. You don’t know who trust, but cooperation is going to be essential in order to tie the events down and crystallize a coherence for this spreading caos. And of course you are the only person who knows the truth behind the "SCP - db", the Standbeelden.

The SCP Foundation is a fictional international organization that contains and classificates anomalities outside bounds of natural law to prevent mass panic. But, what happens before these events are classified and somehow enprisoned? What if those were free?

This is a game based on the contemporary era and involves suburb investigation on paranormal events along a fractional surrealism. The players get bits and pieces of what’s going on and tie them together, giving different endings to it depending on the interpretations of their character's point of view. The objective is to propose the most coherent scenario in a convincing storyline.

The game starts by dealing Character and Object cards that remain hidden. Then a keyframe card is revealed, this one contains a mysterious image and narrative fragment. All the players pose their questions around it and then take turns to answer them with a small story in order do build coherence. A vote round will determine which storyline wins, staying as the real version of the occurred events. The corresponding player's character then becomes the protagonist who will then explain what the "SCP - db (Standbeelden)" turns out to be. The losers will give an outcome to their character taking into account what the protagonist, the antagonist, the narration, the secondary characters and the items are.

It is better consider this game not as a zero sum game but as a narrative game-tool. An open ended game in which players can also write their own keyframes and subsequently play as many keyframes as they want. Any doubt about the game is to be determined by the people involved.

This game's setting underlines the human ability to cooperate and piece together non-linear narratives in search of further, more rhythmic patterns. Through overinterpretation, eldritchness and speculation. It puts into consideration the next questions: “What is that which we do not acknowledge as a whole?” And “Why does it necessarily and so often have to do with streams of massive delusion?”

—description from the designer

name: Corona Chase: The Social Distancing Education Game
description:
RACE TO THE SAFE ZONE: Players race to the safe zone while practicing social distancing and avoiding Corona.

Players move their pieces one space at a time while trying not to be too close to other players pieces. the first player with 5 emojis across the finish line wins.

name: Alphabet Runner Games
description:
The game is created by the winner of the Best Family Game Award - UK Games Expo 2007

Alphabet Runner Games is 3 games in 1 set of cards.

MaxxRas. Word game which contains 10 levels. Age 11 - 99
Pairs. A memory recall game. Age 10+
Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game. Age 9+


MaxxRas: Players begin at level 1 and build/create/form 3 or 4 letter words and progress to level 10 and build/create/form 15 or more letter words. MaxxRas is simple to begin and then through the levels becomes one of the most challenging word games in the world. There is lots of room for progression as it gets harder each time more letters are needed to make a word. MaxxRas is probably the only word game in the world that allows the players the opportunity of building/creating/forming a 45 letter word – “pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanokoniosis” whilst playing Level 10. MaxxRas is for the word game fans in the family and for the players that like being challenged. It’s an ideal travel game.

Deal 7 random cards to each player. Place 3 or 4 cards face-up randomly and then place level 1 card next to the cards in the Centre play area.
Level 1 is to create 3 or 4 letter words. Take turns to build a word by using at least 1 alphabet letter from 1 of your own cards and using letters from the other cards in the Centre play area. Once a player has created a word, place the card separately from the other cards in the Centre play area and then reveal/confirm the word to the other players to avoid picking up an additional card from the deck. Then place that card on top of any card in the Centre play area.

The first player to get rid of their cards outright wins that level. The player that wins the most number of levels is the MaxxRas winner.
Full details and videos on how to play MaxxRas word game in minutes is available on the MaxxRas YouTube Channel.

Game 2
Pairs. A memory recall game.

Game 3
Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: The Royal Court
description:
For centuries, rulers have ruled their Kingdoms with the support of a royal court. A royal comprised of the Kings closest and most trusted family, advisors and nobles. A Kingdom lived or died on the strength of their Kingdoms royal court.

In The Royal Court, players take on the role of royal advisors to their respective kingdoms. Each advisor has been tasked with gathering trusted individuals to join their own kingdom's court.

The Royal Court is played in a series of rounds. Over the course of a round, players fill their royal courts with trusted royals, clergy, servants, and of course the Kings and Queens themselves.

The object of The Royal Court is be the first player to win 3 rounds. To win a round, a player must assemble the highest scoring royal court.

Players take alternate turns drawing cards and performing actions. When the deck empty the round is over

To play a turn, players perform the following actions in order:

The first player draws the top 4 cards of the deck and forms 2 pairs of their choice face-up next to the draw pile.

The second player chooses which pair of cards they receive and which pair the other player receives.

Both players take and place their assigned pair of cards face-down in a single pile in front of them. This is their court. Now starting with the second player, repeat the above steps until the deck is empty.

When there are no more cards left to draw, each players score their own royal court for the current round. The player with the most points wins the round.

The first player to win 3 rounds is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

name: BattleCON: Victor Master of Terror
description:
Victor’s suggestions help him to control opponents, threatening dangerous disadvantages if they violate his commands. The opponent can only afford to break so many suggestions during a fight, so look for ways to force their hand or put them in an awkward position.

Terrorize opponents with your suggestions, or punish those foolish enough to defy them!

name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus -Taïs
description: The Taïs expansion puts a focus on the Deviant faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Deviants. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one deviant character, Taïs.

name: U.S. Civil War: 3CP
description:
March 4th, 1861. In his inaugural address, President Abraham Lincoln promises not to invade the south or curtail slavery as long as tariffs are collected there and forwarded to the federal government. The south secedes from the Union nonetheless. Lincoln won’t let it go, however, and attempts to reinforce Fort Sumter (in his view still federal property) in Confederate South Carolina, provoking the south into firing the first shots. Its cannons level the fort, albeit without loss of life. War fever in the north is at its zenith, and the stage is set – for the U.S. Civil War.

During this game you’ll compete for cards representing Infantry, Artillery, Cavalry and Generals – by playing hands of 3-card poker. (Hence, “3CP” in the game’s title.) However, since this is more or less a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and those of your opponent is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build four Brigades, each with a General and Supplies, and perhaps one additional Brigade if you’re lucky. Card management in the form of “what poker hand to play now and what to save for later” is also an important factor toward winning the game.

This is the third game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine™, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Hoplite
description:
Hoplite is a game of tactics for 2 players, using 18 identical cards as battle units.

Defend, Attack, and Capture the enemy’s units to gain dominance over the battlefield!

Each player controls a phalanx of hoplite soldiers.
Your objective is to kill or capture enemy soldiers until your opponent is unable to make a move.

The cards are laid out on the table in a ‘basketweave’ pattern, each representing a soldier on the battlefield. Soldiers move by rotating on a corner that is touching an adjacent card; either rotating 90 degrees to touch another card, or if it is on a corner, rotating 180 degrees to align to the new edge. Each player makes two moves on their turn, which can be to move two soldiers, or the same soldier twice.

Soldiers have three possible effects when aligned against an enemy card in certain orientations:


Attack: remove the enemy from play
Defend: block an Attack
Capture: flip an enemy card over so that it joins your side


By attacking and removing soldiers from play, and capturing enemy cards, you can gain a dominant position and isolate your opponent’s cards so that they are unable to move. When they have no possible moves to make, you have won the battle!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Breakneck Derby
description:
Breakneck Derby is a fast-paced card driven horse racing game for 1 to 10 players. Thoroughbreds race around the track based on cards played into a five-card Bonus Hand. Poker and cribbage inspired card play and hand building are easily learned, but guarantee wild, competitive action where no two races are alike.

Push your horse down the straightaway by building hands. Take the inside track in the corners while blocking your opponents and pushing them outside to slow them down! Every card matters, and any horse can be moved by any player, so skillful play and a bit of luck are needed for victory. Play money and optional betting rules up the ante with head-to-head wagers and payoffs for win, place and show!

Perfect for parties, game night, solo play, or a marathon session at the poker table, Breakneck Derby is ideal for families, friends, or more "competitive" social groups!

Breakneck Derby Classic is a deluxe, hardwood and metal version of the game available from Big Ham Games for approximately $150 + shipping.
Breakneck Derby "Pizza Box" edition is a smaller, inexpensive cardboard version available from Big Ham Games for approximately $30 + shipping.
Original Breakneck Derby is only available through The Game Crafter for approximately $70 + shipping.

name: 18CZ: Bonus Boards
description:
Hard bonus boards for putting away stocks and an additional map for a 2-3 player scenario.

Only nine companies remain in the game, three of each size.

There is a third automatic player in the game, whose name is Václav.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Suits Me Dice Game
description:
Suits Me is a dice game that is played with five custom suited dice: each die displaying the four standard card suits on the four side faces and 50 points displayed on the top and bottom faces.

Players have three dice rolls during each turn to accumulate as many points as possible, which are added to their total game score. Points are awarded for various suited combinations of dice rolled, plus additional points for each die rolled showing a number value. As the name of the game implies... suited dice rolls offer the most lucrative scoring opportunities and the first player to reach the target score wins the game.

name: Federation Commander: Scenario Log 2
description:
Scenarios form a great deal of the history of the Star Fleet Universe. These scenarios (over 50 of them!) were originally published in Communique #1 through Communique #85. Here they are gathered into one spot as you requested.

Earlier scenarios have been updated to the current format. More options have been added to some of the scenarios. Even better, there is an index by empire involved and the number of players.

You will need Federation Commander ship cards and rules to play these scenarios; however, you can also simply enjoy reading about the various parts of Star Fleet Universe history.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Jinan, 1948
description:
Listed together with the Huaihai Campaign, it tells about the campaign of Jinpu railway middle section in May 1948 and the Jinan Campaign in September 1948.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with the Eastern Henan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: One-page Che Guevara: el fracaso boliviano 1967
description:
Area-movement print-n-play game, ostensibly for 2 players (but probably best solitaire) set during Che Guevara's 1967 insurgency in Bolivia. To win, the guerillas must eliminate the 8 Bolivian army divisions within eight one-month turns, while the Bolivian government must eliminate the Che guerilla unit. Bolivian army divisions cannot leave their regions, but from turn 5, the Bolivians gain one mobile Ranger unit per turn. A variety of optional rules provide much variety to play.
The game consists of an A4 board, 31 counters and one double-sided A4 sheets of rules, optional rules and historical background.

—description from the designer

name: Precision Handball
description:
A possession by possession statistical replay simulation of handball using cards and dice.

The outcome of each possession is determined by rolling 4 dice; two d6 and two d10. The two d6 tell you the type of outcome, the two d10 tell you whether that outcome resulted in a goal, a miss or a save.

A complete game will take around 90 die rolls to complete, so easily playable in an hour.

Men's and women's Olympic, World and European championships are available as well as national leagues.

name: Deadzone: Mars Attacks Human Faction Deck
description:
This deck enables you to field all of your Mars Attacks miniatures in Deadzone, as the Humans invade the Warpath universe!

It contains Mission cards, Battle cards, and stat cards for all of the miniatures from the Human faction.

name: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – High Noon at Gerzenburg Expansion
description:
Corps Command: Dawn’s Early Light High Noon at Gerzenburg is a two-scenario expansion for Dawn's Early Light.

Includes:
- A new 11”x17” map
- 40 new counters depicting the American 11th Armored Division, Airmobile troops from the 101st Airborne Division, the West German 27th Panzergrenadier Brigade, the Soviet 171st and 232nd Motor Rifle Brigades and the 23rd Guards Tank Division—a recon battalion and four regiments
- A battle report on the DEL scenario “The High Road” sets the stage for the continuing battle in High Noon at Gerzenburg

This expansion was released separately from the game and included in the Line of Fire Issue #10 and later incorporated into the 2nd edition Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Botifarra
description:
Catalan point trick-taking card game.

Botifarra is played by 2 opposing teams of 2 players, using a Spanish 48-card deck.

Botifarra is a game in which the points in the tricks are most important, rather than the number of tricks, although a trick also has a value by itself. There a total of 72 points in stake for each hand, but only the difference with respect to 36 is scored. These points can be sometimes doubled, quadrupled, etc. according to the initial bid. The game is usually played for 101 points or more, which generally requires several hands.

The game is closely related to the French card game Manille, from which it takes the mechanics, but its rules induce deduction and minimise the effects of luck.

When playing Botifarra you must bear in mind that it is forbidden to speak, show your cards or make signs or comments that may reveal your cards or your opinion as to whether game decisions are good or bad. Despite this, it is quite normal to make some comments during the game, which adds to a more entertaining atmosphere.

name: PMC 2670
description:
PMC 2670 is hard sci-fi platoon-sized ruleset intended for 15mm and it's second edition of PMC 2640 released in 2013.

Introduction
In 2013, we have boldly released PMC 2640, which successfully found its place on crowded 15mm sci-fi wargames market. Now, it's high time to leap forward! In the last 3 years, we have worked hard on PMC 2670, which is much more than just a new edition of the game! As you can probably guess, the action takes place 30 years later in the same dirty, gloomy PMC-verse – but it's also indirectly connected to Shadows in the Void, which takes place much later in the same timeline. The story was moved forward: humanity developed new technologies and improved older ones, encountered an alien threat (or rather the aliens encountered a human threat...) and made the galaxy an even more turbulent place.

So, what are the gameplay changes?
There is no revolution in the core mechanics, as better is often the enemy of good... Still, the basic rules were polished and perfected, making the game even faster, more flexible and more uncompromising – but it's still the old, fine PMC! Special rules were revisited and all known question-causing or unclear elements were re-edited. But the main advantage of the 2670 edition are the added extras! Now you can lead not only merc forces, but also space bugs and rebels, which became fully playable factions. What is more, there is a fourth faction – the aforementioned aliens! Forces of your PMCs were bolstered with lots of additional unit entries, offering many new tactics and army compositions. We listened to the players and added a lot of elements they asked for (e.g. power armours, medics, drop pods, and many exotic sci-fi troops). Existing units were carefully examined and rebalanced to adjust them to the new lists. But don't worry, if you already have a collection of minis for PMC 2640, it will be fully playable in PMC 2670 – you'll simply get even more possibilities! We see no point in making existing armies useless or weaker – we're players ourselves and know how irritating this can be! In addition to new armies and PMC units, we have updated the scenarios based on the experience from previous years – but no major changes in this chapter.

Anything else?
Of course! All factions received their own campaign rules, allowing for even more interesting club gaming! Campaign is as important, as it was aspect of the ruleset. Whether you wish to create your own PMC, start a revolt, make bugs the dominant species on the planet or conquer new territories for your Xenotripod tribe, you will have the means to do it. Campaigns became even more challenging thanks to improvements such as quicker progress at the beginning and reduced snowball effect.

...and?
The whole solitaire/coop section was redone. Thanks to universal scenarios you can use any force against any other force on any tier. Additionally, the Special Commando composition allows you to start playing with just a few finished minis – perfect for people who like to collect different armies without expanding them too much.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lets Go Cadets!
description:
In the year 2500 C.E. (more or less), humanity has become, let’s say, slightly clumsier and dull with the passing of time. Now, overwhelmed by the last Znorg’s invasion, humans are desperately looking for cadets up to the task. That is why you are here: a group of uncoordinated and undisciplined new recruits, yet committed with a selfless willingness to serve with enthusiasm and loyalty to “The Last Hope” left for humanity. Will it be enough?

A cooperative game from 2 to 4 players in a 30 minutes match on which you should manage “The Last Hope” spaceship while getting ready for the final battle against the Znorgs. Coordination, organization and teamwork are pivotal in order to survive in the ship. Will you be able to coordinate the numerous logistic tasks? Such as managing inventories, storing and keeping your food or even cleaning the bathrooms. Will you be able to do it while the occasional Znorgs’ inconvenient shenanigans disrupt the ship?

The game takes place during 3 stages where players will coordinate, upgrade ship modules and strengthen the team to defeat the Znorg in the Final battle.

The players will choose their dice simultaneously behind their screen. They will take turns declaring the number of the dice they are going to play, but not its color nor on which mission they will put them on to play. When everyone but the captain have declared their dice, the captain will say Lets, Go, Cadets! at which point everyone will simultaneously place their dice on a mission trying to fulfill the color and sum requirements, while trying not to damage the ship.

If players make it through the battle against the Znorg without destroying 4 ship modules, congratulations! You have saved humanity.

This game was the winner in the Party Games category at the recent Game Jam Latam Creativa 2021.
categories: Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Ooze
description:
As you play Ooze, your goal is to collect the ingredients necessary to make the tastiest smoothie, according to those listed on "recipe" cards. Those who make the most delicious drink, win the game! And, of course, you're an even bigger winner if you actually play this game while sipping on a smoothie—which I highly recommend.

Each player has a hand of 8 cards and draws one card and discards one card each turn. If a card is discarded with a special action, follow the card text.

Each player has 5 turns of drawing/discarding. At the end of this the player wins the round who has the most ingredients in their hand from a smoothie recipe in their hand. Ties are broken with any "base" cards (milk, juice, or water) that might also be in the hand.

The player winning 3 rounds wins the game.

name: Ardennes Plus+: Volume One
description:
Ardennes Plus is a grand strategic level simulation of 20th century conflicts in the densely forested and rough terrain of the Ardennes region of France, Luxembourg and Belgium. This game features scenarios have been created for the Battle of the Bulge WWII December 1944.

The game uses Army level command structures to simulate supply and command in divisional and corps level units. The game optionally represents the fog of war that was very common in the rough country of the Ardennes, by offering 2 hidden movement systems.

The low counter density, and high map scale is used to create conditions for fast play and resolution is possible in less than 2 hours. Event card options are also incldued to add historical flavour to this classic battle, based on the geopolitic and technical events that occured at the time.

The game can be played solo, as a two player game, with one player commanding the Allied forces, and one the German forces, or as a three player game, with two players playing the Allied forces (one playing Commonwealth forces and one playing USA forces), and the third player commanding the German forces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sleeping Queens: 15th Anniversary Edition Promo Pack
description: Four special cards to add to your Sleeping Queens Anniversary Edition game! Included in the pack you will find the following: 1 Bubble Tea Queen, 1 Blank Queen Card for you to create your very own queen, 1 Stinky Tofu King, 1 Gnome King, and Rules of Play.

name: Kaput
description: It's the end of the world, as an asteroid is barreling toward Earth, with the very real possibility of making the planet go Kaput. Lucky for you, you're a wealthy elite with your own underground bunker within which to ride out the apocalypse. However, what you never counted on were all the "normies," showing up, at the last moment, wanting you to save them. You can't take them all in, and if your fellow elites form alliances with the best prospects, you won't retain power inside the bunker for long. So, choose wisely, my friend.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Alexander the Great: Alexander's Campaign from Macedonia to India
description:
Alexander the Great is the second "historical" title of the One Page Games series.
It’s a quick game where you play the role of Alexander on his march from Macedonia to India, where he will meet the Indian army at the Hydaspes river (326BC).

The game uses the engine of Hannibal ad Portas with several changes introduced to better represent the campaigns of Alexander:

Companions special rules
Persian and Indian armies
Army Morale


New stratagems and events have been added to provide new challenges to the player.

–description from the publisher

name: Last Minute Christmas
description:
Christmas is coming and we still haven't put the tree together!

In Last Minute Christmas we will have to decorate our Christmas tree using ornaments within everyone's reach, but as we are taking out of the same box they will be running out, so we must choose carefully so as not to stay with the tree half decorated.

It is a roll and write game for 2 to 5 players where each one will choose and draw ornaments trying to reach the end with the most festive tree. For this they must choose carefully which ornament they place each turn and in which position of the tree they place it.

The active turn player will throw 3 dice, and select the result of one die for drawing their ornament. The passive players will cross out the selected ornament, and choose one of the remaining corresponding to one of the other two dice.

At the end of the 15th or 16th turn (depending on the number of players), you will add up the scores. Whoever gets the highest result will be the winner and will have managed to decorate the most festive tree!

name: Mischief of Faction
description:
Mischief of Faction is a social deduction megagame where players work with their friends and neighbors to advance their agenda by passing policies and gerrymandering district lines to gain political advantage.

In Mischief of Faction, players win by passing their faction's policies or scoring points for their home district.

Play is divided into two phases: "voting" and "policy". During the voting phase, all players vote on players to represent them in the capitol during the policy phase. During the policy phase, players discard policy cards based in a reverse draft (players discard instead of keeping cards.)

Players win when their role card's objectives are complete. This is variable across four groups. Generally speaking, players want to score five policies for their faction or score five points for a district (most likely the one where they are located. Play continues until either a victory condition is met or 11 policies are in play.

With two routes to victory, players face interesting tradeoffs: help their agenda or help their district? All the while, players are moving from district to district, realigned to their new homes, new colleagues, and new alliances to build.
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Voting

name: Dungeon in a Box
description:
Dungeon in a Box is a solo dungeon crawler game based around a deck of cards and a handful of dice. Take on the role of the mighty warrior and slash your way through the dungeon until you come face to face with the boss. Will you win the day or be left at the feet of your would-be victim to serve as a warning to any foolish enough to follow in your footsteps?

Dungeon in a Box offers many choices. Which dungeon will you enter? Will you fight the monsters in their rooms or flee? Will you press your luck or ensure victory? Do you drink your potions when you find them or save them? Blame the dice and rail against the cruelty of fates as much as you like but know that you have chosen your own path. You may get mad, you may get overly invested but one thing is for sure: you won't be able to stop until you find your victory.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play

name: Is or Isn't
description: In Is or Isn't, players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawns around the gameboard. When they land on a word card space, all players look to identify the matching synonym or antonym on their bingo boards and cover that square with a token. Landing on a challenge space provides the player an opportunity to choose any open square on their board and place a token if they successfully complete the challenge. The first player to fill a row or column with four tokens wins the game.
mechanics: Bingo, Matching, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Friday the 13th: Horror at Camp Crystal Lake – Player Powers Promo Set
description: These six player power cards will add to the excitement and drama of your game by giving unique abilities to each of the players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: Passport Game Studios, The Op Games

name: Legends Untold: Potions & Preparations Expansion Set
description:
Long ago, when the Orakhee fell upon the Brethren Empire, the Gnimshka listened to the earth and it protected them. Today the great Glyptographers of the Gnimhomes teach their disciples how to inscribe the rocks of the world, releasing the Lustre within them in an art they call Petromagika.

From the revered Gardeners of Achea, to the humble village Broth Apothecarys of the Painted Forest, almost every culture on Mor Nadar knows that foraging for plants, and scavenging some of the remains of animals, can yield treasure when combined with the skilled use of pestle and mortar.

Potions and Preparations is an optional expansion for the Legends Untold game system. This set unlocks new options for Heroes to gather resources during their adventures and use them to make alchemical potions and magical preparations.

This set introduces:

New Resource types for Alchemy – 80 new Plant and Animal Reagent cards which can be used to brew exciting Potions.
A new magic system - the ancient art of Petromagika; inscribe the 56 new Mineral Resource cards and used them in Preparations to unleash the magical Lustre within.
45 new Potions and Preparations to make. Will you use the ‘Draft of Foresight’ to Divine the next 3 Adventure cards, or maybe you will place your inscribed gem inside the ‘Steel Shot’ Preparation enchanting your Crossbow bolts with lethal penetration.


A range of new options to help you build the character you want to play, specialising or dabbling as you see fit:

2 new Occupation cards; the Gnimshka Stone Scout and Persi Apothecary
New Kits and Outfits to assist you in gathering and preparing resources
6 Skill Talents to support gathering and using Herbs, Plants, Animal Reagents and Minerals.
2 new weapons; the Gnimshka Gastraphetes crossbow and the Sagaris club/axe
6 Weapon Talents used in conjunction with the two new Weapons provided



New Herb and Gem Loot Items for use with the Adventure and Treasure decks.
Updated Location cards for the caves and sewers sets to help you find the minerals you are looking for.


This set requires a core set to use it.

This expansion pack works in conjunction with the Alchemy Booster Pack (which is intended to be reprinted in the Novice Booster Set Volume II) and there are rules for updating those cards in conjunction with this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Clear the Decks!: Pirate Hunters
description:
Pirates are the scourge of the seas and islands of the world – attacking, robbing, pillaging and kidnapping those that would live and trade in peace. Someone must rise to the fore and rid the waters of these dastardly villains. Take command of a man-o-war, add a brave crew and set out to sea as a Pirate Hunter.

Clear the Decks! Pirate Hunters is an expansion to the original game Clear the Decks! The base game is required to use this expansion. Pirate Hunters adds three new mechanisms and 50 new cards to the original game. The 74 card sized box also has new tokens for adding Marines to the Longboat Attack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Adivina Adivinador
description:
How to explain what a PARAGLIDER is? How to imitate the sound of a TRUMPET? How to mimic an Indian? With this game you will be able to explore your expressive capacity 100%

Players must draw cards where a picture is shown and get their partners to guess it. To do this, he must make sounds, mimic or explain what he sees, as indicated on the card taken out. Also, bring 10 action cards to give it more difficulty. The team that manages to guess the most cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Heroes II
description:
What could be better than a Giant of the Free People? Two Giants, of course! Welcome to Wun Wun and Mag the Mighty.

Contents:
2 Miniatures

Wun Wun
Mag the Mighty


2 Unit Cards
20 Tactics Cards
1 Special Rules Card
2 Movement Trays (72mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: King of the West
description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and out think them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone else's. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: ConSEXuate
description:
ConSEXuate is a game of affective Sex Education, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Mature / Adult, Trivia

name: Last War: West 1968/1989 – Expansion Pack
description: An Expansion for Last War: West about conflict on 1968/1989

name: Ozam!
description:
The divine protector, Ozam, guards the Sun and the Moon. Yet, these two heavenly orbs are under attack from all sides by the horrifying “Chaoscreeps”. Wizen and frail, Ozam is searching for a warrior of talents to win 3 out of 5 battles to inherit his role and power, destroy the Chaoscreep and save the Earth.

Ozam uses 5 different Card Play Conflict resolution mechanisms with differing win conditions. Players who win 3 of 5 battles, win the game.

How to play:
• Shuffle and draw a card from the battle deck.
• Follow the instruction and play.
• Anyone who wins 3 over 5 battles will become the next Ozam and win the game!

name: Veggie Battle
description:
Veggie Battle is a hidden goal, tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players. You play the role of one of several neighbors working in shared community gardens, scheming against each other to win the coveted "Gardener of the Year" award.

Each player receives four Goals for the game, two of which are shared while the other two remain hidden. Players also receive three Tool cards that allow them to take actions that are otherwise outside of normal gardening etiquette.

The gardens are represented by four 3x3 grids. Players take turns drafting tiles representing one of seven different veggies and placing them in an unoccupied slot in any garden. Once all gardens are completely planted, players assign one goal to each garden and calculate their harvest to determine who scored the veggie victory.

"--description from the designer"
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Tierra de Misión
description:
Tierra de Misión is a game of cards and tokens with an educational and integrating purpose in the pastoral history issued by the missionaries of the Catholic faith in the mission of the Argentine Patagonia in a time of dispossession and persecution of the native peoples.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest number of story points at the end of the game.

During three rounds, players select and play cards using a draft similar to 7 Wonders. Players start the rounds with 7-9 cards and 2-3 coins, depending on the player count. The cards have different colors and different scores, with some cards having an economic cost.

The cards stay in the table after each round, and the player with more points at the end is declared as the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flee Fi Fo From
description:
“Halt! What business have you in our glorious city? Sir, kind sir, please let us in! Our villages were plundered by the giants not two days past. Flee we did, but they come behind us! Won’t you take us in? Nearby villages you say? Hmm, you provide us much grain. Our city council perchance might let you in. But you must show us your papers. Queue up! Our glorious knights can fend off the giants.”

In Flee Fi Fo From, players take on the role of competing clans attempting to protect villagers from rampaging giants by bringing them to safety within the city walls. Clans are not saving people out of pure altruism though - they have their own agenda to gain influence in the city council. The clan with the most influence points at the end wins the game.

The game is played over a series of Action and Reset turns. First the player with the action marker performs up to 2 actions (Authorize, Riot, Swap or Escort). These typically involve selecting villagers to be admitted to the city and moving them forward. Following this, the reset player is responsible for maintaining the flow of villagers towards the city, but may also choose to abandon the rescue efforts by retreating the defending knights instead.

The game ends when either all villagers have been saved or too many knights have retreated from the battlefield.

Scores are a total of villagers rescued, hidden objectives, end game bonuses and rating. The player with the most influence points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Prisoner's Dilemma, Score-and-Reset Game, Worker Placement

name: The Inappropriate Workplace
description:
The Inappropriate Workplace is a fun party card game similar to Cards Against Humanity, but with workplace situations.

Players start with a series of Answer Cards and each player takes turns playing a Situation Card. The most 'inappropriate' answer earns a point.

Be the first to earn 6 points and you'll be declared the winner (and may be fired by HR).
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Emoji Bible Stories Card Game
description:
Emoji Bible Stories Card Game is great entertainment for everyone! With 4 versatile gameplay options, even younger children and those new to the Bible can join in the fun!

Game 1: Tell an Emoji Bible Story

Tell the Bible story on your Green Story Card with the help of 3 Emoji Cards.

If other players agree that the emojis used are appropriate, you get 1 point. Score 3 points to win!

Game 2: Guess the Bible Story
Lead other players to correctly guess the Bible story on your Green Story Card by playing your Emoji Cards faceup, 1 at a time.

If another player correctly guesses your Bible story, both of you get 1 point each. Score 5 points to win!

Game 3: Match and Guess
Stay alert to collect Emoji Cards that match your picture-based Purple Story Card.

If another player correctly guesses your story, both of you get 1 point each. Score 5 points to win!

Game 4: Snap and Redeem
This game is great for those less familiar with the Bible. Play a variation of “Snap” to win Emoji Cards.

Then use 3 Emoji Cards to redeem a Purple Story Card. The first player to redeem 3 Purple Story Cards wins the game!

name: Bible Animals: Click Clack Match
description: Have a rolling good time with this clickety-clackety dice game! With 20 animal dice and 56 beautifully designed cards, Bible Animals Click Clack Match is the perfect game for both young and old!

name: Deck Destroying Game
description:
This is a card game with 72 cards.

In Deck Destroying Game, each player has a Personal Deck containing 10 cards with numbers 3 to 9 on them. Throughout the game, some of these cards will replace by worse cards of the "General deck" (with numbers 0 to 2 on them).

The game will be played in turns. Each turn, players play up to 3 of their in-hand card(s) simultaneously and the winner takes one of the played cards as reward.

Each card shows from one to three gem icons which are victory points of the game. At the end of the game, the player with most gem icons is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tug
description:
Tug is a 2 player card game played partially on top of the game box.

Two dog owners and their pups compete to tug a rope toy to their side.

Each round, players secretly designate any number of their cards as tug cards and bid cards. Tug cards work to tug the pawn toward their side. The high bidder gets a new upgraded card. Whoever tugs the pawn all the way to their side is the winner! Or collect 2 bone cards which provide no bidding/tugging power for an alternate path to victory.

name: Duty calls
description:
Duty calls is a 28mm miniatures game designed to recreate modern and contemporary conflict in solo game or in cooperation mode. The game involves the use of infantry troops but it is also possible to implement air vehicles and supports for more substantial games. The aim of the game will be to free the streets and war zones from hostile objectives that will reveal themselves during the game in an unexpected way...

Game and war theaters
The game involves armed clashes and it is advisable to use a game table full of scenic elements to make the combat more exciting. The size of the table is at the discretion of the player and the mission you want to play but for a standard game it is advisable to start on a 3 '× 3' table.

Necessary material:
2d6, 1d20 one meter per inch, paper and pencil

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Maniwalde
description:
Simple strategy postcard game for two players.

Maniwalde was an elder of ancient Estonia. He died in the battle of St. Matthews day, alongside with Lembitu, defending his country from the Livonian order.

You're going to need six D6 dice (preferrably in two colours, 3 each), pen and a sheet of paper. Each player receives 3 dice of the same colour.

During their turn player 1 places one of their dice (while keeping the result) in one area and then may activate the special bonus of that area. After that it's other player's turn - and it continues until both players have placed all their dice on the gameboard. No area may have two dice from the same player or with the same result.

After a round ends players receive victory points for controlling the areas (in addition to the victory points received from the area bonuses, if any). Area is controlled by the owner of the die with the highest number. Those points are recorded on the paper and then new round starts.

Game ends after round three and all victory points are added together.

Full English language rules are available on the web site.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #75 – Operation Tombola
description:
Operation Tombola was a British SAS-led mission to carry out a series of harrassing raids behind enemy lines in the Reggio Emilia region, at the top of the Italian "boot". The operation was put together by Major Roy Farrar, who was not allowed to go on the actual mission, although he was allowed to accompany the SAS on the aircraft as they were airdropped. During the airdrop, he "accidentally" fell out of the aircraft, although he happened to have a parachute on, and was able to lead his troops in the field.

The attacks included an assault on the German Gebirgs (mountain corps) headquarters in an attempt to decapitate their regional high command. Notably, a Scottish piper was part of the assaulting force, so that the friendlies could identify which side they were fighting on, as well as to confuse the Germans into thinking that a main Allied force was attacking rather than a raiding party.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Airborne SAS Soldiers, German Alpine Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Location, Landing Zone, and Enemy Lines cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 SAS Player Soldiers
3 SAS Non-Player Soldiers
3 SAS Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
1 Location
4 Landing Zone
9 Enemy Lines
1 Skill
6 Weapons and Gear (including Bagpipes)
17 German Alpine Hostiles

Player's Note: This set is intended to be played using the Warfighter Mediterranean core set, including Locations. There is a Tombola Location card "Villa Calvi" in the set, which is a requisite for one of the Objective cards "Villa Rossi", and can be omitted for the other Tombola Objectives.

If you are playing the "Villa Rossi" Objective, add the "Villa Calvi" card into the Location card deck and draw Locations as normal. Although the Tombola Location card back is a giveaway, treat this as the effect that the squad has a pathway to the Villa Calvi, as a prelude to attacking the Villa Rossi.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #77 – Battle of Crete #2
description:
The Battle of Crete marks the occasion in which the German Fallschirmjäger (paratroops) executed the first major airborne invasion in warfare, only to be faced by stiff resistance from Allied forces, bolstered by Cretan civilians who also took up arms against the invaders. Initial fighting from the defenders was so fierce that the German offensive briefly faltered, before Allied hesitation allowed the Germans to rally and regain the initiative, forcing the Allies to retreat and eventually capitulate. The success of the airborne operation demonstrated the mobility and capabilities of airborne assault forces.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new German Airborne Soldiers, British Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Location, Landing Zone, and Enemy Lines cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 German Airborne Player Soldiers
3 German Airborne Non-Player Soldiers
3 German Airborne Squad Soldiers
5 Missions
6 Objectives
11 Locations
3 Landing Zone
9 Enemy Lines
8 Weapons
2 Skills
3 British Hostiles + Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #78 – Battle of Rimini
description:
The Battle of Rimini was part of Operation Olive, the Allied offensive against the Gothic Line in Northern Italy. The township of Rimini, situated along the Adriatic coast, was the easternmost anchor point of the Rimini Line, which was part of the multi-layered wall of Gothic Line defenses. The battle for the town along its outlying regions and into the town itself was some of the most brutal fighting, given the strategic significance of the city. At the conclusion of hostilities, it was estimated that less than 2% of the buildings in the city had been unscathed by the fighting.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Greek Mountain Infantry Soldiers, German Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Skills, Gear and Situation Cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Greek Mountain Infantry Player Soldiers
3 Greek Mountain Infantry Non-Player Soldiers
3 Greek Mountain Infantry Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
5 Weapons
2 Skills
17 German Hostiles
2 Situation
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #72 – Battle of Bardia
description:
The Battle of Bardia was one of the first Allied incursions into North Africa as part of Operation Compass, with the Australian 6th Division assaulting the fiercely-defended fortress and township of Bardia. It was a hard fought victory with over 30000 enemy prisoners taken, and opened the path for the Allied campaign to advance into Libya and Cyrenaica.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including:

4 Australian Player Soldiers
4 Australian Non-Player Soldiers
4 Australian Squad Soldiers
3 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
6 Weapons
1 Gear
1 Skill
15 Hostiles + 2 Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Diggrie
description:
Diggrie is a two-player game played on a 5x5 grid, with each player having five flat discs and one taller king disc in their color.

To win, you must create in your color a row of four pieces or a square of pieces. You can move over unoccupied spaces; jumping is not allowed. The game includes three variants, and if you include the king piece in play, it needs to be part of the winning row or square.

name: ¡Tierra a la Vista!
description:
Tierra a la Vista is a cooperative game for 2 to 4 players and 40 minute games, where we will become treasure hunters, crew members of a drifting ship trying to return to the mainland with their coffers as full as possible.

The game consists of 2 phases. A planning phase where players will move their characters around the ship collecting action points in the cannons, sails, spyglass, among others, that they will have to collect and then use in the exploration phase.

In the exploration phase, players will take turns drawing cards from the exploration decks trying to get treasures, avoid the weather and defeat the pirates, while they are running out of supplies and the ship suffers damage that will have to be repaired if they do not want to sink. All this using their action points in the best possible way.

The objective is to find in the depths of each deck the three map fragments that will take them back home.
You will win the game if you succeed, and if you have the required amount of treasure in your coffers. But if a crew member drowns, they run out of supplies, or the ship sinks, they will have failed, and their ship will be one more lost in the depths of the sea.

It will not be an easy task. Only cooperation, coordination and teamwork will bring you back.

Beware of Pirates!

The prototype of this game was awarded the "Best New Latin Game" award in the Quarantine Challenge 2020 organized by the game makers community in Mexico.
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Move Through Deck, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: 18Kit
description:
18Kit is a modular game designed to scale based on the number of players and choosen lenght of play. Players aim to make the most money by buying and selling stock in different corporation; those entities, conversely, are operated by players and may lay track, place stations, run and buy trains, and distribute returns to its shareholders.
While most 18xx rely on a detailed historical background which shapes the map and companies' starting locations in a fixed way, 18Kit is completely ahistorical and consequently much more flexible.
18Kit features a modular map with up to 7-hex tiles, a "game chart" that defines all aspects of setup depending on player count and bank size, like number of trains, map tiles, available company types.
The game feature a unique ribbon-style hex stock market, which is a variation on the classic 2D stock market.
Other than that, the game is an incremental cap 18xx with minor companies, price protection à la 1870 and 2:1 mergers (systems).
It ends when a player goes bankrupt or the bank breaks, and the winner is the richest non-bankrupt player, taking in account personal money and value of their own shares.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hexagon Grid, Market, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Necromunda Underhive: Delaque Gang Tactics Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in your Necromunda games.

It has 18 Delaque cards and 8 blank fighter cards with the House Delaque gang stamp on it.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – Ghost Ship
description:
The Ghost Ship mini-expansion for Neko Harbour: The Card Game. The expansion contains four ghost ship cards. Ghost ships costs two fuel to move, and cannot move to an attraction. They are worth seven points if they reach the end of the preparation line.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Resource to Move

name: Risen Osiris: Sacred Numbers
description:
A mini expansion to the micro solo roll & write game, Risen Osiris. Select a card and incorporate into the base game using the same dice rolling mechanic.

---
Instructions:

Using numbers that were considered powerful by the ancient Egyptians, these cards are meant to add some more variety to Risen Osiris gameplay.

Select any card from the expansion and cover the boxes under the Canopic Jars location and roll for the new numbers in the expansion boxes as normal.

Exception: In Sacred Fours, when rolling 12s, you can place a cube in the corresponding Canopic Jar instead of moving a yellow cube to Set’s Pyramid.

name: Pokémon TCG: Celebrations
description:
Celebrate some of Pokémon's greatest moments over 25 years of adventure, discovery, and friendship! The Celebrations expansion offers plenty to be excited about, including an opportunity to stroll down memory lane with classic Pokémon TCG cards. Add a joyous parade of Legendary, Mythical, and other beloved Pokémon to your collection, including Mew, Ho-Oh, Zamazenta, Flying Pikachu, and Surfing Pikachu. Join the party with the Pokémon TCG: Celebrations expansion!

- publisher's blurb


Adds more than 45 cards to the game.

- user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cotton Trade: 1800-1860
description:
It is the early 19th century. The Industrial Revolution is underway, and the demand for cotton is soaring. As a British entrepreneur, you see an opportunity to profit from this booming market. You will send your ships all over the world in search of the best prices for cotton. Will you keep up with the expanding market and become the most successful merchant?

The game is played over 9 rounds in 3 stages. At the start of each round, players compare the wealth of their companies to determine turn order. Then, they rent ships, send ships to regions where cotton is harvested, buy cotton, and return to the United Kingdom to sell cotton at a profit. At the end of each round, players pay a ship maintenance cost and clear the board for the next round. Players can also benefit from transporting passengers and exporting small amounts of goods from the United Kingdom.

The game uses a deck of 24 ship cards with different properties, including maximum capacity. Cotton can be purchased from contract cards of different quantities and prices in four historical regions where cotton was harvested. Droughts and local wars can interrupt players' plans and, along with the order of cards being drawn from the decks, are the main random factor of the game.

Ships are rented when only limited information about cotton harvests is available, adding to the difficulty of managing trading companies. Players can sell shares of their company to obtain additional funding, but they are required to repurchase all of their assets at the end of the game.

There are no victory points in this game. The player who owns the wealthiest company at the end wins.

Relative cotton prices and amounts of cotton harvested in different regions were based on real-world economic data. In order to simulate the exponential growth of the market, the game rescales itself between stages. This allows players to keep up with the cotton boom without having to handle large amounts of coins and tokens.

Advanced game rules introduce the possibility of buying other players' shares, among other options. This way, players can invest in and profit from their competitors' success.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Contracts, Market, Trading, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Motley Dice
description:
Motley Dice is an intriguing puzzle where you roll the dice to generate a unique challenge for every game. Then you must try to place as many dice as you can into the grid, following certain placement restrictions. Challenge yourself, or try one of four different play modes to cooperate or compete with your friends.

To pack some extra punch, this mint tin comes with rules for four other dice games you can play with the 25 dice included. That's 5 games in your pocket!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Salvar Doñana
description:
In Salvar Doñana, several environmental problems have emerged simultaneously in the Doñana National Park. The players are expert naturalists whose mission is to discover a solution for each of the four environmental problems before they get out of hand.

On each turn, the active player can use up to four actions to travel from one point to another, mitigate environmental problems, discover a solution, or build control centers. A deck of cards will provide players with these abilities, but they will have to be careful with the catastrophe cards, which will accelerate and intensify environmental problems. A second deck of cards will control the inevitable expansion of environmental problems within the National Park.

Assuming a unique role within the team, players must plan their strategy to combine the strengths of their specialties to conquer the solution to environmental problems. But if one or more of those problems extends beyond the point of no return or if too much time passes, all players will lose. If they find a solution to the four environmental problems in time, the players will win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Coup Rebellion G54: Anarchy Promos
description: A small package containing one influence card of each new character featured in Coup Rebellion G54 - Anarchy.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Renaissance Wars: Seed of the Enlightenment Luminary Set
description: Now play the game with one of the most illustrious men of the period. This set add four new luminaries: Desiderius Erasmus, Johannes Kepler, John Locke, and Claudio Monteverdi.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance

name: BattleTech: Operational Turning Points – Hanseatic Crusade
description:
ensions simmered between the Hanseatic League and the new Scorpion Empire for decades before the Hansa lit the spark that led to war. The Khan of Clan Goliath Scorpion knew a simple punitive expedition would be a waste of resources. This would not be a war of reprisal. It would be an all-out crusade for control of Hansa territory. Superior Clan technology pitted against superior numbers of Hansa troops. In such a war, can there truly be a victor? Would two nations be shattered in the conflict, or would a single, new power rise from the ruins?

Operational Turning Points: Hanseatic Crusade opens up the battle for players to join in the fight using the successful Turning Points PDF-exclusive format. This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions and Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF includes detailed information on several of the worlds affected by the Scorpion Empire assault, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run characters and battles from this time period. Only the players’ imaginations are the limits.

name: BattleTech: Turning Points – Helm
description:
The Gray Death Legion: Mercenaries betrayed by their employer and betrayed from within. Both the Mariks and ComStar oppose them. Can Grayson Carlyle lead his command out of the trap that has ensnared them? Only quick, decisive action and determination will see them survive overwhelming odds.

Helm: A world of glaciers, tundra, rock-filled deserts, barren seas, and an ancient Star League secret. That secret could destroy the Legion and move humanity another step closer toward darkness. Or one step closer toward salvation. Helm and humanity’s future lay in the grasp of an outlawed mercenary unit.

Turning Points: Helm uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or to follow a campaign arc. Included are a detailed map of the world of Helm, a rundown of the forces involved, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Helm.

name: Ăn Ý
description:
An Y is a party game for 4-8 players. An Y is a simple party game that promotes interaction between players. The game has humorous questions, will bring fun and surprise moments to players because of the creative answers of friends or two strangers who suddenly share the same strange thought.

Summary of game
The game follows 3 steps:

Open the question card: On the turn, the player flips and reads the question of the first card on the question deck card
Write the answer: All players write their answer on their answer sheet
Compare answers and score points: Players compare the answers. If another player has the same answer, you score points. The more similar answers, the more points you score.


After 10 questions, the game ends, the player who has the most points will win.

The interesting point of the game is the interaction between the players and the humorous questions. The game is suitable for everyone, will be an indispensable part of your gatherings with friends.
—description from the publisher (translated)

“Ăn Ý là một party game cách chơi đơn giản, đẩy mạnh sự tương tác giữa các người chơi. Trò chơi mang đến những câu hỏi hài hước, đảm bảo sẽ đem đến những tiếng cười vui vẻ và những phút giây bất ngờ bởi những đáp án sáng tạo của bạn bè hay hai người xa lạ bỗng chia sẻ cùng một suy nghĩ lạ đời.

Tóm tắt trò chơi
Trò chơi gồm có 3 bước:
1. Mở thẻ câu hỏi
Vào lượt, người chơi lật và đọc câu hỏi của thẻ đầu tiên trên chồng câu hỏi
2. Ghi đáp án
Mỗi người chơi ghi đáp án vào giấy câu trả lời của họ
3. So đáp án và ghi điểm
Người chơi so sánh các đáp, ghi điểm nếu người chơi khác có đáp án giống mình. Càng nhiều đáp án giống nhau, bạn ghi càng nhiều điểm

Sau 10 câu hỏi, trò chơi kết thúc, người chơi ghi được nhiều điểm nhất sẽ chiến thắng

Điểm thú vị của trò chơi nằm ở sự tương tác giữa người chơi và bộ câu hỏi hài hước. Trò chơi phù hợp với nhiều đối tượng, sẽ là một phần không thể thiếu trong các buổi tụ họp của bạn cùng với bạn bè”

—description from the publisher

name: 1848: The Golden Spike
description:
1848: The Golden Spike (aka 1848LT, or "The one true 1862") is a member of the "18xx" series of games. The series is based on 1829, by Francis Tresham. 1848LT is set in the western part of the US.
Two to six players represent investors in railroad corporations, spending their initial capital to buy wholly-owned Private and Subsidiary Companies and shares in Public Corporations and the Credit Mobilier.

The Public Corporations, each controlled by the largest shareholder (its President), build track and run trains in order to earn revenues. These can be paid out as dividends to shareholders or retained to fund further track and rolling stock.
A key feature of 1848LT, as with all the other games in the series, is that the interests of the President and the interests of its shareholders are not identical, so minority shareholders need to be careful in their investments.

Being a President is not without its difficulties, either; bailing out an insolvent Corporation is the sole responsibility of its President.

— user description
mechanics: Market, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Catan: Das Duell – Sonderkarte 2021: 25 Jahre CATAN-Kartenspiel
description:
Bonus Card for "Catan: Das Duel".
Text on card: "Sie dürfen eine große Festhalle für 2 Rohstoffe weniger bauen. Haben Sie bereits eine Große Festhalle vor dem Ausspielen dieser Karte gebaut, erhalten Sie 2 der bezahlten Rohstoffe zurück."

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Stormcast Eternals
description:
Stormcast Eternals are the mightiest warriors of Order. Each forged in Azyr by Sigmar's hand, these noble warriors strike out into the realms to do battle. Riding coruscating thunderbolts, they arrive on the field of war with an ear-splitting thunderclap. The forces of the Stormcast Eternals are the mighty hammer that crushes the forces of Chaos and the shield that protects the helpless citizens of the realms from the myriad encroaching evils. Armed with weapons blessed with celestial energy, these immortal demigods' fury and faith knows no bounds.

In this book, you'll discover how the Stormcast Eternals, mortal heroes chosen by the God-King to be Reforged into his foremost warriors, fought to bring hope to the war-ravaged Mortal Realms. Battletome: Stormcast Eternals is also packed with all the rules you need to create your own force of Order, from the Stormcasts' finest champions to the ancient draconic lords.

This 184-page hardback book contains:


A wealth of lore about the Stormcast Eternals covering everything from the Realmgate Wars to the Era of the Beast and the Dawnbringer Crusades, complete with stunning illustrations
Background information on every Stormhost and unit available to the Stormcast Eternals
A showcase of expertly painted Citadel miniatures and an in-depth painting guide covering a variety of Stormhosts
76 warscrolls covering every Stormcast Eternals unit, including three faction-specific endless spells
Rules for both Scions of the Storm and Stormkeep armies, as well battle traits, spell lores, mount traits, and holy commands
Brand new Path to Glory rules, including rules for Reforging, bespoke Stormcast Eternals territories, four quests, two battle plans, 15 warscroll battalions, and more
Pitched battle profiles with points for matched play games
And more!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Area of Engagement – Outer Reaches
description:
This foldable Area of Engagement: Outer Reaches board for Aeronautica Imperialis represents two different locations over which your air fleets can compete. Measuring 19 by 18 squares (or approximately 36" square), this game board provides a large area on which to play your battles.

The double-sided game board comes in two pieces and features artwork depicting the following aerial war zones:

- Side 1: Imperial Outpost

- Side 2: Lava World

You'll need a copy of the Taros Air War or Rynn's World Campaign book, or Aeronautica Imperialis: Wrath of Angels, Skies of Fire, or Wings of Vengeance boxed games to use this game board.

name: Mord bei Tisch: Klassentreffen
description:
Welcome to the class reunion of the graduates of the Goethe-Gymnasium of 2001. The celebration takes place in the sports hall of the former school and everyone is looking forward to reviving the good old times.

But long-forgotten secrets and intrigues also resurface. And then the former school spokesman Ralf Simon is found murdered in the workroom.

The question that remains is: Can you solve the criminal case together?
