Mord bei Tisch "Klassentreffen" is a criminal dinner game in which 5-7 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Mercenaries Cards
description: Alpha Strike Mercenaries Cards includes 36 double-sided (72 units) cards with all the game stats player need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in a wide variety of eras. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2021 Goody Box
description:
A promotional (plain white) box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2021.

For Shadows of Brimstone:

Grave Robber’s Den / Untouched Wreckage map tile pack
2 Map cards (Mine and Blasted Wastes, P-914 and P-916)
2 Encounter cards (Corpse Cart and Fresh Salvage, P-915 and P-917)
1 double-sided map tile (Grave Robber’s Den / Untouched Wreckage)
1 double-sided double map tile connector‡ (Mine / Blasted Wastes); 2 squares deep
1 double-sided single map tile connector† (Mine / Blasted Wastes); 1 square deep
2 double-sided single map tile connectors† (Forbidden Fortress / Forest of the Dead and Forbidden Fortress / Belly of the Beast); 1 square deep

Master Samurai Dice Fest 2021 Miniature
Rusty Shovel promo card P-497
Masterclass Revolver promo card P-338
Keg of Dynamite promo card P-329
Infinite Darkness promo card P-339


 
For A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic:`

Duel of Honor promo card P-052
Horse Chase promo card P-051


 
† These are essentially 1.25 inch "corridors"
‡ This is essentially a 2.5 inch "corridor"

name: Talento
description:
A mediator chooses a photo and delivers 5 cards with phrases to each of the other players. Players choose one of the provocative phrases for the photo and vote for the best one. If your idea is the most creative, congratulations! You gained in talent. He is an advertising genius and gets points for that and a new round is held. The first player to reach a number of points wins.

—user summary

name: Microbrew: Sarsaparilla Promo Card
description:
This promo card can be added to the thirsty customers deck. Doc Francis there loves Sarsparilla, which matches the “DMML” recipe in the base game -- the one with the scored out “perfect.”

He also will pay an extra $2 for any beer that is sweet. (He's offering the ORE-SOME style dollars, but we'll give him a 1 for 1 exchange rate because we're generous that way.)

Now mechanically speaking, Sarsparilla makes DMML slightly more valuable than it should be, so it’s not recommended in highly competitive play but it was just meant to be a fun little reference to our first game, ORE-SOME that we hope you enjoy.

—description from the publisher

Included with Kickstarter pledge rewards.
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Dead Machine Gods
description:
Dead Machine Gods is a strategic cyber-occult worker placement and tableau building mint tin game for 1-2 players. Set in a world of dark magic, occult technology, and haunted machinery.

Gather resources, research and build arcane blueprints, and complete the rites of summoning to resurrect ancient mecha-deities. Will you appease the ancient ones or succumb to their grim will and embrace the call of annihilation?

In each round of Dead Machine Gods, players will roll all their worker dice, and take turns placing workers on available card slots based-on their rolls. Placing workers lets you gather energy, material, and blueprints for building out your tableau.

The game ends when the first player completes their 8-card tableau (completing the rites of summoning). Players then tally the base victory points on the cards in their tableau as well any additional points earned form card abilities, placement synergies, and special symbols. The player with the highest score, wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: RAIN
description:
RAIN is a solo game about auditory hallucinations. The games comes as an A3 sheet of paper, with the rules and a diagram to help understand the board printed on the rear. Players are expected to provide any other required components.

The board has different tracks for the volume of the protagonist's hallucinations, the current time, and the time you expect the hallucinations to subside.

The player will use a die to determine if the current volume of rain is enough to drown out the hallucinations. If it is, the player will be able to advance the current time on the tracks. If it is not, the player is instructed to wait a period of time equal to the distance between the current time and the time they were trying to move on that track.

The time tracks are in 8 different units, such as seconds, minutes, hours, days, and weeks.

The rules include an exception for the game ending in case the remaining period of the game would exceed your expected lifetime.

name: Athanasia
description:
Athanasia is a Scifi/Fantasy Competitive Skirmish Wargame where players engage in tactical conflict to secure the key to immortality.

Players mobilize and strategically position their characters, leverage their surroundings to increase their power, and battle their rivals as they venture towards victory.

Every character has a value that determines their health, movement, defense, and attack power as well as additional character abilities that increase their effectiveness on the battlefield.

Each turn, a player is allotted 3 activation points for their civilization which they can use in a variety of ways to increase their own power as well as decrease their rival's power as they carve their path towards victory.

In a given turn a player may: Move their characters across the battlefield based on their allowed movement, collect and activate items that spawn dynamically, activate obelisks to increase their movement, defense, and attack power, activate character abilities to weaken their rivals, and attack or steal items from adjacent rivals using a D20 die to simulate battle. As in any battle, strength in numbers always helps you come out on top. When attacking or defending from rivals, you get additional D20 roll or defense bonuses by positionally linking your characters together.

Securing the key to immortality first requires crafting it at the crafting table in the center of the battlefield using both the philosopher's stone and antimatter which are spawned throughout the game. The race is then on for a civilization to secure the key and activate it at the battlefield's exit point. The player that successfully activates the key at the exit point is the winner. Alternatively, you can win Athanasia by being the sole survivor after obliterating your rivals. Will you be the first to reach immortality?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination

name: Firebase Inferno
description:
Firebase Inferno is a 2 player wargame that takes around 1 hour to play, and is an area control, simultaneous card play, jungle combat wargame set in a near-future dystopian world. Players control one of two factions (the Cyto-Command or the Shadow-Force) who they will use to traverse treacherous jungle terrain, collect strategic resources, and construct powerful upgrades to their base that will deliver devastating blows to their opponent.

At the center of the jungle is a key village location that starts the game in control of the Shadow-Force, and is used to obtain powerful advantages and fund a rebellion against the Cyto-Command. During the game, players will fight for control of the village, along with the other 4 unique locations around the board.

Over the course of 6 rounds, players will simultaneously play commander cards from their hand to move units on and around the board, and engage their opponents in combat. At the end of six rounds, players will total their victory points to determine a winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans
description:
The Orruks are Destruction incarnate. This vicious and primal race of natural-born killers loves nothing more than to wage unending war. Their society is built around conflict, and huge migratory invasions called Waaagh!s erupt from all corners of the Mortal Realms to drown the worlds of Order, Death, and Chaos in a green tide of violence. To face the Orruk Warclans is to face total annihilation, for their numbers are beyond counting, and they live solely for the thrill of bloody combat.

In this book, you'll discover the history of the Orruk Warclans, including their presence across the Mortal Realms and the societies that hold them together. As well as exploring the movements and motives of the orruk race, Battletome: Orruk Warclans also gives you insight into their spiritual connection to Gorkamorka, the primordial god of Destruction. The background information is complemented by a full suite of rules allowing you to field armies of Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz, or to combine all three clans into one colossal Big Waaagh!.

This 136-page hardback book contains:

– A war chest of lore about the Orruk Warclans, their history, and their activities following the return of Kragnos
– Stunning art depicting the Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and the new Kruleboyz
– 37 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for everything from sneaky Hobgrot Slittaz to the Earthquake God himself
– 15 warscroll battalions for Path to Glory narrative campaigns
– Allegiance abilities for every Orruk Warclans subfaction, including battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power, as well as the Big Waaagh! that combines Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz
– Content for matched play, including 5 grand strategies, 6 battle tactics, and 3 core battalions
– Path to Glory campaign rules for creating an Orruk Warclans warband
– A beautiful miniature showcase and painting guide for getting the most out of your Waaagh!
– Extensive bestiary information for the Orruk Warclans units, including the background of Kragnos, End of Empires

'— Description from the publisher'
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mimetix: S'envoie en l'air
description:
In Mimetix "s'envoie en l'air", in less than a minute, we have fun mimicking the spicy expressions of lovers ... of the French language! Get ready to "heat up" and "get it right", without necessarily "going to the pan"!
In less than a minute, act out and have your team guess as many phrases as possible. Easy ? Imagine miming literally “taking a rake” or “having a puck in the drawer”. The funniest in addition to the extravagant mimes? Fabulous responses from players pulling their hair out and tangling their brushes guessing the expression. You will find 2 rule variations, 3 difficulty levels of expressions and action cards to spice up the game even more!

name: TKG ARENA: A Rift of Portals
description:
Establishing a portal to another world is a major milestone by any yardstick. The Constellars are often tasked with the conveyance of armies across realms during wars and this ability is crucial to their role.

Setting up and preparing for the ritual is the easy part, the real challenge comes in maintaining a delicate balance of the cosmic forces as one disrupts the fabric of space and time so that others may arrive at their intended destination safely.

TKG ARENA: A Rift of Portals is a game for 1 player.

Components required for this game:

WORLD TILES: 48
OINKS: 15 from each element for each player (Default)

Winning Conditions

The objective of the game is to stabilize the portal once it is set up and this is represented by fulfilling a number of conditions.

1. The number of Oinks in the Inner Gate must be equal or more than the Oinks placed in the Outer Void.
2. The number of elemental insignias placed on any linear sides of the Boundary must be equal.
3. The elemental insignias on each tile must be matched by a placed Oink representing the same element.

Ending Condition

The game ends when all tiles are played and all unmatched Oinks on any tile on the Boundary are moved to the Outer Void. The player loses when the winning conditions are not achieved when the game ends.

Setup

A player starts the game by drawing randomly from a stack of world tiles to be placed in a 3 x 3 grid manner as below.

X A B C O
D I E
F G H

1. Shuffle the 48 world tiles into a stack. World tiles are referred to as tiles.

2. Draw 3 tiles from the stack. From these 3 tiles, flip 1 over to the grid side to form the Outer Void (This is represented by the faced down tile O in the diagram), 1 to form the Inner Gate (This is represented by the faced down tile I in the diagram).

3. Gain the Oinks matched by the elemental insignias of the last remaining tile and discard it, an area such as X can be designated for discarded tiles in the diagram.

All world tiles built are placed faced up with their elemental insignias visible. Tiles A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H surrounding tile I forms the Boundary. To fulfill winning condition 2, the sum of the number of elemental insignias on the Tiles A, B, C; Tiles C,E, H; Tiles F,G, H and Tiles A, D, F are equal.

On each turn

Draw 3 tiles from the stack and the player must perform ONE of each of the following actions in the following order:

1. Gain - Play a tile, gain the Oinks indicated on the elemental insignias and discard it. Put the Oinks gained in the Inner Gate.

2. Build - Build a tile, if it is the first tile, place it adjacent to the Inner Gate, if it is not, it must be placed adjacent to another tile that has been built that bears at least one of its own elemental insignias. If the intended location is adjacent to two or more world tiles, then all adjacent world tiles must bear at least one matching elemental insignia between them.

If you are unable to or do not wish to build for any reason, gain the Oinks indicated on any one of the remaining tiles that has not been played and put them into the Outer Void. You can also replace any tile built with any tile in your hand but all Oinks placed on the built tile will be placed in the Outer Void.

3. Move - Play a tile, you can move Oinks indicated on the elemental insignias of this tile from the Inner Gate to any built tile, or to move any Oink from a built tile to an adjacent built tile. If you are unable to or do not wish to move any of the Oinks indicated for any reason, gain the Oinks instead and put them into the Outer Void.

The player cannot skip any action and each action must be fulfilled in totality. E.g. During a Move action, a tile with 3 Fire Insignias has been chosen but the player has only 1 Fire Oink in the Inner Gate. You may NOT move the existing 1 Fire Oink to any other tile, gain 2 Fire Oinks and then placed them in the Outer Void. 3 Fire Oinks should be gained and placed in the Outer Void.

Scoring

For each Oink placed in a tile that bears the same insignia, gain 1 Victory Point. The player with the most Victory Points wins the final victory if multiple players are competing. Ties are broken by the difference in Oinks between their Outer Void and Inner Gate. The player with the greater difference wins. If the differences are the same, the players shared a joint victory.

Variant

The game can be scaled up with a BOUNDARY with sides featuring more tiles. (E.g 4 or 5). The rest of the rules remain unchanged. In this case, players can choose to leave the space representing the Inner Gate empty instead of a faced down tile I. Players can choose to use other appropriate counters to represent Oinks during play.
mechanics: Map Addition, Matching, Modular Board, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Civilia
description:
In Civilia, players place down overlapping cards to make groups of symbols and expand their civilization. The player that builds the largest group of a symbol becomes World Leader in that sector.

Exploit your superiority by planning and achieving to score points before your opponents take back the advantage! Score final points after the last card is drawn and the player with the most points wins.

PnP Files: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1gQWn47hBR5yltvSrChIL...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z_v35CSWckA
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Matching, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The StarComm Wars
description:
The StarComm Wars is a game of economic warfare simulating the Helion wars of 2312 to 2317. Players take on the roles of merchant companies and of the ill-fated Helion Imperium in an attempt to survive and prosper.

Two introductory scenarios introduce the merchant mechanics and how to play the Imperium. There is then one short and one full campaign scenario. The game is for 2-5 players, with one player representing the Imperium, against 1-4 merchants.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: MapPack – Woodland
description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

name: BattleTech: MapPack – Open Terrain 1
description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

name: BattleTech: The Wars of Reaving – Supplemental
description: The Wars of Reaving Supplemental also includes Random Assignment Tables for the Reaving era and beyond, a short Strana Mechty mini-campaign, and fifty-one record sheets of units used throughout the conflict, including new OmniMechs and ProtoMechs introduced in The Wars of Reaving sourcebook.

name: Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys!: An archeological adventure in the Ancient Egypt
description:
An expedition, composed of subjects of various backgrounds (there are distinguished Egyptologists, valiant officers of Her Majesty, archaeologists in search of notoriety with their daughters, treasures hunters of every ream etc., and their respective carriers), runs through the corridors and rooms of an ancient Egyptian Temple miraculously remained intact in the sands of the desert, in search of treasures and precious finds. But there are those who make good guard. And, above all, the Eternal Sleep of the Queen's Spirit is very heavy, but not entirely bombproof.

Do Not Wake Up Netiqrys! is a three-dimensional tabletop game, which is played with miniatures and on a map containing three-dimensional elements. It is a quite traditional dungeon crawler, so your characters (miniatures) move on rooms and corridors in order to reach the Hall of the Sarcophagus of the Mummy and to collect treasures. What makes the game a bit particular is the random generation of the path and of the enemies every time the characters turn a corner or open a door.

The rules are very simple but immersive, in order to satisfy both old friends of colonial or exotic miniature games and casual players or children. A game can involve a number of players ranging from one to six.

To play DNWN! it is necessary to have about twenty miniatures, normally in 28 or 20mm, including the Mummy, some of her Followers, some "Undead", as well as members of the archaeological expedition and their local carriers. You also need a 12-sided dice, a pair of 6-sided dice, some furniture to be disseminated on the path and a play area of about 90 cm - 36" per side, which will represent the perimeter of the Temple, within which the path will have to wind.

Everything else you will need is present in this issue that, in addition to the rules of the game and two sides of very complete “fast reference” tables (to play you will only need those), provides you with the "Character Cards", containing the characteristics of each of the protagonists, and also with the tiles for the construction of the path (including corridors, rooms, doors and so on) as you see it in the photos, to print, paste and crop. In fact, DNWN! involves the random construction of the path during the game, an element that makes each match deeply different from any other and that allows the game to be particularly enjoyable even in “solo mode”.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Random Production, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Coralon
description:
Coralon is the base trick-taking game for Crab Fragment Labs' Vines deck. The Vines deck has eleven cards in five suits, including Ace (high) and four face cards: Knight, Bishop, Farmer, and Tar. Below these are the ranks 7 through 2. Games with the Vines deck include several trick-taking games for 3 to 6 players, including cutthroat and team games, based on familiar mechanics from games like Hearts, Pitch, and Euchre, with an abundant assortment of clever innovations.

Players bid on the number of tricks they will win, with the highest bidder leading and choosing trump.

If you make your bid, you score the number of tricks won and your opponents score nothing.

If you make over your bid you and your opponents all score the number of tricks won.

If you make under your bid you score nothing and your opponents score the number of tricks won.

Game ends when one player reaches a winning score (dependent on number of players).

name: Iwapelé
description:
Iwapelé is a set collection and pattern recognition game of African masks.

In their turn, players pick and discard a card, and make sets of 3, 4 or 5 cards, of the same community membership and geometric pattern, receiving points for each set.

The game ends at the fifth round or when a player reaches 500 points.

name: PizzaPorazzi!
description:
The New Card Game to Create, Pizzas, Together.

Place 4 Pizza Cards on the Table.
Deal 5 Ingredients Cards to each Player.
Starting from the youngest player,
proceed clockwise.

On your turn, you must place at least one Ingredient close to a Pizza Card which contains it.
When you complete one or more Pizza Cards, just take them.

At the end of your turn, replace a total of 4 Pizza Cards on the Table and 5 Ingredients in your hand.

When all the PizzaCards are completed, who scored the highest number of Points...
Is the Winner!

—description from the publisher

Official PizzaPorazzi! Page with Pics and more descriptions:
http://www.warangel.it/PizzaEng.htm
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Matching, Memory

name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – The Spires Abomination Expansion
description:
Abominations loom several man heights over the head of even the tallest mortal. Their gore slicked limbs spider out from its bulbous, distended abdomen and thorax. They are instruments of pure mayhem on the battlefield, scuttling forwards and reaping a bloody toll with their scythe like appendages, leaving only bloody ruin behind them. Survivors speak of a keening whine, just on the verge of hearing that pervades their memories, a sound that registers deeper than the cries of their fallen comrades. This is the only sound an Abomination can make, the only sound it is allowed to make: a keening howl to convey the depth of their misery and torment.

Abominations were not originally intended to serve as organic war engines. They were an advanced and cruel form of punishment, devised on a whim by the Sovereign. Ensconced deep within an Abomination lies the body of an Exile who has betrayed his trust or breached the most sacrosanct of Spire laws. Despite significant effort, even the Sovereign's most ardent opponents have not been able to come up with a more cruel punishment and have adopted this cruel torture for their worst enemies.

Invasive cerebral procedures impairs the cognitive function of the condemned, as chemical and hormonal treatments are applied to make them lose control of their Life-Binding gifts and forcibly bond them to a lower organism. Multiple organisms were proposed and tried but the humble ant was ultimately preferred. While more gruesome examples could be made, it was found that those Abominations bonded to other species were too intractable or self-destructive. The ant's instinctive hierarchical physiology somehow makes it more susceptible to Pheromonic command, forcing the body to respond to orders while allowing compromised psyche trapped within the hellish amalgam only enough control to wail its anguish even while enacting the will of its tormentors.

name: Envyra: Messe Tile
description:
Offered for Essen Spiel visitors.

CONTENT: 1 Messe Tile

SETUP & RULES:
After the setup, just add Messe Tile into the Drafting Bag (Tiles Supply). Messe Tile is a restricted tile. During the game, the player is eligible to move their cube onto the Messe Tile as soon as they have captured at least one themed tile (blue or orange or green).

—description from designer

name: Panzer Grenadier: The Deluge
description:
World War II began when German tanks rolled across the border of Poland on September 1st, 1939. The Poles fought back courageously, blunting several attacks, but the force of numbers and superior weapons drove them back toward Warsaw. Once the Soviet Union launched its own treacherous attack, the Polish state was doomed.

The Deluge is a Panzer Grenadier expansion book focused on the battles of September 1939 between Poland's defenders and the German and Soviet invaders. There are 40 new scenarios featuring battles of cavalry against cavalry, a couple of tank battles, and best of all World War Two’s only fight between opposing armored trains. Plus of course background articles on the armies and weapons involved.

You’ll need Fire in the Steppe and 1940: The Fall of France to play all of the scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Kaosball: Ringer Pack – The Survivor
description:
The Survivor is deadly and will never stay down, no matter how many times he gets hit!

If The Survivor would be killed or knocked down, you may instead bench him and replace him with a bruiser or runner (the kill doesn't count).

This miniature was an exclusive promo from GenCon 2016.

name: Conspiracy
description:
A hidden message in The Valley Falls Observer leads to the conclusion that all is not what it seems. Is the message simply the result of a typo, a practical joke, or mere coincidence? Or is there a deeper conspiracy working behind the scenes of Valley Falls?

Difficulty Rating – 7.5/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for August 2021.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gli amici del 10
description:
"Gli amici del dieci", friends of ten in English, is an educational card game to learn the calculation of friends of ten, the core of mathematics, while having fun.
How to play?
There are two way:
The classic Memory game, but you must find the couple friend of ten (1 and 9, 2 and 8, etc.), if you find the 10, you can take it; for the final counting every couple count 1, the "ten" count 2.
"La Matta" (10), all the cards are dealt to the players and in turn each one draws a card from the next player. If you find a pair, you discard it. Whoever runs out of cards wins. You must insert only one 10 in the deck for this way.

name: 一瞬の名画、あるいは無意識の目覚め (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening)
description:
一瞬の名画、あるいは無意識の目覚め (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening) is a drawing and deduction game from Japan. Players take on the roles of artists and critics, and create artworks to be assessed by the other players.

The game has a deck of cards with themes and other with interpretations. A player creates a drawing and displays it in a picture frame. The other players critique the work according to the choices on the cards (ABC, 123) and vote with markers on the rondel. Does the artwork represent A1 or C2 and so on. Then the artist reveals the intent they had written down.

Players then advance their meeples on the rondel depending on how well they did compared to the expectation.

The game be played with young children by using simple themes and motifs. The intent is to create a happy interaction between artists.
user summary

name: Buru: Kuda promo
description:
The Kuda promo contains:
- 1 Kuda marker
- 1 fish token
- 1 action card
- 2 rule cards

The Kuda promo is available at the Kickstarter and the German Spieleschmiede crowdfunding pledge.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval

name: Necromunda: Book of the Outcast
description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with a wealth of new rules to add even more variety, scope, and excitement to your battles in the underhive. With this book you can explore the dark expanse of the hive city's badzones, striking out to found settlements and expand your territory in Outlands campaigns, as well as enlisting the aid of brand new Dramatis Personae to join or even lead your Underhive Outcasts gang.

Inside this 136-page book you'll find:

– Outcasts of Necromunda: Extensive background information on outcasts gangs, covering aspects such as the badzones, the scum that comprise an Underhive Outcasts gang, and why such maligned members of the underhive would be inclined to sign up

– Assembling the Outcasts: Includes all the rules you need to know in order to field an outcasts gang in skirmish and narrative games of Necromunda, including gang composition, weapons and wargear, and additional rules for creating your own charismatic Leader with a personality all their own

– Hangers-On and Brutes: Includes rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes, for both skirmish and narratives games

– Outlander Terrain: All the terrain rules needed to establish a stronghold for Necromunda gangs, usable with the included Outlander Campaign or any game of Necromunda, as well as rules for fighting across Underhive Markets, Walls and Gates, Watchtowers, and Gunk Tanks

– Wyrd Powers: Light up the underhive with rules for Wyrd Powers and Force Weapons that canand Telekinesis

– Outlander Campaigns: Embark on a narrative campaign to build and grow a settlement while defending and denying resources from your rivals, and assume the role of an Arbitrator keeping the campaign on an even keel while players work through three real-time phases training recruits, gathering resources, and recovering from the wear and tear of underhive combat

– Outlander Scenarios: Rules for six new outcasts-themed scenarios – Settlement Raid, Market Mayhem, Stealth Attack, Gunk Tank, Mining Expedition and The Big Score – each including rules for playing the battle, rewards gained for victory, experience, reputation, and special rules for these scenarios

– Showcase: A full-colour section spotlighting miniatures, battle scenes, and alternative outcasts colour schemes

– Outcasts Gang Tactics: Eighteen new Gang Tactics for use in games, plus rules and background for Lady Credo, Rebel Lord – a unique Rebel Lord who can be chosen as an Underhive Outcasts Leader at gang creation

– Trading Post: Weapons, armour, and equipment available to Underhive Outcasts gangs, who must rely on whatever they can find and barter for without the backing of the major Houses

– A Weapon Reference Chart containing a comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available on the Trading Post for outcasts gangs

– Dramatis Personae: Includes rules for hiring and using three brand-new Dramatis Personae in your games of Necromunda

This is an expansion to Necromunda – you'll need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook to use the contents of this book.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Fort Sumter: Solo Opponent
description: GMT One’s free Christmas print and play for 2021. With this Solo Opponent, Fort Sumter can be played by a single Player with the game controlling the side not controlled by the Player. Using the same system as Red Flag Over Paris, the Fort Sumter Solo Opponent is a tough challenge for one.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The Defeat of Medusa
description:
The Defeat of Medusa (メドゥーサの敗北) is a deduction game from Japan.

One player is the Medusa, who turns people to stone by her gaze. Another player is the Hero, sent to defeat the medusa. The remaining players are statues, previous victims of the Medusa, who know her weakness. The statues must convey this weakness to the Hero, before Medusa identifies it first.

The Statues know what the Medusa's vulnerability is, and they choose to freeze in poses in order to suggest what it is. The hero must try and work out what this is and declare it before the Medusa does. If so, the Hero and Statues win. But if the Medusa has also worked it out, the Hero and Statues lose.

Medusa's weakness could be a variety of things, and a deck of cards suggests the types of things it could be. For example, it might be 'a certain dish', 'a creature', 'a character', 'a certain occupation', 'a certain color'.

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Obsidian Fury
description:
The sinister warrior Obsidian Fury is unleashed! Bristling with weapons, this titanic mech is able to overpower and brutally destroy almost any Jaeger in the PPDC fleet. Can anything stop this menace?

Contents:
1 Obsidian Fury Jaeger model
1 Obsidian Fury Conn-Podd
6 x Obsidian Fury Action Cards
3 x Obsidian Fury Mutation Cards
1 Rage Counter
1 Kaiju Blue Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: MIAU!
description:
In this game, the participants become cats, and they must take the other cats' objects. Don't forget to yell MEOW! and point to the other cat. Add 5 identical or different pictures and become the fastest cat in the game. For boys and girls from 5 years old.

Game tiles are divided equally among players and stacked upside down in front of them. All players turn over a tile at the same time and look for matching results. A player who spots a match with their tile must be the first to point and say "Miao!" to collect the matching tile.

The first player to get 5 sets, wins.


En este juego los participantes se convierten en gatos, y deben llevarse los objetos de los otros gatos. No te olvides de gritar MIAU! y señalar al otro gato. Sumá 5 dibujos iguales o diferentes y convertite en el gato más veloz del juego. Para chicos y chicas a partir de los 5 años.
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 5
description: Configure your target-interlock circuits and hold the line with technical readouts, conspiracy theories, in-depth equipment and tactics articles, a planetary digest, and a glimpse into the future of the new ilClan era"”all from BattleTech veterans and new authors.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 4
description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine celebrates bravery in all its forms on the triumphant, BattleMech-dominated battlefields of 31st century and beyond! Witness the birth of a new mercenary command in the late Third Succession War, follow a combat medic tackling a precarious injury, learn the true meaning of loyalty during the FedCom Civil War, and track down pirates on a forgotten world in the Periphery. Then don your neurohelmet and push back against the enemy with technical readouts, ghost ship sightings, in-depth technology articles, unit digests, playable scenarios, and more"”all from BattleTech veterans and a squad of new authors.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 3
description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine brings you more BattleMech action from the war-torn 31st century and beyond! Celebrate Star League Day with tales of a long-abandoned 'Mech rediscovered and pressed into service, a quest for vengeance in enemy territory, the resurgence of old ghosts, and the threat of bitter betrayal in the face of long odds. Charge headlong into technical readouts, assassin conspiracies, in-depth equipment articles, playable holiday-themed scenarios, and more—all from BattleTech veterans, fan favorites, and new authors.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 2
description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine returns with more explosive BattleMech action from the 31st century! Experience tales of hard-won survival from the gaming world of Solaris VII, the wilds of the Deep Periphery, and the annals of Clan history. Dive deep into in-depth technology articles, technical readouts, conspiracy theories, war-game and role-playing adventures, and more"”all from veteran BattleTech authors, fan favorites, and our latest enlistees.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Pinnacolando Circus
description:
Welcome to the pleasant world of Pinnacolando Circus, where each player is an acrobat or a jester of the Italian language!
In your turn you have two possibilities: draw a card from the deck; draw any card from the discard pile, and collect all the following cards.
You can use the cards to form words of at least 5 letters to be dropped on the table, or you can lengthen words already composed.
The game ends when a player manages to lay down all his cards in his hand. At this point, each player can calculate his score by adding the values of the words created minus the cards still in his hand: whoever makes the most wins.

name: Convoy: Deadly Waters – Rising Storm
description:
The time is 1939-40. Many of the anti submarine lessons of WW1 have been forgotten. But Hitler has thrown an unprepared world into WW2 and under Admiral Karl Doenitz the U Boat menace has returned to the North Atlantic.

Take command of Allied convoys as they struggle to relearn the lessons and deal with ever more deadly Nazi submarines. But other dangers also lurk. Well armed surface raiders are at sea and aircraft are becoming a growing menace. In the North Sea area the enemy have introduced fast motor torpedo craft. British ASW methods are barely adequate. French ASW is antiquated. But the convoys must get through.

This game can be played solo or with several players and is designed for use with players own warship miniatures or counters.

name: Affluent: The Wealth Management Game
description:
Affluent, the wealth management card game simulates real world’s incidents and events and allow players to invest in financial instruments such as growth funds, income funds, gold and endowment. Plan your wealth accumulation strategy carefully and the player who can achieve most of their financial dreams wins the game!

Each turn a player draws a card from the deck and either plays a card from their hand, sells one of the investments they played in prior turns for more cards, which are the in-game currency, or convert those investments into annuities, which score wealth, and help complete objective cards.

The game ends when a player collects 12 wealth, then players score points for cards in hand, their dreams (end game objectives), investments with accumulated wealth, and their wealth.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Investment, Ownership, Stock Holding

name: Cryptid Forest
description:
In Cryptid Forest, you are a cryptid who is drawn to shiny things. When you see the glowing embers from the campfires, you can't help yourself! As scary & easily distracted, yet misunderstood cryptids, your goal is simple: collect more shiny campfires than your opponent. Teleport with the Yeti, travel farther with the Sasquatch, fly with the Mothman or use the Skunk Ape's terrible stench to relocate campers.

Cryptid Forest is an addictive duel game that utilizes a unique hand management mechanic to allow players their choice of a number of important actions! Collect a large set of cards to travel farther, discard cards to collect the shiny fires and leave footprints to draw attention to your rival cryptid, or discard any 1 cryptid card to perform its special ability, even if it isn't yours!

Each turn, move the Park Security pawn to try to deter your rival cryptid from their goal. If either cryptid gets their picture taken 3 times, they lose!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Meta Card
description:
On the surface, Meta Card couldn't be more simple. Draw your hand, take actions, and discard cards to purchase new ones. Beyond that is a complexity that challenges even experienced players. Carefully plot against your opponents, craft perfect turns, and build a table full of cards to manage and protect your deck.

Meta card diverges from the typical deck building format in 3 main ways:

- There are no victory points, health, money or manna; instead the only purpose of the game is to get as many cards as possible.
- The game is intended to maximize player interaction and competition. You can steal and destroy other players cards, interrupt their plans, and defend your own deck with various upgrades.
- The only theme is more cards! It is grounded in simplicity and based around the actions of the players.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Helios
description:
FORTUNE FAVOURS THE BOLD
A card game for the brave, to be played with friends. The aim of the game is to win by earning coins or stealing them from your opponent. Guess the suit or the god behind the cards to get more powers to use against your opponents. You can change the game by making the right choice at the right time. Place your bets...

—description from the designer

name: My Monsters
description:
Once upon a time, there was ... a monster! Well, many monsters to be exact, in different colours, with spots, scales, fur... Monsters of every kind!

A game of observation and speed for the whole family. Find the monster parts shown on the dice and build the maximum number of monsters.

A very funny game that, in addition to:

stimulates visual perception
practices mental agility
requires players to make logical deductions


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Puzzle
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement

name: Blue Coats: Black Flags
description:
Not just another pirate game, "Blue Coats - Black Flags" is a historical deck-building board game that has 4 unique factions (2 more added in the upcoming "Yankees and Frogs" expansion).

The British faction is based on the historically proud navy of the British empire. Its crews and fighting prowess is unmatched in the game. When the British tasked its navy to get something done in the late 1700s and early 1800s, there was none better than the blue coats of Britain.

The Spanish faction is past its prime, but still has plenty of teeth to compete with the British. However, its main focus is to get treasure ships back to Spain while avoiding pirates and other navies who also have a hunger for gold.

The pirate faction is a disjointed conglomeration of characters like Blackbeard, Jack Rackham, Mary Read, Black Bart Roberts, and others, each trying to capture victory points by looting, pillaging, or capturing prize ships. If they can pull together and establish a Pirate Republic and add a little whimsy, the black flags of the pirate faction may even have enough swagger to take on the navy factions in the game.

The merchant faction produces exports and seeks to get them back to Europe. They establish plantations, produce crops and get them to port, then ship them off for export. Of course, with pirates lurking everywhere and navy captains stopping your ships for inspection, it'll take everything the faction has to produce enough VP for a win.

So, pick your side and customize your deck (or play with the suggested decks) to give yourself the best chance to win.

The game is packed with historically accurate people and ships of the Age of Sail and Age of Piracy. They made history. Can you rewrite it?


Note: 2 more factions have been added in preparation for our Kickstarter event in late summer of 2023. The "Yankees and Frogs" expansion adds the American and French factions to the game for even more historical shenanigans and cooperation.


—description from the designer

name: Time to Mate
description:
A strategic board game about biology of mating and competition. In Time to Mate, players race against each other in a bid to spread their genes around the island. Players must be strategic in building the Reproduction and Survival traits of their male and female Mates to gain the most DNA points through mating and cooperation with other players.

Improve your Mate's traits to become the most attractive lover or the deadliest fighter. Deceive and betray other players, form alliances, survive catastrophic season events, and even inbreed (if you dare...).

Every game is a new adventure with Time to Mate, so there is never a dull moment on this island. New players bring on new tactics, new rounds bring on new seasons and their unpredictability.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Negotiation, Resource to Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Fantasy Commander
description:
Fantasy Commander is a strategic board game with highly detailed resin miniatures at a scale of 1:72 (20mm) by Signum Games. Take part in an epic showdown in the Signum world, where the glorified heroes bring their armies of fantasy creatures to the battlefield and unleash a real war out there.

Although the game is basically designed as a two-player duel game, you can involve even more players in additional game modes, as well as test yourself in a single-player Narrative Campaign, where you can easily master basic game rules.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Memory, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Zone of Control

name: Asteroid Field X
description:
In Asteroid Field X, you play as one of four factions mining an inhospitable asteroid belt. The object of the game is to build and upgrade mining infrastructure to both keep your colony alive and protected and to mine and sell as much precious ore as possible. The faction that accumulates the most Creschins (money) from their sales will win the game. However, there is an “X-factor” in play: buried somewhere in the uncharted regions of this asteroid field is a mysterious alien artifact that emits terrifying forms of energy. It is of great value in this hyper-capitalist world, and of equally great danger. If you unearth it and manage to transport it back to your base dome, you can sell it to the ore transport ships for an enormous profit. But given the difficulty of handling it, someone else might steal it before you can accomplish this!

Asteroid Field X is a limited edition game by Zach Horton. It is based upon a prototype he designed in 1992. It functions as a prequel to Supernova, an origin story about a civilization’s extractavist excesses, when mining colonies supplied the raw materials to fuel a powerful but fragile empire—before Object X caused their home star to become unstable, leading to the desperate conditions of Supernova.

Players build and upgrade mining infrastructure in order to extract base metals (not very valuable, but needed to manufacture equipment), premium metals (the chief export of the mining colony, but also used to manufacture some items), and volatile compounds (substances needed to maintain your colony such as water and minerals). Beyond strategizing between the payoffs of these substances, you need to maintain transportation networks to return your ore safely to your base dome. You may build various other units to be used for sabotage, protection, or direct attacks. Asteroid Field X makes extensive use of hidden movement, and ships can be equipped with cloaking devices to render their locations invisible to other players. Many cargo cards offer special capabilities to players who develop and play them. Some of these are played covertly and revealed anonymously, to often unpredictable results. Combined, these mechanisms allow players to pursue secret campaigns of sabotage, openly hostile actions, and peaceful diplomacy, often all at once!

After all players have taken their turn, each round ends with a “diplomatic phase” in which players simultaneously manufacture new units, deploy covert cards that will be revealed in the next round, and decide how much ore to sell to the waiting merchant ships. The base prices of metal ore fluctuate during the game, as they are tied to a semi-randomized timeline of market cards. The final price that each player receives for their ore, however, is determined by how much total ore is dumped on the market that round by all players. Thus betting and bluffing play a significant role, as players attempt to manipulate the market to favor their own interests. After 12 rounds (each represented by a Market card), the game ends, with the player who has received the most money declared the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Minimap Resolution, Network and Route Building

name: Cocktails & Appetizers dice game
description:
A push your luck dice game of making real Cocktail and Appetizer recipes with cards of real recipes of cocktails and appetizers.

Take 3 random cards, roll the dice to try and roll the "Plate" or "Glass" to start your recipe card then start finding the ingredients you need to finish the recipe card, if you finish a card you can keep the points on the card or you can re-roll the unused dice, but if you don't roll an ingredient you can use you lose all the dice you've collected and no score collected and play passes to the next player.

Play continues until one a player reaches a score of 20.

name: It's Llamatch!
description:
Inspired by the most known dating apps, It's Llamatch! is an agile and easy-going card game where only the boldest llama will be able to find its perfect Llamatch! Because dating... is a game!

Scroll through different profiles, read their bios and have a laugh chatting with them. Don't forget to turn on notifications!
Hopefully you'll draw your favourite llama's attention.

Start by taking a Profile card that indicates what you are looking for in your Llamatch!: Sexiness, romance, awareness or coolness.

Display four llamatch! cards in front of each player, facing down.

Now explore your Llamatch! Each one gives you different values for each stat.
Check if they fit with your preferences.
No? Next!
Yes? Then Slide right and play your cards right:

Use Bio and Chat cards to modify stats, change the rules of the game with each Notification and sabotage other players.

When any player is left with no llamatch! cards in the pile, the game ends.

Get the highest score so you and your date have the best chemistry. Only then we can really say It's Llamatch!
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Duelo, juego de cartas
description:
Duelo, juego de cartas is a fantasy themed card game in which you are going to embody a hero, equip legendary items, manifest powerful auras, casts infernal curses and trigger events that lead you to victory.

In Duelo, juego de cartas you will choose a pre-constructed hero's deck to quickly start playing. On each turn you will have to equip items to your hero to increase the attack or defense; use item abilities; play auras to gain a temporal boost and cast curses onto your opponents to damage them and control their actions; play events to get powerful effects on the board and attack your opponents to death or damage them from distance.

Your goal is to defeat all your opponents by reducing they life points to 0 or by emptying their deck. This game can be played on free for all mode or 2 vs 2.

Duelo, juego de cartas is designed to bring you the Trading Card Game experience within a cheap box.

—description from the designer

name: Lost Luggage
description:
You and up to three friends are airport luggage porters delivering luggage during the golden age of aviation. Each turn you’ll take Luggage off of the ever-changing Carousel and sort it into your three luggage stacks. Then stack and sort your luggage based on its size and destination, and score points for delivering complete sets to each airplane on time! The cards you take from the Carousel will manipulate the value of completed luggage stacks, so choose carefully!
The game ends when there’s no luggage left to take from the Luggage Carousel. The player with the most points wins!

Card Drafting:
Choose one of the first three cards from the front of the Carousel. Any cards in front of the chosen card will move to the back of the Carousel and add a Boarding Call to their destination(s), which can help or hinder you AND your opponents’ scoring opportunities!

Push Your Luck:
Boarding Calls and Lost Luggage increase the scoring value of each Luggage Card for that destination by 1. Do you deliver your luggage now, or hold out for the highest possible score? Choose wisely, for when a destination receives a fourth Boarding Call, its value resets to 0!

Stacking/Sorting:
Sort your Luggage Cards from smallest to largest to form complete stacks. Keep your Luggage moving! Any cards that can’t fit into your stacks may become Lost Luggage!
Set Collection:
Score completed stacks of luggage heading to the same destination. The more Boarding Calls played, the more points your Luggage Cards are worth! Extra Trolleys will give you one more stack to work with, but will cost you points to use.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: The Artemis Project: Chill Communication Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

This is an Expedition for use in the game.

name: Love, Career & Magic
description:
Introducing "Love, Career & Magic"! ✨ A collaborative storytelling game set in a fictional reality TV show.


Mythological creatures + modern-day jobs = reality TV fun!
Race against the clock for high ratings each season.
Blend of D&D and party games for easy, exciting gameplay.
Perfect for newcomers to RPGs.
As family-friendly as you want it to be.
Laughter, zany scenarios, and unforgettable moments await.


Enter a whimsically quirky world where orcs code, gnomes tell jokes, and dragons wield spatulas as culinary masters. Play these extraordinary characters in a delightfully offbeat reality TV show and race against the clock to achieve the season's highest ratings!

A game is played in just twelve minutes over four rounds. "Love, Career & Magic" seamlessly blends the charm of Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) with the zany chaotic energy of party games. No character building or prep required—just dive in and let the enchanting adventure unfold!

Perfect for newcomers, this cooperative game offers family-friendly fun with endless customizable quirkiness. Experience laughter, outlandish TV scenes, and unforgettable moments in this whirlwind of a game.




Examples scenes that can happen in a game

Scenario 1: "The Aisle Next to the Bathroom on the Plane"The Orc Web Designer, Elf Aspiring Firefighter, and Dark Elf Instagram Model stumble upon a misplaced hypnotist's watch, leading to chaotic and zany moments as they unintentionally hypnotize themselves and other passengers on the plane.



Scenario 2: "6AM in a Government Building"The Gnome Comedian, Basilisk Lab Technician, and Leprechaun Bank Teller discover a hidden room filled with magical artifacts in the government building, triggering unpredictable chaos as they accidentally activate a time vortex, causing time to loop and their actions to have wacky consequences.



Scenario 3: "A Comedy Show, But the Comedian is Racist"The Cockatrice Optometrist, Dragon Chef, and Ogre Bouncer combine their magical abilities to turn the racist comedian into a literal clown, creating uproarious chaos on stage and exposing his true colors to the audience.




Learn more at lovecareermagic.com
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Chicken-Fox-Snake
description:
It is a board game between two players on either side of a board.

Each pawn moves 3 squares horizontally and/or vertically, if a pawn ends up on a square with an opposing pawn it can capture it if it meets the following conditions: the chicken eats the snake, the snake eats the fox, the fox eat the chicken.

The first player to capture 4 pawns wins.

name: Quiznight: Männerrunde – RUBBELN, RÄTSELN, RATEN
description:
You are all-quizzing and want to prove your quizzing thirst at the next men's round?

This unique quiz game is guaranteed to make for a unique evening with the guys. The quiz will challenge you and put your knowledge to the test in a variety of categories. Scratch the questions, win the mini-games and get your brain in high gear. Who knows more, who is faster - who will leave the game as the winner? Categories include: Politics, culture, sports, spirits, science, surprise.

Playable as single players or in teams - for 2 to 20 players with creative decoration and recipe ideas, invitation cards and Spotify playlist for an unforgettable evening.

Players win by answering more questions correctly and solving more puzzles than their adversaries!

-description by the publisher

name: Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop – Ice Demon Promo Card
description:
This adds an additional card to Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop. The card is a Monster Kill type card named "Ice Demon." It gives you 2 Prestige points and takes away 2 Prestige from all others.

This card was released with the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter Campaign

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Attachments I
description:
With the death of Robert Baratheon, many have put in claims to be the next rightful person to sit on the Iron Throne. For House Baratheon, two people have made that claim. Both of Robert’s brothers, Stannis and Renly, have each decided it is their turn to rule. This has torn House Baratheon in two as half has thrown in with Stannis while the other half backs Renly. With House Baratheon’s great resources, each still has a chance to be the next to rule from King’s Landing.

The Baratheon Attachments #1 box set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon players a host of new options when they’re building their armies, whether it’s for Stannis or Renly. Some of the Unit Attachments will work for both brothers, while others can only be added to particular forces. Either way, these new options will bolster House Baratheon’s already well-equipped troops, making their armor tougher, their speed faster, or letting them last even longer on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – House Harlaw Reapers
description:
The sigil of House Harlaw is a silver scythe. The House Harlaw Reapers have taken that sigil and turned it into an actual weapon of war. Agricultural scythes make poor combat weapons, but the Reapers have adopted using long-handled axes with equally massive blades. These grisly instruments can mow down men in combat the way a regular scythe can mow down wheat in the field. House Greyjoy is putting them to use, clearing the battlefields of enemies.

The House Harlaw Reapers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a melee-focused unit for their army. The Reapers wade into battle with their scythes, dealing massive amounts of damage as they go. But as they reap, so too do they sew. Sew chaos among the enemy ranks, anyway. Foes do not like standing against these gruesome soldiers. The set also comes with the Warsworn Unit Attachment that will make taking out enemy ranks and units even more rewarding.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Dungeon Makers
description:
A 2 player strategic tile laying game with a light fantasy dungeon map theme.
Build a convoluted and trap filled dungeon, scoring points based on creatures, puzzles, traps, and more. The dungeon maker who builds the best dungeon, by scoring the most points, wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: TMNT HeroClix: Shredders Return
description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles HeroClix is packed with “Turtle Power” featuring fan favorite characters including Leonardo, Donatello, Michelangelo and Raphael, along with their greatest allies and enemies.

The set contains characters from the TMNT IP. The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with prepainted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Szilaj: Kalandok Miraderoban
description:
It's time to explore this magical world with Lucky, Pru, Abigail and more, as they take on the role of the well-known characters and their fearless horses. You'll have to explore an exciting and ever-changing board with your speeding steed, where exciting quests will set your goals. Along the way, you'll gain new experience, learn new skills that will help you control your horse with increasing skill and use increasingly valuable dice.

In the three permanent locations, you can take on quests that will earn you skill cubes as you ride to a specific spot on the board. The one who not only speeds like a wind sprinter, but learns the fastest by mastering the art of riding, will be the winner in the end!

The basic version is for those new to the game, while more experienced riders can quickly move on to the advanced version, where event cards add even more variety and challenges, as well as rewards and knowledge to collect. Learn tricks and jump over the biggest roadblocks and the widest chasms!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Eljött a pillanat, hogy Lucky, Pru, Abigél és több jól ismert szereplő bőrébe bújva, félelmet nem ismerő lovaikkal felfedezhetitek ezt a varázslatos világot. Egy roppant izgalmas és minden játék során változó táblát kell felfedezz száguldó paripáddal, ahol izgalmas küldetések fogják kijelölni céljaidat. Menet közben új tapasztalatokat szerzel, új képességeket tanulsz meg, aminek köszönhetően egyre ügyesebben irányítod majd lovadat, és egyre értékesebb dobókockákat fogsz tudni használni.

A három állandó helyszínen küldetéseket tudsz felvenni, amelyek révén képességkockákat szerzel, ha ellovagolsz értük a tábla meghatározott pontjára. Aki nem csupán szélvészként száguld, de a leggyorsabban tanul, elsajátítva a lovaglás művészetét, az lesz a végén a győztes!

A játékkal még ismerkedőknek szól az alapverzió, míg a rutinosabbak gyorsan belevághatnak a haladó változatba, amelynek során eseménykártyák hoznak még nagyobb változatosságot, és újabb kihívásokat, meg persze begyűjthető jutalmakat és ismereteket. Tanulj trükköket és ugrass át a legnagyobb útakadályok és a legszélesebb szakadékok fölött is!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Race

name: Bridges to Nowhere 2nd Edition
description:
In Bridges to Nowhere, you play as an engineer competing to earn a contract by designing the best bridge. Each round, draft cards to build your bridge and design it according to that round’s requirements to increase your evaluation. At the end of the game, if your bridge has the highest score, you win the contract!

Game Summary
Each round you will 1) draft bridge cards, 2) use these and your column cards to design your bridge, 3) then score points and earn crowns. At the end of the fifth round, you’ll complete your bridge and score it. If playing solo, you must meet the minimum score required by your solo objective card and earn 5 objective stars to win. If playing a duel, the player with the highest score wins the game. It takes about 15-20 minutes to play.

name: Devil's Choice
description:
Devil's Choice is a fast-paced shedding card game which challenges players to be first to play out their hands of number cards in sequences called queues. One queue is open to begin the game, others open randomly and as many as 4 can be open at once.

Players begin the game with 8-10 number cards and a devil card which they can use to create havoc by stealing a card from another player or by blocking an open queue. Any player who doesn't have a number card to play in a sequence during their turn must lay down their cards for all to see and draw at least one card from the bank. That's when the skullduggery and the scheming begins.

Any player who plays a rare red number card into a queue earns a blind draw from a treasure trove of wild cards, devil cards and Q-cards which they can use to open new queues. First out wins and cards held by losing players count against them.

One more thing. In poker a player with a bad hand can fold. In Devil's Choice a player dealt a poor hand is the underdog who can earn double points for winning. With much to gain and little to lose the pesky underdog can take risks and torment fellow players. The game has provisions for partnership play.

—description from the designer

name: Wyścigi
description: Polish game released in the mid 80's. The goal of the game is to lead a team of 4 horses through an obstacle race. Horses for successive places receive points. The player with the most points wins. The game board is built of movable elements according to the plan included in the manual. You can also create your own race tracks.

name: Lots
description:
After being dealt a a hand of 13, the active player turns up 1, 2 or 3 cards from the talon to form an “auction lot”. Players bid using cards from their hand, playing a number of cards equal to the lot, alternating, one card at a time–where a diamond=0, spades=1, hearts=2 and clubs=3. The winner with the largest total sum of suit-pts takes the lot cards into their hand, the loser gets the unknown consolation lot. The cards used for bidding are swept aside as discards. And so on, as hands get gradually shaped and replaced; essentially the cards won replace the card bid. After the stock is gone, players score for the sum of the ranks of the 13 cards in their final hand (Queens, Jokers=0, Ace-10 equal rank, Jack=11, and Kings=15). Players also earn 20 pts for having five or more cards in a suit, giving an alternative path to victory.

—description from the designer

name: Beetle Island
description:
It is 1894. A ship carrying you and other explorer-naturalists has landed on the shores of Coleopterra—a newly discovered island in the Pacific Ocean. Untouched by humans, Coleopterra is home to countless undiscovered species, including a marvelous array of strange and mesmerizing beetles.

You have been sent here in the pursuit of science. Search the island for new species of beetles, then use your powers of observation to classify the beetle specimens into groups. The explorer who draws the most meaningful connections will earn the respect of the scientific community and go down in history for their discoveries!

AIM OF THE GAME

Expedition: Beetle Island is a competitive tile-laying game of matching beetles (tiles) based on their traits. Stay focused, place tiles strategically, and score bonuses for large combinations. To win, earn the most points by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Environmental, Exploration, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Chaining, Hexagon Grid, Race, Tile Placement

name: Last Full Measure: The Maryland Campaign
description:
Lee's 1862 invasion of Maryland from South Mountain and Harper's Ferry to the Battle of Antietam at 300 yards per hex, 100 men per strength point, regiments, artillery batteries, in 944 counters and a 43 x 55 inch map.
The files for Last Full Measure titles are free to download, print, and play.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Invocación Fronteras: Leyendas de la Torre
description:
A group of apprentice summoners enter the old abandoned circular tower in Rotrah... It is said that there they hide secrets that no one should discover, a place where the masters are nothing more than curious children, the brave pure fools, where madness is the mana that is breathed, what will they find? who will come back? who will sing his story?

RPG mode expansion for Invocación Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Sucubo (14 - Air): Refill another player's Spells or Supports with random discard cards. For each one you place, you gain Mana.
Acechador (17 - Fire): Defeat all cards in Summon that have 2 or less Supports.



One player is designated the Keeper for the entire game. The rest of the players must take a player sheet.

The guardian will handle all the Golem's card stacks, he can't swap the place cards but he can choose them.
The players are allies and fight against the Guardian, that is, either the Guardian or a player wins.

The guardian will tell a story using the cards available to him as a point of inspiration. At each stage of preparation the
Guardian tells the story and uses his cards to hinder all players, but they can resolve it with a roll of the dice.

The game ends after 6 rounds, the DM will judge the final result...
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Haste Worte?: Das 2. wortreiche Würfelspiel
description:
Roll the dice, choose a theme, combine motifs and write down words! Whoever finds the most words that no one else has written down wins! With Haste Worte - Das wortreiche Würfelspiel, 8 colorful dice have already joined the Haste Worte family. Starting in 2021, the dice will be supplemented with Haste Worte - Das 2. wortreiche Würfelspiel (You have Words? - The 2nd Wordy Dice Game) and feature new motifs for even more creative and witty rounds of play!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Who Killed Robert Prentice
description:
Through the use of clues the reader and Lieutenant John Milton Schwab of the Florida Police attempt to solve the mystery surrounding the death by poisoning of a wealthy British businessman.

Crime Dossier 2 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – War Zone Nachmund Grand Tournament Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2022
description:
This edition of Chapter Approved is the essential gaming toolbox for all fans of Warhammer 40,000 matched play. Whether you're a tournament regular or simply like to ensure your battles are always fought on an even footing, this is the essential supplement for matched play games of Warhammer 40,000. Inside this 56-page softback book, you'll find:

- Two mission packs, comprising nine missions each for Incursion and Strike Force battles, each designed to offer a different challenge to the players.

- Guidelines for setting up and playing a matched play or Grand Tournament-level competitive game, including suggested battlefield size, time limit and how best to determine secondary objectives.

- 23 secondary objectives. Some are entirely new, while others have been tweaked, or had the amount of victory points they award adjusted.

- And much, much more…

In addition, you'll also find a separate 56-page book – the Munitorum Field Manual 2022 – containing all the latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Wars of Faith
description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within this book, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the Nachmund Gauntlet, which continues to suffer under the assault of Chaos and xenos forces.

This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your campaigning forces can battle across the war-torn world of Vigilus and beyond. With Marneus Calgar seemingly slain by Abaddon the Despoiler, and the planet’s surface overrun by aliens and Heretic Astartes, will your Crusade force emerge as heroes in this time of need or be crushed beneath the boots of their enemies?

This 120-page mission pack includes:

- Six missions each for Combat Patrol-, Incursion-, Strike Force- and Onslaught-sized games, all set within the beleaguered Nachmund Gauntlet
- Wars of Faith mechanics that allow armies to earn Belief Points to purchase additional abilities
- Priests Battle Traits to be used in Wars of Faith, plus Requisitions and Agendas
- The basic rules for Warhammer 40,000 – designed to be quickly referenced during your games

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use on the tabletop during games, and it comes with an elastic closure. You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this mission pack.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Subsistence
description:
Subsistence is a compact resource management game that imagines the world behind the standing stones of Neolithic Britain.

Over nine turns, players select idol cards to gain benefits from. These benefits will be additional cards to add to their tableau, or development tokens to place on their land cards- which may trigger additional benefits. After these nine turns, the game ends. Points are scored based on their idols' unique criteria and the placement of their developments. The player with the highest score wins.

Subsistence plays quickly but offers a growing depth of strategic decision-making. It will appeal to players who enjoy careful planning and progression rather than direct conflict.
categories: Card Game, Farming, Prehistoric, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Income, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Varda
description:
A mysterious and adventurous journey from the bottom of the dark soil to the light of crystal flagons and a wonderful and stunning evolution from some simple flower to a prestigious essence!
The original Iranian board game, Varda, is the winner of the 1st prize of “Land of Beautiful Mind” game designing contest and an exciting strategy game which uses the process of planting flowers and producing “Golab” (The Persian Rose-Water) to make a great challenge and puts the players in the role of farmers and craftsmen who try to plant the best shrubs and flowers in the most fertile soils and upgrade their technology to produce the most aromatic “Golab”s and most precious essences…
But be careful, in the breathtaking industry of “Golab”, there is no trace of flowers’ delicacy!

In Varda, you’re farmers who should cultivate the best Damask Roses in your lands and produce the best Golab (Persian Rose-Water), Strong Golab and Essences.

You should send your workers (meeples) to 4 different areas of the board: Planting Area, Floriculture Area, Extracting Area and Technology Area.
At the beginning, a Year card is revealed. This card determines the capacity of each area for placing meeples, based on the number of players and shows the events of the beginning of the year and the end of the year, based on the rainfall amount.
Each game may be played in several years so be prepared for any upcoming events!

Blue meeples can only be placed in Planting and Floriculture areas and the Green ones can only be placed in Extracting and Technology Areas. Pink meeples are the most valuable meeples; You can place them in any area (even ignoring that area’s capacity) and use them to obtain Event cards so take care of them!

After all players placed their meeples on the board, you should do the actions of the different areas by removing the meeples from the board and placing them in Resting Space.

Expand your farm and obtain the needed resources (Water, Light and Fertilizer) to have the best harvest. The Lands with special powers need more resources but help your achieve the products sooner.

Cultivate Saplings and harvest your lands and produce the best Damask-Rose products. You can develop your technology and gain new facilities, paying its price!

After all actions were resolved, take the meeples from the Resting Area as you wish and depending on your strategy, in clockwise order, starting with the First Player. Your choices would affect the others’ play!

As a beginner, you can play Varda without the Event cards which give you combinatory actions and special abilities and add them to the game only when you got enough experiences!
