The winner is the player who can produce the best and more precious Golab and Essences before the rivals, develop their technology more than the rivals and reach their goals.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types
publishers: Land of Beautiful Mind (سرزمین ذهن زیبا)

name: Dungeonrunner: Forest of Torment
description:
There is a reason people do not venture into these lands. However, tales of an ancient civilization with wondrous artifact compels the boisterous and the foolhardy.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Cathedral of the Celestial
description:
Historians have said that an ancient civilization once lived in this area. Those of religious orders would disagree, adding that these beings are not archaic, but eternal! Do mortals dare enter?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: The Unknown Reaches
description:
Dey'Lithia's ambition has been unveiled to be more than merely returning her people to the upper world. No. She wishes to exact revenge upon the gods themselves!

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cooks & Crooks: Fat Fry 5th Player expansion
description: The 5th player expansion introduces chef Fat Fry, bringing his talents to the most chaotic kitchen.

name: Race to Stupid
description:
"The party trivia game where you can outsmart the smartie pants with the stupidest answers and win the game."

The judge reads a question from a card, and all other players write down two answers - their best guess at the "real answer" and then their funniest "stupid answer".

A correct real answer gets 1 point, but the funniest "stupid answer" (as decided by the judge) gets 2 points.

Play in rounds, so everyone has the same number of turns to be the judge. Tally up points at the end of the game.

name: Absolutely Stonkers!
description:
Absolutely Stonkers! is an easy to learn strategic card game that was born out of the 2021 meme stock mania which took the world by storm. The game is fast-paced, funny, and has two ways to win.

Players draw and discard cards to collect stocks and stopother players from colleecting them. Be the first to collect a Stonk (stock) card from each of the seven industries or the last one standing after all the other players have been indicted by the SEC to win. There are plenty of ways to sabotage other players and evade the SEC while on the way to become a Stonk Titan.

name: DetoNations
description:
Manufactured in the USA!

Countries race to be the first in the world to successfully test a nuke to prove their superiority. Players take on the roles of various weird countries in a fictitious world, sifting through junk piles to find parts to build their own nuclear missiles.

On each player's turn, the active player draws Junk cards according to the number their country allows, then checks to see if they have a set of cards according to their country's Set number (could be 2 or 3). If they have enough, they trade those cards in for a piece of their Nuke and bring that new piece into play immediately (even if the new piece is worse than their current piece).

Once a country has all 6 parts for their own Nuke, they test it. To test it, there is a die associated with each piece of the Nuke, starting at a 4-sided die, then a 6-, 8-, 10-, 12-, and finally a 20-sided die. Failure means the failing part is destroyed and the country must save up enough junk to replace it. If all parts test successfully, then STOP THE PRESSES, that country wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Stephens
description:
After the big earthquake of 1755 that tore down Lisbon and most of the south coast, it was necessary to rebuild an entire nation. The demand for window glass increased so much that William Stephens, a British businessman saw the opportunity to expand his business in Portugal by investing in the glass industry.

In Stephens, players compete amongst themselves in the role of master glassmakers working at the famous "Stephens" Factory trying to become the most prestigious figure in town, after Stephens of course. Through clever and cunning planning all players will develop their works, invest in new businesses and promote the creation of jobs. Through a unique action selection mechanism, on their turn players will choose from a variety of options, either by activating the Stephens factory or by activating one of their personal investments.

The game ends when the Napoleonic forces arrive in town and the player with the most prestige wins the game.

name: Biomes
description:
Biomes is a board game where you will expand your lands and develop buildings to gain the most points by the end of the game.

The game

A game for 1-4 players, draft from the available tiles to lay and connect new biomes. Once you have created an area that can be developed, build buildings to gain resources, and gain points.

name: デキタ! (DEKITA!)
description:
デキタ! (DEKITA!) is a tile game from Japan. The theme is apprentice wizards learning how to form spells. But the gameplay is more abstract and somewhat language free.

The 'spells' are formed by placing tiles to construct shapes. Each tiles has four triangles, which match to neighbouring tiles to make squares. The triangles are coloured red, green and blue, or rainbow as jokers. Coloured sides must match up.

The spells are shown on theme cards, and have simple patterns of squares, such as an L shape, or a V shape. When a player has built a pattern of squares that match the shape and colour of a them card they hold, they can reveal the card as a competed spell. The first player to get to three completed spells wins the game.

A player can swap theme cards in hand for a public pool, or draw from the deck.

Players also have item cards, which allow the tiles to be changed. So a quill lets a player rotate a tile. A pocket lens lets a play change a square's colour. By careful use or tiles and items, a player can complete their spells faster.

The game was originally published in 2017, and a second edition was published in 2018 with revised card design.
user summary
mechanics: Contracts, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: HEATED: The Spiciest Card Game
description:
Rules are simple: Play your cards to match the color or card type to clear your hand first! With a plethora of SPECIAL CARDS to choose from, the round can change quickly!

And the great news is, it's Colorblind Friendly!

Don't have a card to play? Ask your friends to offer you a facedown card. They could be telling the truth and creating an alliance, or they could be deceiving you and creating an enemy!

HEATED is a commercial upgrade of Crazy Eights, a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Down the Rabbit Hole
description:
When a string of deaths strikes the Abernathy Retirement Community, your grandfather, Edgar Mirkowsky, contacts you to help him investigate. Edgar has always dazzled the family with fanciful stories of his past as a private detective, so you can't help but wonder if this is just another wild tale fueled by his investigative fantasies. When you arrive at the retirement facility, you suddenly feel as if you've crossed into another world. Nothing seems to make sense, and the residents all feel like characters that stepped out of a book. You wonder if you have arrived at a retirement community or tumbled Down the Rabbit Hole.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Malador the Mystic
description: Malador is an ancient sorcerer from the sunken realm of Atlantis. Once a noble protector of humanity and a scholar of mystical lore, Malador has become mad with power-lust. He wants nothing more than to wield ultimate power and be acknowledged as the supreme master of the mystic arts!

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack
description:
There are no warriors in the galaxy more storied for their prowess and ruthlessness than the Mandalorians, and their kind have seen battlefields in countless conflicts from the Clone Wars to the Galactic Civil War. Mandalorians have fought alongside nearly every faction in these struggles, whether pursuing their own agendas such as the fanatical Deathwatch or unifying with causes like the Rebel Alliance.

The Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack includes new ship and upgrade cards for Star Wars: X- Wing, allowing players to pilot their existing ships with new characters seen in The Mandalorian, Star Wars: The Clone Wars and Star Wars: Rebels. In addition to new pilots and upgrade cards useable by five factions; new tokens and obstacles are also included. Finally, the reinforcements pack also contains dials and ship tokens to convert the Fang Fighter over to the Rebel Alliance!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: iGranie z Gruzem: Nędzność i Biedność
description:
Just when you think that life can't get any worse, it always surprises you with something terrible. The same with iGaming with Rubble! You thought it couldn't get any worse? Yes, it can!

Nędzność i Biedność ("Misery and Poverty") is an unbelievable addition to the game. 55 new cards will make your character's life even more miserable, every trip to work an ordeal, and breathing a sigh of relief at the thought of chilling - a challenge to fate.

description from the publisher (translated)

Kiedy myślisz, że w życiu nie może spotkać Cię już nic gorszego, ono zawsze zaskakuje czymś okropnym. Podobnie w iGraniu z Gruzem! Wydawało Wam się, że gorzej już być nie może? Może!

iGranie z Gruzem: Nędzność i Biedność to niesamodzielny dodatek do gry. 55 nowych kart sprawi, że życie postaci będzie jeszcze większą męczarnią, każde wyjście do pracy stanie się drogą przez mękę, a odetchnięcie z ulgą na myśl o chilloucie - rzuceniem wyzwania losowi.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Edgeguard
description:
By our calendar, the third day of the month of storms was when our world changed forever. Each of the leaders of the five great nations were assassinated by an unknown force, leaving the councils and elders fumbling to reply to this unknown threat. Many laid blame at the feet of ancestral hatreds. The Dwarves blamed the Goblins. The Orcs blamed the Elves. The Humans blamed the Orcs. and the Goblins blamed everyone, as befits their fear and paranoia. What the secretive Elves believe is a thing of mystery...though perhaps you will be the one to uncover the truth?

The Edgeguard is to be a force of elite warriors, rangers, clerics, mages, and rogues—the best of the best. Each nation will contribute forces with a mandate to seek out our mysterious new enemy and report back to their leaders. From these humble beginnings, five heroes will arise, one from each nation, to become our champions⁠—the defenders of Ebonmoor.

Edgeguard is a story-driven tabletop miniatures game for 1-4 players drawing mechanical inspiration from classic experiences across both table and screen—featuring highly detailed miniatures, immersive mechanics, and beautiful artwork.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ)
description:
セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ) is a two player card game from Japan. Players are duelling but with only three cards. The goal is to get gem cards, but not to go bust.

Players take on the role of two magicians fighting to get the gems. In the deck, there are seven magicians to choose from, and 28 skills (from 14 cards). Each player gets a magician card and two skill cards, using this combo to try to win gems valued 0-3 (from 30 gem cards). But if they make a total over 7, they go bust.

The designer styles it as a fast game like blackjack with a lot of replay from 100s of possible combos to try.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Margherita
description:
Margherita is the first game in the Pizza Games collection.

In Margherita, players are trying to win cards.

Each turn, one player flip a card like a coin and, depending of the side it lands on, all the players must do a specific action (slapping the box in the center of the table or not slapping the box in the center of the table). Of course, the player who chooses the good action to do will win cards.

This is a fast pace game where the cards can accumulate on the table and where every action is decisive.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: GolfPro Card Game
description:
GolfPro Card Game gives players the 18-hole experience while allowing families and friends to spend time together, chatting, laughing, and having fun playing golf around the table.

Wisely choose the best club cards to get on the green, avoid actions that will land you penalties, and then putt out in the least strokes possible! Scores just like golf.

Like the real course, GolfPro is a game of strategy and luck. But now you can play anywhere, anytime. When was the last time you played golf at home?

You can choose from Drivers, Woods, Long Irons, Short Irons, Wedges, or Chips. Your goal is to get on the green in the fewest strokes, then once you’re on the green, draw a putter card and lay it face down on your cards… Don’t look until everyone is on the green!

Like on the course, you’re not always going to have a great shot. There are several hazards that can appear on the club card faces:

Out of Bounds, In the Trees, In the Water, Topped it, Chunked It, and In the Bunker… if you pull one you must follow what it says!

Included are Hole-in One cards, Holed It Wedges, and several Chip-In cards.

name: Secret Identity: Promo Pack
description:
5 more identity cards to add to the game. The pack also contains 5 blank cards to create your own identity cards.

Just mix the cards with the other identity cards during set up.

Promo found in Plato Magazine 143 from March 2022.

name: Speed-E-Scoops!
description:
Welcome to Speed-E-Scoops—the mom ‘n’ pop ice cream shop with international flair!

It's the height of summer, and the Speed-E-Scoops is a busy place, with many customers waiting in line to sample your scoops. You and your coworkers compete to see who can churn out the tallest cones and satisfy customers with the right flavor combos. When the shift is over, who will go home with the most tips?

In this ice-cream stacking word game, players draft ice cream scoops (letters) and compete to stack them into cones (words) while managing their workspace, a line of customers, and special requests. Earn points based on the length of each word, plus bonus points for taking care of customer needs. To win, end the game with the most points.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge 2022 contest entry
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Spelling

name: Amerique 1500
description:
We are in 1500, at a time when Europeans had not yet settled in America. A great fair is in preparation among all peoples.

In Amerique 1500, players compete to be the first to complete 3 tasks. On their turn, the player begins by rolling the nature die which will give an advantage to all players or only to the active player. Then, he will have to choose an action among these four: explore his territory (draw cards), barter (exchange resources), manufacture items (engine building) or play cards (to collect resources).

Versions
There are two ways to play Amerique 1500: the QUICK game and the FULL game. For a first game, it is recommended to play the fast version if children 10 and under play it.

name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 04
description:
BLASTER: Vol. 4 includes two exclusive standalone games, and three expansions.

Last Days: Legends
Official Expansion for Last Days
Rules for including The Luchador, The Mechanic, and the Waitress in your games of Last Days. These rules are compatible with the modern game setting and both the core Rulebook and Seasons Supplements. Keep an eye out for new miniatures available via Temple of the West.

BRUTL! Tank Arena
Standalone Game
BRUTL! Tank Arena is a beer and pretzels style game of insanely fun tank battles. Your humble author wanted a ruleset to use all those cool tanks he had lying around, but something simple and required minimal effort. With only a bit of terrain and a single tank per player, BRUTL! Is both easy to start and plays quick, getting to the best parts of miniature wargaming, blowing up your opponent.

Sludge Nations
Expansion for Sludge War, core rules available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
The world of sludge is vast and each player’s interpretation of the setting is a valid iteration in the decaying multiverse. The Nation Factions described here will represent both existing nations and archetypes found across the dying world. For what it’s worth, these factions are primarily focused on the western branchways inhabited by mankind and don’t represent the full breadth of the sludge world.

Gaslands: Legacy (Part II)
Official Campaign Expansion for Gaslands: Refuelled, part I available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
Earth gets an eviction notice from Mars, and becomes dismantled and reassembled into a progressively more chaotic post-post-apocalyptic world. Randomly generate an illegal build and get out of the factory fast before you become dismantled yourself. Unique LEGACY Gaslands rules, and the remaining narrative scenarios. (The first five scenarios in the story are b in Vol. 3, but you don't need them to play these four, as the Legacy Rules are recapped in Vol.4.)

Deathship One
Solo/Co-op Standalone Game
Deathship One is a solo or co-operative miniatures game in which the player controls a small squad of warriors attempting to fight their way through an alien death trap. It’s designed to be fast and fun and to use a minimum of miniatures and terrain. It’s also designed to be limited. The whole game consists of 5 scenarios or ‘rooms’. The order of those rooms can change from game-to-game, but you always play all five, assuming you live that long

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Ciemna Strona Mydła
description:
The game consists in arranging five-word sentences from word cards divided into 5 levels of "sharpness". The players randomly choose one of them and try to dominate the sentence with words with their level. To make it not too easy, word cards have effects that significantly affect the gameplay and allow you to plan your strategies.

Classic variant: 170 cards + instruction.

Deluxe variant: 170 cards + 50 cards from the Pierwsze Namydlenie expansion + instructions.

Every player on their turn add one card to form a sentence and selects a new card on hand. The cards are arranged in the following order: adjective, noun, verb, noun, adverb. On the first card, more are placed, changing the sentence. The meaning of the sentence does not matter, what counts is the markings (numbers) on the cards. The resulting sentences are fun, but just an extra dose. Some cards also have additional functions that make the game easier for their owner or make it difficult for opponents. When someone dominates the sentence with his sign, he wins and the game is over.

name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Millennials
description:
Were you born between the 80s and 90s? Did you grow up to Britney's hits and playing Minesweeper on Windows XP?

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about pop culture, technology from another era, movies, music and much more. Disconnect dial up internet and let's play!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Amacao
description:
A simple eurogame were you venture the seas to buy goods and try to make the biggest profit out of them.
It is based on the historic Portuguese sea routs on the far east, and the adventures the merchant of that time lived.
It has a great supply and demand mechanic, were the player can interact with the board state and there for with each other.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Market, Roll / Spin and Move

name: I'm Right You're Wrong: Shots Fired
description: This is the expansion for the hilariously, combative, I'm Right You're Wrong, a game about arguments. Interrupt the argument with hilarious drinking rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Fatal Knockout
description:
A 2 player card-based fighting game. The aim of the game is to be the last fighter standing in this competitive, tightly-designed fighting game.

Fatal Knockout aims to embody digital fighting games like Smash Bros, Street Fighter and more, and the card play reflects move sets which you would see in the genre. Fatal Knockout comes with six fighters with completely unique decks. Player's play cards which allow them to move, change orientation, and attack on the board. On top of that, each fighter has one-of-a-kind abilities that are triggered by playing cards.

On a player's turn, they draw to their hand up to three cards. The leader of the round places one card face down, the second player follows. At this point the leader can choose to play another card, or reveal. This continues until either the leader reveals all cards or players run out of cards.

Throughout the game, players will be dealing damage to each other with fighter specific cards. The game ends when there is only one fighter left standing, the player left standing is the winner.

Fatal Knockout can be played with just two players, but can also be played in a tournament style where players advance through brackets with the aim of being crowned the winner!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Valls 1809: Batalla del Puente de Goi
description:
Valls 1809 is a Napoleonic wargame from the Spanish War of Independence. A battle in which Saint Cyr, commanding the French army, wants to finish off the Spanish army under Reding before sunset. Time is key for the French side while the ally must defend itself until night falls.

A simple block wargame for two players with a solitaire option.

With 5 minutes of explanation, it allows a dynamic game with several decisions that can be key to victory in approximately 15 - 20 minutes. It can be played with the basic module, but by adding the tactical cards, they give greater historical flavor and variety in the decisions of the players. Playing with events (optional) allow replayability in different hypothetical scenarios.

Will the Spanish army hold out until nightfall or will the potential of the French army be unrivaled?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Master of Wills: Waterborne Fringe War Neutral Pack
description:
A group of nomadic sea travellers were forced to inhabit two islands in the cold and distant northern hemisphere centuries ago. These rugged people somehow survived the tidal apocalypse when a comet damaged the planet’s moon however, dust-like particles from the comet penetrated the atmosphere effecting only their small area of the world.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: エリートイケメンマッチョ (Elite Handsome Macho)
description:
Each player starts with one of each of the following cards: 1/ Elite, 2/ Handsome, and 3/ Macho.

The dealer cites an issue they may have, such as "I need someone to watch my house while I am away." Each player privately selects which of their 3 characters would best address the issue. All players' cards are then revealed at the same time.

Players whose cards are in the minority can explain why their choice was actually the best. (If there aren't too many players, then players with the second minority may also defend.) The character selection and reveal is repeated.

The dealer then assigns scoring chips to the answers they like, and the player with the most chips wins!

name: Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land
description:
Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land is a narrative mystery game inspired by the game Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

This case centers around the unveiling of a new rollercoaster in La-La Land that goes tragically wrong when mayoral candidate Bradley Rideout flies right out of his seat and into Pirate Poppy’s Popcorn Stand. Is this a tragic fairground mishap or carefully planned foul play? It is up to you to figure out who is behind it is all - before you yourself become La-La Land’s next high-flying victim.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Battle of Dunstop Castle
description:
Dunstop Castle is of course that fortress at the northwest portion of your Dragon Pass map in the Lunar Empire next to Jaldon's Wrong River at the end of the road from Goldedge. In a major offensive by the Sartar, Dunstop had to be taken within three days. Did they succeed? We're not sure, the history is vague on this point. What we have done is set up the situation as it was for you to find out what may have happened. You can play it out and decide for yourself whether the Sartar succeeded in taking Dunstop before finally being driven out by the superior army from Furthest.

--publisher description

A small-format two mapsheet game of fantasy combat in, around, and under Castle Dunstop. The game is 22 turns long, which includes daytime and nighttime turns. The winner is the player whose forces occupy the inner tower of the castle at the end of the game.

Set in the Glorantha realm and inspired by the rules of White Bear & Red Moon. Published in the Wyrm's Footnotes newsletter, issue #3.

--user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Băo Huáng
description:
This Chinese climbing game for five players is said to have originated in Shandong province, and in the early 21st century it has become popular across a wide area of northern China and online. Băo huáng (保皇) means 'protect the emperor', and the game is also often known as dìwáng (帝王) meaning 'emperor'. In each deal two players, the emperor and his protector the eunuch (xiao baozi: 小孢子), play against a team of three, the farmers or people (ping min: 平民). The emperor and the eunuch are the holders of particular cards. While the emperor is known from the start, his protector remains hidden until the card is played.

As in all climbing games the object is to get rid of one's cards (and help one's partners to do so) by playing them singly or in combinations, where each play must beat the previous play.

There are five players and a pack of 168 cards is used. This can be constructed from four standard 52-card packs from which the 3's, 4's and 5's are removed plus four red jokers and four black jokers. Suits are irrelevant in this game, and the cards rank from high to low:

Red joker, Black joker, 2, A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6.

One red joker and one black joker are marked on the front, and the holders of these two cards will be the emperor and the eunuch respectively. Although standard Anglo-American cards can be used, the game is sufficiently popular that special 168-card packs can be obtained for this game with the emperor and eunuch cards ready printed.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game

name: Succeed or Die! The Battles of Rafah and El Arish
description:
"If we are to win the war, we must win the first battle. The battle must be fought with no retreats, every objective must be taken—no matter the cost in casualties. We must succeed or die.” –General Israel Tal’s admonition to his officers before crossing the boundary into the Sinai.

Succeed or Die is a low complexity Operational level wargame simulation of the battles of Rafah and El Arish, fought in the Sinai between the Egyptian Palestinian forces and elements of General Israel Tal’s and Avraham Yoffi’s armored Ugdahs (divisions) during the Six Day War. General Tal’s Ugdah was tasked with attacking the dug in Palestinian 7th Infantry Division in and around Rafah to secure the crucial road intersection near the Sinai/Israel border. Once secured, General Yoffi’s Ugdah would become the breakthrough force that would then drive deep into the Sinai to either take the Mitla Pass if General Sharon’s Ugdah was unable to defeat the Egyptians at Abu Ageila, or El Arish. General Tal would support General Yoffi by preventing any enemy attacks out of Gaza as well as taking El Arish if General Yoffi’s goal became the Mitla Pass. The Egyptian’s had powerful forces in the area, including their 4th Armored Division and a combined arms formation that combined outnumbered the attacking Israeli formations. The Israeli’s enjoyed total air supremacy, but numbers were against them, and it would take all of the skill, daring and luck they could muster if the Israeli’s were to succeed.

Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield. Both will be challenged to do as well, or better than their historical counterparts.

Each hex is about a quarter of a mile across. A turn represents four hours of time. Each unit is either a battalion (II) or company (I).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Scaffold
description:
Scaffold is a drawless connection game played on the intersections of a square grid using stones (as in Go). Black is trying to connect N-S edges of the board, White E-W with an orthogonally connected group.



DefinitionsGroup: Either a single stone (a group of one) or any number of stones of the same color connected through a continuous series of orthogonal adjacencies.



PlayFirst player places a single black stone on any grid intersection, after which the second player decides which color they will play (pie rule). Players then alternate taking turns.

On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point. Then, if possible, place a stone of your color on an empty point that is orthogonally adjacent to two groups of your color, and keep making such placements until no more are possible.



AcknowledgmentsEvery one of the regular posters on the BGG Abstract Game forum could rightfully consider themselves a co-author of this game if they wished. I'm like a kid who built something (hopefully cool!) out of LEGO -- but they made the bricks. Thank you all for your generosity and brilliance.

Luis Bolaños Mures helped clarify the presentation of the rules - Thanks.

This game shares some similarities with Quadrex by Bill Taylor, although it was arrived at independently.



Online PlayScaffold is one of the many games that can be played for free at mindsports.nl. You can find it in the ArenA here:

https://mindsports.nl/index.php/arena/scaffold/

I'd like to express my gratitude to Christian Freeling and Ed van Zon for making this possible.

You can now also play Scaffold at Abstract Play thanks to BGG users Striton and ypaul. You can find it here:

https://play.abstractplay.com/



Creative Commons LicenseScaffold by Andrew Lannan is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

Please let me know if you do anything fun with Scaffold!

—description from the designer

name: Solar Expansion
description:
Stardate 1800, five years after the first permanent human settlement on Mars. Regular trade routes are established between the inner planets, and the spaceports grow into major cities. Helium-3 mined from the ice giants becomes our most valuable resource, as fusion reactors become the radiant heart of the asteroid-cities far from the warming rays of our sun. Meanwhile, a shadow economy is growing stronger. Space pirates patrol the inky void, employing new versions of classic tactics.

Solar Expansion is a space-themed 18xx game with simple navigation and complex corruption.

Three tiers of operating company (private minors, pirates, and full-cap public) provide creative embezzling opportunities and increase player interactivity. Pirates run protection rackets to benefit themselves (and occasionally the businesses they protect), while the minor companies are pocket-to-pocket cash delivery missiles.

This game borrows the East Asia Expansion engine, removes all the safeties, and takes off like a rocket!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Maize Craze
description:
In Maize Craze, players will simultaneously roll and place dice on their player boards attempting to match various maze paths shown on a card in the center of the table.

The game is played over the course of six rounds.

You earn points based on correctly placed dice and receive a bonus for being the first to exit the maze.

The player with the highest score is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time

name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Heroes' Inn
description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters allows you to diversify the enemies encountered during the journey of the group of adventurers, to make the acquaintance of the great elemental masters but also to grant your heroes well-deserved rests at crucial stages of their journey!
This expansion, in addition to its 2 new heroes, brings many welcome advantages to the adventurers, but be careful not to overdo it or you'll get bad karma.

name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Dead
description:
The third cycle of the "Monsters" series features the cinematic 'slashers' of 1981-1990. All monsters and tactical cards (neutralizers) have unique powers from the other cycles. This third set adds a neutral area called the Dead Zone, which represents a parallel dimension, dream realm, or comatose hallucination. The Dreamstalker can trigger a card in the dead zone, the chainsaw-wielding Butcher or the machete-wielding Slasher can send monsters there, and Reanimation Serum can bring back a monster.

Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Then, tactical cards (neutralizers) destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck. At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

At the end the game have the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting

name: The Irregular Miniatures Ancient Rule Box
description:
Thank you for buying this set of rules. Their aim is to produce an enjoyably fast yet realistic game from the Biblical period to Medievals.

The rules are designed for use with the Irregular Miniatures 6mm strips or blocks, but having said that, they can be used with any scale of figures with the relevant changes to ranges and groundscale. Using the Irregular Miniatures 2mm Ancient bases and halving the firing and movement distances, being an ideal case in point. The 2mm range is comprised of a full selection of all the necessary Elephants, Chariots, Cavalry and Infantry.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Small Time Crooks
description:
Small Time Crooks is a 15 minute RPG Card game that blends narrative mechanics and strategy into a short and sweet heist experience.

Small Time Crooks works in three stages:

In the 'Case the Job' phase, you'll gain intel on the target, letting you plan the best route. Then, during the heist stage, you'll break in, overcoming obstacles and reaching the score. Finally, in the escape stage, you'll race to one of the exits before the guards are alerted.

Small Time Crooks is a cooperative, GM-less game that uses targets, or pre-built locations with scores, to steal. The base game comes bundled with 10+ targets to rob, and players can also build their own.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ironborn Bowmen
description:
House Greyjoy’s influence spreads like the tentacles of the kraken that adorns their banners. While most of their ranks consist of hit-and-run melee units, they know that a force lacking in ranged support is like a fish on a hook. As such, they recruit from their own Ironborn Reavers, teaching them the art of archery and turning them into the Ironborn Bowmen. These archers are equipped with moderate armor, and their previous melee training means they’re not helpless if enemies close in on their position.

The Ironborn Bowmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a ranged unit to support their other troops. They excel in dealing with enemies from the flanks, peppering them with arrows. As they lay waste to enemies, it’s their allies that benefit in more ways than one, able to pick up the spoils left behind from defeated foes.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
‣ 12 Bowmen
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray (140x120mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Steel Rift
description:
In the near future, in the wake of crippling solar flares, the remnants of humanity fight for resources, order, and sometimes glory.

Steel Rift is a fast paced skirmish game featuring highly configurable mechs called HE-Vs. Played on a 3’ x 3’ table, it’s easy to set up almost anywhere.

Customize your HE-V loadouts and hit the enemy hard in a fast-paced game of mechanized combat.

Written and developed by the writer of Last Days and Gamma Wolves, Ash Barker puts his passion for both apocalyptic and mech combat games on full display. With expansion to add more HE-V mechs, Campaign Modes, Faction-Building rules, and a variety of new Unit Types already in the works, you’ll have even more Steel Rift models, lore and rules to look forward to.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Petrify
description:
Petrify is a finite territory game for two players: Blue and Orange. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square grid (board). The recommended board sizes are between 6x6 and 10x10 squares.

Both players must have access to a sufficient number of disks of their own color and a sufficient number of neutral blocks.



DefinitionsA group is a disk along with all other like-colored disks one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent disks of its color.

Similarly, a patch is a square not occupied by a block along with all other such squares one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent squares not occupied by blocks. Note a patch may contain any number of groups, as well as empty squares.

The size of a group or patch is the number of squares it spans.

A mound is a set of four blocks occupying a 2x2 area of the board.

A barricade is a set of three adjoining blocks in a straight diagonal line.

Mounds and barricades are illegal formations. For the purpose of spotting them, the edges of the board count as lines of blocks. In other words, the real board is considered to be the middle section of an imaginary board with sides two squares longer, and all edge squares on this larger board are considered to be occupied by blocks.



PlayBlue plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if possible, make exactly one of these board plays:


Place a disk of your color on an empty square.



Move a disk of your color any number of squares in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line, without jumping over any blocks or enemy disks, to a square occupied by an enemy disk. Then, remove this enemy disk and place a block on the square from which you just moved your disk, without forming a mound or a barricade. Note a disk can jump over friendly disks.


If you have no board plays available on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. Then, for each patch on the board, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from it until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over in a patch owns the patch. Empty patches are owned by neither player.

The player with the higher score in the resulting position wins. Your score is the sum of the sizes of the patches that you own. If there is a tie, whoever made the last board play loses.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means Orange will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Blue instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Emergence Event: Captain Xeron and Xoron
description:
Xeron the Planet Smasher and Xoron the Galaxy Conqueror

These two each bring 1 special ability to their ship:

Xeron grants +1 to any stat for control markers they have in their current Galaxy tile.
Xoron grants +1 to all stats if they completely control each Location in a Galaxy tile.


These two abilities stack.

However, at the start of the game they only have a two in each crew stat. This is by far the weakest start of any captain, but they have the unique ability to shift their stat bonuses to whatever stat they need for the current situation. As the game progresses and they control and conquer more of the galaxy, their power grows and if left unchecked can quickly eclipse everyone else.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Puns of Anarchy: Expansion Pack
description:
Ready to take your punning to the next level? This Puns of Anarchy Expansion Pack is the perfect addition to the base game, adding new ridiculous categories and loads of fresh Punnable cards. Make puns on nursery rhymes, cereal brands, and more!

This pack fits seamlessly with the original Puns of Anarchy game, and will add hours of wildly creative, laugh-out-loud punning.

name: 人狼ドッチ (Werewolf Which)
description:
In 人狼ドッチ(lit. Werewolf Which, phonetically Jin-roh Docchi), a kind of a One Night Werewolf game, each player picks one of the two role cards for their hidden role for the game, and place the other face down on the table. This makes each player knows a role that should NOT in the town, in addition to their role, making deduction and bluffing more interesting.

As in One Night Werewolf, during the two discussion phases in a game, Civilians (non-Werewolf players) try to deduce who the Werewolves are, and Werewolf players try to hide/bluff their identity. There are special actions done before/between the discussion phases depending on the role, ranging from Seer or Cop to see the cards, or even DJ to exchange a player's role card to their unused card.

Then one and the only voting in the game is held to decide whom to expel from the town. Civilians win when a Werewolf gets most of the votes, otherwise Werewolves win.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team – Card Pack
description:
Don't miss a beat on the pitch! This deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your Norse team, as well as positions and Star Players. It also includes Special Play cards exclusively for use with Norse teams.

CONTENTS
6x Player Reference cards for the Ulfwerener, Berserker, Valkyrie, Beer Boar, Norse Raider Lineman, and Yhetee
3x Star Player cards for Ivar Eriksson, Skrog Snowpelt, and Thorsson Stoutmead
8x Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
8x Heroic Feats Special Play cards
18x Blank Positional Cards, to fill in for each player on your team: 9x Norse Raider Lineman, 2x Ulfwerener, 2x Berserker, 2x Valkyrie, 2x Beer Boar, and x1 Yhetee
One all-important card that explains how to use all of the above cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules and Spike! Journal Issue 14 to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Beautiful Game:  A Turn-Based Strategy Boardgame
description:
Step into the shoes of great football coaches and show off your managerial skills. You will be in charge of every move your team players make, whether an audacious attack or resolute defense. Test out different formations, based on those of famous football clubs, and find out which one best matches your play style. In 'The Beautiful Game', players will take turns positioning their players formations, as they tackle, pass, shoot and score, in order to break down the opposing player's defence.

Your turn (as the one with the football) consists of as many 'singular moves' as possible, plus one 'multi-move' based on your designated formation. Moving the ball carefully, you will seek to pass to your teammates and look for opportunities to shoot & score on the goal.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, Pattern Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Rabbit vs Bondsman
description:
Rabbit vs Bondsman is a modern-day cat & mouse board game that the entire family will enjoy. In the game a fugitive known as 'Rabbit' has jumped bail, and John, the bondsman, has hired Bounty Hunters to retrieve him. Therefore, the game pits the Rabbit against 1 to 3 Bounty Hunters.

The goal of the game differs between the Rabbit and the Bounty Hunters. The Rabbit's goal is to collect funds from his stash houses or jobs while evading the bounty hunter(s), and the Bounty Hunters goal is to capture the Rabbit before they run out of money.

It is a roll and move game that's quick pace and fun, and also features a set of cards that directs the players of their actions.

There are three different options for playing, so the fun can last anywhere from 30 minutes to three hours. Only one question remains: Will you be the Bondsman or the Rabbit? Your fate will be decided by the roll of the die.
mechanics: Bribery, Catch the Leader, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Argentina (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Territory Building, Trains, Transportation

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack
description:
X-Wing 2nd ed.: Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add two Rogue-class Starfighters to your Separatist or Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the traditional Magnaguard color scheme, and another in the distinctive scheme of Xanadu Blood, the personal ship of notorious bounty hunter Cad Bane. The expansion also has four maneuver dials (two for each faction), and an assortment of tokens. Additionally, thirteen ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic starfighter into battle and seventeen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Arctic Survival
description:
Arctic Survival is a 2-4 player game of predator and prey that takes place on a ‘tundra’ of 25 cards arranged in a 5x5 grid. One team plays as lemmings, who move beneath the tundra searching for food and water to bring back to their burrow. The other team plays as foxes, who hunt on top of the tundra trying to dig up and catch the lemmings.

On the lemming turn, lemmings will roll, move, tunnel (by flipping cards) and search for resources. On the fox turn, foxes will roll, move, listen for lemmings, and pounce (by flipping cards in the opposite direction of the lemmings).

There are also adaptations and natural events hidden that can help the lemmings or foxes respectively and additional player tokens of the carrion beetle and polar bear that can change the tide of the game.

The game is designed to be both educational and fun. It can be used to teach about ecosystems, food chains, adaptations, abiotic and biotic elements, and the impacts of climate change.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Deduction, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Una civilización en 45 minutos
description:
Become the Master of the World by establishing and leading a civilization from the dawn of man to the space age. Discover new technological advances key to the development of humanity and build the most powerful empire the world has ever known.

A card game for 1-4 players (best with 2). Exchange technology advances with the shared card tableau to develop your civilization. Exchange Exploration and Gather cards with the shared tableau to expand your civilization and to gather the raw materials to invest in progressing your technology.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Ladder Climbing, Multiple Maps, Open Drafting

name: Bloodsport Gambler
description:
Bloodsport Gambler, a game for 1-2 players, focuses on a tense & seedy story of risk, luck, and the efforts that sway fate in your favor. The simple gameplay combines card-driven strategy, risk mitigation, and resource management with the thrill of betting, dice rolling, and pushing your luck.

Thrust into desperation by swelling debts, you must gamble on the foul pit fights of Ghoulmorrah in a last-ditch struggle to pay off a merciless syndicate of moneylenders. With looming payments fast approaching, the only way to beat the odds is to sleuth, scheme, and sabotage. While a sure bet is favorable to warding off debt collectors, the risk of getting caught cheating could rid you of your earnings, your reputation, or worse - your life! Only those who are clever and cunning enough to pay off their debts will survive the vile underbelly of the slithering city.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Con-Carnival mystery board game
description:
There is a traveling carnival rumored to be a front for con artists & thieves... and one has just arrived in your town. Could it be the infamous “Con-Carnival“? By finding CLUEs and gathering points you must determine whether this carnival is the infamous CON-Carnival or just plain FUN. But you only have until 8:00!

DID YOU KNOW: The Con-Carnival is a fictional carnival that originates from The Spirit Seeds graphic novel series.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Lose a Turn, Matching, Memory, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting

name: Spearmint Island
description:
Spearmint Island is being invaded, and it’s up to the lesser spirits and natives of the island to fend off the attacks and save themselves from being wiped from existence! As the player, you take on the role of a spirit that inhabits the island and use a mix of powers at the right time to stop the invaders from spreading out and ravaging the land. The invaders are strong, but your spirit will grow in power as the game progresses. Will you be able to send the invaders fleeing from your homeland, or will the island succumb to their ever-increasing population and blighting of the land?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Nova Burn: Tabletop Shmup Action
description:
Tabletop. Shmup. Action.

Choose your ship, load the wave, and blast 'em all in this tactical, grid-based RPG! Each wave is made of a set of enemy ships who fire a bullet pattern at you. It is then your turn to dodge and return fire!

Nova Burn uses simple, easy to learn d6 rules to emulate classic shoot 'em up video games through tactical combat. It is for one player and you can play by writing in the book!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boocoo Fire Mission
description:
Boocoo Fire Mission is the result of 3 years of research and playtesting, drawing from first-hand accounts of the war to create a wargame seasoned with plenty of historical flavor. A simple and effective hidden movement system allows players to really sweat as they try to work out if it's safe to cross that open field in front of them. Plans don't usually survive contact with the enemy, and a number of mishap tables help to create a narrative experience that goes beyond your average "move and shoot" wargame.

Boocoo Fire Mission is aimed at 6mm or 15mm miniatures, and can be played on a 4' x 4' or 6' x 4' table.

This game is company scaled, and the smallest maneuver unit is the squad, with players generally controlling 2 - 4 platoons, each with a number of squads and an HQ. Players will direct their forces on the ground, as well as coordinating support such as air strikes, artillery, and taking advantage of special assets such as VC spider holes or booby traps, or the NVA's stubborn resistance and uncanny ability to recover casualties, preventing US a body count...

Rules are provided for infantry, from the lowest quality ARVN troops, to the most elite ANZAC SAS and US Recon squads, and their various weapon attachments such as RPGs, LMGs, Recoilless rifles, and mortars, as well as helicopters such as the UH-1, AH-1 Cobra, OH-6 Loach and CH-47 Chinook. Vehicles such as the M113, M48 Patton, M551 Sheridan, various marine "amtracs", the M42 Duster, and M50 Ontos are also covered.

Boocoo Fire Mission is has a descending level of detail, with infantry as the most detailed unit in the game, followed by helicopters, and finally vehicles. Infantry can hide, dig in, crawl to avoid opportunity fire, and conduct suppression. Helicopters have detailed damage tables to provide for many interesting results from fire, and can drop off and pick up infantry on the table. Vehicles can disembark their crew, leaving sentries behind to man a single weapon, and can also transport infantry.

Army lists are provided for ANZACs, ARVN, US army, Armored Cavalry, Mechanized companies, and US marines. VC and NVA are of course included, and some factions are split into different time periods depending on if their equipment evolved over the course of the war. Boocoo Fire Mission covers the entire Vietnam War, from early ARVN vs VC skirmishes in the early 1960s, through to 1975. Specific city fight lists are also included for both the Allied and Communist forces, to allow players to play battles such as those in Hue or Saigon.

The game provides printable markers, and a printer-friendly version of the rules is also provided. Note that the markers are only in the full-color version of the rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Dice, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Signum
description:
Signum is a drawless connection game for the hexhex board in the vein of Global Connection, but without markings on the board or an initial position.

Play: Players take turns placing one stone of their color on any empty hex.

Goal: When the board is full, the game is over and the player with the higher score is the winner.

Scoring: Each stone is worth 1 point for its owner if it is part of a group connecting opposite sides of the board, and -1 point otherwise.

The pie rule is used to balance the game: One player decides what the first move is, and the other player decides whether to play first or second.

The titular scoring trick that ensures there are no ties (each stone is either worth +1 or -1 points) was (unbeknownst to the inventor of Signum) discovered by the inventor of Loops 9 years earlier. That game expresses it even better: Stones that are not worth a point for their owner is worth a point for their opponent.

—description from the designer

name: Zombomination
description:
Zombomination is an intense, post-apocalyptic, real-time or turn-based dice-rolling game that pits hardened Humans vs hungry Zombies. Asymmetrical roll options create intense action and unique strategies for each end-of-the-world faction. Zombies and Humans also have multiple, and different, winning conditions to make each game an exciting experience that feels new. Do you have what it takes to win?

Humans attempt to destroy the laboratory or find enough supplies to win. Zombies either attempt to kill all humans or overwhelm the safehouse to win. Depending on preference, players can engage in hectic real-time action or more strategic turn-based action. Both zombies and Humans take actions when 7's or doubles show on two rolled D6. Most real-time games play in less than 5 minutes. Turn-based games take about 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Variable Player Powers

name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Danika & Iva
description:
The woods are enchanted, so the common folk say, but the most deeply enchanted part of the woods is the maze of hedges where the sorceress Danika and her familiar, Iva dwell. They say the hedges shift and move and devour those who enter them, and that those who try to hurt Danika soon find Iva there to protect her...

A new character for Gatefall.

name: Hakuna Matata
description:
The buffalo is going - can the meerkats hold themselves on their hill, or do you fall down?
Game progress - To get a better overview, one curious earthman climbs on the hill after another
Obstacles - The hill wiggles through the buffalo. Fingertip feeling is required, because too much swing lets the figures fall down
Goal of the game - Whoever first placed all his figures on the hill is the winner. The game is also suitable as an individual activity

name: Siege Command: The Conclave Wars
description:
Siege Command’s first expansion: The Conclave Wars brings three new Tribes into the fray. Not only do each of these Tribes introduce asymmetric gameplay, but they also bring unique mechanics that deepen the gameplay and strategy. The expansion also includes new optional Terrain types that can be used to further deepen the game’s strategy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Catchy Match
description: Catchy-Match is above all a rough backyard soccer field spectacle than a slick Champions league Cup match. Here, two proud character teams challenge each other, betting on who can most trickily use their opportunities to score a goal. If only there wasn't the matter of luck. The dice decides which possibilities there are and sometimes it also prevents the victory that was thought to be certain. Especially people who are enthusiastic about the game and don't know anything about soccer can quickly get ahead of the game and show the supposed soccer pros how to win a match.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Square Grid, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Archery Tournament (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Once a year, the townsfolk of the county of Carcassonne gather for the annual archery tournament.
This tournament sees the best archers from all over Europe demonstrating their skill in the hopes of
becoming the champion archer. But there can only be one champion, so second place simply won’t
do.

The new Archery Champion (the player with the majority of Farmers in the field with the Archery Range) will earn 4 points for each completed city in that field.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Underwater Hunt
description:
Underwater Hunt is a board game that helps children enjoy learning number skills as they find a way to collect gems from the bottom of the sea. Designed for 1 to 4 players, Underwater Hunt is a great game for developing and sharpening math skills, as they add and subtract their way through the board, strategically using their cards to earn gems.

The goal of the game is to use your diver cards to land on a space that has gems. The first player to collect 5 gems wins.

How to set up
1) Place the chest cards face down on the table.
2) Place 5 gems randomly on 5 blank spaces on the board. 1 gem per space.
Tips: You may use 5 random diver flash cards to select the spaces for the gems.
3) Place your token on the "Start" space.
4) The dealer deals 5 diver flash cards to each player. The remaining cards not dealt are placed face down on the table to form the draw pile.

How to play
1) The person to the left of the dealer starts play. Players take turn in clockwise direction.
2) You choose a card from your hand and play it faceup on the table.
3) You calculate the sum (or difference) shown on the card and go that many spaces forward.
4) If you land on a space with a gem, you take the gem, and replenish the space with a new gem.
5) If you land on a "miss a turn" space, you will be skipped on your next turn.
6) If you land on a "chest symbol" space, take a chest card and follow the instruction on the card.
7) Keep playing and go around the board until a player collects 5 gems.
8) When you have played all of your cards in your hand, you draw 5 new cards from the draw pile.
9) If the draw pile is empty, shuffle the discard pile and use it as the new draw pile.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals
description:
Sigmar’s immortal champions wield the celestial fury of the God-king, and nowhere in the Mortal Realms is safe from their wrath. Clad in armour and weapons of an ingenious design, they descend from Azyr on bolts of holy lightning. They’ve come to the Eightpoints to punish the followers of the Dark Gods and bring them to order with relentless might.

If you’re looking for a warband that’s incredibly hard to kill and hits with the force of a meteor, the Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals are where it’s at. You might not get many in your warband, but each one is a match for several mortal warriors, striding through battle like lords of war. This set allows you to build a balanced force of both Vindictors and Annihilators. Their heavy armour means your enemies will have to gang up on you, while your punishing strikes will cull the hordes little by little until you’re left standing on a pile of corpses. The additional cards allow you to bring along powerful leader units and specialised fighters, as well as a Gryph-hound. What more could you ask for?

This warband set contains:


- 5 Vindictors armed with long spears, tall shields, and awesome masks
3 Annihilators, which can be equipped with either a large round shield and heavy hammer or an even larger double-handed meteoric grandhammer
Thunderstrike Stormcast Eternals wound divider and abilities cards, loaded with powerful attacks and magical effects to bring Sigmar’s wrath to the Eightpoints
18 fighter cards, including 1x Lord-Imperatant, 1x Knight-Arcanum, 1x Knight-Relictor, 1x Knight Vexillor With Banner of Apotheosis, 1x Knight-Judicator, 2x Vindictor variants, 2x Vanquisher variants, 2x Vigilor variants, 2x Praetor variants, 4x Annihilator variants, and 1x absolutely amazing Gryph-hound
84 tokens, including 24x activation tokens, 32x double-sided wound tokens, 2x initiative markers, 10x special tokens, and 16x objective marker/treasure tokens


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hold your Hat
description:
Players are divided into teams, and a color card is selected at the beginning of the game to determine the words being guessed. On each team's turn, one player is the clue-giver and the other players on the team attempt to guess words and phrases from the word deck before the sand timer runs out. Each team's turn ends by drawing a special card that provides powerful effects. The game is played over three rounds.

Round 1: Description
Round 2: One Word
Round 3: Mime

During each round, teams take turns until all words are guessed correctly. At the end of the round, the correct guesses are counted and points are awarded. All word cards are then shuffled for the next round. The team with the most points from all three rounds wins the game.

—user summary

Играчите се разделят на отбори. Формира се тесте от карти с думи. Избира се карта с цвят, която определя думите за обяснение по време на цялата игра. На всеки ход един от играчите обяснява думи, които трябва да бъдат познати от неговите съотборници преди изтичане на времето.

Ходът на всеки отбор приключва с изтеглянето на специална карта. Играта продължава в три кръга, като думите се обясняват чрез описание, една дума и мимики. Всеки кръг приключва с познаването на всички думи.

Играта печели отборът с най-много точки от трите кръга.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: リスのタルトやさん (Risu no Tarte yasan)
description:
The players take on the role of squirrels that live in the forest taking turns to collect resources to make tarts. At the end of a round, if a player has made three tarts, they are the winner.
Each round the players place their squirrels on trees or a tart pile to collect fruit or tart recipes, respectively. Large squirrels can gather two fruits, while small squirrels can only gather one. Once all the squirrels have been placed, they are collected back by the players and any tarts can be made, provided the player has the correct fruits and tart crust available.
In the beginning of each round, the fruit on the trees are refreshed from a bag, and new tart recipes are flipped over and play continues with a new first player.
mechanics: Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Goons: 5 Player Expansion
description: A 5 Player Expansion for GOONS that includes everything you need to get cracking, including a new goon, extra goon board and 20 orange deluxe mini poker chips!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Goons: The Sergey Brothers Solo Expansion
description: Take on the merciless Sergey Brothers in this solo experience of Goons that also can be used to create more dynamics in 2 player games!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Hostage Negotiator: Pack Peticiones #1 y #2
description:
This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Demand Pack #1 and Demand Pack #2).

Demand Pack #1 is an expansion pack that comes with 16 new cards that will add new major demands for the original abductors (Arkayne, Donna, and Edward) as well as the abductors from Abductor Packs 1-2 and 3-4. These cards will breathe new life into abductors you've faced off against before.

Demand Pack #1 was a stretch goal that was achieved in the Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave Kickstarter campaign.

Demand Pack #2 is an entire pack of 16 all-new cards to use with the abductors featured in Crime Wave (Barrett, Lijah, and Renesha), as well as abductors in Abductor Packs (5-6 and 7-8! Just like Demand Pack #1, this will bring a whole new challenge to abductors you've faced in the past!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ¿Qué Hace un Hombre con una Sardina en la Cabeza?
description:
It all started in a chance encounter with old Captain Sargasso. He was going down the street alone, lurching to port and starboard and bumping into everything that got in his way. When he crossed paths with me, he took my arm tightly and showed me a worn and half-torn map, with drawings and nonsensical phrases that filled each sheet.

Then, out of the blue, he burst out laughing, left me the map and said goodbye shouting into the wind: "And that's how I ended up with a sardine on my head!" Since then I have had time to look at that old nautical chart many times, and I have always been curious to know what they meant, and what meaning those phrases and drawings had and, of course, what relationship they had with a sardine on the head of a man.

Maybe you are able to make sense of this story... Or not.

In addition to this witty story, the game brings a series of images and texts that will make sense when you put your imagination to work. There is only one question: What is a man doing with a sardine on his head? but countless possible answers. From the cards and their combination, you will be able to create a new story every time. Perhaps it will be a long story; maybe small or even a single scene. But you will take the helm, in the way you want on each occasion.

The proposal of this game arose as a search. The original idea was to make a book album as open as possible: that each person, when reading it, would create their own meanings, make their own plot. This is how this book-game was born that proposes you to establish the reading rules, play with visual and written language to shape the narrative, create connections that only you will know and enjoy a different way of reading.

name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Caustic Valley/Mines Battlemat
description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Fungal Crevasse/Washout Battlemat
description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

name: Enquêtes à Los Angeles: Nouveaux Crimes
description:
After discovering the game and the 5 first cases as a detective or as the Chisel in "Enquêtes à Los Angeles" (the French version of Detective: City of Angels), you can know continue the experience with the 4 next cases.

WARNING: You will need the core game to play with "Nouveaux Crimes" as the box will only contain the 4 new cases and the corresponding booklets.

Even if the different cases will be slightly harder one after the other, the game stays the same: a 3 to 9 players asymmetrical investigation game.

The detectives will have to solve the case before their opponents. The Chisel will try to manage the story and how it's told, sometimes helping a detective in distress, sometimes slowing a lucky detective down, choosing the answers of the interrogated witnesses.

Every game, dive deep into the nice film noir atmosphere of Los Angeles during the 40s.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game
publishers: La Boîte de Jeu, Van Ryder Games

name: Name The Thing: After Dark
description:
When the sun goes down this expansion comes out to play! This expansion to Name The Thing adds 99 adult only cards to your collection. Can you name all the naughty things?

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Zesty: The Slow Game
description:
You can learn the principles of sustainability by playing with family and friends. Intelligent fun and lots of green-themed challenges.

Zesty is a game to learn how to save the environment… one challenge at a time! The funniest way to challenge yourself to change your habits step by step.

Help the Planet with small actions that can be done in an hour, a day, a weekend or even several days.

You and your team draw a Challenge card. You will have up to 1 week to complete the highest number of actions listed on the card and, thanks to ZESTY, you will be able to change your habits and those of those who will play with you.

You will read, think, play, record your team's progress on a very special log.
