The Challenges are divided into five Thematic Areas: Nature, Consumption, Pollution, Society, Emotions and will allow you to reflect on many different topics related to the well-being of the Planet and its inhabitants.

Zesty is a "slow" game: your skills are not demonstrated with speed but with commitment and attention to important topics, which you can explore in a very special book.

Warning: this is a cooperative game. You win, or lose, all together!

—description from the publisher

name: BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash – MODS Expansion
description:
The action gets bigger and louder with two new trucks and a crew of experts.

MORE MONSTER MAYHEM!
More players at the table = more fun. Expand the player count of BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash to 6 Players AND get two more trucks from TEAM BIGFOOT's history: BIGFOOT #5 and Ms Bigfoot.

GET A CREW
Every driver needs a great crew. With this expansion, you'll get a chance to draft Monster Truck experts to help you plan and execute your run.

MODS Expansion Includes:

5 - 6 Player Rules
CREW expansion - Draft Monster Truck Experts to your team!
*BONUS* - 8 new Obstacle Tiles


Featuring two fan-favorite playable BIGFOOT trucks:

World Record Breaker - BIGFOOT #5
Queen of Crush - Ms. Bigfoot
Player boards and Style decks for each truck


—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Transportation
mechanics: Programmed Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Crown & Crescent
description:
The American victory at Saratoga in 1777 and their Treaty with France in 1778 transformed the war in America. The potential influx of fresh French troops to swell the ranks of General Washington’s Army drove the British to rethink their colonial strategy. As a result the British moved their efforts from the middle colonies to the southern colonies where it was believed sentiment for the crown’s cause ran strong. Having secured Savannah in 1779 the British turned their eyes on Charleston and South Carolina. When the British crossed the Savannah River South Carolina became the focal point of the revolution.

The years, 1780-1781, in South Carolina saw some of the most intense fighting that occurred in the revolution as both Loyalists and Patriots both rose up in numbers to fight for or against the crown. The struggle for independence during those two years saw over 200+ actions, skirmishes, and battles fought in South Carolina resulting in the names of Marion, Morgan, and Tarleton and places such as Kings Mountain and Cowpens entering American lore.

Crown and Crescent models the two years of intense, fierce fighting in South Carolina adopting and modifying the unique and innovative command and control mechanics created by the Ragnar Brothers for ANGOLA! These mechanics keep players guessing, create plenty of tension, and reward the right balance of boldness and caution as you guide your forces towards independence or crushing the revolting colonists. The map is divided into seven districts, encompassing 6 to 7 key locations each, used to show control of the district. Control enough key locations and you’ll then control the district and therefore advance on the victory point track towards winning the game.

The counters represent military units and auxiliaries such as artillery, rifled and light troops, grenadiers, dragoons, and cavalry. A unique command and activation system has players planning in secret the order in which they will activate a limited number of their units for the turn. The players then take turns activating their units in the determined order. The result is a tense game, with players trying to analyze the map and out guess their enemies.

Crown and Crescent can be played with between two to four players (Continental and Whigs vs British and Tories).

Components:

One 22”x34” full-color map
Two full sheets of counters (352 5/8" counters)
One full color rule book
One deck of 55 cards
4 player aid cards
20 dice


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Communication Limits, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Middara: Lupercalia 2021 Pack
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Just like our Cross Promotion Pack, our Resin Lupercalia Kits from last year are now available in plastic. The Lupercalia 2021 Pack includes a plastic set of all seven of the miniatures we made in Resin from our last Kickstarter. This also includes their Item Cards, Combatant Cards, and Adventurer Cards.

Profane Occultists Made Immortal

“Toxie scrubbed the blood from her hands, noting idly that she had nailed the color when choosing her crimson fingernail polish. In the far corner of the abandoned warehouse, a half dozen corpses, all still bound hand and foot, lay in a heap as testament to her night’s labors. Her final victim lay sprawled on the concrete floor behind her, still breathing shallowly through his broken, twisted mouth. She hadn’t actually been planning to pull out his teeth when she started questioning him, but then Luperci and Tixie had radioed in that they cleared the enemy’s hideout, and that Mena was one of the captives they had freed. Threatening the Faun was one thing; dragging an innocent child into it was something else altogether.

Toxie dried her hands gingerly, then turned around to consider her captive. He was definitely dying; even if someone found him now, there weren’t enough surgeons or drugs on Earth to save him. But Toxie had to meet up with her pack to run down the last of the heathens who had escaped with the Faun, and she didn’t like leaving jobs unfinished.

She hunkered down next to him and saw with satisfaction that his eyes were still open, though only just through the swollen wreckage of his face. She blew him a kiss.

“You get a little mercy now,” she crooned as she gently stroked a blood-free patch of skin on his forehead. “I’m late for an orgy, so I can’t really wait around for you to die. You know how it is. . .”
She turned to her gear bag and considered her options. She wanted to use her favorite, but, of course, it had to be the messiest of the lot and she had just finished cleaning up. Eh, what the hell, she thought. Grinning, Toxie grabbed the pink handle and turned back to finish the job.

Outside the warehouse, an early morning train rumbled past, just loud enough to mask the roar of a chainsaw.”

This product contains 7 miniatures, Adventurers, Espers, and new Items.

These new Espers spice your game with unknown variety by adding new Espers that can be summoned by both Adventurers

—description from the publisher

name: For What Remains: Terrain and Template Pack Expansion
description: This expansion adds 9 new double-sided terrain tiles which allow the player to blend scenery from the 3 games (Streets of Ruin, Blood on the Rails, Out of the Basement) together. Also included are 4 transparent ability templates.

name: Into The Echoside: Promo Card Set
description:
A set of three promotional cards, one from each faction, for Into The Echoside. They were all included in a single pack available for those who preordered Into The Echoside: Oracle of the Three Rings.

The three cards were Inner City Posse, Wizard of the Hood, and Blahzay Rose.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Usurper Battle System: Titans of Tartarus
description:
From the triangular game pieces to the diamond shaped game board you'll have trouble finding anything like what the Usurper Battle System has to offer. You'll have an even harder time putting this game down once you've learned the rules.

In this campaign (Titans of Tartarus) You'll choose one of the four banished Olympian Gods. You'll build a team of specialized Mortal units and together you'll use them to unleash a Titan's power and escape the prison you've been banished to.

This campaign comes with the Core Rule Set, a game board (Battleboard), 2 full sets of Battle Tokens including 8 Gods, 12 Mortals and 2 Titans.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Game System, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Physical Removal, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack
description:
The minions of Thanos are unleashed in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack, which combines the characters previously found in the Corvus Glaive & Proxima Midnight and Black Dwarf & Ebony Maw expansion packs.

In addition to miniatures of each of these characters, this pack also includes stat cards featuring updated graphic design for all four as well as all of the Team Tactic cards found in the original packs. Finally, players will also find copies of the Space, Time, Mind, and Reality Infinity Gems that help them unlock the full potential of their Black Order characters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: SIXGEMS
description:
In SIXGEMS, players play gem cards to a tableau in front of them in order to manipulate dice around a central area. The gem cards show die faces that affect which dice can be moved, and if their face is adjusted.

The players then have the option to play an account settlement card which may grant certain bonuses, but also triggers a scoring where players earn points for the gems they hold corresponding to the location and face of the blue dice, and lose points in the same manner for the red die.

After a certain number of account settlements have been triggered, the game ends and the person with the most points wins.

name: Treacherous Trails
description:
In Treacherous Trails, the players begin as pioneers in the American Mid-West, and must take the money they start with and decide how to use it as they travel across the West, to their destination on the Pacific coast.

Should they buy a wagon and mule team, or use oxen? Go light and ride on horseback with a pack mule? And what provisions to pack; should they carry a lot of food or hope to hunt and forage along the way? And what kind of gear? Should they spend all the money or save some for the destination? Not knowing what they will encounter on the trail, they must use their best judgement, and no matter how often the game is played, the cards (including random events) will change and the results will vary, even if the same choices are made at the outset. The replayability is high, in this family-friendly, yet competitive game of the American West.

There are 5 trail choices you may take, or you can play as an outlaw along a trail, and once their trails & equipment have been chosen, the game begins. Players vie to reach their cities and then select a career and amass wealth, as they establish themselves on the West coast!
categories: American West, Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Travel
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement, Trading

name: Esculenta
description:
Esculenta (named after the taro plant) is an original 2-player Tarock game with an ordinary deck of cards. It’s aim is to fill a gap in the genre to provide 2-player experience of the same feel and depth as found in traditional games, yet with its own personality and strategies. Like all tarock, Esculenta is distinguished by a super-long trump suit with the other cards being where one score most of the points: in this case half the deck, 20 cards, are trump! Players bid to win the most card points but often gain even more points from declaring to achieve certain bonus feats in tricks, such as taking the last trick with the lowest trump.
In addition to the fact it’s played with a regular deck, distinctions include declarer going against a defender who plays two cards to the three card trick with the help of a mini-dummy, and an idiosyncratic trick-playing order. The dummy is played by defender (so it's 2:1) but this is offset by the fact the declarer can often maintain the lead by forcing dummy to win.

Esculenta is part of the "Twisted Dummy" series: 2 player adaptations of traditional games using dummy third hand used in innovative ways.
—description from the designer

name: The Zorro Dice Game: Equipment Pack #2
description:
This has 6 Common Equipment and 2 Premium Equipment. It contains:
Bandana
Bolos
Charm
Gauntlets
Goat
Pitchfork
Amulet
Chalice

It was released with the Stunts and Allies expansion Kickstarter campaign but it works with any combination of base game or expansions.

name: The Zorro Dice Game: Ally Pack #1
description:
This has 4 Allies for use with Stunts and Allies expansion to The Zorro Dice Game. It contains:
Ana Maria Verdugo
Zorro's Fighting Legion
Joaquin Murrieta
Jose of the Cocopahs

name: Eating Vegans
description:
In this highly strategic game entice a free range vegan to graze, plump them up, and eat them before you’re attacked. Steal vegans, cropdust neighboring ranges, and try avoiding the allure of bacon or bunnies eating what’s rightfully theirs.

This 100 card deck is packed with fun. This game is for 2-6 players and suitable for ages 8 and over. Games usually last between 15 and 30 minutes. This game is based on the Trophic levels and pokes jest at the fact vegans have voluntarily lowered themselves on the food chain. In the game vegans are free range. You utilize crop cards to entice them to graze before plumping them up to ultimately harvest them for consumption.

Plant a Crop card in Your Range (players personal play area) and entice a Vegan (Male, Female, or Non-Binary) from the Free Range (face down Vegan pile) to graze. Feed a Vegan 3 Crops and they are ready to harvest. Eat your Vegan and place them in your Belly (area adjacent to Your Range). First player to eat 3 Meals wins the game.

Players may also generate Meals by utilizing a Breed card with a Male and Female Vegan, creating a Baby Vegan. You may harvest 2 Baby Vegans in Your Range as a Meal or use a Vegan Snack card with a Baby Vegan as a Meal.

Players obstruct each other's ability to harvest Vegans with Action Cards. Some action cards have attack elements, others defense / block elements, and some both.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: The Great Escape: Day 1
description:
In this expansion for The Great Escape, it is day 1 in camp and as the POWs are processed into the camp you must decide how best to deploy them by strategically placing cards within the camp layout.

Do you try and help 1 or 2 POWs escape today or do you concentrate your efforts towards a mass escape at a later date?

Or maybe you really do deserve the title of Big X and can achieve all of the following objectives:

On the way to camp help 1 POW leap from the transporter and flee into the forest.
Hide POWs amongst the forced labour gang as they are taken out into the forest to work.
Hide POWS in the trucks that are about to be cleared for departure.
Set up a lookout system.
Designate POWs to create distractions.
Find a blind spot in the outer fence.
Discover the identity of the spy.
Blackmail a guard.
Produce disguises for escaping POWs.
Choose a hut in which to hide wire cutters.
Tunnel to the administration offices.
Dispose of soil from the tunnels.


Guard cards will be used to continually thwart your escape attempts.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Echoes of Doom
description:
When the verminous skaven make a daring raid on the innocent Sylvaneth enclave of Neos, Grey Seer Skrittat's successful theft of priceless soulpods sets in motion a devastating counterstrike – for the Lady of Vines and her hand-picked Sylvaneth warriors have a thirst for vengeance that can only be quenched by a lake of spilled skaven blood…

Whether you have pledged your life to the Everqueen or have dedicated yourself to learning the ways of the insidious Clans Eshin, this battlebox provides a sizeable force to suit your needs, as well as several entirely new miniatures – the vengeful Lady of Vines, the deadly Gossamid Archers, and the treacherous Deathmaster, who may have an agenda all of his own. The graceful warriors of the Everqueen are ideal for players who like to be fast and agile, while the slinking agents of the skaven overwhelm their opponents with sheer strength of numbers.

Start a new fighting force (or two) as you choose to either save the sacred soulpods or steal them, or bolster your existing armies with reinforcements.

Inside, you’ll find 42 plastic Citadel miniatures, including:


1x The Lady of Vines
1x Spirit of Durthu, which can alternatively be build as either a Treelord or a Treelord Ancient
3x Kurnoth Hunters
5x Gossamid Archers



1x Deathmaster
1x Grey Seer on Screaming Bell, which can alternatively be built as a Plague Priest on Plague Furnace
10x Stormvermin
20x Clanrats


You'll also find:


1x 40-page Echoes of Doom booklet
1x 56-page Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Rules book
1x Token Sheet
8x Warscroll Cards


In this box, you will find all the Citadel miniatures you need to play out the brutal conflict between the vengeful Sylvaneth and the thieving skaven. Alongside these two armies you will find a book of detailed background information on the narrative of Echoes of Doom and the two factions involved. Also included are warscrolls and battleplans that allow you to start playing with your new armies right away, as well as extra rules content such as Region of War: The Adamantine Chain, Aqshy.

—descripton from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Exsilium
description:
Competitive card-driven tactical combat from 2 to 4 players. Prepare to dominate and take control.

Exsilium is a fast and light game with simple rules and familiar mechanics. Players will use Deckbuilding to upgrade their decks and battle enemy factions for control the Baralytas crystals.

All players will start with 12 basic cards and draw 4 at the start of each turn. Each player can perform as many actions as there are cards in his hand and can decide between activating the action of the card or using it to move the miniatures of his faction.

Expand the territory to wherever you want. Exsilium is competitive, so ruthless and terrible tactics are welcome.

All against all, without exception.

In Exsilium you must survive both the other factions and the common enemy that has emerged from the depths of Eris. A.I. enemies allow even in two player games, the battle starts from the first second.

RULE ERIS!

Control Terminal points and upgrade your deck before the other factions. Cross the frontiers, dominate the crystals and take control of the dwarf planet.

Exsilium's mechanics allow you to place explosive mines on the ground, drop items, and use tactics to mislead A.I. enemies.

Don't forget that you have a 24-page manual where you can explore each rule in detail and make the most of your abilities in battle.

The preparation of the game is super fast and the duration for 4 players does not exceed 50 minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Daughters of Khaine
description:
Twisted followers of the God of Murder, the Daughters of Khaine combine aelven prowess with shadowy abilities and strange mutations.

If you desire nothing more than to dance a trail of destruction through the Eightpoints, spilling blood in the name of Morathi, this is the warband for you. With no fewer than 20 types of fighter to choose from, you’ll be ready to take on everything the Dark Gods can throw at you. Not only can you build the monstrous Blood Sisters and Blood Stalkers, plus Witch Aelves and Sisters of Slaughter, you’ll also find fighter cards for many of the Daughters of Khaine models.

The Daughters of Khaine are one of the fastest, hardest-hitting warbands in the game, and they can be tailored to very specific play styles. Of course, you’ll also be able to use all these models in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar forces, making it a great buy for existing players to bolster their collection or anyone looking to start up a new army.

Contents:
15 Miniatures
‣ 5 Melusai Blood Sisters OR Melusai Blood Stalkers
‣ 10 Witch Aelves OR Sisters of Slaughter
5 Round Bases (40mm)
10 Round Bases (25mm)
Daughters of Khaine Wound Divider and Abilities Cards
20 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultra Quick College Baseball
description:
This year book contains all of the college teams from 2021 in Divisions I,II, III,the NAIA, all three divisions of Junior College Baseball, and the CCCAA. There are 1300+ teams rated in this year book. The Year Book also includes a SOS system, so you can match up any team realistically.

The purpose of this game is to quickly simulate scores and standings for baseball leagues. You can use the game as a companion to a play-by-play baseball game, or as a stand-alone game in which you play out the season and watch the pennant races unfold.
Each team is accurately rated for their hitting, pitching and defense as well as how they perform when playing at home and how they handle pressure situations. The combination of these ratings gives you a very accurate picture of each team. In addition to the team ratings, we also provide you with a quick and simple method for normalizing teams across eras. So, you can effortlessly determine the best team of all time if you choose, without worrying about any biases.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Darkoath Savagers
description:
Darkoath Savagers are legendary for their strength and martial prowess, which they use to fulfil the pacts and prophecies that drive them across the Mortal Realms. To break these vows is the foulest of crimes, and a sign of terrible weakness – such cowards don't last long, among their own ranks or those of their rivals. Guided by the dire visions of God-speaker priests, Darkoath warbands venture forth to prove their mettle and win the favour of the Ruinous Powers.

Strap on your boots, grab the heaviest weapon you can lift, and get ready to mangle your foes with the Darkoath Savagers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tarantulas Brood
description:
The Tarantulos Brood worship Chaos in the form of the Eightfold Watcher, a bloated cosmic spider, and seek out mutagenic substances like varanite to uplift their mortal forms ever-closer to the sacred shape of their god. The Tarantulos act as an eerie psychic gestalt, communing with the spiders they keep like livestock, and bear weapons and garments created from the byproducts of their arachnid companions.

Scuttle forth from your subterranean homes to ensnare your foes with the Tarantulos Brood.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Torre Alta
description:
Torre Alta is an introductory-level hex and counter wargame, set in a fictional European medieval kingdom. Players take on the role of princes fighting for the throne of their dying father, the king.
Published in Espaço T Magazine, a general interest Portuguese magazine from the 1980s, as a detachable cut and mount game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Malki
description:
The basic game is played with 2 or 4. The game for advanced players can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. The Malki game is best served with 4 colors.

The objective of the game is to conquer the Center of the board with your King. Each player disposes of 9 pieces on the board (and 4 spare pieces), representing The King, the watchmen (guards), the warlords and the sorcerer.

Malki is a game of magic that reveals more and more of its depth as you play it. Mind-marvelling.

name: microCrime
description:
microCrime is a Roll-and-Write investigation game for 1+ people. You are the detective. And you need to solve the case. It features intriguing game mechanics, ever changing scenarios, a detailed Rulebook and tables. Plus, it's endless and ever changing!

The game starts soon after the Chief Inspector ends writing the premises of the case on the Case File by rolling dice several times and writing down the results took from the rulebook's tables.

At this point, all the players try to solve the case, building up a story which should include and bring to light all the elements, especially the missing ones, of the crimes scene, getting to a final solution, in order to close the case.

Detectives discuss their ideas and perceptions of the crime scene in its whole and try to figure out a possible solution, finding a meeting point that could explain the murder.

Investigation can vary in duration, based on the ability of the detectives to deal with the fundamental six questions every detective is asked to answer to close any case: How? What? When? Where? Why? Who?

While the investigation goes on, detectives should try to enrich their reconstruction of the case with more and more detailed elements.

Discussion and interpretation are fundamental, during this part of the game. Only with discussion, deduction and compromises they'll be able to meet a point where everyone is satisfied with the story.

When all involved players are pleased with the reconstruction they inform the Chief Inspector which writes down the story, closing the investigation, solving the case and, ultimately, ending the game.

It goes without saying that if players can‘t build up a story encasing all the elements of the crimes scene and get to a final solution, they can agree to archive the case. In this case players might want to try and solve the case another time, considering it a cold case.

To play this game no investigation knowledge or improvisation skills are necessary. Players debate the case, evidences and dice results by combining all the elements to create the most convincing and entertaining solution for the case.

Also, the crime scene is the main attraction of microCrime and the game gives you the opportunity to immerse yourself in it. After players select an area to play in (it might be the bedroom, the kitchen or any other space they want, like the courtyard, the garage or anything else) they can consider that space like a real crime scene by exploring it and simply by walking and looking around.

Moving through the crime scene and looking carefully at its peculiarities could prove to be really useful and interesting.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: 9-Card Dragonslayer
description:
You are the great dragon slayer and have found the beast. It is cornered and now it is up to you to deliver the final blow.
Unfortunately for you the beast doesn't want to surrender and puts up a fight for its life.

Each turn you will roll your dice, assign damage to the dragon and prepare your defenses. Then the dragon will attack back, reacting with a determinable but variable sequence of actions.
The fight end when one of the opponents is slain.

—description from the designer

name: Altai
description:
In the land of eagle hunters and herbalists, you represent a nomadic tribe. Face the tasks of the Great Shaman. You will be accompanied by your eagle and a power animal, your moose. The journey lasts 17 rounds, during which you can choose to explore landscapes or play cards to move your equestrian figure. En route, you'll need to use your strength well, as the landscape becomes more and more spacious. When you find fountains and reach them with your figure, you can fill up your water supply and extend the range of your cards. There are also some special actions, such as "deploy water." A highlight of the game are the power places with their mighty stone pines, which rise like peaks from a sea of fog, sink and reappear at another place ... Whoever gains the highest reputation wins.

The basic game is intended for beginners, which can be expanded to an expert game, including a solo variant. Three modules await you, with additional power animals (wolf, bear and snow leopard) and much more. A campaign combine all modules to the "Golden Journey."

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Map Addition, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Battle Array
description:
"Battle Array" is a set of 'fast play' wargame rules intended to simulate major battles from the ancient period until about 1500. It is played with miniatures or counters on a table top or board consisting of squares to regulate movement and distances and to speed up play by avoiding interaction and measurement issues. The system places less emphasis on weapons and more on training, quality and morale. Several historical battle scenarios are provided but, as usual in table top gaming players can also select their own armies and play 'random' battles such as Sumerian v 100 Years War French. The game is intended for experienced players and assumes that they know how to collect, paint and base figures and provide their own playing equipment such as dice, terrain and so on.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Arixia: War of Essence
description:
In Arixia: War of Essence, players take on the role of a god/goddess. Select one of five thematic and asymmetric factions consisting of multiple tiered units including: common, elite, specialist, general, and a mighty avatar unit class. Throughout the game, players will destroy each others’ units and accumulate their “essence” as well as fight over control points, known as Essence Wells. Harnessed essence is used to activate unique, faction-specific abilities.
With enough essence, your god will be able to manifest in the physical realm in the form of a massive avatar. Empowered avatars gain access to once-per-game Act of God abilities to swing the tide of battle in your favor. If you destroy the enemy’s avatar, you are victorious!

Gameplay is turn-based and consists of several phases. First, each player rolls an Essence Storm die to determine which way the Essence Storm will blow and which variable effect it will take on during that game round. Next, player one will take their turn. During a player turn consists of two phases, the movement phase and the activation phase. The movement phase allows your entire army to move up to their maximum speed stat. The activation phase allows up to two units to attack and use the active special abilities of those units. Thus, interesting situations arise where some units get into position for future turns, contest Essence Wells from opponents, or keep your options open on the fly.

However, because only two of your units can attack each turn, you must carefully plan not only your current turn, but think about how future turns might play out. Players roll unique-faced dice to simplify gameplay and avoid having to memorize combat tables. Additionally, most powerful units have access to faction-specific Divine Dice, providing a boost to damage, defense or annoying tricks. Additionally, players have the option to complete their turn phases in either order they wish, opening up further tactical options as needed! After players have taken their turns, a new game round begins, repeating this process until one side defeats the enemy avatar!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle 4 Mars
description: Humans have invaded Mars, but Martians aren't going down without a fight! Each player chooses a deck and issues orders to their troops to break through the other player's defenses and win the game.

name: Haphazard: Azulea Awakens
description:
Don't follow me. Eight tried. Eight died.
-Z

The note is small, the script neat and angular. Unhurried, confident, just like it’s mysterious author. No signature, just a flourishing letter Z. But the message is clear. To follow would be to flirt with fate itself.

The Foxthief has no idea of the value of the stone they stole. It is the only thing that has kept Azulea calm. Now, the ground beneath you is rumbling. You vow to recover the Stone of Azulea, before she awakes completely and unleashes her wrath on your little village.

Unsure of how long your journey will be, or what dangers await you, you gather some provisions and embark on your quest.

When you return, you’ll be a legend.

...that is, if you return at all.

Objective

Haphazard is an addicting, grid-based dungeon crawler, complete with dramatized story (optional) to make your adventures come alive. Take on the role of a woodland creature and embark on a quest to find the Stone of Azulea before the mountain erupts destroying everything and everyone you’ve ever known.

For your family, your friends, your homes, and your honor!

Gameplay can be divided into 3 main phases


Create- fill in your labyrinth for your rival to solve. Add some monsters and locks and gold based on the map's legend.
Explore- move, collect gold, fight lurkers, pick locks, and find the exit.
Upgrade- record your renown, buy boosts, heal up, and prepare for the next level.


Each time you begin a level, you will listen to a dramatized story. When you fight certain monsters or encounter certain locks, the player sheet will instruct you to listen to another entry in the story.

Haphazard: Azulea Awakens
Navigate labyrinths, fight ferocious lurkers, discover shiny treasures, upgrade your character, and make a name for yourself... if you ever make it out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling

name: La Chacolatería
description:
La Chacolatería is a board game for 1-4 players in which you'll cooperate to run a café of chacorritos, adorable but very demanding creatures that will come to your place and order from you. Here there are no turns, but all the players will play at the same time, dividing the tasks if necessary and playing the correct command cards on the little ones that ask for them. If you manage to serve all the chacorritos before the time runs out (counted through a stopwatch or the official application), you will have won the game!
In the estimated time, you will have to seat the chacorritos at their tables, give them the complete orders from the hand of one of the players, clean their tables when everyone has been served (separate the order cards and chacorritos from that table) and wash the dishes if necessary (shuffle the order cards when they are finished). All this in a limited time where you will have to think fast and cooperate with your companions!
But that's not all, because many special levels await you with which to test yourselves as a team. You may have to serve the chacorritos in a buffet, or play with one less table, or you may not be able to speak to communicate during the game or even face your friends in the competitive levels. Are you ready? The chacorritos are waiting for you!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Multiple Maps, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Exploradores de las Profundidades Sombrías. Compendio de Aventuras 1
description:
The Adventure Compendium includes the first five campaigns published in English: Blood Moon, Temple of Madness, Ghost Stone, Incinerator and Menagerie. Five complete supplements that will provide you with endless hours of game.
It includes 5 resin coffers for the game.

El Compendio de aventuras incluye todas las primeras campañas publicadas en inglés: Luna de sangre, El templo de la locura, La piedra fantasma, El incinerador y Casa de Fieras. Cinco suplementos completos que os proporcionarán horas y horas de emoción. Incluye 5 cofres de resina para poder jugar
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Neko Boss
description:
Neko Boss is a fun abstract cat game. Players need to move their cats around Neko(cat) Town to take control of the streets. When the cat stack grows those cats can travel further. Also, the top cat on the stack is the one that controls that stack of cats.

Basic rule for standard edition.

Board is consist of 24 intersections and paths. At first to decide players number, 2 or 3 or 4. Each player has same number of own pieces.

phase 1: placement
Decide players turn and every player places their piece on the board(intersections) alternately.

phase 2: making groups by piece moving
A piece can move one space but it must stack on other piece(s). It can't move to vacant space.
Player who keeps top piece of the group can move them. They must move as same number of stack pieces straightly on the path jumping other piece(s). They can't move to vacant space.
Players can't pass their turn if they have regal take. Passing the turn means finishing their playing.
When all players has no regal take, then the game is over. 4 or more pieces stack is score. The player who keep more 4 or more stacks than opponents wins the game. Score is same, then player who keeps highest stack wins the game. All are same, then player who keeps more stacks wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: Werwolf: Insurgency in Occupied Germany 1945-48
description:
Inspired by the COIN series, Werwolf: Insurgency in Occupied Germany 1945-1948 is an asymmetric, Alternate History Strategic level board wargame for 1-4 players.

It is 1945 and Germany has been invaded and occupied by the exhausted forces of the Soviet Union and Western Allies. Unlike in our timeline, the fighting continues as German resistance fighters engage in a prolonged guerrilla war. With the Manhattan Project still incomplete, Japan fighting on and the Allied invasion of Europe losing millions of men, the Allies are war-weary and there is pressure to bring the troops home. While the Wehrmacht was defeated, the Nazi leadership has spent 1943 onwards building up a huge secret guerrilla force – Werwolf - to turn the occupation of Germany into a costly quagmire. Other groups, calling themselves the Edelweiss Movement, are opposed to the Nazis but also to the invaders and will fight to restore an independent and patriotic Germany. The Fuhrer himself has gone missing, and many Nazi officials are in hiding, perhaps awaiting their chance to return to power.
Four factions are now competing for control and the loyalty of the German population: the Allied Occupation Forces (Western Allied Troops and German police, referred to as Allies in the rules) the Soviet Union (the Red Army and NKVD, referred to as Soviets in the rules), the Edelweiss Movement (patriotic but anti-Nazi German resistance, referred to as Edelweiss in the rules) and the Werwolf organisation (former SS and other Nazi fanatics trained in guerrilla warfare, referred to as Werwolf in the rules). The struggle will be not only for military control and the hearts and minds of the German people but also over the remnants of the Nazi war machine and research programs. The Soviets and Allies may reluctantly co-operate to crush German guerrillas but will compete to secure top German scientists and prototypes for their own arms race. As the Allies try to de-Nazify the populace and entice them with American pop culture, the Soviets will use everything from indoctrination to mass deportation to keep Germany under control. Loyalties will be split between democracy, communism and resurgent fascism or nationalism. This will not be an easy occupation…

—description from the publisher

name: The Grand Trunk Journey: Berlin Con Promo Cards
description:
This mini expansion is composed of 4 promo cards developed for the Spiele-Offensive Berlin Con crowdfunding campaign.

Improvement cards:

CITY HUB: The player can place a City or a Port card in reserve on this card. The city or port can come from their hand or their train (when they remove the card from the front of their train). The player spends 1 Day to take the City card and place it in front of their train during step 1 (but not back in their hand). They can discard the City card without spending a day.

DISPATCHER: The Grand Trunk Jct card allows the player to reach a city without a terminal.

Objective cards

EXPANSION TO BERLIN
Requirement: The player collected 2 or more each of Coal, Iron and Steel and the train of the player must be in Hamilton.
Score: 5 VP
During the 19th century, the city of Kitchener (Ontario), which is located about 60 km northwest of Hamilton, was called Berlin. The Grand Trunk Railway built a station in Berlin in 1856.

NEW MARKETS
Requirement: The player collected 3 or more first delivery tokens.
Score: 1 VP/1st delivery token collected

-description from designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Quintuple
description:
An abstract strategy game for two players.

Place or move your cubes on a grid of nine squares. Each cube's number shows how many squares it moves by. Position your token next to a row of cubes to change their numbers. First player to form three in a row and three in a column wins!

—description from the designer

name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men Rise and Fall Fast Forces
description:
The X-Men are no stranger to struggle, but some foes will rock the entire GALAXY!
Based on the critically acclaimed story Rise & Fall of the Shi’ar Empire, this HeroClix release has everything! Vulcan is out for revenge against the X-Men, the Shi’ar, and their allies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ciemna Strona Mydła: Wpieniona Impreza
description:
An add-on to the game Ciemna Strona Mydła.

The expansion includes over 60 new cards, including new VETO cards (cancel someone else's effects), new effects, new words and more Dots for up to 10 players!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Liber Astares Loyalist Legiones Astartes Book
description:
The Space Marine Legions of the 31st Millenium field a diverse and formidable range of genetically-enhanced warriors and advanced war machines, superior to any other military force in the galaxy. As an Age of Darkness falls across the stars and the fires of rebellion rage out of control, the armies that were used to forge the Imperium turn upon each other in an apocalyptic civil war – the Horus Heresy.

Of the eighteen Space Marine Legions, only half remain loyal to their oaths. Heroes without equal, these Space Marines rally to defend the Emperor and all he has strived to build. In the turmoil of the Horus Heresy, the Loyalist armies stand firm against a tide of corruption and betrayal, waging bitter war against their former brothers – those that have forsworn their oaths and turned upon the Imperium. By the courage and might of these steadfast warriors will the fate of the Imperium, and that of humanity itself, be decided.

This book is an essential guide for anyone who wants to command a Loyalist Legiones Astartes force in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy. It contains all of the rules you need to field every unit and formation available to Loyalist forces, from core units and weapons shared by every Space Marine Legion to specialist rules for each of the Loyalist Legions – including Rites f War, unique wargear, signature units, and their legendary Primarchs.

Inside this 344-page hardback book, you'll find:


Rules and unit profiles covering every unit, weapon, and piece of wargear available to the Loyalist Legiones Astartes in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy
Legion-specific special rules, Warlord Traits, Reactions, Rites of War, wargear, unit profiles, and unique characters for each of the Loyalist Legions: the Dark Angels, White Scars, Space Wolves, Imperial Fists, Blood Angels, Iron Hands, Ultramarines, Salamanders, and Raven Guard
Profiles for each of the Loyalist Primarchs: Lion El’Johnson, Jaghatai Khan, Leman Russ, Rogal Dorn, Sanguinius, Ferrus Manus, Roboute Guilliman, Vulkan, and Corvus Corax
A visual showcase for each Loyalist Legion, containing heraldry markings, colour schemes for infantry and vehicles, and a small gallery of stunning miniatures photography


—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Novel-based, Religious, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Events, Force Commitment, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Physical Removal, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hunt the Ravager: Temple of Secrets
description: These are the Kickstarter stretch goals. It adds 2 unique locations: the Temple of Secrets and the City of Lights. New graphics, but no substantial change to gameplay.

name: Nephilim Fraternités
description:
Nephilim Fraternités is the first board game in the Nephilim rpg universe.
It is a game of cooperation between Nephilim to face their ancestral enemies, secret societies, while trying to acquire as much esoteric knowledge as they can. It takes place in past incarnation periods.
The game play is a mix of dice/worker placement where each player has a dice pool they use to start actions on the game board. Each action is linked to an element and can either allow better fighting against the secret societies or progression in the quest for knowledge.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Fruitable
description:
Fruitable is a game in which you combine alphabet tiles to achieve goal cards in English words.
This is a game that will not only help you learn English, but also be enjoyed by all ages. Get the right alphabet tiles and try to complete the goal card.

- Game Summary -
Fruitable is conducted in a total of 4 rounds. Each round proceeds with the steps below.


Players who do not have a goal card take the corresponding goal card.
Use number cards and take alphabet tiles
Use seed tokens (all 3 can be used at a time), exchange 1 alphabet tile you have 1:1 on the market board (can only be exchanged once per round)
Complete the mission card
Place a new tile (no tile placement in the last round)
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Black Hole
description:
Flicking game on a revolving wooden board with some similarities to Carrom and Crokinole. The game was created by the owner of Maison du Billard in France, Philipe Rogé, and won the Concours Lepine Gold Medal in 2009.

Each player has 4 coloured discs that are positioned on the circles marked on the playing surface. The player who starts is drawn at random, and play goes clockwise.

When a player shoots an opposing disc into the black hole in the middle of the board, he can play again. If his disc enters the hole at the same time as an opposing pawn, he passes the turn to the next player. Direct or indirect shots are allowed.

1) If a player shoots one of his discs out of the playing field, it will be lost and taken out of play. If it is an opposing disc, it will be placed on the circle closest to where it went off the board.

2) If a player by mistake plays (touches or shoots with) an opposing disc, his disc furthest from the hole will be taken out of play.

POSSIBLE GAME ENDINGS:

The last player who has one or more discs left on the playing surface is the winner. If there is only one disc left for each of the last two players and one of them pockets both of them at the same time, the game is drawn and must be replayed. There are no winners or losers.

As soon as a player no longer has a disc on the playing surface, the game is over, and the 1 point per disc is scored for the other players. The first player who reaches 5 points wins the game. It takes 2 points difference to determine the winner.

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Tiger II
description:
Wave 7

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The German Tiger II is the biggest tank in the game thus far, but it's not just for show! With its high Survivability, in combination with the Heavy Tank rule, this behemoth will be hard to take down. If that wasn't enough, it also comes with the Tiger II Serienturm Turret upgrade card which adds an additional point of Survivability, and Improved Hardening for an extra Hit Point. This iconic piece of German engineering is ready to roll out and dominate the battlefield. Additional upgrades include Modified Configuration (re-roll a failed Repair roll), Adrenaline Rush (+1 Firepower while in-the-red), and Commander Hugo Christern.

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Tiger II Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Alternate Finale Pack #1
description: The first Alternate Finale Pack, providing a completely different finale to your Career experience. Adds 14 new cards to your Career game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Black Powder Epic Battles: The Waterloo Campaign – Wellington's British Starter Set
description:
Sunday, 18 June 1815; on an unassuming rain-soaked field in Belgium; two great generals of the age finally met in battle. The climactic clash of the Hundred Days campaign wrought the end of around twenty years of continuous warfare on the continent, and with it an end to the reign of Napoleon. The Battle of Waterloo, arguably the most famous battle in all military history, provides more than a fitting subject for our second foray into the 'Epic' scale of wargaming. Black Powder Epic Battles: Waterloo is here.

Wellington's British Army starter set provides a solid core of a British army serving in the Hundred Days campaign - 10 units of line infantry, 3 units of 95th Rifles, units of each type of heavy cavalry (Heavy Dragoons, Scots Greys and Household Cavalry) and light cavalry (Hussars and Light Dragoons), ably supported by 16 pieces of artillery and brigade commanders. Also included is an MDF building of La Belle Alliance Inn and a bespoke A5 softback rulebook with Napoleonic specific content.

—description from the publisher

name: Myn Pikkewyn
description:
Myn Pikkewyn (Afrikaans for: "Mine Penguin") is a family-friendly fun board game where fish-hungry penguins help you to mine precious metal nuggets from a floating iceberg. These nuggets are used to fulfill contract cards, earning players victory points. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

The game consist out of a game board in the form of a giant floating iceberg. On the iceberg is 30 faced down nuggets to be mined. Each player have 4 plastic penguins as the maximum number of workers per round. Other components are action cards, contract cards, precious metal nuggets and resources.

At the start of every round, players take turns to place their available workers (penguins) to either harvest resources or mine nuggets on the iceberg through worker-placement. Once enough penguins(as indicated per mining tile) are placed on a mining tile in the iceberg, the precious metal may be mined. At the end of each round, players recall all the penguins, who bring their mined nuggets and resources back with them. Resources may be used to purchase action- or contract cards. The action cards may be played in the next round to upgrade mining skills or to increase the players penguin colony by adding additional (to a maximum of 4) penguins. The nuggets of precious metals and contract cards are kept until the end of the game.

Once all the tiles on the iceberg is mined, the game ends and the players apply their nuggets of precious metals to their contract cards, earning victory points for each completed contract. The player with the most victory points win the game and is declared the Myn Pikkewyn.

name: The Battle of the Hydaspes
description:
An expansion for Avalon Hill's Alexander the Great published in the company's in-house magazine "General" volume 12 issue 4 in 1975.

Included a cardstock counter sheet and a 3-page article on the battle with setup/victory conditions for "The Battle of the Hydaspes"

name: Primordial: Creatures of Pandemonium
description:
Mages, the land of Cathaira needs your help!

The last Celestial War with the Titans of Yarre` has left the landscape changed. Entropic Energy spreads at an unprecedented rate and the Creatures are becoming volatile and unpredictable as their environment shifts. They are vital to the health of the continent and must be preserved!

Each of you are masters of a Sanctuary, which Entropic Energy cannot easily penetrate. Your distinct prowess and your historical harmony with the land of Cathaira means that only you can Tame these Creatures! Can you manage to offer them protection, and return the presence of Entropic Energy to normal levels?

Honor is to be had, and each of you has the opportunity to be held in the highest regard by mastering the use of Energy, advancing in knowledge, and Taming these Creatures who need your help!

Primordial: Creatures of Pandemonium is a mid-weight, euro resource management game that is played over rounds. During the game, Mages will traverse the landscape, tame mythical creatures, learn skills, become more proficient in Energy use, and manage a Sanctuary to earn more honor than other Mages.

Primary mechanisms of the game include resource management, tableau building, skill-tree progression, and area movement. Additionally, the game features a unique communal bag building element!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Ladder Climbing, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Horrorclix: Predators Seven Figure Collector's Set
description:
The most dangerous hunters in the galaxy are training their young here on Earth. Upon their arrival in the Antarctic, tney learn that their target prey—the fearsome Aliens—have been released by human explorers. Not only that, but the Predators are without their full complement of weapons. Now these young Predators are fighting on two fronts—with deadly, all-new rules.
This second of three Alien vs. Predator HorrorClix sets expands your game with evertyhing you need to bring AVP to your game table.
Whoever wins... we lose!

—description from the back of the box

Released with The Lab expansion set, this set contains 6 Predators and a human Apprentice Predator, as well as Plot Twist cards, victims, and a map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Homunculus
description:
You and your fellow players are a Wizard's minions, imps spawned out of a vat. While your Master is away adventuring, you have free run of his workshop. Experiment with his magical adjuncts to serve your Master better than your fellow minions, and you will be well-rewarded when the Wizard returns. Or you COULD just get rid of your competition by doing away with your vat-mates altogether!

Homunculus was first published in The Game Crafter Community Anthology, and is a small game created with a constrained set of components from that anthology.

In phase 1 of each round, each player takes turns rolling 8 dice, and using them to activate 1-3 activities in the Wizard's Workshop, each providing some number of element cubes. When all players have gained cubes, phase 2 begins, and players simultaneously take Actions to move up the Favor Track, or to attack each other!

To win, you must either destroy all your fellow vatmates, or have the most Favor (and at least 4 Favor) when the Wizard returns after 6 rounds.

Homunculus is a fast and cutthroat game of vicious minions!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dice Forge: Piranha Princesse
description:
New promotional card offered to the winners of a tournament organized at the "Festival Ludique International de Parthenay" (FLIP).

This card was created to honor Piranha, the winner of the 2021 French Dice forge championship.

RULES :

When you buy this card, you gain as many victory points as the number of completed rounds multiplied by 2. AND THEN you can make a normal forge (with any number of faces) with the gold you have + a bonus of the number of remaining rounds in gold, multiplied by 2.

So :
Win 2 X (past rounds) victory points
AND
Forge with a bonus of 2 X (remaining rounds) golds

name: Babylon 5 Collectable Card Game: The Great War – Opposition Factions Starter Deck
description:
Opposition Factions
60 Card Supplement Deck
Not a Stand-Alone Starter Deck.

—description from the front of the box

THE GREAT WAR - The Babylon Project was our last hope for peace. It failed. The year is 2261. War has broken out between the ancient and powerful Shadow and Vorlon races. Like two giants fighting in a sandbox, neither side seems to care who gets crushed in-between them...

During this moment of crisis, what if Lord Refa had overcome Londo and set the course for the Centauri Republic? Or what if Neroon had gained the upper hand over Delenn? Find out by supplementing your decks with cards that make them playable as factions opposed to the B5 Ambassadors. Utilize new "Faction Leader" versions of Refa and Neroon as well as Earth's V.P. Clark and Na'Far of the Nam. Also included are cards and rules for playing games with multiple factions of the same race.

The Collectable Card Game brings to life all the action, combat and heroism portrayed in the climactic episodes of the Hugo award winning Babylon 5 series. Now internal struggles magnify the danger presented by external foes. YOUR actions will decide what happens next…

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Science Fiction

name: Guatafac: El punto G
description:
NEW GUATAFAC! DIFFERENT THEMES TO LIVEN UP YOUR PARTIES!

In GUATAFAC 3, you have 8 seconds to discover the deepest thoughts of your friends, family or even strangers. You can find 480 cards with different categories such as: chill, confession, hot and hangover, as well as "Truth or Dare" or "The freak".

Contents:
420 categorised cards (chill, confession, hot and hangover).
60 special cards ("Truth vs. Dare" and "The Freak").
1 free app to download.
Game rules:
Form a small pack of cards in the centre of the table, face down. The player who has not dipped for the longest time is called "Master Guatafac".

The Master of Guatafac will read the first card to the player on his left.

The player will have 8 seconds to answer: download our App "Guatafac" on Google Play or App Store to count them ;)

If you give the answers in less than 8 seconds and the Guatafac Master accepts them, you keep the card and win a point. After answering, you will be the Master. Then, it's your turn. Read a card to the player on your left and so on.

The first player to score 7 points is declared the GOD or GODDESS of Guatafac (don't forget to count them between drinks!).

End of the game: The player who finishes with the most "HOT" cards will have to give a lap dance to the player who finishes with the most "Chill" cards.

name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – Fireheart
description:
This supplement for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City provides a study of constructs, offering expanded rules for their creation, modification, and even re-animation. It examines enchanters' workshops, detailing new magic items and base modifications that aid in the animation process, and also includes a bestiary full of new constructs. Of course, much of the knowledge that was once lost still exists in the frozen ruins, so the book also features several scenarios set in the once-great factories where the art of construct creation reached its pinnacle.

—description from the publisher

name: Eirakuchotori
description:
Eirakuchotori is one of the main streets in Dadaocheng. It was the moment when Japan ruled Taiwan. Players play as the local merchants and send theirs helpers to the various buildings for gaining the special resources and Victory points. As the game ends, the player who gains the most victory points is the greatest merchant in Dadaocheng.

Eirakuchotori is a two player game and is the twist of the mancala mechanism.

In player's turn, players choose one of the two options to perform. 1. gain 1 rice and send 3 merchants to the street. 2. choose one building with your own mechant(s) and perform the power of the building.

When the game meets the conditions below, the game ends:

The returning slots are full.
There are 5 merchants deployed on the buildings.


—description from the designer

name: Risky ITZI
description:
Risky ITZI, It’z simple! It’z fast! It’z R-rated laughs! Risky ITZI is one of the newest creations from the award-winning duo that brought you TENZI, SLAPZI, ITZI, and PAIRZI. Risky ITZI is an easy to learn, fast paced card matching word game that rewards creativity and warped thinking. Quick, name a drink with bubbles that starts with “C.” If you said, “Champagne” or “Cola,” you pretty much know how to play. Risky ITZI is super-simple to learn, and super-fast to play! Be the first to get rid of your 5 letter cards to win. There’s not just one way to play Risky ITZI, there’s plenty of fun, “colorful” twists. Risky ITZI is a great choice for your next adult game night, party, girl’s night, road trip, or any other time you’re looking for fun, fast-paced entertainment. A ton of laughs went into making this game and we think you’ll get just as many out of playing it.

—description from the publisher

name: UNSCREWED
description:
Due to dwindling ratings, the Blammo! Network can only afford to keep one of their notorious Saturday morning cartoons on the air, but they can't decide which!
​
​You control the misfit characters from these cartoons in a televised fight to the death, concocting schemes and watching them go hilariously wrong. You'll try to out-scheme each other, using game changing Quirks, and an arsenal of cartoon weaponry to attack each other and survive a map that's out to kill you - all to keep your show from being cancelled.

The last player standing wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Worn Wanderers: Cast of Steel
description:
Worn Wanderers is the world's first Trading Pin Game, but more importantly, it's a game that you can wear! That means that you can play when and wherever you come across someone else sporting their Worn Wanderers character pins.

To play Worn Wanderers, you assemble a team of six unique characters, each represented by a beautiful enamel pin, and customize them with wearable cards that represent the weapons your characters use, the attacks they make, and the loot they guard!

The object of Worn Wanderers is to use your nomad’s attacks (represented by the cards you assign them) to defeat your opponent’s characters and steal the most loot. Beware, though! As you thwart characters’ low-level defenses, you’ll strengthen their resolve and drive them to use more powerful weapons against you to protect what few resources they have!

Gameplay consists of turns where you pick a member of your warband to attack an enemy character, with each dealing damage to the other. Stay alert though; it isn’t always about having the higher stats! The hardened survivors you battle may enlist their cohorts for powerful combo attacks, pierce your armor for extra damage, lay traps for your characters, or more!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up

name: Cussing
description:
The elegant game of Cussing

In this simple insult-battle party game, players take turns cussing one another using only the cussword cards in their hands. Everybody gets in on judging whose cuss was best. Winner takes the points.

name: Parachutes Over Crete: Heraklion
description:
German paratroopers landed on Crete in May 1941, hitting four drop zones defended by Australian, New Zealand and British troops, plus hastily-organized Greek regiments and often the armed Cretan populace. Our Parachutes Over Crete game covers the air landings at Maleme, Prison Valley and Rethymno; this new Campaign Study looks at the battle for Heraklion, the capital of Crete, defended by the British 14th Brigade.

Heraklion is a Campaign Study, a short book adding nine scenarios based on these battles to Parachutes Over Crete. To play these nine scenarios (which come with three battle games, too), you’ll also need Parachutes Over Crete and Road to Dunkirk.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Panzer Grenadier: New Zealand Division
description:
Between March 1941 and November 1942, the 2nd New Zealand Division fought in all the major battles in the Western Desert, Crete and Greece. After the victory at Alamein, the Kiwis helped lead the Allied pursuit of Erwin Rommel’s fleeing Axis army across Libya and into Tunisia.

New Zealand Division is a Campaign Study based on the operations of the 2nd New Zealand Division between December 1942 (the Battle of El Agheila) and May 1943 (the fall of Tunis). The New Zealanders, down to two brigades after the destruction of 4th New Zealand Brigade in July 1942, took a lead role in the Eight Army’s penetration of the Mareth Line in southern Tunisia and fought until the Axis collapse.

New Zealand Division adds 10 new scenarios to An Army at Dawn, split into two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. This being an Avalanche Press product, there’s also the background story of the battle. It requires only An Army at Dawn to play all 10 scenarios.

New Zealand Division also includes 88 die-cut and mounted pieces showing New Zealand troops – including the famed 28th Maori Battalion – in their own unique color scheme.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Journal 29 Oblivion: Interactive Book Game
description:
Journal 29 Oblivion is a unique book game where you can solve puzzles and submit your answers online to get the keys to move forward in the story. To solve the puzzles, you need to think out of the box. You can write, draw, search, fold pages, combine different methods and try to get those puzzles right. Journal 29 Oblivion is a 110 pages physical book with over 40 puzzles to solve.


It is not necessary to have solved Journal 29 & Journal 29 Revelation to enjoy Journal 29 Oblivion.

name: The Gallery
description:
The Gallery is an 18-card game where players are curators trying to secure the best and most expensive paintings for their Galleries. With a limited hand, players can draw cards, trade from the market, or place your paintings in their gallery for end-game points and powerful abilities. But Curator beware, your Gallery has limited space, and you can only place 4 paintings at a time! The game ends when the limited deck is depleted and the player whose Gallery is worth the most, wins the game!

The Gallery is a free Print and Play game designed for 2-3 players.

–description from designer

name: LA-1
description:
Most detective work done in the city of LA-1 takes place under the perpetual dark clouds that still linger from the bombs. Even so, you plan to work together to gather clues, interrogate suspects, and go on stakeouts in a world that is divided by class and dominated by status. Use your skills to solve the case before the all-consuming darkness closes in forever.

In the story-driven, co-operative adventure game LA-1, you take on the role of detectives working for Mace & Doyle Investigations who are helping one another to resolve cases in the post-apocalyptic city that was once Los Angeles. Each case can be played individually or as part of a campaign. Because of the multiple cards that can send investigations in different directions, it's possible to play each case more than one time, having different situations and outcomes each time.

—description from the publisher

name: Peninsula
description:
Peninsula is a challenging and very strategic flip & write in which you are drawing the map of a fictional island.
You draft symbols and draw them on adjacent hexes of your architect token, while offering symbols to your competitors to draw.
Try to build an infrastructure, so your architect can move more efficiently over your map and stay flexible. Draw symbols, which increase your victory points and fulfill contracts along the way with your drawn patterns to please the monarch of your Peninsula.
The winner is determined, by points for the most efficient peninsula after the last symbol card is drafted.

The novel mechanism is that you cannot draw anywhere but only on adjacent hexes to your architect token. This forces players to move at the right time to the right place, otherwise players run out of hexes where they can draw new symbols.

Check the link below to get notified of our coming crowdfunding campaign.
mechanics: Area Movement, Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wolf
description:
WOLF is a solo Roll and Write game about the last months of the Battle of Atlantic in WWII, in which you are in command of a type VII U-Boat fighting for survive to an attack from an allied convoy decided to sink your submarine.

The game is played on 2 pages. You need 12 6-sided dice and a few of 8 m.m. cubes or pencil and eraser.

You reach victory when you have destroyed all the 6 enemies or escape definitely from their fire.

You lose the game when you have lost all the Hull points of your U-Boat.

North Atlantic. May 1943. You are in command of a type VII C U-Boat. You have just attacked a convoy of merchant ships with your wolfpack, but the revenge of the allies has been so brutal that 41 of 50 submarines have been sunk in the battle. As a result, you have been left isolated but intact, taking on the challenge of reaching safe harbor in the Bay of Biscay before being destroyed by an enemy fleet hunting your boat. You still have 10 torpedoes, the anti-aircraft guns and the morale of your crew to face the threats and survive the siege in which you have been involved.

Wolf is a solitaire game in Roll and Write mode that recreates the scenario of the Battle of the Atlantic, during World War II, when the "wolf pack" was losing its effectiveness due to technological and strategic advances by the allies.
Your mission is to cross the hexagons map from top left to top right before losing all your Hull points or losing power Battery points. Another way to achieve victory is by destroying the 6 enemies that siege your boat.

COMPONENTS
You will need 6 six-sided dice for the Action Dice; 2 6-sided dice for Threat Dice and 4 6-sided dice for Torpedo throwing.
Because it is a Roll and Write game, it can be played using a pencil and eraser or red and black marker and laminated game sheets. 8 millimeters of 2 different color cubes can also be used. Game sheets 1 and 2, plus this set of rules, are also required.

GAME SHEETS
Game sheet 1 displays the health status of your U-boat, i.e. Hull, Electric and Diesel tracks, as well as the Torpedo Room, Torpedo Tubes and the Battery . There are also spots to place Action and Threat dice.
On game sheet 2 you will find the Threat Chart, the Hexagons Map and the Tiefenmesser, Depth Indicator.

—description from designer

name: Three Dice Horse Racing
description:
Sports replay game of flat racing using real horse statistics and three dice.

Races take place over 4 to 7 rounds depending on the length of the race and, for each horse, the three dice generate a movement factor to which modifiers are applied to take account of the horse's qualities and whether it favours the early, middle or closing stages.

The system allows for starting odds to be generated for historic races based on actual results or, if pre-playing a race before the event, using official horse ratings.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Scum of Kilforth Promo Cards
description:
Three promotional cards from 1815, Scum of the Earth: The Battle of Waterloo Card Game that expand Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game


Forest: Cobman Buttons (stranger, noble)
Item: Brown Bess (item, weapon)
Plains: Torrential Rain (event)


Included in Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 2
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dig it Up!: Crack the Crate
description:
When the last of the dragons vanished, terrible Darkness spread across the land. Now the only hope the Kingdom of Valoria has is in an ancient prophecy that whispers of hidden orbs that hold the secret of ringing back the dragons and defeating the Darkness. Now it's up to you and your team to work together to save a precious dragon egg before the Darkness finds it. Crack the Crate and you will unlock the secrets of the dragons. Do you have what it takes to overcome the challenges, break the curse and discover a new breed of dragon that will save the kingdom?

This interactive, one-time-use game lets you merge the excitement of experiential escape rooms and Dig It Up! excavation projects into one exciting group activity! Work together with friends and family to save a precious baby dragon egg and keep darkness from spreading across the land. Do you have what it takes to overcome the series of challenges, unlock the secrets of the dragons and break the curse?

--description from publisher

name: Wargamer's Guide to Stalingrad
description:
A 65-page supplemental booklet for the Avalon Hill wargame, Stalingrad. Contains variant rules plus strategy and analysis articles. Recently reissued in PDF form with an afterword by James Lowry.

User Summary
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Fox Den Gaming, Guidon Games, Panzerfaust Publications

name: Special Ops Issue #10
description:
Special Ops #10 has ten articles, two ASL scenarios and two ASLSK scenarios, The magazine also features the game Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2.

Featured articles cover Front Toward Enemy, Iron Curtain (with additional scenarios), Last Blitzkrieg, Panzers Last Stand, and more. There are also a ASL SK article and a couple ASL articles, including a preview of the upcoming HASL covering Marco Polo Bridge.

Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2, originally published by Bonsai Games, is a quick playing eastern front game. The game has one map, eight pages of rules, 12 cards, and 60 1" counters.

name: Unstable Unicorns: Respawn Unicorn
description:
Respawn unicorn is a new mini in the Unstable Unicorns Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.

Card text:
Magical Unicorn card
When this card enters your Stable, you may DRAW a card.
If this card is sacrificed or destroyed, you may DISCARD 2 cards, then bring this card from the discard pile into your Stable.

name: Legends of Draxia: Monsters of Nairu
description:
Terrifying Boss Monsters have descended upon the lands of Nairu, and the call has gone out for Heroes to slay them – for fame and fortune, of course.

Monsters of Nairu is the second expansion to Legends of Draxia board game, adding a semi-cooperative element as players work together to defeat persistent Boss Monsters that modify basic game rules.

To aid Heroes, Monsters of Nairu also adds a new deck of Mercenaries cards which produce resources and provide additional Victory Points.

–description from publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Engine Thieves: The Andrews Railroad Raid of 1862
description:
This game recreates the situational challenges of charismatic Union spy, James Andrews, and his band of Union raiders just as they have arrived incognito in Marietta, GA from TN and are making final preparations to steal "The General," a Confederate engine with a tinder and 3 boxcars. Their plan is to travel north to meet up with Union General Mitchel's force heading to attack Chattanooga. Their assignment is to burn bridges, tear up track, and sever telegraph wire along the way so that reinforcements and supplies cannot be brought up from Atlanta. This is not an easy task since there is only a single line of track and extra trains are unexpectedly heading south to Atlanta carrying people and supplies! Meanwhile, Confederate railroad-men Fuller, Murphy, and Cain did not take the train theft very well and began chasing the "engine thieves" (as Southern newspapers referred to them)- first on foot, then by pole car, and finally on several trains.
