Can you fare better than the original raiders, all of whom were captured and some were hanged, and meet General Mitchel in Bridgeport with the mission accomplished?

The Raiders player must decide, in 15-minute increments, what Actions they want to accomplish, all the while keeping an eye on the train's wood supply and planning stops to replenish it. With the trainmen and a train from Marietta in hot pursuit, the player must negotiate southbound trains, Station Challenges, and Encounters with Station workers and suspicious citizens, all deep behind enemy lines and surrounded by Confederate Units. Sometimes all that will save the group from disaster is Andrews' Persuasive ability!

The raiders player begins a turn by choosing 15 minutes worth of Action cards, in order, to move, damage track, burn bridges, cut telegraph lines, resolve challenges and encounters, initiate combat, and more. The game’s bot controls the dogged pursuit of the trainmen and the movement of the southbound trains. The Raiders player must be careful to not use up too much wood in their tinder or allow the Alert Level to rise high.

The game ends when the Raiders player either passes through Chattanooga and reaches Union General Mitchel in Bridgeport, must abandon the stolen train, all Raiders are killed or captured, or the time track reaches 4:00pm. The Raiders player wins by accumulating a net of at least 22 Victory Points. Victory Points are mostly gained by reaching Bridgeport by 4:00pm, burning bridges, cutting telegraph wire, damaging track, and eliminating Confederate Units. The Raiders player loses Victory Points for each Union Raider captured, hanged, or killed.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Trains, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ivion: The Ram & The Raven
description:
Ivion combines the intensity of a fighting game with the strategy of deck-building card games to create an experience unlike any other. In Ivion, your deck IS your character, and you build it from a variety of classes and specializations. Each character type has numerous cards from which to choose, along with wildly different playstyles. Mix and match them to create your own, unique character!

Upon the field of battle, crush your opponent with various strikes, stabs, slashes, spells, and other mayhem at your disposal. Be careful, though, as they have numerous ways to block, dodge, parry, fizzle, and disrupt your assault. Only one can be the victor, and the battle will be bloody!

In Ivion: The Ram and the Raven, protect your clan as the stalwart Steward, or fulfill your oath as the enigmatic Watcher. Fully compatible with all other Ivion products.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Hackers
description:
Hackers is a quick & punchy print-and-play card drafting & hand management card game for four players, themed around the 1995 film of the same name.

Players draw, play and swap cards to hack the planet, at the end of the player with the most data wins!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #62
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #62 was published in April of 2022.

Table of contents:

Features

Harpoon Scenario: Hunt for a Queen

The Helge Ingstad / Sola TS Collision: An Analysis

Søværnet -The Danish Navy in WW II

Naming Chinese Warships

CaS Scenario: Operation Tunnel - The Charybdis Action

DoB Scenario: The Lüders Affair

Ships and Aircraft of the Ukrainian Navy and Air Force

Annexes C1, D1, D2a, and H2 for Ukraine

Rule Changes and Corrections

Harpoon Q&A: SAMs Against Passing Aircraft

Small Rule Change in DoB

Product Updates

Scoutbush Publications

Book Reviews

French Warships in the Age of Steam 1859 - 1914, by Stephen Roberts

French Armored Cruisers 1887-1932, by John Jordan and Philippe Caresse

Modern Taiwanese Air Power, The Republic of China Air Force Today

by Roy Choo and Peter Ho

Modern South Korean Air Power, The Republic of Korea Air Force Today

by Robin Polderman
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Autobot Megatron
description:
Promo card given away at GenCon 2022 head-to-head challenge.

Autobot Megatron is a 5-cost Robot that is both an Autobot and a Decepticon, but is an adversary to neither. He provides 3 power at 5 range, and has a Block protecting all characters. For 1 Energon, he can teleport target character to any space.

name: Admiral Zheng He: Sailing Alone
description:
Admiral Zheng He: Sailing Alone is a small, solitaire expansion for Admiral Zheng He consisting of just 18 cards and 4 pages of rules, much of it historical background.

You as a Trader must contend against three other Traders who play effectively, but using simple rules.

You must also contend, for the first time with Pirates and Ambushes, that can arise at particular ports without notice. Voyager beware!

You can even add these events to the multi-player game if you wish.

-description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Travel
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Nachmund – Rift War
description:
Haarken Worldclaimer, Herald of the Apocalypse, leads one of the mightiest traitor hosts every assembled. His mission, ordained by Abaddon the Despoiler himself, is to smash aside all Imperial resistance and claim the Nachmund Gauntlet in its entirety. This lawless place is home to pirates, xenos, traitors and renegades – yet Nachmund is strategically vital to the Imperium of Man, for it remains the most stable route known through the Great Rift. Should it fall, contact between Terra and the Imperium Nihilus would be all but lost.

The Imperium cannot afford to lose the Gauntlet, but its forces are already exhausted and overstretched. Even as the systems around the southern end of the Gauntlet are reinforced, sedition begins to take hold, and no amount of heroism and sacrifice may be enough to throw back the Worldclaimer...

In this 88-page hardback book, you'll find:

- The story of Haarken Worldclaimer’s conquest of the Nachmund Gauntlet, including the siege of the Chaos Knight world Dharrovar, and the Imperium’s attempts to resist them at all costs
- An in-depth War of Desperation campaign system for all modes of play – fight for control of three brutal War Zones, each with its own special rules and Legendary Mission
- Crusade rules to represent mobile Space Marine raiding forces and devoted hordes of Chaos Undivided, plus new arcane rituals for the Thousand Sons
- Additional rules content, including a Codex Supplement for the Castellans of the Rift Chapter of Space Marines, and Armies of Renown for Tzaangor-themed Thousand Sons and the Drukhari's Haemonculus Covens
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Season of War – Thondia
description:
As the Era of the Beast rages on, the savage realm of Ghur awakens and the bone-strewn plains of Thondia are consumed by war. A wellspring of primordial energy has burst its banks, spilling out and settling into the souls of mortals. Rival powers fight tooth and claw in the wastes, strange dreams echo with monstrous roars, and outbreaks of animalistic mutation transform common folk into wrathful beasts. Yet all this pales before the rise of a fierce new force in the cosmos: the mystical incarnates. When the dust settles, the Mortal Realms will never be the same again.

Season of War: Thondia is the first in a new series of expansion books for Warhammer Age of Sigmar, containing a mixture of detailed background lore, gripping story, and immersive rules for the conflicts shaping the narrative of the Mortal Realms.

Inside this 112-page hardback book, you'll find:

- An exciting narrative exploring the wild Realm of Beasts, as the Prime Huntress Yndrasta investigates the strange events transforming the land
- Detailed maps, history, and lore for Ghur, including a bestiary of the flora, fauna, and factions that make their homes on the alpha-continent of Thondia
- Rules for using the Krondspine Incarnate of Ghur, a powerful new unit type available to all factions, plus warscroll battalions and battleplans for recreating the story of Season of War: Thondia
- Realm rules for fighting in Thondia, including Realmsphere magic, monstrous denizens, and mysterious terrain, plus an open play battlepack for randomly generating your own Ghurish battleplan
- A narrative Path to Glory battlepack for founding your own Thondian outpost to explore the Realm of Beasts, plus Anvil of Apotheosis rules for creating Ghurish heroes
- A matched play Strife in Thondia battlepack including core battalions, battle tactics, grand strategies, campaign rules, and battleplans for matched play games
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game –  Phantom Ranger & Master Vile
description:
Promo cards given away at GenCon 2022 events.

Phantom Ranger and Master Vile are a 4-cost Hero and 5-cost Villain card, both for the main deck.

Phantom Ranger can attack to deal damage, or heal if negated. Master Vile gives your opponents stuns.

name: Mystery Games: Der Ausbruch aus Arazar
description:
In the storytelling and adventure game Mystery Games: Der Ausbruch aus Arazar, players try to break out of prison. How the story develops is entirely in your hands and your decisions! Will the escape succeed?

The players try to escape from prison together. You follow the trail of the escape legend Jack, who has systematically searched the prison for the weakest point with a plan. Any parts of the plan that proved useless he left behind in prison. Can you figure out which piece is missing, then implement Jack's last hints and freedom calls?

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Red Skies: P-38J Lightning Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of USA P-38J Lightning fighters and additional accessories to add to the core game.

The twin-engined fighter enjoyed its most extensive deployment and successes in the Pacific theatre. Though it could not outmanoeuvre the A6M Zero at sub-200mph speeds, its speed and rate of climb lent it the capability of making several high speed passes in combat, and Japanese aircraft armour was more susceptible than German aircraft to the tight groupings of the P-38s guns.

It was P-38s that engaged in the fighter-intercept mission that claimed the life of Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto, architect of the attack on Pearl Harbor. In this engagement, 16 P-38G lightnings met two G4M “Betty” transports and six escorting Zeros. Both transports were lost as well as two Zeros, for the loss of one P-38.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Flamingo
description:
In Flamingo, players seek to create the best flamingo habitat in their marshland to draw the most accolades from the Audubon Society and The Flamingo Specialist Group.

Over a variable number of rounds, players choose 1-3 actions based on the dice drawn. Dice are used to gain a flamingo, gain an egg, and improve skills in nesting, feeding, and flocking. Players have 35 actions for the whole game. In order to win, they must most carefully use their dice to achieve their goals in those five areas.

While the dice are random, players can control their use and develop a better plan each turn. Further, if two dice of the same color are drawn from the bag, they may be treated as any color.

In skills, players must use die values to make equations true, using skills in logic to aid teaching if game schoolers are interested. Additionally, there is a further math component of players using multipliers with various areas to score points for other areas.

—description from the designer

name: Beautiful Monsters
description:
Beautiful Monsters is a quick-playing 2-player card game about recruiting a team of monsters, dressing them up in accessories, and entering them into a beauty contest!

Multi-use cards: Each monster can have a varying number of accessories attached, and each accessory can be attached to augment the monster's traits -OR- enhance their personality. Scoring is tight, so this choice makes a world of difference!

Hybrid open/closed drafting: You can use monsters/accessories from your hand -OR- from the Shortlist/Market (public card rows). Either way, you always end up putting a card into at least one of those rows. Will you put junk there to limit your opponent's options, or will you take a risk by leaving something useful for you to use on your next turn?

Variable scoring criteria: Each game has a unique combination of scoring criteria shared by both players. 2 criteria award points based on which monster(s) you committed to it. A 3rd criteria modifies those points based on the composition of your opponent's team or even the Shortlist/Market. Focusing your strategy on one area means neglecting another, so pick your battles carefully!

Beautiful Monsters was created and self-published from the ground up by Chris Logsdon and Alix Lytton (aka Maow House). What started as a challenge to make a game in 1 month has become their first foray into their dream of bringing to life the games they want to see in the world.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Melding and Splaying, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: Elite
description:
These elite horror miniatures from Lobotomy 1 are now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included Daily Nightmare cards and the new monster cards compatible with Lobotomy 2! With this pack, you will be able to play two additional scenarios.

1 Big Bad Wolf,
3 Piggy
3 Nun
4 Angel

Miniatures in this set are the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own these miniatures, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Como me acuerdo de Salta
description:
In this tourist card game you can play vacation in the province of Salta, touring the most traditional tourist spots, take pictures of the best landscapes, enjoy the local cuisine and find the most representative handicrafts of each area.


En este juego de cartas turístico podrás jugar a vacacionar en la provincia de Salta, recorriendo los puntos turísticos más tradicionales, realizar fotografías de los mejores paisajes, disfrutar de la gastronomía local y encontrar las artesanías más representativas de cada zona.

name: #DrawnTogetherGame
description:
A strategic, competitive colouring in game.

Two players take turns to colour in areas, each player trying to make the finished sheet look like one of two objectives.

The game ends when every section is coloured in.

At the end of the game, the players show the sheet to an impartial judge (or post it on social media) to determine the winner - the person aiming for whichever objective the judge(s) think it looks most like.

Will you focus on your picture, or on ruining your opponent's? To succeed, you'll need a balance of aggression/defense, an understanding of how things might be percieved, and a smidgen of empathy.

Though the final result is determined by aesthetics rather than maths, this is essentially a perfect information abstract strategy game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Player Judge, Zone of Control

name: Bike Delivery
description:
BIKE DELIVERY:
A game of dice collecting and strategy

SET UP
Dice must be placed one by one on the 12 available squares of the first half of the board (the first 3 columns).
Then the players dispute the die who starts the game. Whoever is first has the right to choose the exit point before others, but whoever makes the first move is the player who came in second and so on.

HOW TO PLAY
On their turn, each player may move along the paths in 2 different ways:
1) Along the asphalt streets (gray): they may move 1 square at a time, ahead or to the sides.
2) Along the fast bike lanes (brown): 2 squares at a time, ahead or to the sides.
Each player may make their move and collect the die at the door with a number equal to the die in the center.
In this case, the Player has reached door #3 of the green house and may collect the die with number 3.

CHOOSING THE DICE
You must choose and collect dice, trying to pick up those which will provide the best total, and find the best trajectory to take them to their destination.
Choices must take into consideration the number and color of the dice, which grants special features to each of their number:
- Blue - Increase the number on the die by 1 (+1);
- Red - Reduce the number on the die by 1 (-1);
- Green - Allows an extra move (>1);
- Orange - Double the number of the next die to be picked up (x 2).
Dice that are collected go to each player's marker on the TALLY CHART.

END OF THE FIRST STAGE
When a player reaches any position of the 4th column - where there is a traffic light in the middle of the game board - the first stage of the game ends.
All the dice to the left of that column are removed and rolled again, completing the 12 squares of the second stage, from the 5th to the 8th column.
Players keep their current position and game resumes with the next player after the one who first reached the middle of the game.

IMPORTANT DETAILS
Picking up 2 dice
In some cases, a player's movement will allow them to pick up 2 dice (or more):
- When they pick up a green die and make an extra move, they may pick up a second die;
- If they reach a square in which both door numbers allow them to pick up both dice;
- On the fast lane, if they move 2 squares and pass by doors with the same numbers of the dice, they may pick up both.
Extra movement
Picking up 2 green dice only allows for 1 extra move. On the fast lane, picking up a green die also provides an extra move (i.e., a third move).
Changing direction
If a player wants to change direction during the game, they may spend one action/movement to make that inversion.
Doubled dice
The player who picked up an orange die will pick that one with its normal value and double the next die - even if that just happens on the next round. The die with doubled value will go to the gray area of dice tally.
Blocking
A player may not occupy the same square as another player. To move, they must go in a different direction. A player may also choose not to move.
Movement from the brown lane to the gray lane
When leaving the brown lane to the gray lane, a player doesn't lose the second movement. It may be performed in the gray area. To have a second movement in the brown area, the first movement must be in that lane as well.

ENDING THE GAME
To end a game, each player must have picked up at least 1 die of each color.
When a player reaches one of the arrival points, the game ends, and the other players may still play their last turn.
Besides the scoring from the dice, some Bonuses* may also be acquired by players:
- First in Stage 1 (+2 points);
- First in the Final Stage (+2 points);
- Player with the most dice (+3 points).

The total sum of dice and bonuses determines the winner. If they are tied, the winner is the player who collected the most dice.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Set-up

name: Car Wars (sixth edition): City Block Playmat 1
description: 2' x 2' Playmat/tile for Car Wars 6th edition. Playmat/tile can be combined with other mats/tiles to create battlefields to play Car Wars on. Playmat depicts city intersection with buildings, parking areas, and abandoned lots.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: UltraQuick College Softball
description:
This E-Book contains every college softball team in Divisions I, II and III, plus the NAIA. Over 1000 teams are included in the year book. The year book also includes a strength of schedule system so that you can accurately match up any team across seasons or divisions.

The purpose of this game is to quickly simulate scores and standings for softball leagues.
Each team is accurately rated for their hitting, pitching and defense as well as how they perform when playing at home and how they handle pressure situations. The combination of these ratings gives you a very accurate picture of each team. In addition to the team ratings, we also provide you with a quick and simple method for normalizing teams across eras, as well as a strength of schedule system. So, you can effortlessly determine the best team of all time if you choose, without worrying about any biases.

As the name implies, the games play out Ultra Quick! Now you can finally complete that full softball season on your tabletop with Ultra Quick Softball.

name: Moonstone (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
MOONSTONE
AT 822
In a parallel dimension sheltering a feudal world, a strange disease is spreading, changing the infected into aggressive and overpowered beings. An agent had been sent to investigate, but he disappeared. You will need to find this agent and bring him back, but also investigate the pandemic. And this huge blue moon, doesn't it finally have more influence than expected on this world?


PIERRELUNE
AT 822
Dans une dimension parallèle abritant un monde féodal, une étrange maladie se répand, changeant les contaminés en êtres agressifs et surpuissants.
Un agent avait été envoyé sur place pour enquêter, mais il a disparu.
Vous devrez retrouver cet agent et le ramener, mais aussi enquêter sur l’épidémie.
Et cette énorme lune bleue, n’a-t-elle finalement pas plus d’influence que prévu sur ce monde ?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Domina Anthology 2
description:
Limited edition slipcase compilation set featuring:


Margot: La fée
Latria
Night Clan

name: Admin Test Item without Image
description: Admin Test Item without Image

name: 1810: Bussaco
description:
1810: Bussaco simulates this battle in lavish historical details using the "Fix Bayonets!" tactical system. The map was carefully drawn based on multiple historical sources while the unit counters sport the colors of the uniforms that were worn by those combat units that day. Two decks of Leader cards help you determine the order of activation of each of the armies' formations.

This is Volume II of the Fix Bayonets! system, simulating combat at the battalion level between the armies of the Napoleonic Wars. The rules include an emphasis on Command and Control, a card driven initiative activation system and limit the use of informational markers. The combat resolution system differentiates between the effects of fire, infantry assaults and cavalry charges. While not overly difficult, learning the game can be a challenging but rewarding experience for all wargamers.

Counters are (mostly) Batallion (infantry), regiment (Cavalry), battery (artillery) & Leaders
Game System "Fix Bayonets!"
Hexes are 100m
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up

name: Orpheus Descends
description:
Orpheus Descends is a one-card game with only a few components.

You are Orpheus and have to manage your resources Anger, Sorrow, Harmony and Trust. With enough Harmony you will be able to sing again. Descend to the Underworld (the back side of the card) and persuade the ferryman to bring you to the other side with your singing and later on even Hades the god of the dead to let Eurydice go. With enough Trust, you will make it back to the land of the living.

Do you know how the story ends?
Hades agrees on the condition that you have to go first and Eurydice follows behind. But if you turn around on your way up she will have to stay forever.

name: NAMiMALS
description:
A party game version of that thing on the Internet where people rename animals like calling raccoons "trash pandas," skunks "fart squirrels," and snakes "danger noodles" and "nope ropes."

Players draw a hand of eight Hint Cards, so you don't have to think too hard, to create a name for the animal the judge that round, the Critter Critic, chooses off the Animal Card they drew.

The Critter Critic closes their eyes, or turns away from the table, so players are anonymously submitting their name creations. Once all have submitted a name, using from one to four Hint Cards, the Critter Critic reads each name out loud, as they lay flat on the table, to entertain everyone.

The top 3 choices are awarded points: 1 for Third, 2 for Second, and 3 for First. The scorecard is tallied. The role of Critter Critic passes left. Played cards are discarded, Hint Card hands replenished, and the new Critter Critic draws the next animal card, and picks an animal to be renamed.

The game ends when the pre-agreed upon number of Animal Cards in the deck runs out, and the final animal is renamed and scored. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Everbloom
description:
As the final flower unfurled its petal and the pollinating factions surged forth into every biome, the plight awakened Anteri, the legendary dragon of abundance. She begins her journey across the lands, bestowing her petals upon chosen creatures in every biome, transforming them into wondrous hybrids of flora and fauna. Recognizing the potential for rejuvenation, pollinators from every corner of the world converge on these hybrid beings to attract them to their respective habitats. The Everbloom has begun again.

In Everbloom, lead one to four pollinating factions: Bats, Bees, Butterflies, Hummingbirds, Lemurs, and Lizards to create an abundant habitat full of hybrid beings. Each round you'll send pollinators from your faction into the wilderness to landmarks in the hopes of attract hybrid beings to your habitat, eventually pollinating their flora in exchange for nectar and points. Along the way, you’ll complete blooms and gather nectar cards to make sure your habitat flourishes. After the final round, you will gain points for the nectar you've collected in each biome as well as your progress on the bloom track, the faction with the most points wins!

–description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Conquest: Global Shuffle
description:
Conquest: Global Shuffle is an easy to learn strategic card game of world domination. Centered around territory and military management, Conquest recreates the feeling of epic war games but is played in under an hour.

This turn based card game has players collecting Continent Cards in their play area while using their armies to defend, and attack other players through use of attack cards. These actions are also aided by the skills of history's generals,

On a player's turn they will begin by drawing cards from the central game deck, they then can take actions that include playing continent cards, building up their army strength, disrupting other players through action cards, or attempt to conquer opponents' continent cards.

As players take their turns, the world and player's armies, get larger, increasing player to player engagement. Players cannot actively defend an attack and must plan ahead before their next turn.

They game is over when a player's reaches a set global empire value, calculated by the number of completed continent sets they have.

—description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Take That

name: Werewolves: Night of the Vampires
description:
Wherever werewolves are up to mischief, vampires are not far away. This is also the case with the sequel to the communication game, Werewolves - Night of the Vampires, in which the bloodsuckers are loose. The proven game principle remains the same: Every night the vampires secretly devour a human. The following day, all players discuss who among them could be a vampire - and can lynch the most suspicious person after voting. Special characters like the insomniac and the investigator can unmask the vampires, but will people believe them the next day?

Werewolves - Night of the Vampires is stand-alone, but can also be combined with Werewolves New Edition to play with up to 48 people in three teams (vampire, werewolf, village).

—description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Orda Chess
description:
Orda is an asymmetric chess variant that pits the Mongol horde against the kingdom.

The Mongol horde is based around knight movement, with pieces like the horse archer that move like a knight but capture like a bishop, or the Kheshig which moves and captures like a knight and king combined, while the kingdom has the same pieces and opening set up as the standard chess army.

name: In Memory
description:
In "In Memory", you bought an old abandoned farm and with it a lot of pieces of the story of the couple who lived here.
The goal of the game is to experience the story of those who lived here - to immerse yourself into their narrative.

The game features 3 roll and write games.
Common for each game is that you roll two dice and get a shape and a plant that you will fit into a custom grid.

During play, you'll be presented with the story through tiny glimpses of notes tucked beneath other notes, of pictures that you find, and tough flashbacks.

-description from designer

name: 1 vs. 100 Electronic Game
description:
1 vs. 100 Electronic Game - Where you take on a new mob every time!

Based on the hit NBC game show, to stay in the game, the player must answer trivia questions and get every one right. Wrong answers from the mob eliminate them from the game, driving up the cash prize for the player. If the player can eliminate all 100 members of the mob, which will also be stacked with surprise opponents, such as geniuses, valedictorians, grandmothers and other game show champs, they will go home eight the $1 million top prize. However, if the player gets on answer wrong, the game is over and the mob will split the player’s winnings up to that point Ana new contestants gets to take on the mob.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Гравити Фолз: Битва воспоминаний (Gravity Falls: Mabel Album)
description:
Returning home from Gravity Falls Mabel discovers that all photograps in her memorabilia album is mixed, and now she desperately needs your help.

Before the game split up in two even teams, shuffle all photographs and put them randomly in 4x4 grid. Shuffle all quest cards and reveal the top one.

On your turn you may flip one card, if the hero or symbol on the flipped card match with the one on the quest card you may go again, if not your turn is over.

First team to have all 7 heroes or symbols corresponding to the quest card, win that card.

Team with most quest completed wins the game.

name: Soiled
description:
In Soiled you go through an entire year attempting to grow vegetables for points.

Seeds are gotten from a shared deck which is shuffled and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

After a first player is chosen, they can perform 3 actions to plant, water, and harvest plants into your garden basket.

Each card has a plant power that can help your garden grow, or attack your opponent to harm theirs.

Play passes to the left. after everyone has had a turn, the round is over. All players will grow all of the plants they can with a growth token. 1st player then passes left.

Use strategy and combos to your advantage to push your garden to its best and win the game!
mechanics: Action Points, Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Medusa Oschophoria
description:
After the exile of MEDUSA in a distance, the gods POSEIDON and ATHENS stood between them and fought a new competition to discover which of the two island is the most acclaimed god in Greece. So ask for the help of the god DIONÍSIUS and together they created a THEATER FESTIVAL to mark the beginning of winter entitled OSCHOPHORIA.
They invited the greatest artistic producers in Greece to represent them and thus, PRODUCE a GREAT THEATER SHOW. And for this dispute to become more fierce, the gods create an unquestionable rule: 'THE SCENARIO used in productions must contain perfect sculptures'. And for that, it will be necessary that NOBLE ACTORS SACRIFICE themselves in great pose and style, facing MEDUSA on their island to be PETRIFIED. And later these statues must be RESCUE and linked to the great show.
Other gods would also like to participate in this event helping producers with specific powers.

You'll have up to 15 turns to create the best show. At the beginning of the game, you must choose whether to defend the interests of Athena or Poseidon. Your choice will determine which benefits you get at the start of the game. The game will have a maximum of 15 turns, which may decrease depending on the perks earned during the match. Managing your time during the match will be essential to build the minimum necessary to score. At the end of the game, the player must have the minimum necessary to count the points.
Each player will have four meeples to move around the board, collecting resources distributed in nine factories. You will also be able to collect cast cards, mask cards and also petrified statues on the island of "MEDUSA".

The roll of the dice will serve to create the resources in the factories and also to make the movement of the four producers.

To take an actor to the island of "MEDUSA", just enter with your meeple in the place destined for this. And to rescue a statue of your petrified actor, the player must have another actor hired and also a mask activated. To hire actors and activate masks it will be necessary to allocate the correct components to each card.

On the board there is a space for market transactions between players. And some houses of movement, called squares of Dionysus. When stopping at these squares, the player will receive resources in gold. With this gold you can offer and receive help from other gods. Every time the player receives 3 gold, he must advance one turn on his turn track.

The game ends when the first player reaches the "0" square on the turn track. And the winning player will be the one who scores the most points with their hired squad cards, rescued statues and resource filling on their individual show sheet (chosen at the beginning of the game).

The sum of this score will show which player manages to perform the best show in honor of the chosen god. And if there is a tie, art always wins and all players share the victory.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Citytrip Brugge: tspelopdewagen Promo
description:
tspelopdewagen is a promo-card that is given to players whom buy the game directly from the designer/publisher at fairs for instance. tspelopdewagen is an actual game shop in Bruges.

tspelopdewagen is an alternative location that belongs to the buying souvenirs - category. So it can become your starting point or one of the locations for mission card 6.
mechanics: Bingo, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Napoleon in Egypt
description:
Napoleon in Egypt is a two-player, card-driven, operational wargame that allows you to recreate the French campaign in Egypt and Syria, from the landing of the French troops to the surrender of General Menou on August 31st, 1801. The game draws inspiration from other top-selling CDGs like Here I Stand and Twilight Struggle. A good and fast-playing introductory wargame thanks to its tight ruleset with few exceptions, the game will also please the veteran wargamers with 100 cards dripping with flavor, challenging players with the hand management every CDG fan has come to love!

—description from the publisher

name: Die geheimnisvolle Hütte in den Bergen
description:
You have come across a seemingly uninhabited mountain hut in the Alps — and stepped into the middle of a mysterious criminal case.

Die geheimnisvolle Hütte in den Bergen is played in a team of 3-7 people, one of whom takes on the role of the game master. The game master tells the crime story and guides the other players step by step through the adventure and the puzzles using the game master's booklet. They know the solution to the current puzzle and can decide whether to give the players hints or not. It's even possible to switch the game master from puzzle to puzzle, giving everyone a chance to solve puzzles as the game progresses.

Many of the puzzles are designed to spread information evenly among players. To solve these puzzles, the co-operation of all players is mandatory. The game ends when the players have reached the exit of the mountain hut. The time elapsed up to that point and any penalty minutes result in the final score.

name: Rune Rite
description:
In Rune Rite, your goal is to summon the most mystical energy while performing your ritual! You do this by reading Runes to generate powerful Glyphs and by etching those Glyphs into your Altar.

Rune Rite is a flip-and-write build-your-own polyomino game in which you use playing cards to produce shapes that you’ll draw on your player sheet. To win, you’ll need to score the most points by arranging non-matching Runes in specified areas, and by arranging matching Runes in large clusters.

description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Layering, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building

name: Battle of the River Wkra 1920
description:
The Battle at the Wkra River took place in August 1920 during the Polish-Soviet War (1919–20). It was an important part of the Battle of Warsaw, during which Polish forces managed to repulse the Soviet armies marching on Poland's capital. During the Battle at the Wkra River, Władysław Sikorski's Polish 5th Army fought against numerically superior Soviet forces (three Soviet armies); yet, they succeeded in halting the Soviet advance, forcing them to retreat. During this battle, Polish 5th Army tied the three Soviet armies, making it impossible for them to reinforce the Soviet assault on Warsaw. Thus, Poles foiled the Soviet plan to capture the capital of Poland and advance further to the west of Europe to spread communism.

The game consists of:


map
216 die-cut counters
basic rule set (in Polish and English) – pdf version in Polish can be downloaded for free from the publisher's store
scenario specific rules (in Polish and English)
two scenarios of identical length but different victory conditions
additional aids for players (combat tables, reinforcement tracks, etc.)
one d10 dice


Additional info for players:


no. of players: 2
time: up to approx. 8 hrs
age: over 12
difficulty – easy
playing solo is possible but all information concerning Polish and Soviet units will be available to the solo player (i.e. no fog of war, no bot system, etc.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Quick 6 IV Scenario Pack
description:
Designed for the participants of the 2021 West Coast Rumble, these six scenarios for ASL are designed for minimum set up time, resulting in maximum playing time.

Q19 – Raff’s Ruffians: Diersfordt, Germany, 24 March 1945, Germans v. Americans, Estimated Playing Time 2 hours 43 minutes

Q20 – Boxcloth: Otto Island, Apamama Atoll, 23 November 1943, Japanese v. Marines, Estimated Playing Time 2 hours 4 minutes

Q21 – Hold Pokhlebin!: Pokhlebin, Russia, 5 December 1942, Germans v. Russians, Estimated Playing Time 3 hours 24 minutes

Q22 – French Spirt: Oise-Aisne Canal, France, 5 June 1940, Germans v. French, Estimated Playing Time 3 hours 45 minutes

Q23 – Campoleone Salient: Campoleone, Italy, 30 January 1944, Germans v. British, Estimated Playing Time 3 hours 7 minutes

Q24 – Moldavian Precursor: Zgardesti, Moldavia, 3 July 1941, Romanians v. Russians, Estimated Playing Time 3 hours 21 minutes

ASL Map Boards Required: 2a, 6, 6a, 85, & m

name: Ritter Trenk: Ritterduell für starke Ritter
description:
Duel with opponents in a knight tournament and win pairs of items. Beware of the Black Knight, he gives you a negative point at the end of the game and you can only get rid of him with a little piggy card.

The game consists of two phases. In the first phase, players draw from the common deck faceup cards equal to the number of players. Then all players roll a die. Whoever rolls the highest chooses the card first, second highest - second, and so on. When all players select a card, draw the next cards from the deck and repeat the process.

The second phase started when there are no cards in the common deck. Whoever rolls the lowest number - goes first in this phase. Players choose an unpair card and could select an opponent to duel with him for the second card of this kind. Both players roll a die, and whoever has the highest result wins a duel. When all pairs are collected game ends, and players score victory points.

Pair of the same cards: 1 VP
Black Knight: -1VP
Piggy Card: 0VP, Disable Black Knight card
Red Knight Trenk: 2VP

name: Oneover
description:
Oneover is a game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board).



DefinitionsA group is a stone along with all stones one can reach from it through a series of steps onto adjacent stones of the same color.

The value of a group is one divided by the number of stones in it. For example, the value of a 5-stone group is 0.2.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell.

When the board is full, the player with the lower score wins. Your score is the sum of the values of your groups. If there is a tie, whoever has fewer groups wins. If the tie persists, White wins.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



NotesStrategy revolves around having as few groups as possible and having group values as uniform as possible. It is possible to follow these general principles without much actual arithmetic.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Dragons vs Unicorns Card Game
description:
Dragons vs Unicorns is an dual randomized game (dice and cards) where you can build dragon and/or unicorn armies.

You are able to take 5 actions per turn, which starts as either drawing cards from your respective pile or playing connecting cards. Each creature has either a 3-card or a 5-card version which are different colors that will connect seamlessly.

Once your army starts taking shape you can choose to Battle which will be the only action you can take on that turn. Once you have started a battle you must continue until either players attacked creature is defeated.

Battles consist of rolling dice to determine the amount of hit points weighted against your opponent. When individual cards are defeated they are flipped over. Once all cards of the either creature are flipped over, the opposing player gets those cards as points.

The game ends when either player can not build or battle and their card pile has been depleted. At the end of the game the players combine the defeated points earned and points of their surviving creatures and whoever has the most points wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Wolfenstein: The Board Game – Hans Grosse
description: Guten Tag! Are you ready for another encounter with Hans Grosse? The mighty enforcer, Wilhelm 'Deathshead' Strasse's personal bodyguard is armed with two chain guns and will be waiting for you! Can you win and send him running to his Mutti?
categories: Miniatures, Video Game Theme, World War II
publishers: Archon Studio, Bethesda Game Studios, MachineGames

name: Masters of Crime: Shadows
description:
You are undertaking a secret mission for criminal masterminds!

In Masters of Crime: Shadows, you plan to break into the Bachmann Gallery in Amsterdam in order to steal a famous painting — but to do that, rooms must be examined, security systems hacked, and puzzles solved. There are many ways to steal a masterpiece. Which one will you choose?

In addition to the game material, the internet is also an important part of the game: Google Maps, extra websites, and clever online research help with this exciting adventure in Amsterdam.
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Orp: The Market for Space Merchant Translators
description:
A wealthy alien has promised you riches beyond your wildest dreams if you can collect five of the items on their shopping list. There's only one issue: the wares of the market are only marked with Orpian symbols! You only know one symbol and must deduce the other players' tidbits of alien symbology to be the first to fulfill your wealthy client's request and profit from the intergalactic bazaar of Orp.

Instead of traditional hidden roles, every player knows the translation of one Orpian symbol. Players take turns asking each-other questions about their symbols or their meaning. They may also additionally ask a second question, swap cards with another player, or draw locked container cards from the deck. Once a player believes they have won, they will declare victory and then secretly check the results. If they have not won, they are eliminated from the game and play continues, so one must be fairly certain of victory before declaring it.

This game is a must-have for lovers of matrix logic puzzles, alien linguistics, trading, and social deduction.

-description from designer

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Sado
description:
Sado is an island off the coast of Niigata prefecture, Japan. It has never had trains (and likely never will), but it is a beautiful island and a fantastic place in many other respects. It would be even better if it had trains...

So the city council decided that Sado should have trains indeed, and gave a small budget to three companies to develop a rail network for tourists and freight on Sado, connecting the main ports (Ryotsu and Ogi) to the main tourist destinations and centers of (mainly agricultural) production.

AoS Sado doesn't deviate much from standard Age of Steam. It is a 3-player variant with a few twists and turns. Black cubes represent tourists, and consequently, these come in at the ports (Ryotsu and Ogi) only. Towns start with one cube each. And players/companies start with a little bit more money thanks to a government grant to promote tourism and the local industry (through railroad development). That extra money is necessary, however, as finances tend to be extremely tight in the beginning of the game.

-description from designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Tierrennen
description:
Ein lustiges Würfelspiel für und mit dem Nachwuchs.
Wer erwürfelt sich zuerst seinen Seehund und baut ihn zusammen? Simples Kinderspiel für zwischendurch.

Reihum wird gewürfelt, jeder Körperteil des Seelöwen hat eine Zahl (1-6). Die Würfelziffer bestimmt, welcher Teil des Seelöwen zusammengesteckt wird, wobei eine bestimmte Reihenfolge zu beachten ist. Schritt für Schritt wird der Seelöwe fertiggestellt. Wer zuerst alle Teile zusammengesetzt hat, gewinnt das Spiel.

English:

A fun dice game for and with the offspring.
Who gets his seal first and builds it together? Simple children's game for in between.

The dice are rolled in turn, each part of the sea lion's body has a number (1-6). The number of the dice determines which part of the sea lion is put together, following a certain order. Step by step the sea lion is completed. The first to assemble all the parts wins the game.

name: History of the Ancient Seas
description:
A special Kickstarter Master of the Seas version only be available during the Kickstarter Campaign.

All three games of the Series in one huge box.

name: Die of the Dead: The Ofrenda Variant
description:
It’s time to prepare your ofrenda, tonight is the Day of the Dead! Make your altar the most beautiful of all, decorate the borders with papel picado, shower it with marigold flowers and bring only the freshest bread, food and drink, so the souls of the deceased can rest and eat and drink, recovering their strengths in their long trip between the land of the dead and the living. As night falls and the moon rises, light the candles and incense, let your altar become a guiding beacon for the spirits going home.

The Ofrenda Variant takes the Die of the Dead dice, caskets and steps, and transforms them into a dice drafting game in which players attempt to make their altars the most appealing to their ancestors. Instead of putting dice in caskets players are drafting dice from caskets, to reprsent the bread, candles, incense and marigolds which will adorn their altars.

The Ofrenda Variant offers a puzzle based spin on Die of the Dead, for players who love the theme and beauty but prefer something less on the luck side of things. In order to enable more people to play Die of the Dead to celebrate Dia de Muertos this expansion also contains a solo mode, something only possible with the cerebral nature of this variant.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flying Saucers
description:
Flying Saucers is a strategy game in which 2-4 players have spaceships of different power and speed. Your task is to neutralize either all enemy ships or the enemy "generator" (which supplies all ships with energy). The battle is fought with the formation of energetic majorities; thus: a 2-FS neutralizes an enemy 1-FS, two 2-FS neutralize an enemy 3, etc. Neutralized FS remain as (impassable) space trash, but can be reactivated. Another scenario is collecting ore.

Flying Saucers has an expansion. This contains more scenarios such as the production of panels and the expansion of base stations, the abduction of the robot pilots and some exciting new spaceships.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Wandering the Whimdark
description:
Welcome to the Wandering the Whimdark, a solo journaling RPG engine that utilizes a Character Sheet, a deck of 25 cards (five different suits, with values from 6 to 10), three 6-Sided Dice, and this adventure source book. In playing this game you are taking on the role of a character who for their own reasons has chosen to embark on a journey through this wonderful and whimsical, wild and perilous world. You’ll have to use your skills not only to make your way through the Whimdark, but to survive the encounters it throws at you.

This is a game about telling stories. The Whimdark wants you to wander its overgrown trails, seek out new and interesting inhabitants, find lost things, confront your beasts. Know that as you wander, dangers lurk near, fight when you can, and run when you must. Not everyone makes it through the Whimdark…

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Carrera de Compras
description:
Grandma has returned from her rock tour and wants to show her grandchildren her delicious recipes. The grandchildren, four wonderful young people, endowed with unique abilities, have let the family ties that unite them vanish.

The Grandmother will try by all means that they return to share the old time love You must assume the role of one of the grandchildren and collaborate with the others to achieve a common goal.

Will they be able to fulfill Grandmother's legacy? Players start with a sum of money that must circulate around the supermarket to buy the products of Grandma's recipe. They must collaborate with each other to give the products to Grandma and thus win the game.

If any player cannot pay what is indicated on the board, the others will help him pay. In the event that a player runs out of money, they continue to play and their expenses are assumed by the other players.

If among all the players they cannot pay what is indicated on the board, they will lose the game.


La Abuela ha regresado de su gira rockera y quiere enseñar a sus nietos sus riquísimas recetas. Los nietos, cuatro jóvenes maravillosos, dotados de habilidades únicas, han dejado desvanecer los lazos familiares que los unen. La Abuela tratará por todos los medios que vuelvan a compartir el cariño de antaño.

Deberás asumir el rol de uno de los nietos y colaborar con los demás para lograr un objetivo común, ¿podrán cumplir con el legado de la Abuela?

Los jugadores comienzan con una suma de dinero debiendo circular por el supermercado para comprar los productos de la receta de la Abuela. Deben colaborar entre sí para darle los productos a la Abuela y de este modo ganar la partida.

Si algún jugador no puede pagar lo indicado en el tablero, los demás le ayudarán a pagar. En el supuesto de que algún jugador se quedara sin dinero, siguen jugando y sus gastos son asumidos por los demás jugadores.

Si entre todos los jugadores no pueden pagar lo indicado en el tablero, perderán la partida.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Budget Fighter
description:
The base game is a book and set of punch-out tokens that combine with ANY miniatures or grid maps you have from ANY game.

The modular system is designed for cooperative play with a large group of friends while being both budget friendly and allowing one to use some favorite game pieces that were either in storage or just never meant for gaming.

For instance you can play with Warhammer 40k, Dungeons & Dragons, and Star Wars mini figs all in the same game on a Heroclix map. The combinations are endless and easily supported by an easy to use system.

The game even supports basic play without any miniatures or maps in your collection.

Players choose teams from various classes and play games in either a cooperative or head-to-head fashion. Players can choose; Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Crusade, or Survival Mode.

In "Crusade" mode players occupy bases around a map over the course of several rounds. In Survival Mode players cooperatively fight against waves of AI generated and operated themed opponents such as zombies, or aliens, or the dreaded escaped zoo animals.

Bottom Line is this is a fun board game with endless replicability and options.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: The Artemis Project: Trial By Ice Promo Card
description:
Part of Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter Promo
Sometimes you find more than you set out looking for, when you brave an expedition into the frozen heart of Europa. Sometimes, you find a leader.

If you sent a colonist on an expedition and won first place, you may discard one Expedition badge and exchange that colonist for a Commander.

name: Runebound: Berło Kyrosa
description: Berło Kyrosa contains three additional card sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Berło Kyrosa, Legendarne Relikty and W czeluściach grobowca.

name: Runebound: Kult Runów
description: Kult Runów contains three additional card sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Kult Runów, Wędrowcy Pustkowi and Cienie Margatha.

name: Runebound: Awatarowie Kelnova
description: Awatarowie Kelnova contains three additional card sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Awatarowie Kelnova, Wybrańcy Kellosa and Siedlisko Smoków.

name: Appetite For Adventure
description:
The dinner rush has just started in the town of hamfort.

As the hungry customers file in, it’s up to you to send your heroes out into the wilds and retrieve the precious ingredients that your chefs will need to satisfy each and every patron in your restaurant.

At the beginning of each round, players roll their hero dice to form their hero pools, then take turns recruiting their heroes to send on expeditions to defeat the monsters in the 4 wild zones, or even send their heroes out into their restaurant to take new orders. Defeated monsters will award players with ingredients which will be used to craft delicious dishes and earn tips. After 10 rounds, the player with the most tips is declared the winner, and best chef in Hamfort.

Roll, plan, and cook your way to victory in this fast-paced dice placement game for 2-4 players. Simple to understand, and deep with strategy, Appetite For Adventure is designed to be perfect for casual and hardcore gamers alike.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Flashback: Zombie Kidz – Prologue Demo
description:
This prologue to Flashback: Zombie Kidz lets you visit a mini memory.

The Kidz have launched an expedition to retrieve a valuable gizmo, and getting back into he barricaded school was no easy task! Using the Flashback technology, reconstruct the day's events.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: Catan: Aufbruch der Menschheit – Der Schamane
description:
Sonderkarte zu Catan - Aufbruch der Menschheit
1 Schamanen-Karte
2 Regel-Karten

Spiel 2022 Promokarte, die es beim Tauschrauschspiel von Kosmos gab.

Kartentext:
In deinem Zug:
Bewege 1 deiner Entdecker bis zu 2 Kreuzungen, ohne dafür 1 Fell oder 1 Fleisch abzugeben. Gib diese Karte dann an deinen rechten Nachbarn weiter.

---

Promocard for Catan - Dawn of Mankind
1 shamans card
2 rules cards
Promocard from the Spiel 2022, which was handed out as a gift during the Catan Swapping Game at the convention.

Text on card:
On your turn:
Move 1 of your explorers up to 2 intersections without paying 1 hide or 1 meat. Then pass this card on to your right neighbor.

name: Fallen Flags
description:
In this game players invest in and manage railroad and other companies during the 1800s and early 1900s. Industry is dynamic with finance, and local municipalities grow depending on the economic activity in their immediate area. Players also compete against the plutocracy, a NPC.

COMPANIES
Like many train games companies are separate entities than the players. Company management changes depending on share ownership. Other companies, the government, and the plutocracy can also own companies. Companies get started with an IPO, after that share price is dependent on both industrial activity and share trades. Company management can involve managing railways, ships, wagons, and hiring professionals to provide the company advantages.

GOVERNMENT
The government is controlled by the player with the most votes. Votes come from not only other players, but from the public and the plutocracy as well. Certain actions impact the public's and plutocracy's opinion of the players which can change their vote. In addition to creating government run companies or investing public funds into private companies, the governor is able to change corporate and income taxes, outlaw or legalize labour unions, provide welfare payments with government funds, and hire and manage lawmen.

THE MOB AND THE UNION
These are 2 other entities that players can use to manipulate the situation on the map. Union stewards can harass company activity and attempt to gain higher wages for the public. The mob might also harrass companies, but can also come after union stewards. Lawmen can always attempt to stop gangsters, but can't interfere with union stewards unless unions are outlawed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Income, Investment, Loans, Ownership, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding, Voting, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Catan: Das Duell – Sonderkarte 2022: Sonja, die Schäferin
description:
Bonus Card for "Catan - das Duell"
Text on card: "Place Sonja between pastureland and hill country or between pastureland and mountains. Once in a turn you may swap 1 resource between the two adjacent land slots"

name: Greenland: A Fluffy Promo Deck
description: A promo deck of cards including 5 new animals (2 for south Greenland and 3 for north), 4 new daughters (one for each tribe), and 4 starting farm animals (3 dogs and a cat).

name: Little Mouse: Adventure game
description:
Join Little Mouse on his journey and discover the world!
Little Mouse leaves his hole and goes on an adventure.
He meets all kinds of other animals in the big forest and
is amazed by all that he sees. But then it starts getting
dark already... Are you able to bring Little Mouse home in
time? Then you’ll win this adventurous game!

Little mouse is an easy to learn childrens game, where players roll the dice to move their mouse over a track. Players try to get their mouse to the finish before the time runs out. The game can be played alone, or against each other.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Pintamonas
description:
Welcome to the world of PINTAMONAS, a playful experience where painting, fantasy and adventures coexist. During the game players take the role of heroes, each one represented with a model of a warrior, mage, rogue, ranger, paladin or warlock.

Heroes must explore the map and overcome challenges in order to win color potions. To do so, the will have to defeat creepy monsters and fight in desperate duels against other heroes. But that is not all, because randomly a magic storm of colors will hit this epic history. Only then players can get magical items, forge the cromatic crown or paint their bold characters.

RULES SUMMARY
Players play turns as follows:
1. MOVEMENT. The player rolls the die and moves his HERO on the map. If the HERO lands on any other square than a CITY, the player draws an ADVENTURE card. In cities, the player can roll again or rest. If a HERO lands on a square already occupied by another HERO, they could DUEL.
2. ADVENTURES. Another player draws a card from the ADVENTURE deck and reads it.
- ENCOUNTERS: The player rolls the die. If the number rolled is the same as or higher than the MONSTER's difficulty level, the player wins.
- RIDDLES: A question related with color and painting must be answered.
- TRAPS: Resolve the effect on the HERO (or player) and keep the card if it is a permanent card.
- MAGIC BOOM: Stop the game and start the CLOCK for painting.
3. MAGIC BOOM. In this pase players get their brushes and paint with the colors available in their inventories. While the CLOCK is running they can:
- CRAFT MAGIC. Each player may paint the HERO miniature.
- FORGE MAGIC ITEM. Players may paint two gems on the base of their miniatures. They must be two colors from different lands. They take a MAGIC ITEM card then.
- INSERT COLOR RUNE. Players paint with the colors available in their inventory on their COLOR CROWN boards.
4. DUEL. Each player rolls the die. The winner gets 1 GLORY token and deals wound or madness to the loser.

Once a player finishes the turn, then it passes to the player sitting on his left.

A player wins the game if his HERO has become a LEGENDARY HERO. For doing that he/her must forges 5 MAGIC ITEMS and complete the combination of the COLOR CROWN.

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Miniatures, Trivia

name: Alala!
description:
Alala was a war cry used by the ancient Greeks.

These rules are designed for recreating battles between the Greek city states during the Peloponnesian and Boeotian wars of the fifth-fourth centuries BC. They do not take into account the more varied troop-types of the Persian Wars or later Hellenistic period.

Game Concept

Games played with these rules are all about deploying phalanxes of Hoplites and getting them ordered and psychologically ready before signalling the advance to close with the enemy. Once the phalanxes begin to move in on each other there is little scope for tactical finesse or complex manoeuvre. Light troops and cavalry play a subordinate role — harassing and annoying the enemy and driving off enemy skirmishers.

-description from rules

name: Jester Card Game
description:
Jester is a "trick" based game, like hearts or bridge, using a standard 52 card deck with 2 jokers (Jesters). Players bid on the number of tricks they believe they can take in each hand.

Jester is one of the most enjoyable and sophisticated two player card games. It is a fairly straightforward game to learn, but the strategies are challenging and there are multiple modes of play that add to the fun.

A game consists of multiple hands and a cumulative score is kept. The score is based on the accuracy of the bidding as well as the number of tricks taken. Games can be very short, or quite long, as scores can increase or decrease based on the success or failure in any given hand.

Jester Rules

name: World Facts: 2nd edition
description:
The second edition of World Facts includes many more cities, countries and categories than the first edition. In addition the rules got simplified so that new players can join the game immediately.

World–Facts is an entertaining geographical guessing game for 2-6 players aged 8 and up. Does Canada or Australia count more inhabitants? Does Rio de Janeiro or Sydney indicate a higher average temperature? And does London or Rome have more annual rainfall? These are just a few questions, where the players need to find an answer. In doing so it is not necessary to know the exact values, but rather to estimate and compare them in between different countries and cities. Through the different categories of questions the game offers a lot of variety and excitement.

Another special feature of World-Facts is its internationality. Via translations of all categories into 5 languages, global topics and the frequent use of symbols, World-Facts overcomes the usual focus of quiz games on just one language and culture. Thus, World-Facts is very suitable for multicultural groups.

​-description from designer

name: Afritoria
description:
An eternal struggle rages amongst the animals in the breathtaking African nature reserves such as the Serengeti, Ngorongoro, Masai Mara, and Kgalagadi. Every animal, pack or herd wants a territory, fresh grass or juicy meat. A lazy or unattentive animal will be chased by other animals, who will claim this area as their new home. Also be wary of the roaming poachers. Luckily the rangers are also on the look out.

In this simple card game you and 1-3 other players try to gather the most points by scoring animal cards from your hand. Each animal has a nature reserve, strength and a worth. Strong animals are worth less than weaker ones. Simultaneously, everyone plays a card. The strenght of each animal played determines the order in which the players get to select a card from the market (which contains the same amount of cards as the amount of players). Only played animals matching the same nature reserve (colour) as those in the market allow you to take a card and score the animal played. If you cannot take a card matching your nature reserve, you draw a blind card and score no points. However, do you play a strong animal to be guaranteed of a card and points, or do you play a weaker animal which will give you more points, yet may allow the other players to take all the suitable cards from the market?

name: Wizards & Werewolves
description: Take on the role of either a wizard or werewolf and try to complete your objectives in three different game modes. These are variations of tag. The most advanced including role cards and different player powers. Light up bracelets, star stones, and the moon stone make the get extra exciting to play at night.

name: Warlord Chess
description:
Objective
To be last one standing or have the highest score when the game ends.

The Basics
In Warlord Chess players move, capture, check, and checkmate just like in standard chess. However there is no en passant or castling. Instead, special spaces on the board allow the pieces to make special moves.
Duration: Play lasts for 40 ROUNDS after which TIME’S UP.
Round: A round is counted after every ACTIVE (non-Mated) player has taken their turn.
Winning: If a player checkmates their last opponent, they win the game.
Otherwise after TIME’S UP all active players add up the points of the pieces they captured during the game.
The active player with the highest score is the winner.
If there is a tie, then the tying player with the most
checkmates wins. If there is still a tie, then all tying
players tie for 1st place.

name: Murder of a Musician
description:
MURDER OF A MUSICIAN

A murder has been committed in London’s famous Monastery Road Studios. Renowned saxophonist and songwriter, Roland “Stubby” Hackett, died during a recording session due to an allergic reaction, but initial forensic investigations have brought up clues to suspect foul play is at hand.

The evidence has been collected for you, and it's your job to piece it all together and work out who it was that killed Stubby.

Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice.

26 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find magazine articles, crime scene investigation documents, suspect statements, a parking ticket, police reports, 7" record sleeve, a loyalty card, phone/text records, a coroners report, a map, photographs and more.

SEARCH THROUGH A POLICE WEBMAIL - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the box, you'll need to access an online police officer's webmail to prove the suspects innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access!
You will be required to access the internet to view other important evidence linked to the case.

A difficulty rating of 4.5/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller.

name: Beetle Game
description:
The Beetle Game is a party game where players or teams draw pictures of beetles on a playing card containing 10 small squares.
On the roll of a dice, players can draw the Beetle body if they get a six, then if a 5 is rolled can then draw a head. Others numbers then permit other parts to be drawn. First to draw a beetle stops the game and points are tallied for the parts drawn. This proceed to the 2nd round and repeated until 10 rounds are drawn in the squares provided on the card. The winning team or player is the one with the most points after 10 rounds.

The game is also identified and included under the BGG entry for Cootie. This being the paper and pencil version of the well known plastic beetle pieces that are constructed with the roll of a dice

—user summary
publishers: G. N. Raymond, Universal Publications Ltd

name: サラウアバク(Sarau Abaku)
description:
-Phantom thief laughs, detective roars. The battle over the hidden treasure.

This is a mystery board game for two players in which the detective and the phantom thief can enjoy a brain battle over the treasure. Planning and production is led by board game designer Kengo Otsuka. Character designer Tatsuro Iwamoto(岩元辰郎), whose works include the "Ace Attorney" series, designed the characters for the cards.

The novel included with the game, which is a prequel to the main game, was written by Takeshi Yamazaki(山﨑剛), scenario director of the "Ace Attorney" series.
The well-crafted worldview is appealing.

The rules are simple. Turn over a card from a deck of your choice and place it in front of the treasure.
The phantom thief aims to steal the treasure, while the detective discovers who the phantom thief is disguised as.
The key is observation. Keep thinking, "Why did he put it there?" and keep thinking "Why did he put it there?
-Every choice you make is being watched by your enemies.

On the phantom thief's side...
Where is the real treasure hidden?
How and when should they steal it so that their disguise will not be revealed?

On the detective's side
How should the cards be arranged to protect the real treasure?
Who is the phantom thief disguised as among the six suspects?

Although what you do on your turn is simple, various thoughts intersect with each other.
It is a game of deduction and psychological warfare.

Planning and executive producer is board game designer Kengo Ōtsuka (大塚健吾).

—description from the designer

name: Attack on Cahokia Game
description:
The Attack on Cahokia game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the British led attack on Cahokia during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Americans and the other player commands the British.

CONTENTS:
48 game pieces (5/8" inch)
A single rulebook (4 pages)
20 game cards
CANVAS game map (11x17" inch)
1 six sided die

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Pampero: Nature
description:
The installation of wind farms can have an impact on the natural habitat of the surrounding fauna and flora. The government has programs that reward the protection of this habitat.  

A new action lets players score points for nature reserves near their transformers.

To play the new Nature Action Card, you must:
• have a wind farm of your color in the sector you'll take the action
• have a transformer in a remote location in that sector
• play a card with the Nature icon matching the wind farm and transformer
• pay the cost of the space on the Action Board, as normal

You then take a Nature Token from the supply and place it on the game board by the transformer mentioned above. 

If this is the first Nature Token you're placing, take the Nature Income Marker in your color and place it on the $1 Remote Income track space of your PG&I board. If that space is occupied, place it in the $2 space.  If the Nature Income Marker is already on the PG&I board, move it up one space. 

Next, you may pay 2 energy or 1 battery to move the Nature Income Marker up 2 spaces. 

If the Nature Income Marker or Remote Income Marker ever land on an occupied space, they instead move to the next space.

Score the Nature Income Marker during Consolidation as per the normal income rules.

Additional Nature Specialist Cards and Build Wind Farm Token add even more play variability.
publishers: APE Games, Cosmodrome Games, Intrafin Games, Tesla Games

name: Bestiary
description:
Bestiary is a simple card driven draft game in which players create chimeras by adding different creature parts.

Each turn, players take turns to draw a card from a pool, then use that card to begin a new chimera, continue one in progress, or complete one. Creature parts include tails, bodies and heads. The game ends when the draw deck runs out; then, the player with the most points among those printed in their chimeras wins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Flick Racers
description: A flick race game. Build a track with what's on your table and race to victory. En route you may collect weapons and special powers.

name: Incountry
description:
Incountry is a real time tabletop wargame for one or more players. Players will assume command over several different modern day forces or be given the option to create their own before facing off in intense tactical battles and military intelligence gambles.

Incountry features a quick to learn and in-depth game system with the absolute bare minimum for Tokens. Incountry plays intuitively and features a unique pregame battle where Players will faceoff with their opponent gambling on intelligence and bluffing their way to victory! Shape the battle to come by drawing the right cards or bluffing the intel you have to throw your opponents off!

—description from the publisher

name: Saboteur: Pathfinder
description:
With this promo Action card, you may play twice again a path card.
After this, you draw only 2 cards from the Draw pile. This means that you must continue the game with one card less.

-description from designer

name: Escape Room: The Game – Superhelden Next Generation
description:
Ready for new family adventures? With this expansion for Escape Room The Game you can discover new puzzles themed around superheroes!

Note: To play this expansion, you need the Chrono and Hint Decoder from either the base game, Family Edition, or Jumanji edition.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: ZomBined
description: ZomBined is a fast-paced card game where players mash together zombies to attack other survivors. A Survivor must use the weapon or action cards strategically to outlive the others. Should a survivor fail, the game continues for them as they join the ranks of the undead to take down other players! In this survival horror card game, the last survivor wins!

name: Colt Express: Halloween
description: In a form of free download - 7 Scary Objective cards to be dealt at random at the start of the game, one for each bandit in play. Unless otherwise stated, your Scary Objective remains hidden until the end of the game.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains

name: Baltic Offensive, Fall 1944
description:
Baltic Offensive: Fall 1944 is a two player simulation of the Soviet offensive in the Baltic countries in the Fall of 1944. The Soviet player must conquer as much territory as possible within a limited time frame, while the German forces must try to delay the Soviet advance as much as possible. The Soviet player has a positional advantage and numerical superiority, but it has a tight timetable to clear the Baltic countries so that the Red Army can return to the decisive direction of the war: the Vistula-Oder-Berlin axis. Each game turn represents 10 days. Each hexagon is 10 miles (15 kilometers) from side to opposite side. Units are corps, divisions, brigades or equivalents, and specialized smaller units.

22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters.

World at War 93, October 2023

-description from designer

name: Ladrón de Caminos
description:
Each of the players has two objectives to win.

The first objective is to get to the opponent's base.
