Then go find the talisman, and bring it back to your own base.

All of this is accomplished by rolling the dice. On each turn you can choose to create paths to move along or simply block your opponent.

name: Lodestones
description:
Lodestones is an abstract strategy game for two players in which participants compete to achieve the highest score by pushing pieces out of play, into the boards outer rim. Players move along the board according to the interaction between surrounding pieces.

—description from the designer

name: Decisive Action
description:
Decisive Action is a game of tactical level warfare between modern American and Russian forces. Players are in the role of the battalion commander and must decide how to order subordinate units to fire and maneuver, how to allocate assets like helicopters and drones, and how to choose the best battle plan each turn via selection of activation cards.

The game is based on the US Army Combined Arms Battalion (CAB) conducting traditional high intensity force-on-force missions against variable-sized Russian forces, which include a reinforced Motor Rifle Company, a Battalion Tactical Group (BTG), or a Composite Brigade.

—description from the publisher

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Varamyr Sixskins
description:
Among the most powerful Skinchangers beyond the Wall, Varamyr Sixskins commands a huge snow bear, three wolves, a shadowcat, and an eagle simultaneously. In battle he rides astride his great snowbear, commanding his various beasts in coordinated attacks. Nothing escapes his eagle’s gaze, nor his shadowcat’s patient stalking. Any that approach his person face a savage mauling. One may defeat the individual creatures, but Varamyr will find more. To face an ordinary skinchanger is to square off against a skilled combatant with their creature’s strength backing them up. To face Sixskins, one faces an entire unit unto themselves.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dune Vipers
description:
House Martell rules the desert, plains, and badlands of southern Westeros under the Sunspear banner. Their troops are garbed in desert robes under light armor, and rank among the fastest forces in the War of the Five Kings. House Martell's doctrine of battle is to strike fast, strike hard, and evade counterattack.

The Dune Vipers are House Martell infantry units.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Pijersi
description:
In the Pijersi game, you and your opponent must master distance, speed and rhythm, while moving, stacking and unstacking your cubes which play the "rock-paper-scissors" roles of fighters, or the "wise" roles of blockers and carriers. You move each cubic piece either individually or by stacking it on top of another which then acts as a quick carrier.

To win, you must bring at least one of your "rock-paper-scissors" cubes to the opposite edge of the board.

Pijersi is a major variant of the Jersi board game which has distilled its core mechanics keeping only 4 types of cubes (all starting on the board) and whose simplified rules are expressed in one and a half page.

A print n play file of the rules (without components) is available.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Stacking and Balancing

name: Imperium: Progeny Promo Pack
description:
Imperium Progeny is an expansion for Imperium Classics and Imperium Legends. It contain the following 6 cards:
- Bountiful (Fame/Region) variant replacing one of the base cards
- Heir Presumptive (White & Green) added to the Green deck
- Abundance x4 is an alternative to nations who have Prosperity

The promo pack was available during Turczi Junior Promo Pack gamefound campaign.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Market, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Pax Viking: Promo Pack 2
description: The second promo pack for Pax Viking will continue on the appreciated path of Promo pack 1. Featuring 5 guest designers that all provide ideas for 2 tiles each, 1 rules tile and 1 saga tile.

name: The Barons' War: Death & Taxes
description:
The rebellious French forces controlling England are demanding additional funds to support their war effort. As supporters of King John, Wimentun village, having already paid taxes to the English crown, are resisting paying for a second time. As villages scatter, rushing to squirrel away their last pennies, mail-clad soldiers have already arrived to collect.

Death & Taxes is the first supplement designed for The Barons' War skirmish game. Play your way through the linked scenario-driven campaign, choosing either the forces of the Sheriff of Nottinghamshire or local outlaws sworn to protect the villages.

Further rules are included for developing and running exciting stand-alone seasonal campaigns where individual Commanders strive to be the most chivalrous while battling it out over a campaign map to conquer territory.

This digital supplement contains 112 pages (plus original cover art by Peter Dennis) which include the Death & Taxes linked campaign, the Outlaw retinue list and rules for running a map-based campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Era of Tribes: Grey Leader Variable Cost Module
description:
This expansion adds a small board where the neutral grey leaders are placed. The cost of buying a gray leader now changes during the rounds. They get cheaper every round until one is bought. In that case, the price rises for one or two of the remaining.
Also, the end of game conditions are shown on the board.
This was sold at Spiel Essen 2022 and can be also bought on the website of the publisher.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Simulation, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Chivalry is Dead: Race for the Crown
description:
Chivalry is Dead is a Fantasy Tabletop Chariot Racing game. The game plays 2-5 players with a goal of being the first to get one chariot to complete 3 laps around the track. Players can do this by using speed, traps or by destroying opponents.

For setup; each player chooses between 5 unique fantasy races for their team. Each of the races has a unique racial ability that applies to all of their chariots. Then the chariots are further customized by using ability points to upgrade their chariot, driver or animal amounts. Additionally, you choose at least one racial perk per chariot to customize them even further.

The players then race on a map dodging terrain modifies, traps and other players to try to be the first to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Monster Mash
description:
Bradley Raymond is one of the world's most successful horror writers. So, it only makes sense that he lives in Valley Falls where frightening things seem to lurk around every corner. Raymond is known for writing about things that go bump in the night and about monsters that wear human faces. Yet, when people begin to be murdered in ways that mimic the plots of some of his most famous novels, it becomes clear that someone is doing their best to frame him. Things take a turn for the worst when it is discovered that the most recent victim can be linked to one of his unpublished manuscripts. Is the killer a member of Bradley Raymond's inner circle? Did his novels inspire a murderer to commit these atrocities? Or is there more to Bradley Raymond than meets the eye? Do the Monster Mash and find out!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: True Wizard
description:
Collect Magic Gems and learn Magic Spells. Prove that you are the True Wizard! Use your Spells smartly against your opponents and destroy evil items to win the most points!

How to play: In every turn, collect a Magic Gem or spend Magic Gems to buy a Spell Card. Then use Spell Cards to either destroy Evil items for victory points, or cast the unique power of your Spell to weaken your opponents. Decide when to use each Spell or combos of Spells for maximum impact!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Heroes 3
description:
House Baratheon’s claim to the Iron Throne is made all the stronger by King Stannis Baratheon being the only king to face the growing threat beyond the Wall. In the field, King Stannis is a juggernaut, rallying his forces to stand against ever-growing odds. Of his loyal retainers Justin Massey, Dale Seaworth, and his squire, Bryen Farring, stand amongst his most skilled commanders. Off the field but of even equal value is his wise counselor Maester Cressen, and even the court fool, Patchface, proves his value to his king with his bizarre but insightful mutterings.


Details:**

The Baratheon Heroes 3 Box gives House Baratheon, a new range of characters to add to their battles, especially for Stannis supporters.
Contains popular and well-known characters like Stannis Baratheon and his loyal supporters Maester Cressen, Dale Seaworth and the like.
The miniatures are highly detailed and come pre-assembled so they can be played with and painted straight out of the box.



Contains:**



6 Miniatures
5 Attachments
2 NCUs
12 Tactics Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Path of Light and Shadow: Solstice – Promo Pack
description:
16 promo cards created as stretch goals during the Path of Light and Shadow: Solstice kickstarter campaign. This includes:

- 10 New player cards (Dreadbanner, Fearbender, Palestar, Shatteredmask, Heretic, Informant, Nomad, Proxy, Spirit, and Warlord)
- 2 Title cards (The Arcane and The Mad)
- 4 Relic cards (Forbidden Gate, Sojourner's Blessing, Eye of the Prophetess, and Gift of the Ancients)
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Ladies & Rats
description:
A ghostly pirate-themed solo trick-taking card game where you play against two A.I. opponents (ghost crew) vying to score more card points than the combined scores of the crew. Special cards include Rat cards that infest your hand eating your highest cards, and Pirate cards that have two suits and win almost any trick. To win the game, take at least 5 of the 9 gems before the crew take 5. Each round you bet on the number of gems you are attempting to take. The Pirate cards contain images of famous female Pirates throughout history, including Ching Shih, Awilda, Sayyida al Hurra, Anne Bonny, and Mary Read.

-description from designer

name: Battaglie in Miniatura
description:
Battaglie in Miniatura is a complete guide to miniature wargaming, one of the first Italian books on the subject.
The rules included in the book allow to play wargames set in different periods: Ancient and Medieval, Renaissance, 17th century Pike and Shot, 18th century Age of Reason, Napoleonic Wars, American Civil War and World War II.
Also included are chapters on organizing a wargame campaign and on solo wargaming.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, Ancient, Medieval, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame, World War II

name: Wargame, la Guerra sul Tavolo
description:
Wargame, La Guerra Sul Tavolo - The complex rules of wargame, the engaging game of war with miniature soldiers, thoroughly explained for the first time in Italian.

Old school Napoleonic rules, with one miniature representing 25 men.

name: Remnant
description:
Remnant is a build your character card game where you build your character by buying and selecting cards of your choice to prepare your character for the final epic battle.

2-6 players

On your turn, you roll the dice. Moving your character holder that many spaces in the direction of your choosing. Resolve what you land on to collect cards or coins. Once completed you have the opportunity to buy cards for your character. Once you have 3 features or 3 characteristic cards you can no longer buy those until you have 3 of the opposite.

Choose the cards you want and even replace cards if you get the same types. Once you become a full character you can even buy weapons and armor to deck out your fantastic creation, giving you attack and defense benefits as well as special interactions with different cards on other players.

Find your opponent to attack and roll a dice to multiply your attack or defense.

Final circle occurs when all players become a "full" character. This forces battle after battle in a brutal all out war.
Last one standing wins!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: The Sloth Game
description:
A talking electronic plush sloth acts as the timer, judge and prop in this two team charades type game.

The sloth will randomly assign one of the three super slo-mo clue categories: Sloth Charades, SL-ACTING or sloth-ercise. The active team then has 45 seconds to guess the correct clue. The player assigned to be the round actor, though, cannot move too quickly or else the sloth will get upset and buzz. Three buzzes and your turn is over.

The non-active team can steal the clue whenever it is not guessed by the active team. Guessing a clue correctly results in one point. Alternating play continues until one team has accumulated 5 points and therefore wins the game.

name: Fila
description:
Fila consists of a 21-card deck, with each card having a point value. To start, reveal a number of cards face up based on the player count.

On a turn, draw a card from the deck and without looking at it show this card to 2-3 other players, then place it face down in front of you. After all players have three cards in front of them, write down your predictions for which player has the most points or whether there's a tie for high score, then predict how many points each player has. Players win or lose points based on the accuracy of their predictions, and whoever has the highest score wins.

name: Micro Mars: 2-player PvP Edition
description:
Micro Mars: 2-player PvP Edition is a fun and fast Roll&Write/Print&Play game of open space adventure where the players make decisions about how to capture more territory on the map.

To start a game, players roll 2 dice in turn. In the following, you can find the elements for the rolled values
of the dice in the route field. Since you have two elements, you can craft a figure.

The goal of the game is to fill the space of the map with your figures. To get more points, you need to fill in more spaces in the points field. Your points per round are all the cells that you filled in the points field minus the unfilled cells on the map. A player who collects more points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Space Exploration

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Sunlion Armor
description:
White Sunlion Armor - Erza Promo was included with 1 x Terrain tile and card, 1 x strange resource, 2 x pattern cards, 2 x pattern gear cards, 1 x hybrid armor set card (not part of the Kingdom Death: Monster Base Game).

Gear card sneak peek: Beast Kunai (melee, dagger, tool, bone) - At the end of your attack with any melee weapon, you may place yourself in any unoccupied space adjacent to the monster.

The White Sunlion Armor - Erza is packaged in a box that includes:

1 x Hard plastic White Sunlion Armor Erza miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and insert
Large matte art print
Character art card
1 x Terrain tile and card, 1 x strange resource, 2 x pattern cards, 2 x pattern gear cards, 1 x hybrid armor set card.

Erza of the Sun wears modified armor adapted to the scorching conditions created by living under the sleeping sun. This White Sunlion hybrid armor is added to People of the Sun campaigns. It grants the wearer more movement, less armor, and the ability to ignore the extreme heat that prevents survivors from wearing heavy furs.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Float: From the Deep – God From the Deep  Booster Pack
description:
A God From the Deep is a booster pack for Float: From the Deep.

The first booster pack for FLOAT comes with a bigger than life enemy, an experienced leader, eldritch relics, equipment, downgrades, and more.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement

name: The Federalist Papers Game
description:
The Federalist Papers Game is a short, simple, solitaire, card-driven game about the ratification of the U.S. Constitution between 1787 and 1790. The player’s goal is to get as many of the 13 states as possible to ratify the Constitution. The game takes around 15-20 minutes to play and can be used as a teaching exercise in a classroom.

The game includes a deck of 29 cards, 13 of which are convention cards--one for each of the 13 states. The other cards are Federalist Papers cards representing a selection of the 85 historical Federalist Papers political essays. When a convention card is drawn, the player holds that state's ratification convention. Starting with a base number representing the state's starting level of support for the Constitution, the player rolls two dice to add to the base number. Twelve or higher and the state ratifies; less than 12 and the state rejects it.

The player may choose to add Federalist Papers cards to the convention to increase the odds, but may also spend them for die rolls to advance along two tracks to gain bonuses in future conventions. The player mat is used to keep track of which states ratify as well as progress along the tracks.

Most of the Federalist Papers cards appear early in the game when the easy states hold conventions. The player must conserve them for use late in the game when the difficult states hold their conventions.

To win, the player must get at least 9 states to ratify--the minimum number required for the Constitution to go into effect. But each state has a number of victory points, and the more states that ratify, the higher the score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Romantic Crocodile
description: Romantic Crocodile is a simple push your luck + influence-based party game that becomes an alligator escaping from the zoo and goes on a trip. Here is an alligator with romance. The crocodile dreams of leaving the narrow, dark zoo, making love around the world, and heading for its distant hometown of Amazon. But it's not easy. The zoo is trying to catch the alligator again. The longer the adventure, the deeper the risk. Can the alligator's romance come true? Make the Alligator's Romance Come True with Your Hands!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck

name: Gift Words
description:
Gift Words is a friendly but challenging word rummy game. When one player adds a letter to another player's word, they both score.
There is also an advanced version where players get replacement letters when they expand words or make long words for themselves.
The basic and advanced games are for 3-6 players. There are additional rules for solitaire, and for a 2-player cooperative game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Wacky Cousin Wendell
description:
In Wacky Cousin Wendell, 1-2 players will assume the role of cousins who are pitted against each other in another one of Wacky Cousin Wendell’s games. During the game, players will have a hand of five cards each round where they'll simultaneously place and/or tuck one each turn to their tableau to form polyomino patterns for various scoring opportunities.

After a card has been played, players then simultaneously point their finger at a score condition they'd like to claim with a polyomino pattern that matches one they've created in their tableau. The claimed score condition is placed in the players tableau on top of the symbols that created the pattern. If players point to the same score condition, the player nearest to the card will choose who receives it while the other player will draw two cards and choose one to claim.

After all five cards have been placed, players set aside all claimed score conditions and reset the game. After three rounds, tally up the scores and whoever has the most points wins!

Wacky Cousin Wendell is the third game in the Risible Relatives Series. Each game in the series is a standalone 54-card game for 1-2 players that can also be combined with each game in the series for a different experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Layering, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Zombie World: Bonus Pack
description:
From the publisher website:

This Zombie World Bonus Pack of Kickstarter exclusive cards includes:

2 Enclaves (2 cards each)
4 Advantages
5 Population cards
6 Past cards
6 Present cards
6 Trauma cards

WELCOME TO THE CARAVAN

Seems crazy that I live in a bus now. But that's how it's gotta be if we're going to reach Refuge before we all die.

WELCOME TO THE AMUSEMENT PARK

FunWorld's weird, but not too weird—and now we're settling in. Even unloaded a bunch of us off the buses and into game stands. Not exactly what we'd had in mind, but it's beginning to feel like home.

Not available in retail stores.
Requires core game to play

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Veggy Memo
description:
MEMORY GAME
The veggie patch is an absolute mess!
There are fruit and vegetables all over the garden!

Veggy Memo is a memory game for young learners. The tiles are placed face down in a square on the table. The matching cards are placed in several piles, face up, to one side. The players have to match up the pairs of tiles and cards, just like a game of pairs.

To do so, The players take turns to tun over one of the tiles. If the tile matches one of the visible cards, they win the card! The player then turns the tile back over, face down, and takes the card as a point won. A new card is thus revealed on top of the pile, giving the players an opportunity to match any of the face-up cards, that's too bad - the player turns the tile back over, face down, and it's time for the next player to have a go.

+++ Increasing difficulty levels.

Start by finding 4 tiles, then 9 and, finally, 36.

-description from publisher

name: Tiny Turbo Cars: Speed Up Expansion
description:
Tiny Turbo Cars is a frantic race game for 2 to 4 players where you program the movements of your tiny toy car in advance, with a sliding puzzle acting as your remote controller.

Expand your Tiny Turbo Cars experience with the Speed Up Expansion! Play up to 6 players, face new obstacles, and use Power cards to upgrade your racecar mid-race!

Play up to 6 Players
Add 2 more controllers to your base game: more players, more mayhem… more fun!

Power Up
Cross the Check-Point to grab Power cards and upgrade your racecar with news abilities!

Face the fury of the Elements
Includes 4 double-sided elemental track boards with new unique obstacles: dodge fire, slide on ice, and try to program your commands while in the mist!

Power to the Pup
A brand new racecar joins the game: Battle Pup, a real master of the Power cards, is ready to enter the fray!

-description from publisher's website

name: Destination Mars
description:
DEXTERITY, OBSERVATION AND SPEED GAME
A race is raging between Earth and Mars. Who will get to the Red Planet fastest? To get there, you’ll need to be an ace rocket pilot!
A finger game requiring dexterity and observation to complete the various challenges set by the cards.
The further you get in the game, the harder the challenges become.

Destination Mars is a game of dexterity, observation and speed. The race to Mars unfolds in 5 stages: you’ll have to pass by Saturn, cross an asteroid field, make a stop on Neptune and then on the space station to finally arrive at your destination. For each leg of the trip, the organisers outline your mission,
during which you must use certain colours on your pilot pad. And to up the ante, they’ll add more shape constraints as you get closer to the goal. For each section, the first pilot to correctly use their pad according to the mission and the imposed constraints
will be allowed to move forward! The first to reach Mars wins the game.

The first to get to Mars wins.

+++ Develops motor skills and shape/colour recognition.

—description from the publisher

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Thirsty Thirsty Dragons! Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo card for their 2022-2023 convention season.

Text on the card:

Thirsty Thirsty Dragons!
Drink Event
Each player reveals cards from their Character Deck until they reveal a Sometimes Card, then draws their revealed cards. The player(s) who drew the most cards in this way each reveal and drink a Drink from the Drink Deck. If a player reveals a Drink Event before revealing a Drink, they discard it and reveal again.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Roll and Rails: Japan Map Pack
description:
Japan map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 3 maps:
Kyushu - for solo game
Hokkaido - for duel game
Honshu - for multiplayer game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Great Britain Map Pack
description:
Great Britain map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 3 new maps:
Northern Ireland for solo play
Wales for duel play
England for multiplayer game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: USA Map Pack 2 Expansion
description:
USA map pack 2 expansion for Roll and Rails game. It includes 3 new maps:
California for solo play
Texas for duel play
South for multiplayer game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Roll and Rails: Railway Moguls variant
description: Railway Moguls variant game for Roll and Rails. Manage the companies, expand the railway connections and multiply the company resources in this roll and write game. This variant includes special maps designed for Railway moguls variant of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Super Squad High
description:
Super Squad High is a cooperative teen superhero adventure game for 1 to 4 players. A crime wave has struck the city, and only Super Squad can save the day! Fight crime, keep up your grades, and become besties or sweethearts with your classmates to learn clues and unmask the villain behind the crime wave. The twist — the villain is secretly one of your classmates!

Features:

Unique narrative dating mechanism. Test how well you know the likes, fears, and feelings of non-player classmates to become besties or sweethearts.

Fresh take on crime fighting. Your super powers and crime fighting gear are limited. Make difficult choices between saving the city buildings and citizens, taking bruises, or running late to class. Push your limits just like classic teen heroes from the comics!

Tense, thematic gameplay. Manage your time between schoolwork, fighting crime, and forming relationships with your classmates. Every choice matters as life pulls you in multiple directions.

Heroic teamwork. Use powers and costumes to back each other up. Patrol to get the drop on crime or face danger head-on to protect your teammates.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Galaxy Force: Battles of the Fallen Stars
description:
Galaxy Force: Battles of the Fallen Stars is a fast-playing, immersive solitaire play experience. The once glorious Order of Allied Stars now lies in turmoil as formerly devoted systems have seceded from the empire, joining a hastily formed rebellion. A well-crafted event system along with numerous alien species you will encounter ensures a different narrative and action-packed play experience.

Product Information:
Complexity: Low (3 out of 10)
Solitaire Suitability: 10 out of 10 (designed for solitaire play)
Time Scale: Each turn represents one galactic year
Map Scale: Milky Way galaxy (Each space about 2500 light years)
Unit Scale: Fleets (each SP represents a squadron of about a thousand ships)
Players: One (solitaire game)
Playing Time: 2-3 hours per scenario

—description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: TKG ARENA: The Tome Weavers
description:
A Tome Weaver interlaces the different magical spell fragments obtained by the Arcane Scribes into a transcendent manuscript, arming the Battle mages with such ruthless combos that easily turn the tide in any war of magic. The intricacies and harmonies involved in such an enchantment are often insanely complex and requires not only a deep knowledge of the elements but also a strategic cognizance of how well all this fits together in an impossible manifest and more often than not in the midst of a chaotic and unexpected confrontation.

TKG ARENA: Tome Weaver is a game set up for 2 - 5 players.

Winning Condition

The objective of the game is to compile a valuable collection of spells into a volume designed to unleash a volley of spells in a battle. The value of the collection is determined by number of HARMONY points scored as it is an indication of its stability. The player with the most HARMONY points wins the game when it ends.

Ending Condition

The game ends when all cards are played from the hands of all players.

Setup

A player starts the game by designating the following areas: A draw deck area O, a discard area X and five adjoining spaces that is marked A, B, C, D and E.

X A B C D E O


Determine the starting player by drawing cards from the deck of spell cards. The player who draws the highest face value starts first and turn order is clockwise. In case of a tie, the tied players keep drawing till the tie is broken with a player drawing a higher face value. The drawn cards are put back into the deck.
Shuffle all 36 spell cards and deal 9 / 8 / 7 / 6 cards to 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 players respectively. E.g. For 3 players, each player receives 8 cards at the start.
Place 1 face up spell card at each of the spaces A, B, C, D and E.
The rest of the cards are placed faced down as a stack in O.
Each player should also designate a small area in front of himself / herself to group cards of the same colour together for easy scoring later.


On each player’s turn

The player may exchange a card by first discarding a card from their hand to X and drawing the top face down card from O before putting it into his / her hand. If the stack at O runs out of cards, shuffle any discarded cards at X to form a new stack at O to draw from.
Next, the player must either claim one of the cards placed in A, B, C, D or E or to play one of his / her cards face down in front of himself / herself. These cards are part of the player’s collection and will be scored at the end of the game.
To claim a card placed in A, B, C, D or E, the player need to play either a card from his hand of the SAME COLOUR as the placed card or a card with a LOWER face value than the placed card. The played card replaces the placed card in A, B, C, D or E and the placed card is then claimed by the player as part of his / her personal collection displayed in front of himself / herself.
If all players have only 1 remaining card left in their hands, the game ends and scoring begins.


Scoring

There are three types of scoring.


First Scoring: Check the colour of the remaining card and ignore its face value. Locate all other cards of the same colour in the collection and find the lowest face value among all these other cards. For each other card of this colour, score HARMONY points according to this lowest face value. The remaining card is not included as a card in the total number of cards considered for this purpose. E.g. The remaining card in a player’s hand is ASHW with face value 1. There are other 3 ASHW cards in the collection, with face values 3, 5, 9. The power points scored will be 3 x 3 = 9 points. If there are only 2 ASHW cards with face values, 5 and 9, the power points scored will be 2 x 5 = 10 points.
Second Scoring: For each card in the collection that bears the same colour as the card that remains in spaces A, B, D and E, score 1 HARMONY point. For each card in the collection that bears the same number as the face value of the card that remains in space C, score 3 HARMONY points. The last remaining card used in the first scoring is part of the collection and its colour and face value is considered for this second scoring.
Third Scoring: Each faced down cards is scored as 2 HARMONY points.
The final score of each player is the sum of these 3 scorings.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Set Collection

name: Fjord Serpents: Vikings at War
description:
Fjord Serpents is a unique and dynamic miniatures war game, set within Dark Age Scandinavia during the apex of the Viking Age.

As a Viking Jarl you assemble your fleet and crew and compete against rivals through balanced, matched play games, or upon a heroic campaign arc of conquest and domination.

Strategic acumen, dynamic flair and a little battle luck are required to master the Viking Fjords and win. Every decision is important and every crew and ship piece plays a vital role in-game, acting independently or in unison with other pieces.

It is fast paced Viking battle; fought as they did at the time, on the mighty Fjords which connected them, and upon the very dragon ships which gave them their greatness.

Historical in nature and deeply researched, Fjord Serpents will appeal to a wide audience of gamers; from history buffs, lovers of Viking age and culture, competitive or casual wargamers, to board game enthusiasts and strategists.

Included in the box are all the ships and crew miniatures required to field 2x Hersir size naval fleets for 2 players or enough to field one king size naval engagements for 1 player; plus all the rules, tokens, gauges, terrain and dice to play.

—description from designer

name: HATE: CMON Comics – Vol. 2 Promos
description:
Hate - Tyrant Edition
And the associated pre-order exclusive content:
1 Tyrant, 1 Shaktaar Mercenary, and 2 Figure Cards.

The Tyrant Edition includes 2 HATE hardcover comic books, that bring the original HATE comic book as well as new content to complete the story.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: Invader – CMON Comics: Vol. 2 Promos
description:
Zombicide: Invader - Playing Prometheus Comic and the associated pre-order exclusive content:
5 Survivors, 2 Abominations, 1 A.P.E. 002 Serv Bot, 5 ID Cards, 12 Spawn Cards, 1 Equipment Card, 2 Rules Cards, and 1 Mission Sheet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Frontier Wars: Weather Cards & Solo Mode Mini Expansion
description: This rulebook includes new optional rules for your games of “Frontier Wars”, as well as a 29 card deck, 23 Weather cards and 6 cards for the Solo Mode.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Eclipse Editorial, Giant Roc, Van Ryder Games

name: Anima Mundi
description:
Play as one of four factions that seek to control Anima Mundi, the Worldsoul: The Elementals, guardians of this sacred source of magic; the Celestial Accord, foreign invaders who destroyed their own world’s Anima Mundi; the Humans, who desperately need it to defend themselves; and the Alloyed, a new race of golems who depend upon the Anima Mundi for life. Send out heroes (and their armies) to gather and control resources on the board, battle other heroes, and siege kingdoms. Use the resources you gather to build up your kingdom and your armies. Win by defeating the heroes of the other factions or toppling their kingdom.

Gameplay consists of a series of rounds, each of which is divided into three phases. In the first two phases, players upkeep and upgrade their kingdom during simultaneous play by exchanging resources for upgrade cards and purchasing units. In the third phase, players take turns controlling their heroes as they venture across the hex-grid board to take control of resources, battle other heroes, attack kingdoms, or return to their own kingdom for shelter or to resupply.

Battles determined by binary dice, unique unit abilities for each faction, powerful artefact cards, and a fully modular board all combine to create a game that necessitates thoughtful and adaptive strategy, with a high level of re-playability.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: Angry Birds
description: Angry birds meets monopoly. Roll the dice, collect bird and pig tokens and start the shooting action for collectibles. Buy, buy, buy and fly, fly, fly in the Angry Birds edition of the classic game of Monopoly! You can play as Red, Bomb, Ice or Stella, and your goal is to buy as many Angry Birds properties as you can in this fast-trading game. You’ve got to launch your tokens to get extra money, and if you finish with the most money, you win.
mechanics: Ownership, Physical Removal, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ragnarocks: Kvasir Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Card description:
During your opponent's turn: Your opponent cannot select the same Viking that they selected on their previous turn unless there is no other option.

name: Ecologies Junior: Forest
description:
A simplified and accessible version of our Ecologies game, Ecologies Junior: Forest allows younger children to practice building food webs with 32 pairs of matching organism tiles for a total of 64 tiles.

The game can be played as a simple memory game with children flipping tiles or extended to include food web building and trophic level practice. It is flexible enough to be played cooperatively or competitively, depending on the audience.

It contains much of the art from the original Ecologies card game, with a few bonus additions as well.

Designed by a biology teacher, it can be played for fun or used in preschools, outdoor schools, homeschools, and elementary schools to teach children about forest ecology.

—description from publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Memory
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos – Cartas Promo 1
description: Card promo pack for A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flows: The Interconnection Game
description:
A game that brings to life how data flows through Internet networks. Put simply, over the course of the game, from two to five participants seek to avoid busy city centres and routes blocked by diggers to deliver data blocks from one city Internet Exchange to another.

Data, however, scores differently and is also subject to cyber attacks from other nasty trouble-making players. But at the end of the day, the first player to fifteen points can celebrate a well-earned victory.

How to Play:
There are a variable number of rounds, with each player, during their individual turn, able to perform any two of the following actions:

Bring a data block into play
Move a data block along a route
Carry out a cyber-attack

The core of the game are the Location tokens.
Each location token bears the name of a location on the board where there is an Internet Exchange.
From time to time, players either leave these locations or have to reach them to deliver their data blocks and gain the points they need to win the game.
Players need to find a container where they can put the tokens, shake them well, and then pick them out one by one as the game progresses.
Data are represented by wooden cubes; they move along the routes on the playing board towards the locations that host Internet Exchanges.

In addition, players can place a digger (only one) on any route after finishing their turn and before the turn passes to the next player. Placing a digger on a route blocks the route.

-description from designer

name: Dreszcz
description: First polish paragraph game. Uses a specific system for character creation and progression rules.

name: Raging Inferno
description:
It is late in the summer the land is dry and the rivers and creeks are low. It is bushfire season. Word gets around that the surrounding lands are like a tinderbox ready to explode in flames. Then it happens. A Raging Inferno is ignited and starts to bare down on your homes. It is too late to flee - you must defend the town until the Raging Inferno has been extinguished. You and your fellow residents are all that stands in the way of saving your homes and the lives of your loved ones. The weak and the injured are seeking safety and shelter in the Community Hall in the centre of town.

Game Play
Raging Inferno is a collaborative board game for 1-6 players. The players must work together to save the town from the Raging Inferno. Wild winds and a climate crisis induced heat wave make the situation very dangerous. Dangers (in the form of fires) come at the town from all different directions. The players must rally the townsfolk to Defend the town.

Dangers come at the Town from eight random directions.

Defenders need to be strategically placed to combat these Dangers - ranging from Arsonists, Spot Fires, Bush Fires and the deadly “Boss” Dangers. But watchout just when you think you have everything covered the wind can change and move the fires around.

Defenders operate in different zones - Scrublands, Bushlands, Farmlands and the Town Centre. The Defenders consist of Volunteers, Fire Fighters, Fire Trucks and the all powerful Fire Chief. You are also helped by lots of fire fighting assistance - Fire Breaks, Water Bombs and occasionally the weather might help.

You will need luck, lots of teamwork and some clever game play to save the town from the Raging Inferno.

—description from the publisher

name: A Fading Star: Insurgency and Piracy in Somalia
description:
A Fading Star: Insurgency and Piracy in Somalia is Volume XV of the COIN Series originally designed by Volko Ruhnke. The year is 2007. We reach the climax of the several decades of civil war that have ravaged Somalia since the fall of dictator Siad Barre in 1991. An African Union coalition, assisted by the Ethiopian army, enters Mogadishu to support a nascent but corrupt Transitional Federal Government. They face a relentless and violent insurgency waged by Harakat al-Shabaab al-Mujahideen, an Islamic group seeking both to expel the "invaders" and to transcend the traditional clan-based government structure of Somalia. In the middle of this power vacuum, minor clans and warlords organize themselves to administrate otherwise ungoverned regions, while others engage in large-scale piracy operations, painting their acts as a fight against foreign trawlers pillaging Somali fishing resources.

Highlights:

An updated take on contemporary aspects of insurgency and peacebuilding. The Al-Shabaab insurgent enjoys intelligence supremacy that allows them to conduct deadly out-of-turn ambushes, while facing a slightly less pronounced asymmetrical disadvantage than insurgent factions in previous volumes (due to the comparative weakness of the Transitional Federal Government). On the other hand, the African Union Mission's logistical, kinetic, and peacebuilding capacities will evolve as contributing countries join or leave the coalition throughout the game.
Intense urban warfare is depicted in more detail through the struggle for control of the capital city Mogadishu. Controlling a majority of districts will provide the ruling faction with further legitimacy and enhanced capabilities. However, limited operational effectiveness, mobility restrictions, and the looming threat from a major Al-Shabaab offensive will greatly slow the COIN factions' progress toward stabilizing the city.
A new ‘Clan Struggle’ interphase draws out some of the conflict's unique uncertainties. All sides bid to forge new alliances with local clans, bringing new blood to the battlefield, while the African Union must deal with the consequences of delayed reinforcements or unilateral withdrawals by member countries, and the Pirate warlords collect lucrative tolls from roads and ports that they control.
A unique piracy subsystem debunks the Somali pirate mythos and explores how piracy stakeholders' interests actually intersected with other local actors during the golden age of Indian Ocean hostage-taking.


Each turn eligible players will select from a faction-specific menu of Operations and Special Activities in an order determined by the current Event card, or choose to trigger the Event text. Typical Operations include Sweep, Assault, March, and Attack, with more unique Operations and Special Activities reflecting the specific nature of this conflict and the factions involved. Regular play is periodically interrupted by Propaganda rounds, during which early victory is possible and some upkeep is conducted; and by Clan Struggle rounds (unique to this game), during which all players have the opportunity to bid for the loyalty of an unaligned regional clan. If nobody achieves an early victory then the winner will be determined by comparing victory thresholds in the final Propaganda round. Each faction has unique victory conditions relating to their aims and objectives during this period of history.

Faction descriptions:

Al-Shabaab wages a deadly Islamist insurgency against the African Union ‘occupiers’ and their dependent Transitional Federal Government allies. A clear edge in media warfare provides them with significant recruiting capacities that will help them build a Somali caliphate transcending the customary clan system.
Ugandan and Burundian troops serving in the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) aim to enforce peace, build support for the Transitional Federal Government, and train the weak federal army. Neighboring Ethiopia and Kenya may also enter the scene to stabilize their respective borders while interfering in Somali politics.
An abysmally weak Transitional Federal Government seeks to survive in a besieged Mogadishu while reaching out into the rest of the country to advance the federalization process. Unprecedented embezzlement capacities and partnerships with like-minded clans may offer the consecutive administrations an opportunity to survive the conflict unharmed and more prosperous than ever, and a new kind of militia unit emphasizes the opportunistic nature of the Somali clans' agendas.
Pirates, minor clans, and unaligned warlords pursue their enrichment projects by raiding the high seas or setting up roadblocks across unruly parts of the country. They'll settle for a "customary" Somalia, neither rooted in sharia law nor totally anchored to the liberal world order.


-description from developer
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Pirates, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Negotiation, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Monkey Wise
description:
Monkey Wise is a brand new trivia game! Every single question is based on a real and bizarre headline collected over the last 30 years!

The turn player (the Reader) takes a question from the box and reads it aloud presenting multiple choice options. The other players select the answer they believe is correct. Then the Reader select one of the wrong answers. For every reader they catch-out for selecting an incorrect answer, they gain points.

Finally, the correct answer is revealed and any players that chose correctly score as well.

With over 100 question cards, this game will keep you family guessing for games to come!

name: The Wizard's First Trial
description:
The Wizard's First Trial is a hand-made PnP riddler set in a world of Harry Potter.
It suits well for the birthday party and can help to give a present or win some souvenirs for all of the guests. Yet it is still fun to play with friends solving riddles cooperatively.

The game consists of a set of puzzles that follow each other till the final envelope. Once parents (or those who set-up the game) print, cut through, glue and hidden all the puzzle envelopes around the house, players will have to find them and solve the riddles hidden, following from one to another.

All elements needed for the game can be printed in one of three options: in black and white print, in color or in color on kraft paper.

This game is designed for home use and is appropriate for age 10+.

—description from the designer

name: Blood Orders: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Three new victim cards:

The Game Designer: Draw the top card of the ritual deck, gain its victory points, then remove it from the game.
The Game Illustrator: Reveal a card from your hand and immediately gain its victory points.
The Game Publisher: Each opponent must give you either 2 victory points or 3 influence (they choose).

name: Die Bewegungs-Bären
description:
Cooperative Movementgame. One kid draws a card and puts it in a cardholder onto his head. The other kids try to reenact what is depicted on the card. The kid tries to guess what is on the card.
If the kid guesses right the bear moves one step closer to the bearcave. If on the card drawn is a snowflake or the kid guesses wrong, the snowflake descends one step closer to cave.
If the bear reaches the cave before the snowflake all kids win.

name: Yummy Yummy Monster Tummy: Dice Tower 2022 Item Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in pack D of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

A set of 4 new item cards:

Grandpa's Gaming Hat
-Location: Grandpa's Attic

Lost Plushie
-Location: Forest

Discard Dice
-Location: Scrapyard

Ancient Dice Tower
-Location: Museum

name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Dice Roller Dungeon Role
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Dice Roller is a new Dungeon Role that replaces the Leader role

Dice Roller 1:
- YRBG Remove Curse: Heal 2 and Cleanse 1
- Passive Community Sup: All Heroes in your Party that are adj to an Ally gain Weapon Attack Skill +1 to Hit

Dice Roller 2:
- YR Weapon Attack Skill Rolling Strike: +3 Hit, Roll the Trap die twice, the Attack Gains both Enhancements you Rolled (if any)
- YRBG Honest Review: Other Target Hero may immediately take a Cube Action. Any Weapon Attack Skill that Hero makes with that Action gain Crit 16+

Dice Roller 3:
- YRBG Dice Tower: Target Hero takes 1 non-preventable dmg and gains Focus 1 for each time you rolled a die this turn
- Passive Seal of Excellence: Whenever a Hero other than you scores a Crit for the first time in a turn, they gain Focus 1

name: Black Stories: Tatortreiniger
description:
The title translates to: Black Stories Crime Scene Cleaner

Thomas Kundt, one of the most well-known crime scene cleaners in Germany, has created this black stories version. In this game, Kundt turns his experience on crimes scenes into pitch-black puzzles.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game

name: Write the Future: Future Proof Expansion
description: The Future Proof Expansion introduces 12 charismatic factions to use in the game, as well as 12 new Mission Cards for further variety!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Tahiti Zombie
description: In a zombified Tahiti Island, players draw cards from a pile placed in the center of the table. Among these cards are zombies (cats, lizards, sharks, whales, pigs, roosters…, each with a value point. On your turn you play as many card as you want or you pass, then you draw a card. When you draw a zombie card you have to play it in front of you or give it to a neighbor using action card you have in hands, which refer to a tahitian object or action. The player with the least "zombies points" when the draw pile is empty win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Gnarlwood – Fearsome Fortress Rivals Deck
description: A Rivals deck of 32 cards usable by any warband. The deck consists of 12 objectives, 10 gambits and 10 upgrades all centered around a theme of defensive play and withstanding the attacks of your adversary.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Volfyirion Guilds: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
A set of six Cards for Volfyirion Guilds. They include three additional Command cards and three additional Building cards.
The cards include:
-Call to Arms
-Vault Depletion
-Coral Fortress
-Future Investment
-Agate Palace
-Jade Tower

Released as a part of the Dice Tower 2022 kickstarter in promo pack Dive.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse War Zone – Damnos
description: Apocalypse: War Zone Damnos is an expansion to the 6th Edition release of Apocalypse. This book contains a detailed background of the Damnos Incident as well as battle reports, minitature showcases, 4 new Apocalypse missions, 9 new strategic assets, and 22 new Apocalypse datasheets detailing key formations used by the Ultramarines and Necrons.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Grand Tournament Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2020
description:
Chapter Approved: Grand Tournament 2020 is a Chapter Approved supplement for the 9th Edition of Warhammer 40,000.

This year’s edition of Chapter Approved is the essential gaming toolbox for all fans of Warhammer 40,000 matched play. Whether you're a tournament regular or simply like to ensure your battles are always fought on an even footing, this is the essential supplement for matched play games in the this edition of Warhammer 40,000. Inside this 96-page softback book, you'll find:

Two mission packs, comprising nine missions each for Incursion- and Strike Force-scale battles, each designed to offer a different challenge to the players.

Guidelines for setting up and playing a matched play or Grand Tournament-level competitive game, including suggested battlefield size, time limit and how best to determine secondary objectives.

This comes packaged with the Munitorum Field Manual which contains all the latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters

name: 大名 (Daimyo)
description:
大名 (Daimyo) is a two-player worker placement game from Japan.

Become a Daimyo in the Edo period, work with people in various positions over eight periods to enrich your country, and ultimately aim to become a Rōjū.

At the end of the game, the winner is the player who has earned the most Honor Points by acquiring territories, advancing technologies, and earning the general's trust by presenting artifacts.

江戸時代の「大名」となり、8つの期間に渡り様々な立場の人々と協力して自国を豊かにし、最終的に「老中」を目指します。
領地を獲得したり、技術を進めたり、将軍に工芸品を献上し信頼を得たりすることで、ゲーム終了時に最も多くの名誉点を獲得しているプレイヤーが勝者となります。
publisher's summary
publishers: Green Games (III) (グリーンゲームズ)

name: Schdix
description: A fast reaction game played simultaneouly where players try to flick a wooden stick to the middle of the wooden board while keeping their own and all other players' cards in mind.

name: Host Your Own Murder Mystery: On the Night Train
description: "All aboard! The crew welcomes you onto the European Belle for an evening of timeless luxury and terror." The train goes dark as it enters a tunnel. Was that a scream from the dining carriage? Take a seat and upgrade your next dinner party or family games night and host your own murder mystery evening. Dress up in character and put your magnifying glass to work as you and your guests attempt to work out whodunnit?

name: Xerz
description:
Xerz is a two-player abstract strategy game, in which players move pawns in order to trap a pawn.
The twist is, players share all the pawns, so trying to trap a pawn willy-nilly can backfire!

◆Features
・A unique hunting game where players share all the hunters / prey.
・The pawn to move is decided by your opponent.
・Pillars allow dynamic maneuvers.
・Pillars create a unique maze, make the game finite and drawless, and make the early- and the mid-game meaningful.
・Elegant gameplay. The only thing you do is to move a pawn chosen on the previous turn.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Network and Route Building, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Tile Placement

name: Taskmaster: The Card Game
description:
Players take turns as the Taskmaster, challenging their fellow players to complete tasks over which the Taskmaster is the sole judge.

Featuring favourite tasks from the TV show, this travel-sized card game brings the essence of Taskmaster to your very own home. Judge and be judged. Your time starts now...!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time

name: Conspiracy Theory 2018: Black Box Expansion Pack
description:
Conspiracy Theory 2018 Black Box is the first Expansion to our popular Conspiracy Trivia Board Game. The 2018 Black Box Expansion can also be used with the 2020 Travel Edition to maximize your Trivia Fun!!!

A blast for conspiracy buffs and sheeple alike. Tinfoil hat not included.

Every copy of Conspiracy Theory 2018 Black Box comes with 125 New Conspiracy Trivia Cards.

—description from the publisher

name: FRIENDS: Ultimate Quiz
description:
Test your knowledge, along with friends and family to see who has been paying attention throughout all 236 episodes of Friends the Television Series. Can you name all 3 of Ross' wives? Do you remember where Monica and Chandler first got together? Friends Ultimate Trivia Quiz contains over 2000 questions covering all 10 seasons of Friends.

Supplied in a full colour, closed box where all the pieces can be stored when the game is not in use. The Friends Ultimate Trivia Quiz makes the perfect gift for any fan of this multi-award winning sitcom. Plus, collectors of Friends official merchandise will want to add this Ultimate Trivia Quiz to their collection of memorabilia.

Test your knowledge about all 236 episodes of Friends the Television Series
Contains a total of 2000 questions
Suitable for two or more players
Officially licensed Friends product

—description from the publisher

name: 星際礦工 (Interstellar Miner)
description:
Interstellar Miner is a space mining-themed board game for family, in which players play as the captain of a mining team. Each player leads three miners to mine in space, and whoever digs the highest score at the end of the game is the winner.

The gameplay is driven by throwing dice. The player moves his miner piece according to the result of the dice roll and performs mining. However, each miner has different characteristics and therefore moves and mines differently.

At the end of the game, it's basically 1 point for 1 ore, but you can add 2 points for every 4 different colored ores you collect.

Advanced play adds expert cards, people who enter the space station can hire experts to make your team more powerful.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Set Collection

name: 栄光への戦い～乱世の英雄 (Fight for Glory: Heroes of a Turbulent Time)
description:
栄光への戦い～乱世の英雄 ("Fight for Glory: Heroes of a Turbulent Time") is a luck-based game where players each play a card facedown to reveal all at the same time.
A strategy card (out of 3 different strategies)is picked at the beginning of the round by the first player , serving as the mechanic of the round (either dictating which card will win over which (Hedgemony/Revolution) or similar cards winning against all single ones (Alliance)). The eleminations proceed according to the strategy chosen. The winning player(s) return their card to their hand, the other discard theirs.
Last player still standing with at least one card win the game.

name: Transperceneige, le jeu
description:
Transperceneige, the game is an asymmetrical semi-cooperative game for 3 to 5 players based on the French comic book by Jacques Lob and Jean-Marc Rochette, published by Casterman. Following a climatic catastrophe, the Earth has been plunged into a new ice age, removing all life from the planet. Only one group of humans has managed to board the Transperceneige, a train that runs around the planet forever, keeping them alive. The players, in command of the different groups of passengers, will have to make choices and collaborate with each other (or not!) to take control of the Transperceneige. But they still have to survive the trip...

To gain influence, you must satisfy your passengers, prepare revolts and achieve secret objectives. However, selfish choices will jeopardize the survival of the whole train, leading to defeat. Can you make the right decisions?

Action planning, cooperation, resource management and bluffing will be your best assets on board the train of a thousand and one cars. Welcome to the Transperceneige!

A. Setting
After a climatic cataclysm, the survivors of the human species embark on a train with a thousand and one cars that runs forever. Prisoners of this machine, it is however their only hope of survival. The mechanisms that make the train move also allow, thanks to the movements, to operate the survival facilities for its passengers. Very hierarchical, the "Golden Cars" at the head of the train house the aristocracy, the richest passengers who live with all the comfort that these cars can offer. They are also responsible for the path to follow, as they direct the train not only from the inside, but especially towards the outside. Then there are the cars that specialize in recovery, recycling, food, but also military cars that help maintain order. Finally, the last wagons are simple warehouses fitted out as bunks for the poorest class. They are in charge of feeding the engine ovens and thus ensuring the survival of the passengers.

B. How to play
Each player controls a class made up of the passengers of the train. Each class is different and corresponds to a specific hierarchy and function in the train (high, medium, low class). Players will have to manage cars using a deck of cards unique to each player, representing the possible actions to be performed during the game turn. Players will have to cooperate (or not!) to survive together to one of 5 possible endgames: 4 defeat scenarios, one victory scenario.

In addition to cooperating to survive to the end of the game, players will have to achieve objectives to gain influence within the train. The best way to do this is to access the leadership and direct the train. However, you'll have to be on your guard, because the players of the lower classes will have the possibility to rebel and take the lead position to, in turn, lead the train and satisfy their passengers!

C. How to win
The end of the game can be triggered at any time, by a victory or a defeat.

Victory
When the train reaches its destination, symbolized by a "Sun" marker on the central board, the game ends immediately. The temperature rises and humanity can finally be reborn!
The player who was the most clever, and therefore with the most influence points at the end of the game, will take control of the Transperceneige!

Defeat
When one of the conditions listed below is met, the game ends immediately. The last hope of humanity has been extinguished.


The train does not go in the right direction (the "Death" marker is reached on the central board)
There are no more Event cards to draw
A player loses all his passengers


D. Game Turns

A game is played in several rounds (15 maximum). A game turn consists of 6 stages:


Phase 1 - Event: Draw a card from the current Event deck (Phase I, II or III).
Phase 2 - Prepare: Plan your actions, exchange resources or services with other players, negotiate...
Phase 3 - Work: Play all planned Action cards in order of initiative.
Phase 4 - Advance: Draw a number of Railroad cards defined by the speed of the train.
Phase 5 - Rest: Passengers at work must eat and endure the cold, those at rest may repopulate.


—description from the publisher (translated)

Transperceneige est un jeu **semi-coopératif asymétrique pour 3 à 5 joueurs** adapté de la BD originale. Les joueurs, aux commandes des différents groupes de passagers, devront faire des choix et collaborer entre eux (ou pas !) pour prendre le contrôle du Transperceneige. Encore faut-il survivre au voyage…

Pour gagner en influence, il faudra satisfaire ses passagers, préparer des révoltes et réaliser des objectifs secrets. Cependant, les choix égoïstes risqueront de mettre en péril la survie de l’ensemble du train, conduisant vers une défaite. Saurez-vous prendre les bonnes décisions ?

Programmation d’actions, coopération, gestion de ressources et bluff seront vos meilleurs atouts à bord du train aux mille et un wagons. Bienvenue dans le Transperceneige !

A. Univers
Après un cataclysme climatique, les survivants de l’espèce humaine embarquent dans un train aux mille et un wagons qui roule éternellement. Prisonniers de cette machine, elle est pourtant leur seul espoir de survie. Les mécanismes qui font avancer le train permettent aussi, grâce aux mouvements, de faire fonctionner les installations de survie pour ses passagers. Très hiérarchisé, des wagons dorés en tête abritent l’aristocratie, les passagers les plus riches qui vivent en profitant de tout le confort que peut offrir ces wagons. Ces derniers sont également responsables du chemin à suivre, car ils dirigent le train non seulement de l’intérieur, mais surtout vers l’extérieur. Viennent ensuite des wagons spécialisés dans la récupération, le recyclage, les aliments mais aussi des wagons militaires qui permettent de maintenir l’ordre. Enfin, les derniers wagons sont de simples entrepôts aménagés en couchette pour la classe la plus pauvre. Elles est chargée d’alimenter les fours des moteurs et ainsi assurer la survie des passagers.

B. But du jeu
Chaque joueur contrôle une classe constituée par** **les passagers du train.** Chaque classe est différente et correspond à une hiérarchisation et une fonction spécifique dans le train (haute, moyenne, basse classe). Les joueurs vont devoir gérer des wagons à l’aide d’un deck de cartes unique à chacun, représentant les actions possibles à effectuer dans le tour de jeu. Les joueurs devront coopérer (ou pas !) pour survivre ensemble jusqu’à une des 5 fins de partie possibles : 4 scénarios de défaite, un seul de victoire.

En plus de coopérer pour survivre jusqu’à la fin de partie, les joueurs devront réaliser des objectifs pour gagner de l’influence au sein du train. Pour cela, le meilleur moyen : **accéder au** **convoi de tête** et diriger le train. Cependant, il faudra rester sur ses gardes, car les joueurs des classes inférieures auront la possibilité de se rebeller et prendre la place de tête pour, à leur tour, diriger le train et satisfaire leurs passagers !

C. Fin de partie
La fin de partie peut se déclencher à tout moment, par une victoire, ou une défaite.

Victoire

Quand le train arrive à bonne destination, symbolisé par un marqueur “Soleil” sur le plateau central, la partie prend fin immédiatement. La température remonte et l’humanité peut enfin renaître !

Le joueur qui aura été le plus malin, et donc avec le plus de points d’influence à la fin de la partie, prendra le contrôle du Transperceneige !

Défaite

Lorsqu’une des conditions listée ci-dessous est remplie, la partie s’arrête immédiatement. Le dernier espoir de l’humanité vient de s’éteindre.


Le train s’arrête (vitesse égale à zéro)
Le train ne prend pas la bonne direction (le marqueur “Mort” est atteint sur le plateau central)
Il n’y a plus de carte Événement à piocher
Un joueur perd tous ses passagers


D. Tour de jeu

Une partie se joue en plusieurs tours de jeu (15 maximum). Un tour de jeu se déroule en 6 étapes :


Phase 1 - Événement : Piochez une carte dans le deck Événement en cours (phase I, II ou III).
Phase 2 - Se préparer : Planifiez vos actions, échangez des ressources ou des services avec les autres joueurs, négociez…
Phase 3 - Travailler : Jouez toutes les cartes Action planifiées par ordre d’initiative.
Phase 4 - Avancer : Piochez un nombre de cartes Chemin de Fer défini par la vitesse du train.
Phase 5 - Se reposer : Les passagers au travail doivent manger et subir le froid, ceux au repos pourront se re-peupler.


—description from the publisher

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Supermutants: Tabitha and Raul
description: Tabitha and Raul are denizens of Black mountain in the Mojave wasteland. Under Tabitha’s guidance a group of Super Mutant Nightkin have set up shop, ready to create her state of ‘Utobitha’. Her radio broadcasts and night time raids have become the scourge of the area surrounding the encampment. One victim of the raids is Raul, a ghoul mechanic always kept one day away from execution by the Nightkin. His services are his salvation however, and as long as he keeps fixing things, the Super Mutants will continue to have a use for him.

name: Temple of X
description:
The Temple of X? Nobody except the group’s members knew exactly what it was or where it was located. There were rumors, of course. Most people thought it was a doomsday cult dedicated to aliens and the end of the world. But, the group was notoriously tight-lipped about their beliefs and what went on inside their compound. Yet, more and more people joined the Temple of X thanks to their mysterious and charismatic leader. People left their families without much explanation and cut off communication with the outside world, choosing instead to live at the commune with their newfound “brothers and sisters.” It’s been weeks since anyone from the Temple of X has been heard from or seen. A group of concerned family members has hired you and your colleagues at the Will Street Detective Agency to investigate and find out if their relatives are still alive. What will you find inside the Temple of X?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: Murano: Light Masters – Game Up
description:
2 expansion modules for Murano Light Masters

Challenge, play solo!

With your experience and your know-how, you have become one of the great glass masters of Murano. Your fame has drawn rivalry from your peers, and in particular that of Grandmaster Alvise (automaton). He will use his cunning to pull strings and put obstacles in your way to complicate your building plans.

It's up to you to counter cleverly, and to use the stratagems put in place by the Grand Master to succeed in your 6 deeds.

The Glass Festival

Draft mode (competitive mode): Shuffle the 24 Works cards and deal 6 cards to each player (7 cards in a 2-player game). In turn, everyone will choose a card, then pass the remaining ones to their neighbor on the left. The cards thus drafted are placed in the order of resolution. As soon as each player has his complete hand (5 cards or 6 with 2 players), return the remaining cards to the box with the others.

Interactive mode (playable with draft mode): Choose one of these 4 Advantage cards to add more interaction between players.

name: Dire Dinner
description:
In Dire Dinner, players take on the roles of randomly selected minions forced to prepare a six-course feast for their monstrous overlord, Gurth the Odious. It's a cooperative tile-laying game where players have to assemble color-coordinated dishes each round, made with ingredients that often have a multi-step preparation process. There are a hundred unique, bizarre ingredients, unique skills and abilities for each player character, and a kitchen where anything may happen to amuse Gurth - or make him angrier. The goal is to keep Gurth’s mood score high enough by the end of the game so he doesn’t eat the players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Drawing, Modular Board, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Vs. System 2PCG: WandaVision
description:
Add both Wanda Maximoff, the Scarlet Witch, and Vision as they appear in Marvel Studios’ WandaVision to your decks!

Wield the Secrets of the Westview Anomoly: Strange things are happening in this idyllic town, with Monica Rambeau and more trying to solve the mysteries of the Hex.

It Was Agatha All Along: A fellow magic-user’s agenda leads Wanda down a path of both discovery… and towards darker powers the MCU has never seen before.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: UNGA BUNGA!
description:
UNGA BUNGA! is a family oriented card game, where players compete to become the ultimate caveman. Players are required to make items like tools, clothes and fire by matching the cards that make those items and placing the cards on the table next to that item card. Players may also send wild animals after their opponents in the hope of stealing their opponents cards if the wild animal cannot be defeated. When a player has made all six items they are declared the ultimate caveman and they win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Дръж се, Земьо! (Hold on, Earth!)
description:
Hold on, Earth! is a board game in which participants assume the role of Bulgarian heroes in search of lost fairy tales. They wander through the areas where the map of Bulgaria is divided and try to save the world from dark forces. They must face the horrors that lurk everywhere in order to reach the lost tales and gain influence over the various locales.

Information from the publisher:
Hold on, Earth! is a family strategy game for 3 - 5 players.
The main goal in this fantasy world is to find the lost fairy tales. But horrors lurk everywhere, and the people are divided. With cunning, strategy, and no small amount of luck, players will have to discover the fairy tales and save the world from dark forces!
Players move their characters around the playing field in a predetermined order and aim to find the most fairy tales. However, this is not so easy! Instead of a fairy tale, you may find yourself face to face with а horror, misfortune may happen to you, or good fortune may smile upon you. Characters can also gain influence over localities, which will bring them extra points at the end of the game.

Дръж се, Земьо! е настолна игра, в която участниците влизат в ролята на български герои в търсене на изгубени приказки. Те странстват из месностите, на които е разделена картата на България и се опитват да спасят света от мрачните сили. Те трябва да се изправят пред страшилищата, които дебнат навсякъде, за да достигнат до изгубените приказки и да спечелят влияние над различните местности.

Информация от издателя:
Дръж се, Земьо! е семейна стратегическа игра за 3 - 5 играчи.
Основната цел в този фантастичен свят е да се намерят изгубените приказки. Но навсякъде дебнат страшилища, а и народът е разединен. С хитрост, стратегия и не малка доза късмет играчите ще трябва да открият приказките и да спасят света от мрачните сили!
Играчите местят своите герои по игралното поле по предварително определен ред и се стремят да намерят най-много приказки. Това обаче не е толкова лесно! Вместо приказка може да се озовеш лице в лице със страшилище, да ти се случи неволя или пък добрата съдба да ти се усмихне. Героите могат да печелят и влияние над местностите, което да им донесе допълнителни точки в края на играта.

name: L'oeil en coin
description:
The players take turns being the captioner.
The captioner chooses a photograph card from their hand and captions it, after which each other player (the viewers) will find a card that matches the caption.

After that, each viewer tries to guess which card is the captioner's, pointing to their candidate. The captioner may then point to the most interesting alternative card.

Points: If everybody guesses the captioner's card, the captioner gets 0 points and everybody else gets 2.
If nobody guesses the captioner's card, the captioner loses a point.
If at least one, but not all viewers guess correctly, the captioner gets three points and the correct viewers each get 2.

Also, viewers whose cards have been pointed to, get a point for each finger pointing to them.
