Special rule: Two of the photographs show a camera. If one of these is played, points for the round are doubled. If both, quadrupled.

Game ends when someone has a pre-agreed number of points, e.g. 36.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Karstark Loyalists
description:
House Stark has many faithful bannermen that gladly march to war alongside the major house. One of the most stalwart allies is House Karstark. The lesser House was originally founded as an offshoot of the major. House Karstark’s soldiers are generally kitted out with flails and shields, making them rather deadly in combat. Though, truly, their greatest weapon is the conviction of House Stark’s cause, meaning they will fight valiantly to the bitter end whenever possible.

The Karstark Loyalists box set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Stark players a new melee unit to field on the tabletop. While the troops are moderately armed and armored, it’s their faith in House Stark’s cause that can see them through combat. When joined by a Loyalist Captain, their zeal reaches almost religious levels, cutting down their enemies in a flurry of attacks.

Approximate Height
Captain: 44mm
Bannerman: 57mm
Loyalist A: 38mm
Loyalist B: 40mm
Loyalist C: 41mm
Loyalist D: 50mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  ‣ 1 Bannerman
  ‣ 1 Captain
  ‣ 11 Loyalists
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray (120x140mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: The Wilderness
description:
The Wilderness Boardgame is a memorable, solo, or cooperative adventure experience for 1-6 players. Set in a beautiful dystopic world where nature has reclaimed the cities. The Survivors will have to fight a horde of wolves and a giant Beast to create a safe heaven amid this chaos.

With unique mechanics, such as limiting the number and places you could draw resources, discarding weapons to upgrade new ones, limiting the number of actors per zone, different skill paths for every character, and many more... The Wilderness Boardgame will challenge your communication and resource management skills.

The Wilderness Boardgame is a unique experience as it's a hybrid between the Boss Battler and Dungeon Crawler genres.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Highgarden Pikemen
description:
After the death of Robert Baratheon, House Baratheon became a House divided. Robert’s brothers, Stannis and Renly, both decided that they should be the next one to sit on the Iron Throne. As such, different groups have thrown in their loyalty with one or the other. House Tyrell, one of House Baratheon’s most staunch supporters, has chosen to place their faith in Renly, offering their stalwart Highgarden Pikemen to his cause.

The Highgarden Pikemen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon players who also want to see Renly on the Iron Throne a new melee option for their armies. The soldiers train relentlessly, able to bring their strength to bear on enemies. And such is their conviction, that troops can continue to fight on even if once thought lost. When paired with a Pikemen Captain, the soldier’s numbers can seemingly multiply.

Approximate Height
Captain: 46mm
Bannerman: 64mm
Pikemen A: 64mm
Pikemen B: 64mm
Pikemen C: 64mm
Pikemen D: 60mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  ‣ 1 Bannerman
  ‣ 1 Captain
  ‣ 11 Pikemen
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray (120x140mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Cards Christians Like: Worship Expansion Pack
description:
The Worship Expansion is perfect for anyone who has led worship, enjoys worship music or failed an audition to join the worship choir. These spirit-led additions to Cards Christians Like will enrich your experience with 30 never before seen cards (25 white cards and 5 blue cards). Whether you love Reckless Love or theologically find it problematic, this expansion is for you.

A collaboration with @worshiponline – Cards Christians Like base game required for gameplay.

-description from publisher's website

name: Cards Christians Like: Dating Expansion Pack
description:
The Dating Expansion is your guaranteed way to finally get someone to swipe right. These 30 brand new additions to Cards Christians Like will fix your dating life so you can finally bring someone home for the holidays to appease your concerned parents. (24 white cards and 6 blue cards).

A collaboration with @dateupward – Cards Christians Like base game required for gameplay.

-description from publisher's website

name: Piously
description:
You are the high priests of Light and Darkness, and your patron deities have been at war for ages. The fate of their struggle rests with the seven goddesses. You’ve come to the Temple of the Seven to seek their gifts and exert your influence, but beware: the Seven do not take sides prematurely. Whenever you ask one for a blessing, she will give another gift to your enemy. Wield these gifts carefully to gain control of the temple.
Piously is a two-player game of area control and tactical combos. You’ll be fighting to place auras on the board and convert enemy auras to your own. If you form a connected region of auras that touches all seven rooms of the temple, you win!
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Empire in Flames
description:
Empire in Flames is a solo print-and-play strategy game set in the world of Reign Absolute played on a hex-based map.
You play the Empire and your goal is to eliminate the treasonous rebels through various actions and abilities before they reach your capital and the Doom Clock is depleted.

After randomly placing all Empire and Rebel units on the hex map, you alternate taking actions for the Empire and the Rebels. You roll dice to assign actions to your units and for the Rebels you follow the Rebel Logic board to determine their actions.

You win by eliminating all Rebel units and you lose when all your units are defeated or the doom clock runs out.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero)
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z ／ ゼロ (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z / Zero) is a co-operative card game from Japan. Previously produced as 精霊回路ドライヴ (Seirei Kairo Drive) and then as 精霊回路ドライヴEXE (Spirit Circuit Drive EXE), this new edition follows the same theme and gameplay, with a refreshed design and artwork. The artwork includes a smartphone style display, to give the feel of playing a videogame.

The game is published as a base set, with seven expansion (six special characters and a raid-box expansion). These expansions build on the previous expansion sets for the prior games. The game includes solitaire play.

The designer says "UNO-like engine + smartphone game theme party building cooperative card game. Each player selects a unit card at the beginning of the game and forms a party.

During the game, play by matching the numbers and colors of the cards, attack with your own units and use skills, to destroy the enemies that appear one after another.

The purpose of this game is to make full use of units with various abilities and stats, and cooperate with friends to defeat powerful boss enemies."

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲームです。
各プレイヤーはゲームの最初にユニットカードを選んでパーティ編成します。
ゲーム中はカードの数字や色を合わせてプレイし、自軍ユニットで攻撃したりスキルを使い、
次々と現れる敵を撃破していきましょう。
様々な能力とステータスを持つユニットを駆使し、仲間と連携して強大なボス敵を倒すのがこのゲームの目的になります。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rogue Hammer
description:
Welcome to Rogue Hammer. 

In this rulebook you will find a fast, easy-playing game of unit based combat closely inspired by the setting and units of the original Rogue Trader rulebook, powered by Squad Hammer.

The game rules are unit based, instead of rolling by figure with a straight-forward tactical system that allows units to retreat and regroup and intense, dramatic firefights at close quarters. The rules cover large monsters, psionics, vehicles, heroes and infantry. 

A typical game can easily be played in an evening and the rules can be used with a wide range of figures. Points values are provided to approximate the major troop types of the original Rogue Trader (Imperial army, star knights, galactic orcs, galactic elves and the 6 limbed Crawlers) plus a few new faces and a few vehicles with more to come.

A total of 32 unit types and 5 vehicle types have been given profiles and points values.

A typical battle is 4-8 units on each side and you can use your original figures or adapt any of the great scifi ranges for sale in the market including in 15mm scale if you prefer. 

Scenario generation with discoverable objections, battlefield exploration and random events is included, suitable for pick-up games as well as those nights where making a scenario just isn't in the cards.

The rules include a progression system where units can be carried over and gain experience in battle.

And of course the game includes solo mechanics, meaning the only thing you need is some miniatures (whether brand new or some dusty old troopers ready for a new battle) and a 3x3 foot table. You can also use the solo system to play with a friend against the bad guys. 

This is only the beginning: While this is a full game, it can be expanded in a number of ways including all the classic units, more scenario options, random events and more. The plan is to support the game through Patreon with updates every month that add new content to the game and incorporate any tweaks and corrections. These updates will be added to the Wargame Vault rulebook a few months later to allow time for testing and catching bugs. The intention is to do a single "Living Rulebook" rather than a supplement model.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Precision Rugby
description:
A print and play sports simulation using cards and dice to replay rugby tournaments, including 15-a-side, 13-a-side and 7-a-side varieties.

The roll of a number of dice will determine the outcome of each possession with each team having a range of dice results determining who has possession and whether a try or kick has been scored. Each match can be completed in a short amount of time, meaning a whole tournament or season is possible in a reasonable time-span.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clades Variana: La bataille de Teutoburg
description:
Clades Variana is a Print & Play solitaire wargame simulating the Battle of Teutoburg which took place from September 7 to 11, 9 AD between the army of the Roman Consul Publius Quinctilius Varus and the coalition of Germanic tribes led by the Cheruscan Arminius.
In this game, four 21x29.7cm format maps represent the historical space of this combat. On this space, 1cm is equivalent to about 200-400m on the ground.
1 turn of the game represents half a day of history, a game is played in 8 turns. The player tries to avoid the announced disaster of the Roman forces while the game directs the efforts of the Germans to annihilate the enemy column; but he can also reverse the roles and like Arminius organize the ambush against Varus' army.
In just 4 days, barbarians annihilated 3 legions, the pride of Rome, forever marking the history of the conquerors. Will you manage to get out of this trap, will you succeed in uniting the Germanic tribes against the common threat? It's up to you to change destiny...

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Next War: Series Supplement #4
description:
This fourth Next War supplement contains the following items:
Rules for playing combined games.
An SOP specifically for Combined Games.
Rules covering backfitting new or updated Series Rules to previous games or just catching up to changes in Orders of Battles.
New optional rules including Limited PGMs, Traffic Jams, Unit Morale & Resiliency, and more...
A new scenario for Next War: Iran (requiring counters from Next War: Poland and Next War: Vietnam).
Two Insurgency scenarios for Next War: Iran.
One counter sheet containing additional and updated counters including:
An Italian AW249
Tejas Mk2 for India
Polish AH-64s
Indonesian F-15C
Additional German F-35As
Various additional markers
An update SOP for using the Alternate Advanced Game Air System 2.0 rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Cyclocross
description:
Cyclocross is a bycicle game. It consist of two laps of a course featuring pavement, wooded trails, grass, steep hills and obstacles. Every player begins with 5 speedcards and 1 action card. The winner is the person who finished as first. With action cards you can follow the racer that is just before you or you can attack. At the beginning of the game you also need to choose your speciality. This can be grass, pavement etc...

—description from the designer

name: 増殖彼女 (Proliferating Girlfriend)
description:
"One day, she wouldn’t stop multiplying! I can't take it anymore. But if I don’t do something, the earth will be engulfed by 'hers.' I’ll fight to destroy them!"
In the solo puzzle game 増殖彼女 ("Proliferating Girlfriend"), rows of cards represent millions of copies of a young woman, which continue to multiply out of control. Every round, a new row is added to the top. If cards reach the fifth row, the game is immediately lost.
Each round, the player chooses which card to blow up and remove. When a card explodes, it may create a chain reaction through an adjacent card with a higher number. If multiple cards have a higher number, the player chooses which way the explosion will spread. But be careful, because if three adjacent cards are the same color, they will flip over and cannot be destroyed.
The player starts the game with 3 Ultra Girlfriend cards, which have unique positive or negative special effects. The game ends in victory once they collect 10 Ultra Girlfriends. A player aims to get the highest score possible by strategically blowing up cards, playing the right Ultra Girlfriends, and collecting cards to meet scoring conditions.

name: Hyperdrive
description:
Hyperdrive is a disc flicking battle game where the perfect shot can turn the tide of war, but it’s also a strategic game of tough tactical decisions.

In Hyperdrive you will build your army, launch your fighters and target your enemies. If that doesn’t work, ram them into a black hole and claim the galaxy as your prize. Whoever builds two space stations in the neutral zone first, wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Flicking, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: The Binder of Doom: Monster Strike
description:
Monsters are attacking Stermont! Join the Super Secret Monster Patrol (S.S.M.P.) to defeat the monsters before they destroy the whole town.

Featuring characters and settings from the Notebook of Doom and the Binder of Doom, you and your friends join the SSMP to stop monsters as they tromp through regions of town. Each equipment card has instructions on different and silly dexterous ways to aim your dice roll at the monsters. To win, defeat all 12 monsters before they escape or they destroy the town.

name: Evil Bunny
description:
Evil Bunny is the Mario Kart of card games where a simple card can ruin relationships in an instant. It's fun, fast-paced, and ruthless. Players start with three golden eggs. On each player's turn, the top card is drawn and determines where they must pass their golden eggs. To the player on their left, right, or to the center of the table. This continues until there is only one remaining player with golden eggs. Pretty easy, right?

Here's where the game gets pretty ruthless. Scattered throughout the deck are Mystery Boxes. These cards give players the ability to sabotage and attack other opponents. You'll even have the option to target specific players. Let's just say, your definition of family might change after playing a round or two.

—description from the publisher

name: Fathom
description:
Fathom is a tile-laying, pattern-building game of deep-sea exploration. Take on the role of a near-future marine biologist competing to uncover the secrets of an uncharted underwater ecosystem.

Over 6 rounds of simultaneous play, guide your biologist and their submersible drone across the ocean. Scan the unmapped depths and place tiles representing signs of marine life. Descend into the darkness and reveal these tiles to discover remarkable creatures.

The depths are vast and time is limited; savvy decision-making under pressure is crucial to a successful expedition. Choose wisely which creatures to investigate, as those you don’t pursue may be discovered by your opponents.

At the end of the game, you’ll gain points based on the scoring criteria of species you've discovered. Some thrive in a homogenous environment; others fare better surrounded by diversity. The solitary life may suit certain creatures, but straying from the safety of a group spells disaster for others.

Discover the most synergistic ecosystem to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Hero Realms: Character Pack – Bard
description:
Even more classes! Play Hero Realms as an Alchemist, Barbarian, Bard, Monk, Druid or (KS exclusive) Necromancer! Character Packs add a cool new dimension to player vs player games. Each match-up is a unique challenge which will require different strategies. When playing a cooperative campaign (either Ruins of Thandar or Dungeons), your Character Pack represents the starting point for your character that you will customize over time.

Bards are the singers of songs and tellers of tales. Bards embolden commonfolk, rally warriors, and captivate kings.

As the bard you will gain bonuses as you acquire champions, then inspire those champions to perform great feats!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Character Pack – Druid
description:
Even more classes! Play Hero Realms as an Alchemist, Barbarian (both included in Hero Realms: Dungeons), Bard, Monk, Druid or the (KS exclusive) Necromancer! Character Packs add a cool new dimension to player vs player games. Each match-up is a unique challenge which will require different strategies. When playing a cooperative campaign (either Ruins of Thandar or Dungeons), your Character Pack represents the starting point for your character that you will customize over time.

These powerful shapeshifters are one with the forest and its creatures.

As the Druid, the creatures of the forest come to your aid. When danger approaches you can transform into a great bear and protect your furry followers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Character Pack – Monk
description:
Even more classes! Play Hero Realms as an Alchemist, Barbarian (both included in Hero Realms: Dungeons), Bard, Monk, Druid or the (KS exclusive) Necromancer! Character Packs add a cool new dimension to player vs player games. Each match-up is a unique challenge which will require different strategies. When playing a cooperative campaign (either Ruins of Thandar or Dungeons), your Character Pack represents the starting point for your character that you will customize over time.

This pack introduces the monk.

The mental discipline, acrobatic skills and combat prowess of these spiritual warriors is legendary.

As a Monk, you will deliver precision strikes and armor-crushing blows with your bare hands. You'll play your Tao Lu cards in combination to deal devastating damage to your opponent and heal yourself.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Character Pack – Necromancer
description:
Even more classes! Play Hero Realms as an Alchemist, Barbarian (both included in Hero Realms: Dungeons), Bard, Monk, Druid or the (KS exclusive) Necromancer! Character Packs add a cool new dimension to player vs player games. Each match-up is a unique challenge which will require different strategies. When playing a cooperative campaign (either Ruins of Thandar or Dungeons), your Character Pack represents the starting point for your character that you will customize over time.

The secret art of necromancy harnesses the magic left behind when the spirit leaves the body at the moment of death. A necromancer can harness this magical energy to animate the remains into soulless warriors that know neither pain nor fear.

As a necromancer you will summon a horde of skeletons to fight for you, and use your magic to imbue them with inhuman strength.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Watery Grave Campaign Deck
description:
Watery Crave continues the adventure, where "The Lost Village" and "The Ruin of Thandar" left off. It features a full-color Adventure Book, and contains over 100 cards, including 12 oversized Master cards.
Choose one of four different ships and set sails.
Each ship has a different helpful ability, but be careful. It has HP, and if it gets destroyed, you lost!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Pesismestari
description:
Light boardgame based on Finnish sport Pesäpallo, which is somewhat similar to baseball.

Players draft teams and then play through 2 innings each. At the start of each inning, both players sort their player to deck as they see fit. Much of the game after that is solved through dice rolls.

There are also rules for 3 or 4 players.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: EMPIRE
description:
EMPIRE is a fast-paced and exciting hand-management game, and 2-4 players can have a blast in about 20 minutes. (If you only play one game. You'll probably want to play again!)

Use action cards (Acquire, Release, and Vanquish) to manage your hand and assemble the assets of your EMPIRE (a Hero, a Ship, a Fleet, a Planet, a System, and a Galaxy) while foiling your adversaries as they attempt to build their own!

The first player to have all 6 assets and NO OTHER CARDS (Ahh, there's the rub!) in their hand rules the EMPIRE!

—description from the publisher

name: Der Clou: Roll & Heist – 3 Heists of Christmas
description:
Welcome to 3 heists of Christmas. This is a campaign for Clou - Roll & Heist! The basic idea behind the game, to spread some easily accessible gaming entertainment in Covid times, shall be continued with this campaign. On boardgame-racoon.de you can find more about the game including the basic scenarios and a link to the digital version. But now have fun with "3 heists of Christmas"!

Introduction:
Like the basic game, the campaign is designed for 1-3 players and includes a total of 3 new break-ins. These are connected to each other and your gang of thieves gains more experience with each break-in. You also have the opportunity to buy new tools and make special preparations.
In addition to the 3 burglaries and these rules, this download package also contains the following:

an introduction and start story
the campaign sheet, where you record your progress, so you can interrupt the game between 2 breakins.
Once again all 4 thieves' sheets, which you do not need to print out again if you already have them.
2 story sheets
the basic rules, if you don't own them already


To play this campaign, you only need 3 six-sided dice and one pen per player in addition to this.
If you haven't played the basic game yet, it is recommended to read the rules for it at least once first.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampirratos Nucleares
description:
In the court of King Rattus, in the underground city of Cheesenobyl, players are nobles with specific skills, fighting to conquer the legendary Sword of Keijalho and thus become the Archduke: the supreme leader for the nuclear "vampirrate" invasion of the human world ! In five rounds, players must manage their nuke barrels to perform the best actions available and gather the largest army, in the best atmosphere of palace intrigue. The game features resource management control, player interaction and collection of the best cards to get more armies, accomplish missions and score more at the end of the game. Whoever assembles the largest army will rule the surface world in the name of King Rattus.

—description from the designer

name: Dawn
description: This is the first expansion of Glow, for 1 to 6 players (2 to 4 with the base game. New adventurers with their new powers and new companions will be available. 3 sets of cards will also allow players to dispel the darkness with 3 different types of new companions…
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Henhouse
description:
Henhouse is a climbing and shedding game for 3-5 players in which players will try to play combinations of cards from their hand with the goal of getting rid of their cards as quickly as possible.

—description from the designer

name: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Princess Pageantry Expansion
description:
Let’s give a royal welcome! Celestia, Luna, Cadence, and Shining Armor join the roster of playable characters in My Little Pony - Adventures in Equestria. These characters will bring new mechanics and abilities befitting of their status to the game, along with new locations and challenges to overcome.

Features:

Play as Princess Celestia, Princess Luna, Princess Cadance, or the heroic Shining Armor!
Use Princess Power! Princesses Celestia and Luna can trigger additional abilities!
Power couple Princess Cadance and Shining Armor have extra starting cards that work on each other's turns!
Attend Festivals using card Traits to earn useful gifts!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Andromeda's Edge: Escalation Expansion
description:
Many faces, one purpose - Unity, the oppressive authority you have fled, has followed you to Andromeda's Edge. Multiple Unity leaders, ranging in difficulty and tactics, will face of against your sole faction in solo mode. Or increase the risk in a multiplayer game by adding Unity into the mix.

The Escalation expansion provides pieces for a 5th player, two new factions (Nebulon Cloudpeople and Darkstar Acolytes), as well as a robust solo mode.

—description from the publisher

name: Winter
description: In the spring of 5000 BCE, you are one of the first neolithic farmers of Europe, and you have to cooperate with the other players in this turn based game to survive. The turns are seasonal, and each Season has 5 Phases, and every player completes a Phase before going to the next Phase. The Phases are (1) flip a Forecast and choose your single Action for the Season, (2) flip more Tiles as indicated by the Action and perform the Action, (3) your Domestic Animals fight it out with invading Pests and Predators, and (4) Advance your Fields and the Season. Then go to the next Season. The harsh snowbound winter will soon return, and you need to hunt, gather, fish, trap, and plant to stay alive. Keep your crops safe from hungry rats and insects that infest your fields and silos. Choose to either domesticate or hunt bigger animals to avoid starvation and survive the winter.

name: Felithian Factories
description:
Players start with a small number of Galactic Credits, a Corporate Headquarters and a small facility. Since space is a very large place, on your turn you roll dice to determine the area of space players will focus their attention this turn. As the Active Player you have numerous options including activating factories, building new factories, hiring employees, or even affect the conditions for victory. When you’re done, other players in clockwise order may activate their factories that fall within the area of focus you determined to produce raw materials, convert raw materials into finished goods, or sell finished goods on the market.

Money is needed throughout the game, but being the best at growing your corporation in the right places and at the right time will win the game. Three scoring rounds occur twice during the game and once at the end. The victory conditions change after each scoring (and possibly also by players) and are determined by a Victory Conditions card. The player with the most victory points at the end is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: HexaGram
description:
The game is simple - to be the winner you must 'out-score' and 'out-word' your opponent.
Take turns to place a tile onto the board and begin building words to add to your score.
The longer the word is the bigger your score gets.
Guaranteed endless fun for all the family; take on this challenge and discover the unlimited potential of HexaGram!
It's time to go head to head against family and friends in this classic game of strategy and vocabulary, designed to discover words on a 'whole new level'...

—description from the designer

name: Brethren
description:
A fast and brutal skirmish system, designed around quick and engaging gameplay.

Brethren is designed to be Fast, Fun and Ferocious.

The rules have been designed in a way to allow wargaming on a tight schedule. Like many others I struggle to get opponents and games in while juggling everything else in life.

Through playtesting the True Skirmish Mode (smallest iteration) can be played within half an hour and the Big Army Mode lasts the typical amount of time as other major games.

—description from the publisher

There is a free downloadable PDF of the Quick Start Guide on the Rules page of the website.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Third Crusade
description:
Unite with your brothers in arms for this holy war. Richard Lionheart and the Angevine have joined with knights from The Holy Roman Empire to try and conquer the city of Jerusalem and retake the holy land from Saladin’s Ayyubid dynasty and the Turkomans.

Fight for control over the cities and deserts of Palestine. Plan out your actions alongside your ally before turning against them and take the victory for yourself. Send out cavalry and siege engines to battle your enemies, but be aware of their need for water. You don’t want your army to die of thirst before they even clash with the enemy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Command Cards, Hidden Movement, Interrupts, Programmed Movement, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Battle of the Aspects Raid Deck
description:
An asymmetrical two-sided card game where one player takes on the role of the raid bosses and their minions, and is opposed by one or more other players who take on the role of the raiding heroes.

The expansions contains the deck and special rule cards for the Raid player. The raiding heroes will need 60-card decks (not included) to defeat them.

This raid focuses on the final confrontation with Deathwing, the corrupted Aspect of Earth.

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: The Caverns of Time Raid Deck
description:
An asymmetrical two-sided card game where one player takes on the role of the raid bosses and their minions, and is opposed by one or more other players who take on the role of the raiding heroes.

The expansions contains the deck and special rule cards for the Raid player. The raiding heroes will need 60-card decks (not included) to defeat them.

This expansion will focus on several villains from across the history of Azeroth, such has Aeonus, Achimonde, Mal'Ganis, Mannoroth, and more.

name: まじかるキングダム ライスル帝国侵攻 (Magical Kingdom: Ricel Empire Invasion)
description:
First Expansion to Magical Kingdom. The Kingdom of Paneteria, the Country of Bread, has grown rapidly and is now seen as an existential threat by the Ricel Empire, the Country of Rice, and they have mounted an invasion.

This expansion adds new cards and powers to deepen the Kingdom Building strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Peanuts Soap Box Drag Racing
description:
Welcome race fans and gaming enthusiasts to the annual derby boulevard soap box drag race event. The gathering entries in this year’s event are sixteen Peanut characters driving their own custom built soap box carts, and they are excited for the fast downhill racing action derby boulevard provides, although Joe Agate forgot to fill in some potholes. Your roll in all this excitement is to be the racing steward guiding them along this competition and making sure the whole gang follows the rules. Being the steward doesn’t mean you can’t root for your favorites, but just make sure they follow the briefing rules contained in this manual, let’s begin the racing fun on this beautiful day for the competition and crown a derby drag racing winner.

Each character has its own card to determine movement. The game uses a simple three die mechanic to the movement based off four variable skill movement characteristics: speed, soap box control, tire shake, and grooving. The result of the yellow D12 control die compared to the six sided red tire shake die will determine if the car drifts left or right along the track.

The game uses a sixteen single race elimination bracket, characters are randomly placed in the first round of the bracket and two drivers race against each other at a time, and the winner of each single race moves to the next round. Each race takes approximately five minutes to complete and there will be fifteen total races to complete the derby competition bracket and crown a winner. It's fast and exciting racing action for ages eight and above.

-description from designer

name: Kendo Playing Cards
description:
A light strategy card game based on kendo, the traditional Japanese martial art, descended from the ancient samurai warriors.

An entertaining card game with real-time elements, Kendo playing cards are designed for 2 players. It mixes bluffing and deduction with strategic thinking to create a funny and exciting gaming experience.

The game simulates a modern kendo competition between two fighters whose goal is to defeat their opponent using familiar elements of kendo. Players score points by performing striking combinations against their opponents and can keep or earn their focus points for executing these combinations at the optimal moment of attack and defense. Each player has a pre-set number of playing cards and each draw will allow him to change their technical „inventory” through optimal hand management.

Every decision must be carefully analyzed because one little mistake can cost you the battle. The game uses a small amount of kendo-specific terms in order to be easily understandable and enjoyable even for those, who do not practice the art. During the game, you can get a little insight into the wonderful world of kendo, the Japanese Way of the Sword, which is worth giving a try in a real dojo, aka training hall as well.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Simulation

name: Lonely Hearts
description:
A solitaire version of the beloved trick-taking game. In this solitaire version of the classic game of Hearts, you will play against the game (“bot”), with the same basic objectives: win tricks, but avoid those with hearts or the queen of spades in them, which carry negative points.

—description from the designer

name: Ranch Hand
description:
Welcome to Ranch Hand, the game that puts the ranch in your hand (figuratively).

You have decided to try your hand at ranching. You have found some land and a few animals to get started. Can you turn your little start-up into a bona fide ranch?

The game consists of 2 phases, the Auction Phase and the Disaster Phase.

Your goal is to meet the objective on your objective card by collecting the indicated animals on your ranch. To win you must establish 3 Ranches this way. To meet your objective, all cards must be the same breed of the animal indicated. You may change which breeds you are collecting as the game progresses. Your ranch also has a max capacity that cannot be exceeded.

During each auction round players have a chance to take 2 cards from an open draft style auction to add to their ranch. They may not exceed their ranch capacity and must discard any cards that take them over the limit.

The end of the auction triggers the disaster phase. The active player turns over the top card from the Disasters deck reads the card out loud. Every player follows the directions on the Disaster card, not just the active player. Players have the option of avoiding disasters with a dice roll indicated on some cards. Certain cards also allow players to avoid disasters. You must survive the disaster round to consider you objective completed. Once an objective is completed players draw a new objective and start over carrying over only a few cards from the previous objective. The first player to complete 3 objectives wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Tags

name: Gone Campin'
description:
You are attempting to be the first player to get 50 points and 5 different terrain tokens (1 of each type) by camping in the national parks (and one National Wildlife Preserve). You get points based on the park you camp in and the camping gear you use.

Players collect camping gear and equipment cards and place them face-up in their campsite. Once they have certain camping equipment they can play park cards to camp in those parks with that equipment. Park cards have multiple camping options. Points are based on the camping equipment used and the park it is used in. Before a camper can complete their trip they must draw a trip card which tells them how their trip went and if they have any bonuses or penalties.

Players may also play action cards that allow them bonuses or penalize other players.

Park cards also have a terrain icon on them. Players must camp in at least one park of each terrain as well as earn 50 points (points are kept track of on a game board with player tokens) to win. The first person to complete both objectives wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Melding and Splaying, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Tags, Take That, Track Movement

name: Continuum
description:
OVERVIEWContinuum - a continuous, coherent whole characterized as sequence or collection of elements slightly different from each other that merge and pass one into the other...

Continuum is a 2 player card game in which players compete with each other in a dynamic duel, trying to outplay the opponent. By collecting, playing and manipulating cards accordingly, players put them together as profitable sets and valuable sequences as well as use them to thwart the opponent's plans. All that for gaining the highest score at the end and winning the game. There are several ways of gaining points and performing actions, so each player may find his own method for playing. To get more points, players have to push their luck hard to take certain actions in their favor or against the opponent. But they have to be careful - these actions may quickly turn against them because of immediate opponent's return actions during the same turn!

The gameplay combines core mechanics such as Push your luck, Set/Sequence Collection, Hand management and Gaining score. Taking into account the quickly passing time, players are forced to constantly balance their tactics as well as adapt their luck based decisions.

Besides the default multiplayer gameplay, Continuum also contains a solitaire variant which introduces a demanding Automa opponent to compete with. This mode imitates the standard multiplayer game. It includes all features and competitiveness of a 2 player game but without the need of a human opponent. The Automa cards determine the difficulty and aggressiveness of the Automa opponent. Player may tune the Automa profile to his liking during game setup.

Continuum offers an endless replayability. This, combined with a very quick setup and pleasantly short gameplay time, encourages players to play several games in a row. With handy components, the game fits perfectly for lunch breaks, trips and any occasions when there's only a short time available. Additionally, the digital version of the game will do great in remote, online play.




Check the forum thread for game presentation and all official resources/files/links
[OFFICIAL] - Game presentation + PnP files + Links + WIP Thread + Digital versions
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Agent Pink vs Omniscient
description:
In this print and play game, you are Agent Pink of the International Intelligence Initiative. You are parachuted to a corporate-owned archipelago where a secret society of technoanarchists called Omniscient are assembling the last hardware modules of a powerful new A.I. called The Eye. If they succeed, machines will rule the world. You are Humanity's last hope!

Cards show icon sequences that can trigger game actions. Complete the sequences by matching dice to card icons. Get the four precious hardware modules and get out alive to win.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: FloriFauna
description:
FloriFauna is a card game with three game modes to enjoy with the family, while we get to know a total of 12 species of flora and 12 species of fauna in Argentine Patagonia.

It is an ideal gift since its rules are very simple, and invites to generate new game modes in case of being used with small children or older adults.

In game 1 (FloriFauna) we must quickly play our cards among the four piles on the table. Whoever manages to discard all his deck and cards in hand, will have won. Also, if someone finds a pair of Flora or Fauna among the stacks, he must mention them, causing his opponent to move that pair to the bottom of his deck.

In game 2 (Revelations) each player also has a personal deck, but no hand is used. Each player, in a clockwise direction, will reveal cards to the table. If any player at any time finds a pair of Flora or Fauna, he can cover them, and thus take them to his area on the table as a trophy. Whoever puts together the most pairs until the cards in each deck run out will have won. If any player incorrectly covers, he will not be able to cover until he passes his turn again.

Finally in game 3 (The Only One), we must go removing cards from the hands of others, to form pairs in our hand and thus discard them. Everyone will try to be without a hand, in order to get rid of it, and only one will be left with a card that does not have a partner.

name: Box Score T20 Cricket
description:
This is a print and play sports replay game using real-life player statistics to play a full T20 Cricket game in 30-45 minutes.

Scores are generated using three decks of cards based on the batting team's selection of how quickly they aim to score (6, 8 or 10 runs per over). Each card gives the result of the next four overs, allocating runs to each batsman, any extras scored, and whether there are any wicket chances. If there are, the skill ratings of the batsman and bowler are compared and a D6 dice roll will determine whether the batsman is out or not. Once five cards have been played, you'll have completed 20 overs and the bowling team then takes over for its innings.
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Deck 'Em: War in Europe 1756-1815
description:
Deck 'Em: War in Europe 1756-1815 is a war game for 2-6 players with influences from Empires in Arms, Axis & Allies, and Conquest of the Empire II (among others). It utilizes an action point system used by the major powers while supported by card play based on the minor countries.

This is not your typical back-and-forth, territory-swapping, dice-rolling slaughterfest war game! Yes, there are dice, but the unique combat system does a better job of simulating the multiple battles and skirmishes that were a big part of campaign warfare during this time period. Players will make tough decisions on where to maximize their strength while working together with their allies.

I've created 5 campaign scenarios representing different years, each with unique and historically accurate alliances, starting territories and forces, and major power strengths. The game also gives you the freedom to create your own historical campaigns, or simply play a cut-throat, free-for-all style.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Wakanda Affiliation Pack
description:
Players can begin assembling their own team of Wakandans thanks to the Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Wakanda Affiliation Pack.

Bringing together Black Panther, Killmonger, Shuri, and Okoye from earlier releases in one convenient package, this pack gives players the miniatures that form the cornerstone of the Wakanda affiliation. Along with these characters, players will also find stat cards for all four characters as well as the Usurp the Throne, Wakanda Forever, Advanced R&D, and Vibranium Shielding Team Tactic cards, ensuring they have everything they need to lead Wakanda into the battles of Marvel: Crisis Protocol.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gather Your Party: Expanded Edition
description:
Venture into 5-6 player action with even more Patrons, Events, and Quests! Players will uncover new mechanics to help shake up their tavern with the introduction of Bards, Sorcerers, Fighters and Treasures!

This expansion must be used with the standard, Tavern Edition of the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Guess the Link!
description:
It's a who's who of whodunits! To start Guess the Link!, deal out a grid featuring sixteen celebrities and other notable characters. One player secretly comes up with a common bond that links three of them. Everyone else must work together to ask questions, eliminate suspects, and figure out the covert connection before running out of clues!

—description from the publisher

name: Heroes of Normandie: Pulp Stories #01 – Pumpkin's Revenge
description: Since the United States entered the war, eerie things have happened during Halloween. Several years in a row, out of nowhere, a haunted Stuart tank had appeared. In a blaze of fire and fury, flanked by pumpkin-headed soldiers, it had trundled straight into enemy lines and wreaked havoc on any terror-stricken soldiers it encountered. This time, German High Command hopes Father Leonhard, military chaplain and exorcist, will be able to send these demons back to the circle of hell they should never have left. He must celebrate a short mass in the sanctified chapel of Saint Gothard, near Cologne.

name: Chronicles of Crime: 2400 – Man vs. Meeple 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Includes 4 new characters to use in Chronicles of Crime: 2400 - 46, 47, 48, 49.

name: Munchkin Kitten Adventurers
description:
This wily band of cats is on an epic quest to face off against the dreaded Doggo of the dungeon! Add them to your next game of Munchkin!

Munchkin Kitten Adventurers includes five brand-new standard Munchkin cards as well as two brand-new Munchkin Dungeon cards.

Kitty-cat caricatures courtesy of Katie Cook!

—description from the publisher

name: Wards of Stonefall
description:
Wards of Stonefall is a competitive print & play roll-and-write campaign game for 1-6 players that offers a robust narrative and gameplay. All you need is a printer and some 6-sided dice! You can even use the digital print files to play on your smart device. This starts with Chapter 1 of 5 that are currently planned. Each chapter comes with 3 different game maps (1 for each act). Each act is an evolution of the previous game narrative with deeper rules and story points.

Players roll and draft dice to determine what kind of Guardians they can place to defend each of the 6 stones housed in protective sanctums. Remaining dice determine the type of creature (called Whims) that will be attacking. Players then roll another die to determine which sanctum each Whim will attack.

The goals of each act in Chapter 1 are for survival, to protect the stones from destruction. Future chapters may have different but similar style of gameplay following the narrative as the story delves deeper into the mystery behind the onslaught of Whims.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Open Drafting

name: Ragnarok Star: Ship Purple
description: This expansion for Ragnarok Star contains the elements for adding a 5th player to the game.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Mythology, Real-time
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Network and Route Building, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Versus 2
description:
A game with a fast paced mechanic based on puzzling in which players try to put in his/her turn as many pieces of his/her painting in an area delimited by a frame.

Each player has a different puzzle but one condition is always true: they both has the same cutting pattern. As there is not enough space for all the pieces of inside the frame, on his turn a player try to put as many pieces as he/she can in order to contribute the most to the whole puzzle, which will result a hybrid of both images.

The game ends when the frame is completed. The winner is the player who has put more pieces inside the frame.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pieces as Map, Real-Time

name: Battletech: Urbanmech Lance
description:
Loved and hated in equal measure, over the last four decades the UrbanMech has become the mascot of BattleTech. Recently, the UrbanMech has been turned into multiple plushies, appeared in a company box, and even a full-scale inflatable display!

This ForcePack brings a new pose of the original UM-R60 variant from the UrbanMech Salvage Box, along with three additional variants, including a brand-new ilClan Era design! No assembly required—includes four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Battletech: Alpha Strike – Counters Pack
description:
A perfect companion to both the Alpha Strike box set and the Commander’s Edition rulebook:


3 heavy-stock reference sheets of the most commonly used game tables
6 punchboards, including additional movement markers and trees from the Alpha Strike box, as well as all-new terrain such as rivers and roads, large game templates, and more.
A second complete set of the fifteen fold-up cardstock buildings from the Alpha Strike box

name: 5-Color Sentai
description:
The Dark Emperor threatens to conquer the world! The 5-Color Sentai (okay, there are actually 7 colors) must work together to stop him. Fight monsters, learn new super moves, and rescue your captured friends. If you can defeat the Dark Emperor, the day is saved!

5-Color Sentai (五色戦隊) is a semi-cooperative worker-placement game. Each player controls an identical team of 5 sentai superheroes represented by red, pink, yellow, green, and blue squares. Players also begin with black and white squares that represent unavailable captured teammates. Each turn, players place one of their sentai on a matching space on a card in the row of monster cards. Players compete to be the one to play the last required sentai, because defeating the monster grants points and an effect or the ongoing ability to perform a special move. Once all players have played all their possible sentai, players take back all their sentai and a new round begins.

All players begin with a selection of special moves that allow them to place more than one sentai at a time. By defeating monsters, a player may unlock additional special moves like Bingo Attack, Triple Fireball, and the Rainbow Ray. Victory may also trigger special situations, such as taking the start player card or rescuing captured sentai teammates. But be careful: some cards can make you lose other cards or even one of your own sentai.

The Dark Emperor is always the final card to appear. Once a player is capable of defeating the Dark Emperor, they must do so. At that point, the world is saved and everyone wins. But the player with the most accumulated victory points on their cards is the biggest winner.
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: SCP The Board Game
description:
SCP The Board game is a Asymmetrical role based game. Each player is given a random role. The first person to complete their roles objective wins.

You can play as up to 6 different SCP's, an NFT combatant, a Chaos Insurgency Combatant, A D-Class Personnel, or a Scientist.

Each role navigates a maze in an attempt to find other players or locations.

The map is segmented into 20 different rooms. Unless a player is in the room the room is hidden. The full map is never revealed to the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Pieces as Map, Race, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: World Cup! Euro 2020 Expansion
description:
Relive the Euro 2020 tournament with the 24 qualified teams, or with any of the 12 additional teams trying to play their way to Europe's biggest stage!
-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Шот Супергеройский (Superhero shot)
description:
With great power comes great party

Superhero Shot is a drinking game based on famous comics and movies. Finally, you will gain the abilities you dreamed of and gather your friends into a rescue team.
On your turn, you either complete a task or drink. For tasks you get bonuses. You decide whether to spend them or not. Sometimes animal cards shows from the deck and make you move. The game ends when the World Saved card reveals from the deck. The winner is the one who has accumulated the most completed tasks.
Who will like:

Those who love comics and films about supers.
As a gift to bloggers and anyone who wants to make a fuss in social networks.
Organizer of a theme party.


—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Gnarlwood – Rivals of Nethermaze
description:
Skittershank’s Clawpack and the Shadeborn take their shadowy battles out of the Nethermaze and into Ghur, the Realm of Beasts. Originally available in the Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze Core Set, this kit contains the miniatures and fighter cards for both warbands, as well as a complete Rivals deck of 32 cards for each. It’s a fantastic way to expand your collection with two amazing warbands – and you can even add the miniatures to your Warhammer Age of Sigmar armies.

This set contains:


The complete Shadeborn warband – Murderous aelven Shadowstalkers that utilise the umbral arts, melting into the shadows and then reappearing to strike down their foes from behind. Quickly assemble your warband with four push-fit models, cast in a deep mauve to stand out even when unpainted, plus fighter cards and a full Rivals deck



The complete Skittershank’s Clawpack warband – Skaven assassins that exhibit all the cunning and cruelty of the Clans Eshin. With five push-fit models in skulking brown plastic, plus fighter cards and a pre-made Rivals deck


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Wave One
description:
A booklet of record sheets for the A Game of Armored Combat box set, Beginner Box set, Clan Invasion box set.

Also included are record sheets for the Clan Command Star, Clan Heavy Striker Star, Clan Elemental Star, Inner Sphere Command Lance, Inner Sphere Battle Lance, Legendary MechWarrior Pack, Salvage Box: UrbanMech.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Wave Two
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Clan Ad Hoc Star, Clan Fire Star, Clan Heavy Star, Clan Heavy Battle Star, Clan Support Star, Clan Striker Star, ComStar Battle Level II, ComStar Command Level II, Inner Sphere Fire Lance, Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance, Inner Sphere Heavy Lance, Inner Sphere Heavy Battle Lance, Inner Sphere Striker Lance, Inner Sphere Support Lance, Inner Sphere Urban Lance, Salvage Box: Shilone.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards of the Dead: The Laboratory (Day 3)
description:
The Laboratory is the second and last expansion to Cards of the Dead: The Board Game. In it, players will expand on the original game adding a completely new zone, and also adding a brand new game mode: "New Game +"

Broaden the base game experience with The Laboratory.

Venture into the laboratory where the virus first emerged, square up against new varieties of zombie and find the cure for humanity it's too late.

Humanity is not yet lost and still has a chance. Find the Pathogens needed and produce a cure for the virus while fleeing from the hordes of zombies.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Speedy Words Twist
description: Speedy Words fans will get to play their favorite word game again with a TWIST! Quickly come up with words that start with a given letter and that represent a certain category. Find words of the opposite category with the TWIST version of the game.

name: Koniggratz, 3 July 1866
description:
Koniggratz, 3 July 1866 serves as a follow up to the previous CSL title "Mars la Tour" which uses the same Mark Hermann inspired system with a few new updates. Koniggratz (also known as the battle of Sadowa) was the crucial battle which determined the victor of the 1866 Austro-Prussian war for Germanic hegemony. Unlike traditional wargames, Koniggratz uses a unique sequence of play featuring pulses and formation changes in order to provide a more competitive experience between two players, and a more educational experience for one.

COMPLEXITY: 6/10
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Tri-balism
description:
Tri-balism is a game based on the Great Clan Gathering of the Nine Trolling Tribes. A moot called by the Shamanic Collective at which a careful balancing of egos, animosity, historical rivalries, paranoia, and toxic stupidity had to be attained else all chaos would ensue.

A traditional fun, family-friendly, card matching strategy puzzle game, Tri-balism is based on some very simple rules which promote strategic thinking and decision making. Tri-balism is designed to be played by 2 to 4 people but can accommodate more if necessary, and also has a single player puzzle mode.

The aim is simple, play 'tri-cards' to create 'gatherings' and score crystal-points.

Crystal points can also be expended to perform certain moves which allow players to manipulate the game board in an attempt to win even more points.

The player with the most crystal points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Sleeping Gods: Distant Skies – Skis and Poles Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

A new piece of equipment - Skis and Poles!
Effect: Travel 2 and Remove Low Morale (Must start on Cold Obstacle or Steep Terrain Obstacle)

name: Best Story Wins
description: In Best Story Wins, Players will use the 150 prompt cards as a starting point to share their best (and worst) stories. Impress the group with the best true story of the weirdest way you've ever made money, or a wild celebrity encounter, and much more! The juicier, and more personal, the story, the better. Spare no detail because the group votes on whose story is the best!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Snowdonia: Grand Tour
description:
A big box expansion for the classic railway-themed, worker placement game that adds a whole range of new scenarios and other elements while remaining compatible with the enormous wealth of material already available!

From the initial launch material:
- A completely new, substantive game mode that enhances and builds-on all the Snowdonia content you already own
- A special new component to enhance and improve all of your Snowdonia games
- Ambitious and challenging new scenarios made possible by these new elements
- Full compatibility with all previous versions of Snowdonia
- All promos released since the Master Set - collected together for the first time
- A new, revised and updated base game: allowing new players to discover the world of Snowdonia at a more accessible price point
- And, for Master Set, owners: The Final Fix Pack!

name: Salamini
description:
Salamini ("Oh Salamis!") is a simple but not simplistic game of trireme battles during the Classical Greece period (500-336 BC).

Rules are just two pages long, but include all the features of ancient naval warfare (shooting, ramming, boarding), are fast and fun but also tactically challenging.

A small and quick naval encounter can be fought between two squadrons of 8-12 triremes, or a bigger battle can be arranged, for a standalone game or as a part of a campaign.

A link to a free STL file of a 1/1200 trireme is provided in the rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Przygodziaki
description:
The aim of the game is to get to know each other better. The game teaches communication. By answering questions, you share your observations, ideas and dreams, and by listening to your loved ones, you can learn many interesting things about them.

By playing Przygodziaki you collect family points. Once you've tallied them up, take a look at the scoring table on the last page of the rulebook to see what you've accomplished together. Remember, you always win.

name: I Found Bigfoot
description:
Larry “The Squatch” McCallister, publisher of “The Cryptid Chronicle”, is needing new pictures of the
monsters and creatures that hide in the fridges of our world. Their story MUST be told!

It is up to YOU, intrepid photographer, to collect pictures of these fascinating beasts. Not all cryptids are created equal, however, and Larry will pay you based on their current popularity. Sell Larry as many photos as possible, but be careful not to wind up with too many photos in your hand at the end of the game...as anything not sold will COST you money!

Now get out there and collect those photos, and make the people believe!

…………

A turn consists of picking a face-up card from one of 9 stacks, or playing a series of cards to match and score adjacent (or diagonal) face up cards. Scored cards are set face down by the player.

The number of cards required to match increases, based on previous matches, and once something has been matched to its maximum amount that specific match can no longer be scored!

The game ends when 3 stacks are empty. Cards in your face down pile are scored, based on their value, but any cards in your hand are worth negative their value!

—description from the publisher

name: RoboMon: Island Adventure
description:
RoboMon Island Adventure is a prequel story in a more condensed format. The box also contains RoboMon Battleground which is everything you need for a player-vs-player experience. It is a standalone expansion that includes:

~4 hours of gameplay
20+ RoboMon variants

+ 10 new RoboMon

PvP Battleground Mode

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Ya Never Know
description:
Ya Never Know is a trick-taking game for 3-7 players played in 7 rounds. At the start of each round, players bet on the number of tricks they think they will win this round. Then, players take turns playing cards to score tricks. Once all cards have been played, players compare their score to their bet and gain points if they bet correctly.

At the end of the seventh round, the player with the most points win.

-description from artist

name: Remate Final
description:
Remate Final is a game of satirical humor about the sale to the public for 2 to 5 players and with games of an approximate duration of 30 to 45 minutes.

The players are dependents and co-workers in a clothing store.

The objective is to finish the game by keeping your job and being the clerk with the most sales.
To achieve this, they will have to overcome the calamities of this trade, serve the most horrible customers, juggle to finish all the tasks of the day, cooperate or compete against their peers and survive the constant threat of his irritable boss.

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Nick Fury, Sr. & Howling Commandos
description:
Nick Fury, Sr. and the Howling Commandos arrive ready to smash Hydra in this new pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol! An elite soldier who has fought in theaters across the world, Nick Fury, Sr. is a strategic and tactical mastermind who never rests in his mission to keep monsters at bay. He is joined by the Howling Commandos, an elite unit that has accomplished many great deeds on the field of battle. Operating together as a single miniature, they are ready to take on the most difficult missions regardless of the challenges before them.

Colonel Nicholas Joseph "Nick" Fury is an elite soldier who has fought as a member of the U.S. Army in theaters across the world. Drawing on his vast combat experience, Fury is a strategic and tactical mastermind who never rests in his mission to keep monsters at bay.

The Howling Commandos are an elite operational unit that has accomplished many great deeds on the field of battle. As a part of the U.S. Military, they fought side-by-side with then-Sergeant Nick Fury as an integrated unit of specialist operatives. Known for completing the most difficult missions regardless of the challenges before them, the Howling Commandos are renowned for their unorthodox tactics and range of combat skills.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Nick Fury, Sr. & Howling Commandos
1 Scenic Base (50mm)
1 Character Stat Card
2 Team Tactic Cards
3 Tokens
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon WC: Veni Vidi WC
description: An expansion to transform your one-session party game to a 10-run campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Siege of Port Arthur Game
description:
1904. The Japanese have invested in the city of Port Arthur, a crucial naval base for the Russians. The city is heavily defended by redoubts and forts. The Russians are confident that the Czar will be proud of their defense, despite the continued bickering among their generals. The Japanese have 100,000 men for the siege, but soon realize taking the city will take more than just superior numbers. The Emperor will accept no more delays. The stage is set.

One player commands the Russian forces and the other player commands the Japanese army.

—description from the publisher

The Siege of Port Arthur is a low-to-moderate complexity tactical game on the Japanese siege of Russian Port Arthur during the Russo-Japanese War
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Node
description:
Node is a sister work to Skirt. Like Skirt, the active player places a pair of pieces in the outer and inner areas, but in Node, the second piece is placed in a space in the inner area that is on the same line as the two pieces in the outer area.

The victory condition is also the same as in Skirt, if you can connect one of the opposite sides with your pieces, you win.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal".

—description from the designer

name: Tiptoe
description:
Tiptoe is one of those games where players compete for space to move.

After each player has placed their pieces two for each on the board, the turn player adds a friendly piece from their group at a distance equal to the size of the group.

The player who cannot place a piece in their turn loses the game. The game can be also played with diagonal adjacency allowed, or with a hexagonal board.

This game is included in Generic Board "Square".

—description from the designer

name: Binary
description:
Binary is a territorial game uses a checkerboard. The goal is to create larger groups by placing a limited number of pieces. The game is unique in that empty squares adjacent to pieces of the same color are also included in your territory.

This game is included in Generic Board "Checkered" set.

—description from the designer

name: ShipHead Card Game
description:
SHIPHEAD is a "shedding" (or ladder down) card game where you aim to be the first to get rid of all your cards. Each player starts with cards in the hand, cards on the table face down, with face-up cards on top of those. You shed them to a center pile, then the next player needs to play an equal or lower numbered set of cards (up to four cards total, of the same rank), or take up the growing center pile.

When one player goes out, the other players receive points for the cards they hold. (You don't want points.) Symbols on the cards influence the counting of those points. After the final round, the player with the least points wins. SHIPHEAD is a fast paced game and accommodates 3-7 players. It's a fun way to start or end a game day. Kids who love games can play it too. It offers meaningful decisions and a compulsive feeling--"got to get rid of my cards"! The most powerful cards in the game are also the greatest liability. Do you get rid of them at the first opportunity, or save them for a decisive moment? SHIPHEAD comes in a sturdy box with 108 cards, a page of rules and a page of illustrated examples. SHIPHEAD features fun ship-headed cartoon characters on the cards.

Since each player is usually getting rid of 1-4 cards per turn, the ratchet squeezes, the cards in hand are getting fewer, and the play pushes toward a conclusion for concise play. Timing is everything. When do you take risks, or how do you avoid them? When do you put pressure on the other players? How do you manipulate the flow? Can you wait for the right moment to make your big play? ShipHead moves along quickly. When do you use the cards in the hand, and when your cards on the table?

ShipHead offers fast and spirited play, tension, and meaningful decisions.

-description from designer

name: Pathfinder: Elemental Stones
description:
Take on the role of an elemental sovereign, shaping the very nature of reality in this fast-moving board game!

2 to 4 players take turns to draft and play colorful (and colorblind-friendly) hexagonal tiles to match specific patterns and meet their own secret objective. With several dozen pattern cards, variable objectives, and a game state that's constantly in flux, you'll never play the same way twice. Simple setup, easy-to-learn rules, and a short play time of around 30 minutes means there's always time for one more game…

—description from the publisher

name: Artisans of Splendent Vale: Recharge Pack
description:
Recharge your copy of Artisans of Splendent Vale so you can play the campaign again! By swapping out a few components, you'll be able to journey back into Splendence and continue to explore!

Contents:
8 Quick Change Cards
1 Rosha Companion Card
76 Sticker Cards
1 World Map
4 Character Sheets
1 Rulebook

name: Letterbox
description:
Letterbox is a 1+ player game about making words. Each player receives 5 double-sided square cards with a letter in each corner of the card. Players shuffle the cards and then begin play. They are allowed to rotate the cards, but not change their positions in the hand. Importantly, as long as the cards are all on their light side or all on their dark side, it is always possible to find a word no matter what order the cards are in.

In the solo variant, players have special challenges and additional rules to make the game more challenging.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time, Word Game

name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – One Man Army
description:
The Cursed City of Ulfenkarn is a dangerous place, dangerous enough to put an entire party of heroes through their paces as they meet wave after wave of the unquiet dead in the desperate quest to depose the Vyrkos vampires.

The original boxed game pitches eight heroes against a swarm of undead gribblies who lay wicked claim to the mortal souls who call the city home.

But what if the city had had just a single champion, one renowned across the realms for their unquestionable might? Could a mighty enough hero have taken on the forces of Radukar alone.

This free scenario – entitled One Man Army – aims to answer these burning questions, with a trio of the mightiest heroes in all the Mortal Realms who must fight alone to rid the streets of the Soulblight Curse.

Choose from Gotrek Gurnisson, The Light of Eltharion, or Gardus Steel Soul and lay waste to your foes. This download is designed for one-off journeys into the dark bowels of the Cursed City, but if players are truly brave they can attempt to play through an entire Ulfenkarn in Peril campaign…
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Greatest Little Cities: Urban Sprawl
description:
"Your sleepy little city is on the decline and some new investors want to help change that. Now you'll compete with other cities, securing the best building projects to gain the most prestige in hopes of become the Greatest Little City."

In this game, players will have two actions to perform. Gaining tiles and placing them within their city. Gaining a tile involves the Investor's Market, a series of building tile stacks arranged in a rondel. The active player moves their Investor clockwise to the desired stack, claiming the top tile. The Active Player pawn then moves clockwise to the next Investor in the rondel.

Between turns at the Investor Market, players can then add these buildings to their cities. New tiles must be placed adjacent to their City Planner, who then moves onto the newly built tiles. Each building type scores differently. Once four piles have been depleted, the game is over.

Greatest Little Cities: Urban Sprawl is the larger box version of Greatest Little Cities, a Mint Tin Game. The tiles are not only significantly larger from the original but the number of tiles of each type has been rebalanced to add a 5th Player from the original.

—description from the publisher

name: Alien Frontiers: Data Core Expansion Pack
description:
The Data Core Expansion Pack includes 8 new Alien Tech cards to be used with the Alien Frontiers base game.

-description from the publisher

Included in Alien Frontiers Edition X but also made available as a stand alone expansion.

The expansion comes with a rules card and eight new alien technologies cards, two copies of four unique alien technologies. When playing with just the base game the rules recommend mixing only one copy of each alien technology into the alien technology deck. When playing with an alien technology deck larger than that included with the base game, whether from expansions or promos, then the rules recommend including both copies of each of the four alien technology cards.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Heroes of Short Track Racing: Collectible Card Racing Game
description:
Heroes of Short Track Racing is a game that has driver cards for real life short track racing drivers. Each driver has a card that has their name, hometown, class of car and what set they are included in. There is a picture of the driver's racecar under that and the game card is on the bottom. The back of the card is the drivers bio.

The game card has a section for Action Numbers, Movement Range and Passing/Defending rating. The Action Numbers tell you if that driver can attempt to pass on that lap or if they are trying to keep their position. If a driver has the Action Number, you roll on the Movement Range area to see what happens. The driver can roll to not have anything happen on that lap, they can be able to challenge the car in front of themselves for position. They can automatically pass the car ahead of him or they can automatically pass the car just ahead and challenge the car ahead of that one. The Passing & Defending ratings are used when the driver is attempting to pass the car ahead.

name: Starlight
description:
In Starlight you play as a galactic trader buying and selling ancient alien relics for profit. Players manipulate the price of relics by changing the board (which is made up of 16 Location Cards). Prices can be further nudged using Research Cards, but players should make sure not to run out of fuel and have to rely on Investors!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Loans, Market, Ownership, Pieces as Map, Resource to Move, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource
