name: Zombicide: Warlords of the Middle Kingdom
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional buy provides you with a series of characters from ancient China, for you to use in your Zombicide games. Play with the likes of famous commanders like Cao Cao and Guan Yu, and tacticians like Zhuge Liang to ward off Abominations and Necromancers!

This Kickstarter Exclusive pack contains:

8 Survivors
1 Necromancer
1 Abomination
8 Survivor ID Cards
1 Necromancer Card
1 Abomination Card
1 Rules Leaflet

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Wölfel
description:
Wölfel was developed as a nice alternative to the card game Doppelkopf. This game, too, is about tricks and points and finding partners! Randomly, dice are drawn from the bag and hidden behind a privacy screen. The green hunters play together, as do the two players without hunters (= forest dwellers). Who plays with whom is partly decided only at the last trick. Compared to Doppelkopf, this game is less intense, more relaxed. But even as an expert, winning without some "dice luck" is hardly possible. Each dice color has different numbers, abilities, and interactions.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Arachno Evo
description:
Welcome to the fight for arachnid survival. The lives of arachnids are never easy, and surviving is always part of a complex and never ending game of hunting, eating, growing, evolving and learning. In Arachno Evo you will step into the shoes of a Spider from one of these four different species - Black Widows, Tarantulas, Jumping Spiders, or Spiny Orbweavers, and will be competing with the other spiders to be the fittest at the end of the game - ensuring the continuation of your species.

Hunting, gathering resources, stealing other spiders' egg sacs, gathering knowledge and undergoing mutations will be the keys to survival. But, don't forget to ensure that some of your offspring comes to life to perpetuate your evolved traits and rule the arachnid realm. Each spider species will compete to collect protein, dna strands, new knowledge, new tools, silk and steal other spiders offspring. Every piece of scrap you collect may be the little advantage that will get you one step closer to domination.

Arachno Evil is a tableau and engine building, tile and set collection competitive game for 1 to 4 players that is played in rounds with five phases each:

In the PRODUCTION phase you will be running your engine to generate resources based upon your current knowledge base (the engine is built on your tableau).
The second phase is the RESOURCES COLLECTION phase during which you will collect additional resources (tiles) that got caught in the central spider web that urdergoing constant change while you and your competitors try to control the best sectors of the web.
Then get into the KNOWLEDGE GATHERING phase when you will invest your generated and collected resources into learning new abilities and adding them to your tableau - at the same time, you will be trying to breed your offspring.
ELIMINATING FUTURE COMPETITION is the fourth and the cruelest phase of the round, it is during this phase that you will steal other spiders' egg sacs and make sure future competition to your offspring is kept to a minimum. Stolen egg sacs may be put to use in two different manners, as protein ingestion for you to open new spaces in your knowledge base (your tableau) or as war trophies added to your set collection.
The fifth phase is MAINTENANCE, during which you will discard any resources collected from the web (tiles) that won't fit in your limited inventory, replenish items and refresh exhausted elements of your tableau.

—description from the designer Alexandre C. Serpa
mechanics: Pattern Building, Resource to Move, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Astral Dreams
description: A mysterious land teeming with dangers demands great heroes. The gods grant the noblest of these adventures an eternal place among the constellations, to serve as a beacon of light for those in need.

name: Flight Command
description:
"Flight Command" is an abstract tactical-level solitaire tabletop wargame that allows players to command a squadron of advanced aircraft, fighting against the evil Red Empire. The game puts the player in the shoes as a squadron commander. The decision you make in this game are smaller theater decisions, focusing primarily on individual missions and an overall campaign. You must manage your squadron, ensuring it is ready for combat.

Each turn, you control one or more Flights of aircraft, moving them along a flight path, engaging Targets and enemy units defending them. You gain points by destroying Targets, and lose points if any of your aircraft are destroyed.

The outcome of Missions impact the overall outcome of Campaigns.

name: קרב תרנגולות (Chicken Fight)
description:
Game essence:
Chicken Fight is an exhilarating and suspenseful card game that involves a lot of humor, thought and enjoyment. This game combines luck with strategy and social interaction.

Each player gets 6 cards which they can use for only one action on each turn.
The players in the game must build henhouses, attack other players' henhouses (and beware of assassins!), protect their own henhouse, collect eggs, and use the different action cards in order to strengthen their henhouses and thus earning the largest amount of points and winning the game!

Game goal:
The player who earns the largest amount of points is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: TimeOut!: The Boardgame
description:
TimeOut! is a boardgame for children, to teach them the value of good choices vs. bad, and reward them accordingly!

This game features a gameboard with 6 progress tracks (for up to 6 players) and 90 cards, with 2/3 featuring good choices, and 1/3 bad choices. There are several cards that offer game choices for the players, and 3 blank cards, that your children can write on to make their own cards (and choices!).

—description from the designer

name: Battletech: Record Sheets – Technical Readout: 3150
description: BattleTech Record Sheets: 3150 offers players the record sheets for all the 'Mechs detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: 3150.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: German-Soviet War 1941
description:
German-Soviet War 1941 is a two-player game themed around the first year of the "German-Soviet War" between Nazi Germany and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) in eastern Europe during World War II. Players assume the position of either Germany or the Soviet Union, and command their own forces to fight. The game covers the German invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941 (Operation Barbarossa) to the capture of Moscow in December of the same year (the end of Operation Typhoon). The German player is required to achieve more military results than history, and if it is prevented, the Soviet player wins.

—user summary

name: Orbit Master
description:
Orbit Master is a trick-taking strategy card game that is based on the Zodiac. In a turn by turn gameplay, players choose 1 Sign to play and the first player to build a House of the other 11 Signs under their Master Sign wins the game. But beware, the 13th Sign Ophiuchus can poison your Master Sign and change the course of the game.

The 12 signs of the Zodiac have existed in peaceful harmony since the beginning of time. However, the murmurs of a 13th sign have persisted without worry until now. The Snake Bearer, otherwise known as Ophiuchus has taken drink of the snakes venom and become corrupt with poisonous power. That poison has opened a black hole ripping the Celestial Orbit asunder releasing the balance of the 12 signs.

The Celestial Orbit needs to be restored, but with an Orbit Master to keep its hold. Which sign has the ability to muster the other 11 signs to re-establish the orbit? And which sign can keep itself from being poisoned by Ophiuchus as well?

Each player must choose a sign to play and the first to bring the other 11 signs under their house becomes the Orbit Master!

—description from the designer

name: Zombicide: Climbers & Terrorcotta Walkers
description:
The Climbers & Terrorcotta Walkers Optional Buy comes with two new types of Zombies which you can add to any of your Zombicide fantasy games!

It contains:

15 Terrorcotta Walkers
15 Climbers
18 Zombie Cards
1 Rules Leaflet

Now, let’s see what dangers they have in store for us!

Defeated Terrorcotta Walkers have the special ability to reform themselves from the remnants of smashed clay left behind by the Survivors if there are still other Terrorcotta in their Zone at the end of the round. To get rid of them once and for all, Survivors must not leave a single one standing in the zone.

Climbers have evolved long fingers and claws which they use to climb over obstacles. Ramparts, barriers, and ledges will not keep these Climbers at bay. Survivors must be prepared to defeat these fellows when their defense is inevitably breached!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Roll and Rails: Austria-Switzerland map pack
description:
Austria-Switzerland map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 2 new maps:
Switzerland for solo play
Austria for multiplayer game

name: Roll and Rails: Czech-Slovakia map pack
description:
Czech-Slovakia map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 2 new maps:
Northern Ireland for solo play
Wales for duel play
England for multiplayer game

name: 1825 Unit 4
description:
The lost unit in Francis Tresham's 1825 series. Unusual for an 18xx game it is designed for one player (it can also be played with two players).

The objective of the single-player game is to take the minimum number of turns to run out the bank.

This is a stand alone game, although some of the needed components need to be drawn from another 1825 unit.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stock Holding

name: Etherfields: Story Dice Expansion
description:
Introducing our latest innovation, the AR Vault: Story Dice. Elevate your gaming experience with fresh twists on storytelling, stunning dice, and unpredictable outcomes. Whether you're a tabletop RPG fanatic or a board game enthusiast, we've got you covered! Our Story Dice are 5e compatible, making them perfect for RPG players seeking something new and exciting. For Awaken Realms board game lovers, we offer dice expansions to bring an extra level of gameplay to your favorite games. Join us for the crowdfunding campaign and stay tuned for more exciting dice reveals. Get ready to roll with the AR Vault: Story Dice!

Luck Die:
With this alternate Luck Die with a „high-risk, high-reward“ basis, players have a greater chance of rolling a critically good result, but be warned – the stakes are high, and there is also a greater chance of rolling a critically negative result.

Movement Die:
With this alternative Movement Die there is an increased chance, that the opponent move less. But beware – this advantage comes at a cost. Using the alternate die will also buff the Entity, raising the stakes and adding a extra layer of tension to every move.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Third Option: Tip of the Spear
description: Tip of the Spear expansion for Third Option adds unique units with enhanced capabilities. Twelve Tier 1 Sea, Ground, and Air Branch Team unit cards with corresponding counters that include DEVGRU SEAL Team 6, and U.S. Army Delta among others. The expansion also includes new event and asset cards for a total of 42 cards and six counters.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chit-Pull System

name: HUEGO
description: Cards come in one of four base colors. In addition, most cards show a second, different border color on the front side of the card. Five cards are dealt to each player, and a discard pile is seeded. Players take turns in UNO fashion playing a card from their hands that matches colors with the top card in the discard pile as follows: base-to-base, border-to-base, base-to-border, border-to-border, or both-to-both. Draw a card if you cannot make a match; other players draw a card if you match both. The first player to shed all his cards wins.

name: Yafsiga
description:
Yafsiga is a diceless skirmish game for two players designed to utilize a single deck of poker cards to generate thrilling, tactical skirmishes between warbands in the remains of a once-great kingdom. Players will utilize face cards to facilitate activation of their units and use the numbered cards of the chaos deck to cinch the successes they need to triumph over their opponents. A bespoke scenario generator caps off the experience, thrusting both players into the maw of danger as their warband is forced to adapt to the changing landscape of the Bloomsreach.

Each player has the complete freedom to build the warband of their imagination using Yafsiga's roster system. Blending the line between Wargame and Roleplaying Game, players will stat out their profiles with as many bonuses they can afford and weapons they can muster. This is the Bloomsreach, after all. Your warband will need all the help they can get.

After you've played standalone games with friends and foes alike, dive into narrative play with Yafsiga's campaign system, offering points of origin and motives for your warbands with unique reward and injury tables and memorable merchants to visit between skirmishes. Play a simple three-act arc in a day, or prolong your campaigns into a larger narrative with your friends as your warbands grow in renown across the Bloomsreach and beyond.

—description from the publisher

name: Crimea: Conquest & Liberation
description:
Crimea covers the series of campaigns in the Crimean Peninsula during the war on the Eastern Front. Several scenarios cover the period of Axis ascendancy during the period September 1941 – July 1942. The Soviet resurgence is represented by scenarios from September 1943 – May 1944.

The map area covers all of Crimea, the Taman peninsula as far east as Krimsk, and southern Ukraine from Kherson to Mariupol.

Crimea can be played as a set of standalone scenarios or as an addition to the OCS game The Third Winter, where it considerably changes that game’s southern map boundary.

Crimea is a low-counter density, small OCS game. There are 560 combat units, and one 22x34 map at a scale of 5-mile hex/3.5 days turn. Seven scenarios are included so players can start at different points in the action.

Scenarios:


Rite of Passage (Initial German offensive, 28 turns), 26 Sept 1941 to 26 Dec 1941.
Tiger by the Tail, (Soviet counteroffensive, 20 turns), 26 Dec 41 to 1 Mar 42, can be combined with Rite of Passage scenario.
Eviction Notice (Operation Trappenjagd, 4 turns), 8-19 May 42.
Operation Störfang (Assault on Sevastopol, 10 turns), 5 June 42 to 5 Jul 42.
Cross of Iron (Taman peninsula, 36 turns), 26 Sept 43 to 22 Jan 44, also the setup to combine with The Third Winter 26 Sept 1943 campaign start.
Sword of Damocles (Crimea setup for combining with The Third Winter 26 Jan 1944 campaign start).
The Liberation Offensive (Soviet reconquest, 11 turns), 8 Apr 44 to 12 May 44.


—description from publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Wyrdhollow
description:
Magic courses through the root-lined halls of the Wyrdhollow, deep beneath the carnivorous Gnarlwood forest. The hellish creatures that make up Ephilim's Pandaemonium seek to harness these arcane energies, and only Domitan's Stormcoven of knightly war-mages stands in their way. Fight through the warped caverns to secure the Wyrdhollow's eldritch power for yourself.

The ultimate competitive miniatures game dives deeper into the Gnarlwood with the Warhammer Underworlds: Wyrdhollow Core Set. This box is stuffed with everything you need to start playing, including two complete warbands, four decks of cards, dice, tokens, boards, and more.

Warhammer Underworlds is a deck-based strategy game of skirmish battles set in Warhammer Age of Sigmar’s Mortal Realms. It’s full of action, clever combinations and tricks, and fast-paced gameplay. You’ll be able to get started right away with the four complete 32-card Rivals decks included in the box – one for Domitan's Stormcoven, one for Ephilim's Pandaemonium, and two universal Rivals decks for any warband. If you wish, you can even tailor your own deck using universal cards from other Warhammer Underworlds expansions for near-endless strategic depth.

This set contains:


A complete and concise rulebook for Warhammer Underworlds – reformatted to make getting started even easier. Wyrdhollow places emphasis on Rivals decks, offering new ways to mix up your games and keep things fresh and balanced. The riveting background material explores the arcane caverns beneath the Gnarlwood, and the ancient relics scattered therein



The complete Ephilim's Pandaemonium warband. A genderless conjurer sworn to Tzeentch, Ephilim clutches magical items and spells in their many slender limbs, accompanied by a host of bizarre daemon familiars unlike anything the Mortal Realms have seen before. Quickly assemble your warband with five push-fit models, cast in blue-grey to stand out even when unpainted, complete with fighter cards and a full Rivals deck



The complete Domitan's Stormcoven warband. A group of Stormcast Eternal battle mages led by Domitan, these Knights-Arcanum are each a distinctive and powerful warrior in their own right. With three push-fit models in a vibrant blue colour, plus fighter cards and a pre-made Rivals deck, you’ll be ready to battle straight away.



2 additional universal Rivals decks, usable by any warband – harness geomantic power and shake the land itself with Seismic Shock, and wield magical venoms and wicked concoctions with Toxic Terrors.



2 double-sided game boards to represent the sinister root-ridden caverns beneath the Gnarlwood



Warhammer Underworlds tokens, including objectives, wound markers, glory points, and many, many more


​

11 dice – 5 Attack dice, 3 Defence dice and 3 Magic dice, enough for the most devastating blows, desperate defences, and cataclysmic spells


Wyrdhollow is perfect for getting new players started faster than ever with the streamlined rulebook and additional Rivals decks, and is perfect for bringing Warhammer Underworlds veterans up to date for the new season.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Die Icon Resolution, Hexagon Grid

name: Omicron Protocol: Critical Condition – Ranger
description:
This cross-faction expansion adds 1 new character who can play for both the Survivalists and Peacemakers factions from the Core Game.

Maria “Ranger” Gutierrez-Rivera is a Supervising Ranger in the Big Trees National Park. She is a crossbow expert and her unique fire/stun and healing abilities will help the Peacemaker and Survivalists factions better survive the CyMS onslaught!

It also includes a new scenario and 2 new forage cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Sins of Our Fathers
description:
Sins of Our Fathers is a may-follow trick taker for 3 players that features a hex board and variable end game conditions.

The game is played over the course of a single hand which consists of 13 cards per player. Every trick will result in special actions awarded to players based on their position within a trick.

Players will manipulate an ever dwindling water supply to score points during the course of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Trick-taking

name: Coalesce
description:
Coalesce is an abstract strategy game for two players, based on the principle of unification.

Components:
One hexagonal board, size 5.
A sufficient number of black and white pieces.

Contract phase:
Player 1 places any number of black pieces on the board.
Player 2 chooses to play Coalesce (Black) or Divide (White).

Play:
Players alternate playing stones of their colour to an empty space, starting with Divide.

Goal:
If Coalesce connects all their stones into a single group, they win.
If this becomes impossible, Divide wins.

—description from the designer

name: Shard Harvest
description:
War has left its terrible wake. The Star Tower and the Night Tower have their truce, but for us in the lands between, everything has twisted, everything has shattered, everything has been scarred by their dread magic. And power-hungry factions stir. The Crimson Coven...the Eye Cult...the Doompipers. But let them have their mad schemes. We have ours. We find the shards, we harvest them, and we fuse fresh spells. Not because we crave power, but because we must so we might survive. I shall follow the trails of those who walked before me, and fashion my own magic before I perish in my SHARD HARVEST.

In Shard Harvest, you play as an aspiring mage in a land following a devastating magical war between the Star Tower (in the west) and the Night Tower (in the east). An uneasy truce exists between these two schools of magic, but their war has left the land between fraught with dangerous magical energies, strange factions, and hopeful villagers who wish to gain magical power for themselves by harvesting the shards that periodically emerge across the landscape, shards the talented can fuse into powerful spells. You are one such harvester. Can you survive the unforgiving landscape long enough to attain mastery or will you perish as the many shard harvesters before you?

This is a board game for 1 player. You control a shard harvester, seeking the power to create spells. Travel can be challenging and tiring. Encounters can be deadly and devastating. Your spells will help you survive the perilous wild. You might die from wounds or succumb to old age. If you have one or more shards collected and you reach either of the towers (the Star Tower or the Night Tower) you win the game, and your shard harvester may either retire or resume the harvest in future games. It may take several journeys for a single shard harvester to achieve the maximum victory.

This is a Make-as-You-Play game, which means that you will create and modify many of the components during play. The components include the rules, the game map, index cards, a pen or pencil, a pawn for your shard harvester, and a collection of coins or cubes for the shards. Each game of Shard Harvester will evolve differently, with different terrain shaping the lands between the towers and different spells available to gain. Moreover, there is no limit to the number of shard harvesters you can make to explore your world or the number of spells they can conceive.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 3-Down Football Frenzy
description:
The unique hand management and dice interactions in this game replicate all aspects of the Canadian Football experience - from kickoffs to passes, running plays to quarterback sacks, punts to field goals.

It's everything you need to have a gridiron battle on your table without being overly complicated or convoluted. The turns are fast and furious, and the action is never-ending! Well, until the game's over that is... but you can always do a double-header!

Each card in the deck contaians an offensive AND a defensive play, each with modifiers to the dice to optimize your chances of successful plays. Use your wits and strategize to maximize your options! Dice rolls and card modifiers determine the success of offensive plays and yardage.

AND! There are 2 ways to play: A quick game runs through the deck once, and the high score at the end wins! Quickies take about half an hour. A regular game runs through the deck twice - the first time through the deck gets you to half time, and then you reshuffle and play out the second half. After an hour you will have an ultimate gridiron victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Spy Master
description:
Nobody ever said that being a top-notch secret agent was going to be easy!

Be the first to complete 3 Top-Secret Missions to be declared the Ultimate SPY MASTER. Use Action Cards to get what you need, sabotage other agents, and cause bedlam as you escape danger to carry out your assignment!

Remember - there are no friends among spies. Trust no one, use your guile to its greatest advantage, and good luck to you, Agent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: CLAW
description:
In "CLAW," lead your faction on a mission to eradicate the menacing cybernetic monstrosity known as the CLAW. Engage in strategic gameplay as you navigate through this semi-competitive board game, aiming for victory amidst the intense rivalry.

On your turn, expand influence in your Zone; draw power and knowledge from Instinct wells; and build Labs capable of bio-genetically engineering Goons & Constructs such as Airships, Tanks, Cannons and Zeppelins to increase your effectiveness against your foes.

Cleverly fulfill objectives to earn additional victory points and an edge closer to success.

Recruit mighty Dwellers from the Dark Hollow or the top of the Dwellers Deck to consume Instinct each turn. Utilize Dwellers to Light or Extinguish wells, or strategically sacrifice them at the right moment to deal a massive blow to your foes.

Navigate the Orders Clock rondel to gain an crucial advantage going into the next round of phases.

Gather Intel on the CLAW to influence their movement using the CLAW threat track, and direct the CLAW's Grinders & Constructs towards the other factions zones. Be careful! Your Dwellers could be caged!

Use your knowledge & Instinct wisely. If the CLAW eliminates another faction's fortress before you exterminate them, the power imbalance will cause the entire realm to fall, and everyone loses!

The leading faction that overthrows the CLAW by taking down their stronghold and gaining victory by eliminating their Cogs will gain control over their territory and reign supreme.

CAN YOU DEFEAT THE CLAW?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Closed Drafting, Command Cards, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Rondel, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Turn Order: Role Order, Turn Order: Time Track, Zone of Control

name: ScandalOh!: Breaking News
description:
Breaking news! is the essential add-on for ScandalOh! It is a book for the most seasoned journalists that brings you:

- 36 exclusive games, specifically selected for you to enjoy investigating to the fullest.

- Detailed profiles of the characters, the celebrities and their contacts. Who are they? What’s their personality like? What’s their occupation? What inspired their creation?…

- The murky underlying narratives behind each one of the stories.

- And a whole journey through the creative process that shaped the game and gave it its own personality: Sketches, ideas, discarded illustrations, Easter eggs, anecdotes and fun facts that explain every little detail.

Take your career in investigative journalism one step further.

name: On the Edge of Time
description:
The year is 2301, and you are operating an agency to travel in time to correct issues created by beings called the Altuli.

On the Edge of Time is a cooperative 1-3 player game (with a 1 v all option).

The players attempt to complete missions to protect their timeline. These missions must be completed before the temporal stress reaches a critical mass, the universe splits and is destroyed.

During the game, two missions will be revealed, the Altuli will land on the game board and restrict your resources, temporal stress will be evaluated, and then players will take their turn.

In the player phase, individuals can spend credits to acquire units, use their temporal energy to travel and eliminate Altuli and utilize research to develop technologies.

Actions taken back in time will affect future points in time, sometimes with unintended consequences. Complete 6 missions and one final mission to succeed. Failure occurs if the temporal stress becomes excessive.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Moving Multiple Units, Pick-up and Deliver, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: The Cradle
description:
We, the first of our kind, at the dawn of humankind, crawl out of, er, our caves maybe, to explore rich lands, meet sages, invent technologies, become a proper people, and herald a new era. Our deeds will become legend and live on, as awkward scribbles on white cards.

The Cradle is a legacy make-as-you-play PnP civilization game. You start with tokens for each player and a deck of blank cards. Each game, you add more content to your deck, turning blank cards into Lands, Sages, and Technologies, to be re-discovered by later ages. Each game lasts until one Tribe reaches technological supremacy. After a few games, a milestone technology will be discovered, ushering the whole game into a new Era that changes some rules and adds new actions and other possibilities as humankind as a whole advances through the ages.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Income, Legacy Game, Map Addition, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck

name: Dual Gauge: Netherlands and Eastern U.S.
description:
The third expansion map set for Dual Gauge!

These maps introduce Star Dits, which function as normal dits for most purposes – they count as a stop but cannot be tokened – but are worth more money. Depending on the map, players may also have an additional incentive to hit these stops over others. Both maps also see players in a race to grab bonuses, which also serve as another game end trigger.

The Netherlands map seats up to five players and features a new gauge conversion step, allowing you to flip narrow track to its standard side. Of course, what it doesn't do is change your narrow trains. You'll need to plan your train purchases carefully, and beware of opponents who might use this tactic offensively.

That's if you have enough time, of course! The standout feature of this map is a race to complete certain Goals. Achieving one of the map's eight Goals will win you a disc. This can be traded in later, either to place a station or to buy a precious second share of stock in a single round.

The Eastern US map is for three to four, and is a bit subtler. Preprinted track segments provide awkward chokepoints to either work around or embrace. Company turn order isn't fixed, but shifts from round to round depending on company stock value. Increases in that value are gated – tied to your dividends, so you'll need to work for big routes while your rivals try to block you with aggressive token play.

At the western end of the maps, there are the destination cities of Detroit and Chicago, each containing a set of Bonus Discs. When a company ends a run there, their President claims a disc. At the end of game, you'll get a payout based on the number of discs you've claimed.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Imperial Glory: Han Dynasty China
description:
This game expands Imperial Glory to encompass the Later Han Dynasty.

It includes a new map plus all the emperors, ministers and bits required to support a two-player experience. It also includes a solitaire scenario for the Han Empire.

Also on offer:
● 19 new Fate cards
● 18 new Ares cards, now with flavor text
● 12 jumbo-sized Emperor cards (including 3 Romans)
● 10 new Science cards
● 114 cubes and 17 sticks
● Historical article on the Later Han with a description of each emperor
● New rules: Corruption, Authoritative Emperors
● Clarifications of the base game rules

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Income, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Time of the Hunter
description:
Time of the Hunter is a mint tin solo game. Direct a small tribe's group of hunters, using your store of food resources to hunt and gather more food for the Winter ahead. Run out of food or hunting days and you'll lose, but gather enough to see the tribe through Winter and you win.

Your hunters start the day by grabbing some food from the store and heading out to hunt wild beasts. They can choose small or large beasts, with the varying rewards but also difficulty and threats they pose.

Dice rolls and allocation of dice to the sets needed to take down each animal decide success, but every dice roll or re-roll costs one food/energy.

name: Fighting Fantasy Adventures
description:
In Fighting Fantasy Adventures, Martin Wallace has adapted the Fighting Fantasy solo adventure book line into a card game format, letting you experience the stories in a whole new way.

Now you can play with up to three friends (1-4 players) in a co-operative or solo format. Gameplay is easy to learn and engaging, downtime is minimal, and your characters will gain new abilities after each adventure. The card-based system lets you have the feel of a role-playing game, without the need for a gamemaster. The map is revealed as you play, and event cards tell you what you have discovered.

This campaign will comprise five adventures based on the four stories below:


The Warlock of Firetop Mountain
Island of the Lizard King
Deathtrap Dungeon
The Forest of Doom (in two parts)


Each adventure takes roughly 90-180 minutes to play, providing 10-15 hours of total game time.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Map Addition, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Littoral Commander: The Baltic
description:
Littoral Commander: The Baltic is the second instalment of the Littoral Commander series. The game explores hypothetical conflicts and crises in the Baltic region of Europe. Building on the core Littoral Commander game system, Littoral Commander: The Baltic features new units, such as the Amphibious Ready Group / Marine Expeditionary Unit (ARG MEU), the Multi-Domain Task Force (MDTF), and various types of Russian regiments. Littoral Commander: The Baltic features new mechanics for ground combat, new cards, and amphibious operations. One of the new core mechanics will require players to outfit their ships for a campaign -- carefully managing resources and space, but the emphasis on managing all aspects of battle, especially logistics will remain.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: Small-Time Heroes
description:
The once-peaceful community we call home has fallen under the shadow of an evil force, and the courageous protectors who defended our town have set off on their own pursuits of fame and fortune. In their place, a band of unlikely heroes have emerged - the Small-Time Heroes. These are not your typical heroes, with bulging biceps and chiseled jawlines. No, these heroes are more like the underdogs, with quirky personalities and oddball skills.

In this cooperative deck builder, you’ll take on the role of one of the Small-Time Heroes and work together to defend the town. With each battle, you’ll build up your deck of cards, choosing from a variety of cards that represent your hero’s unique abilities. As your power builds, you will defeat waves of minions and end with a final boss battle. Defeat the boss before they defeat you!

Play a one off session by battling through three waves of minions and a final boss or turn it into a campaign and battle through all 3 bosses.

name: アルケミストのアトリエ (Alchemist no Atelier)
description:
A new student at the Alchemist Academy is given the task of creating a cure for an epidemic that is ravaging the city.

In each turn players choose to do one of the actions, that is, going to tavern to look for allies, buying items on the market place, going to an expedition to gather materials, creating materalis at your workshop or taking takst from the guild.

The game ends when a player gets 30 points.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dice Fest 2019 Convention Exclusive Promos
description:
Dice Fest 2019 exclusive convention promo.

Mask of Warai:
Forbidden Fortress artifact, Clothing, face, mask. +2 Sanity. Your to hit rolls of 1 do 1 automatic wound to a random model adjacent to you, ignoring defense.

Sword Cane:
Gear, Hand Weapon, Blade. 2 Handed. +1 Move. Your combat hits are +1 damage. Once per turn you may re-roll one of your defense rolls and one of your melee-to-hit rolls.

name: Munchkin Witches
description:
Evil witches are everywhere. Souring your milk, corrupting your files, sailing across the moon with a cackling laugh. What can you do? What you always do – kill them and take their stuff. Here are a dozen witchy monsters with Items and Curses to match!

This expansion works with any Munchkin set, but if you want witches to be a bit more central in your game, shuffle it into Munchkin Pathfinder and let the players be Witches, too!

The 30-card Munchkin Witches mini-expansion! This tuckbox includes new Munchkin cards to shuffle into the classic Munchkin game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Witches: Promo Pack
description: 10-Card stretch goal promo pack (was only available to certain pledge levels).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Little Lucky
description:
The cheese race is on, but which mouse will win the game?
To advance in this race game, the player has to find out which colour is underneath the next square.

—description from the publisher

name: Fish'n'Shark
description:
Papa shark is taking his little ones on a fishing lesson. Who will be the best?
On each turn, the players catch 4 fish, but they can't keep them all. They each have to choose their fish carefully to fill up as many boxes as they can on their board.

—description from the publisher

name: Piratrix
description:
Set sail on the high seas!
Who will be the first pirate to find the way to their hidden treasure on the island?"
The player who manages to place the cross where the hideout is wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Liar/Liver
description:
This is a game where you make your debut as a rookie Vtuber and aim for 1 million subscribers. Earn money while increasing your subscribers and do a lot of distribution. Don't forget to sabotage your rivals by extracting registrants from time to time.
—description from the designer (translated)

In Liar/Liver you will be choosing to roll 1 or 2 dice and then depending on the result activating your own or other players Delivery cards (Machi Koro style.) your character has a persistent power that will activate on a double as you try and balance followers and gold. first to 100 Followers (1 million) wins.

—user summary

name: Battle Trek
description:
A set of miniatures War-game rules for Space Battles in the Star Trek Universe.

Battle Trek uses a points allocating system, which is the first thing you do in each turn. Than the most important action is next, the initiative phase which decide which ship goes first in the action phase, but it might be better to go later in the turn. Special actions phase is any orders which need to announce before the next phase which is the action phase where you move, fire and anything else.

Equipment you need is a number of Starship models, dice (D6), Ship Cards, three (four) sets of different colour counters and one set of Veteran Captain Cards, Position Cards and a pack of playing cards.

The models used in developing these rules was from the “Eaglemoss Star Trek Starship Collection” from 2013, which are mounted on 4 x 3 inches bases, so you need a big playing area, but if you use smaller scale miniatures, use centimetres instead of inches and you should be able to play a game on a kitchen table.

—description from the publisher

Battle Trek is nothing to do with the video game of the same name.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ミラテル: Miracle Cocktail
description:
In ミラテル - Miracle Cocktail, players opened each their own bar in a city renown for its magical cocktails. They will compete to become the most popular bar in town, by obtaining the most popularity points.

Each round, magical ingredients are poured one next to the other from a magical cocktail shaker. Players will then have to choose a group of 3 contiguous ingredients, which will fill different storage bottles or even generate coins, depending on their amount and nature. Storing enough of these components or using them to create cocktail recipes will generate special actions, additional ingredients, coins, and popularity. Combos can be created in the process.

After 8 rounds, popularity points are tallied for every player and whoever has the most wins.

—user summary

name: Go Big or Go Broke
description:
The Lunch Room Game is not your typical food fight fun! With 6 squishy tater tots to play for, you will have to be quick so you won't lose your lunch. Players compete to beat the odds in The Lunch Room Game and it's cast of characters, like the mean girls, to be the first player to fill their lunch tray to win the game.

No game board in The Lunch Room Game, each player gets their own mini lunch tray, just like the one at school.

Players draw a card and add it to the matching section in the tray. Cards may switch up the game by making you trade trays, fight over tots, etc.
publishers: EAP Toy and Games, Easily Amused Productions

name: Felduz
description:
Introduction:Felduz (from Proto-Germanic: Felþuz, which means "field") is a card game for two to four players. It is played with a French deck of 40 cards (without 8, 9, or 10) and betting chips.



Definitions:– The field is the complete set of cards owned by each player with which the plays are made.
– The open field is a set of cards from a player's field that are visible to the other players.
– The closed field is a set of cards from a player's field that are hidden from the other players.
– The reserve is a set of N cards that a player discards when they manage to complete their card combination (where N can be zero).
– An event is a category or type of combination that determines how the winner of a round is decided. Events are classified in order of importance: "by points," "by length," and "by rank."
– An amphora is a mandatory initial bet that each player must make before starting a round.



Card values:– The Ace has a value of 1 point.
– The J has a value of 8 points.
– The Q has a value of 9 points.
– The K has a value of 10 points.
– The rest of the cards have a value equal to their own number.



Hierarchy of events:– By points: refers to the lowest possible sum of points in each player's field, with a minimum of 40 points and taking into account the lowest value of the reserve in case of a tie in points. In case of a tie, we use the next event as a tiebreaker.
– By length: refers to the smallest number of cards in the field. In case of a tie, we use the next event as a tiebreaker.
– By rank: refers to the lowest card in the field. In case of a tie, we proceed to compare the next lowest card and so on until breaking the tie.



Distribution:In the first round, a player is randomly designated as the dealer, who will deal five cards to each player, which will be their field. The remaining cards are placed face down in the center of the table to form the deck. In the next round, the player to the left of the current dealer becomes the dealer. At the start of each round, players place three of their five cards face up on the table to form the "open field," and leave the other two in their hand to form the "closed field."



Turns:The player to the left of the dealer starts their turn and performs these actions in the following order:

1. Take a card from the deck and place it in your "closed field," or decide to stand.
2. Optionally bet any number of chips, as long as it is a multiple of the amphora.
3. Choose one of the cards from your "closed field" and place it face up in your "open field".
4. Decide to stand by choosing not to take any more cards from the deck and horizontally placing a number of cards from your "closed field." Reserve cards are not included in the sum because they are part of the discard.
5. Pass your turn to the player on your left.



Betting:Before the cards are dealt, the amphorae are placed. If a player decides to bet, the other players can:

– Accept the bet by saying "I’m in".
– Reject the bet by saying "I’m out" and lose the round.
– Raise the bet by saying "I raise".

When all players have accepted the bet, the chips accumulate in the "pot". The player who wins the round takes all the chips in the pot.



End of the game:When a player runs out of chips to bet, they are eliminated from the game. The game ends when only one player remains who has not been eliminated, who is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Space Privateer Command
description:
Space Privateer Command is a space game adventure played on 18 cards where players assume the character of a space privateer traveling planet to planet to trade different types of commodities using the dice trading prices on each planet.
Apart from the daily commerce, players may complete missions ranging from destroy freighters or pirates using the space radar combat system. Some privateer jobs are just simple escort VIPS missions or mercy mission to deliver food to planets. All jobs can be found through job postings from the job seeker computer and completing each job with satisfaction will increase the players reputation to satisfy certain scenarios for the game story line. Earning Kredts(cash) will allow players to upgrade their ship. You may buy a new turret gun, add more missiles or even hire crew who will effect certain events and outcomes in combat.
Perhaps tired of the honest living, players could also smuggle some illicit cargo or even do some pirating themselves by attacking poor defenseless freighters to steal precious cargo will incurring the wrath of the local militia. The choice is yours!
There are a small range of enemy fighters to face of during the orbital phase and players will be rolling combat dice to inflict damage during space dogfights or bribe your way out of sticky situations.
Check your fuel gauge and your missiles and strap yourself into this semi “open world” space adventure!

—description from the designer

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Harpers 1
description:
The Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught Expansion - Harpers 1 expands your tactical options with four exciting new characters to add to your games! Ayur, the Aarakocra Monk utilizes mobility to take on multiple opponents while Adnan Zarehm the Fire Genasi Cleric brings light down to burn foes and bolster allies. Eileen Rumrunner the Halfling Sorcerer can win big when gambling on her Wild Magic, and Nurith the Locathah Rogue is a master of the ambush!

Expansion Packs are a perfect way to expand your collection with exciting new characters that ensure you have the right tools for any scenario or opponent you may face. This product adds four new character options to the Harpers faction.

Contents

4 highly-detailed, pre-painted miniatures
4 Combat Dial Cards
8 Level Up Cards
gameplay tokens
rules sheet

-description from publisher's website

name: Instant Celebrity
description:
In Instant Celebrity, the players are all guessing how the next card revealed from a deck will relate to the previous one. Correct guesses are award points and incorrect guesses grant a loss of points.

Once a player has reached at least 15 points, they have won. The other players continue until a majority of players have won or three of a certain symbol have been revealed from the deck.

name: 新幕 桜降る代に決闘を 新劇拡張：神座桜緣起前篇 (A Duel for Falling Cherry Blossoms: New Act – 8th Expansion)
description:
"New Drama Expansion: Kanza Sakura Origin Part 1" is an extension of the "Duel in the Age of Cherry Blossoms" series. A new story inspired by the movie version. The first part of the story depicts an old mystery and the origin of the Kanza Sakura , which is challenged by Renri, who drifted back in time to the Warring States period.

"New Drama Expansion" is a large-scale set in a new form, and includes 2 new Megami and 6 Megami Challenge series, which is a special battle mode.

abacus Megami Akina is the personification of economic games. She invests her capital, and withdraws it in due time, and cunningly collects her profits.
Saw Megami Shisui goes through a harsh thorny road. Give both of them lacerations that open with a time delay, and then screw the blow into the gap with a blow that converts pain into power.

In the Megami challenge, the product versions of Korunu, Hagane, Yukihi, Hatsumi, Himika, and Utsuro.

Contents
Cards: 42, Megami Tarot: 2, Special Board: 1, Special Token: 11
1 rulebook, 2 papers, 2 card folders, 1 card update pack

桜降る代の動乱は決着したかのように見えた。しかし或る来訪が旧き謎の紐を解く。それは時を遡り、戦国の時代へと流れついた夜山恋離の物語 ―― そしてその果に潜む神座桜の縁起だった。旧き天秤を担いし算盤のメガミ「アキナ」とかつて桜に挑みし鋸のメガミ「シスイ」が参戦。本作には彼女たちが持つすべてのカードが収録されているぞ。

『新劇拡張：神座桜縁起 前篇』は『桜降る代に決闘を』シリーズの拡張です。劇場版をイメージした新たな物語。その前篇――時を遡り戦国の時代へと流れ着いた夜山恋離の挑む、旧き謎と神座桜の縁起が描かれます。

『新劇拡張』は新しい形態での大型セットであり、２柱の新たなメガミと特殊な対戦モードであるメガミへの挑戦シリーズ６作が収録されています。
算盤のメガミ・アキナは経済ゲームの体現者です。資本を投資、そして然るべき時に回収し、狡猾に利益を取り立てましょう。
鋸のメガミ・シスイは過酷なる茨道を進みます。両者に時間差で開く裂傷を与え、痛みを力に変えた一撃を間隙へとねじ込むのです。

メガミへの挑戦ではコルヌ、ハガネ、ユキヒ、ハツミ、ヒミカの製品版、そして本作限定収録のウツロが参戦します。クレイジーな原初札と新たな挑戦をお楽しみください。

内容物
カード：42枚、メガミタロット：2枚、特殊ボード：1枚、特殊トークン：11枚
ルールブック：1冊、ペーパー類：2枚、カードフォルダ：2個、カード更新パック：1個
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Relative Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: マリンダウト (Marine Doubt)
description:
There have been vicious falsehoods circulating, such as "Hoshou Marin is in her 30s." This is truly deplorable.
The captain would never lie about his age!
Look at her profile on the official website, it says she is "roughly 17 years old!"
What is needed to counteract the hoax and correct the perceptions of the Internet community is good assertiveness.
Let us, the members gathered here today, compete in our assertions and improve our skills for the coming day.
Now let's get to the question, Hosho Marin is 17 years old!

The numbers 0 to 5 and 8 to 10 appear, but 0, 5, and 10 have different reverse patterns, so the player deduces his or her hand by using that as a clue.
Since the same numbers can be treated as one card, the sexy structure of the game increases both risk and chance at the same time as the number of cards in the hand increases.
If you are the only one left in the hand, you have a chance to score a lot of points, and so on!

name: ニャイスコード (Nyaice! CODE)
description:
Use your luck (dice) and programming ability to
get the first treasure fish and take it home!

Nyaice! CODE is a programing style board game that uses dice to program the actions of cats.

name: 骰棋 (Dice Chess)
description: Dice chess is similar to chess but uses dice instead of standard pieces. Each die face has a set of legal moves, like chess pieces, but each player has 11 dice on a 7x7 board. Dice can either be moved or changed, where two adjacent dice add their numbers and redistribute them. The 1 pip acts as the king.

name: Tiny Troy
description:
Tiny Troy is a 1-2 player card game in which players cooperate to get the Trojan Horse into the city of Troy.
Use Drachma Tokens to buy different cards to keep Soldier Tokens under control, and use special combinations of cards to get better results.
To win, the player/s need to make it through a certain amount of nights inside the Trojan Horse, counted by the Darkness Deck, from which cards good and bad might appear.

Draft and play different cards - There are a variety of cards available to buy and use in strategic ways.
Manage the mayhem of a grumpy army - Think the opposite of worker placement: worker removal!
Ultra-fast turns - Each turn takes only a few seconds, resulting in quickfire gameplay.


The worker placement game where you need to REMOVE workers!

—description from the designer

name: Rad Zone Totality: Science Lab Expansion
description:
This is the first expansion of Rad Zone Totality and is designed to be used in conjunction with the core rules. It includes the search matrix for the Science Laboratory and the building map. All the search matrix references for the map are found below, so this is a totally new location and map for your survivors.
The Science Lab (SCL) search matrices are listed first. Search modifiers do not apply to all tables in the matrix: guidance is provided in the title of the table. Some of the tables are designed to increase the random nature of searching so may point you to another table. At the back of the book are the maps. They included large and smaller formats; on half pages to be stuck together and on a full page giving two print options. Because this is a digital product these pages can be printed individually.

Situation

You have discovered a large building which appears to be a science centre or laboratory. There could be useful loot inside, but you can see from the outside that there has already been some looting and it looks like there may even be people living within the structure. However, there could potentially be medical supplies and handy equipment for the bunker.
You may now select the Science Laboratory when out on mission!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rad Zone Totality: Exhibition Centre Expansion
description:
This is the second expansion of Rad Zone Totality and is designed to be used in conjunction with the core rules. It includes the search matrix for the Exhibition Centre and the building map. All the search matrix references for the map are found below, so this is a totally new location and map for your survivors.

The Exhibition Centre (EXC) search matrices are listed first. Search modifiers do not apply to all tables in the matrix: guidance is provided in the title of the table. Some of the tables are designed to increase the random nature of searching so may point you to another table. At the back of the book are the maps. Because this is a digital product these pages can be printed individually.

UkGamesExpo

This Rad Zone Totality expansion was released to coincide with our first appearance at the 2023 UKGamesExpo in Birmingham, England. It has been designed in homage to this awesome event, although the map provided here is nowhere near the size and scale of the NEC.
Situation

On the outskirts of the industrial sector of the city, you have discovered a large building with a sign at the front reading “Exhibition Centre”. There is a rumour that this place was once used as a base for a small bandit group, but they joined the Quarantine Denizen and haven’t been seen since. You suspect there could be useful loot inside, including Equipment and Raw Materials. There is a huge sun symbol, with a V in the centre, painted on the outside (the symbol of the Quarantine Denizen) and you wonder if this has put off potential looters. You might be in luck today!

You may now select the Exhibition Centre when out on a mission! Refer to the tables in this expansion when exploring the building.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rival Restaurants: Colonel Absaloot Feast
description:
Colonel Absaloot Feast is Rival Restaurant's first cross-over chef. Add a little extra flavor to your game as he sinks his teeth into your opponents.

—description from the publisher

This promo, which contains one chef card and one cardboard standee, is included for free in the deluxe edition of Illiterati or can be purchased directly from the publisher.

name: Baron von Zom's Dice Of The Undead
description:
Baron von Zom and his undead underlings are hungry! To open the portal to the dimension of the living and fill their bellies, they need your help.
If you manage to place 12 dice with the correct value and colour on your player board, the portal will open and the Baron will reward you handsomely - with fresh brains! Muahahaha!

The goal of the game is to collect brains. The first player to fill all die spaces on their board wins a brain. Each player receives a player board and a cogwheel. Shuffle the green and red cards and place them in separate face-down piles on the table. Place 4 dice of each colour per player in a supply on the table.

Draw a green card and read it out loud. The card will show an additional rule, valid for one round. It will make the game trickier or faster and even more fun – so that every round plays differently.

Choose any 3 dice and roll. Your turn ends when you placed 3 dice on your board or you rolled 3 times or you draw a red card.

To place dice you first need to roll a pair. Place that pair on your board in the corresponding colour segment. Now insert the cogwheel into your board accordingly.You can now place single dice on your board. Place them directly adjacent to dice you’ve already placed, in the right colour and with the value indicated by the cogwheel.

After your last roll, if any dice you can't place fit on other players’ boards, you must pass them those dice.

If you roll a straight, you may - but don't have to - draw a red card and carry out its instructions. If you roll a three of a kind, you must draw a red card. Most of the cards are beneficial, some are risky, depending on the situation and your luck.

End of the game: The first player to fill all die spaces on their board wins the round and gets a brain. To win the game you need to collect the requisite amount of brains: 3 brains in a game with 2 players, 2 brains in a game with more players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Incal Infinite
description:
The Incal Infinite is a cooperative board game based on the captivating universe of the famous comic book The Incal created by Alejandro Jodorowsky and Moebius. Immerse yourself in an epic chase across planets where you must escape ruthless enemies, unravel the mysteries of the Incal, and save the galaxies.

In this thrilling game, you'll embody John Difool and his companions, working together as a team to defeat the enemy who seeks to seize the Incal Lumière. The gameplay is fast-paced, the rules are simple, but the challenge is high. Only flawless cooperation can lead you to victory.

The core of the game revolves around the ritual of Transfiguration, where you must reveal the Incal tokens one by one in ascending order. But beware of the sneaky attacks from the enemy, as each game introduces a different adversary with their own powers and strategies.

Explore different planets aboard the Meta-ship, fulfill objectives, reveal the Incal tokens, and use the mystical light of the artifact to annihilate your opponent. Communication between players is crucial, but keep the information confidential and avoid revealing anything about the Incal tokens.

The Incal Infinite offers an immersive experience thanks to Moebius' unmatched artwork, capturing the essence of the The Incal universe. Each game is unique and full of twists, providing exceptional replayability.

Join this mythical quest to preserve the balance of galaxies in The Incal Infinite. Let yourself be carried away by this cooperative adventure where victory depends on your ability to work together and master the powers of the Incal.

Game Features:

Game Rules:

The players must perform the ritual of Transfiguration by revealing the Incal tokens one by one. However, an enemy, different in each game, will use attacks and tricks to hinder this objective. Only the mystical light of the artifact will allow you to annihilate the adversary who is hot on your heels.

When their turn comes, each player can either travel with the Meta-ship, skip their turn, or attempt the Transfiguration ritual. The travel phase consists of three steps:

Move the Meta-ship from 1 to 6 Location tiles.

Explore the location where the Meta-ship has landed. If the condition required by the Location is fulfilled, there is a Revelation: the player can secretly consult the Incal token present on that Location, then place it back without revealing or communicating the number to other players.

Complete their hand by drawing cards until they have 4 cards in hand.

The player who chooses to attempt the Ritual must reveal the Incal tokens of each location one by one in ascending order. If successful, the game is won for everyone! Otherwise, the game is lost.

During the game, players can openly discuss the cards in their hands but must not show them to other players. It is strictly forbidden to talk about the Incal tokens, even through hints.

Think you've understood the strategy ? Poor you ! The game offers 2 enemies (for now). Each one has a different gameplay mechanic. Each creature has its own powers and methods to defeat you. Therefore, in each game, you'll need to collaborate and come up with a new way to overcome the challenges.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction

name: Royal Builders
description:
Royal Builders is a print at home roll and write game for one to four players where you take on a job of constructing buildings in a kingdom, given to you by the Crown. During the game you will gather resources and use them to build infrastructure that will satisfy the King.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: SSO: Wonder of Wubs
description:
A 31 card tuck box including 24 Challenge Cards, 6 Mission cards and 1 Achievement card. Allows players to face a new threat and tell a new story of survival horror on the SSO.
The new deck's theme features an infestation by small, fast breeding, furry creatures who will choke up the ship, taking over locations and even draining morale.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: SSO: Classis Caetera
description:
A 36 card tuck box including 24 Challenge Cards, 6 Mission cards, four new location cards, 1 new crew card and 1 Achievement card. Also includes a divider card, cardboard tokens and two wooden meeples. Allows players to face a new threat and tell a new story of survival horror on the SSO.
The new deck's theme features a terrifying alien creature which stalks and hunts crew through the ship, attacking and killing them. It also include the Vet crewmember and two new locations, the Vents and the Bio Dome.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: CLAUSTRO
description:
Claustro is an abstract two player game, with super simple rules (goal, movement, capture) like many others, but it has a twist on the capture mechanism that makes it engaging, thoughtful and fresh.
Captured pieces are not removed from the board but must be placed back on the board by the player that captured it.
This simple twist make the game hard to master and engaging.
The game is free to be crafted at home and needs just two sets of different color pawns and a 5 by 5 grid (as you can see in the pictures).

Setup
take a five by five grid and place it diagonally oriented between the players, the two corners closest to the players are each other players' respective goals to reach with one of four pawns, the other two corners are non-occupiable squares.
Each player stars with the 4 pawns on the four squares to the left and right border of their closest corner.

Gameplay and Win
Players alternatively take turns moving one square orthogonally towards the goal or capture opponent's pawn diagonally (in all four directions), a captured piece must be immediately placed back on the board on any unoccupied square by the capturing player before passing the turn. The first player that walks a pawn in the goal wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Battle Dentale
description:
Working as a monster in an evil wizard's dungeon isn't easy. It's dark, damp, and your boss has a habit of turning employees into frogs during annual performance reviews.

But perhaps the worst thing is the boredom. Sure, it's exciting when the occasional hero stumbles past and you have a bit of a scuffle. However, most of the time you're just hanging about watching mould grow on the walls.

Deep in the depths of Hoodez Dungeon, Toothache the Troll and Gumrot the Goblin became fed up of sitting around doing nothing. Borrowing the jaws of a nearby skeleton (asking politely first, of course) and some gems they found in a treasure chest, they invented a fun new game of teeth collecting which made the hours between battling adventurers just fly by.

In Battle Dentale, you play either Gumrot the Goblin or Toothache the Troll, competing to collect the best collection of teeth from a jawbone. Toothache favors the cleaner teeth because they're shiny, while Gumrot likes the decaying ones as the smell reminds them of their mum. Winning requires strategy, efficient decision-making, and sometimes evil moves to sabotage your opponent! To win, gather a more highly valued collection of teeth than the other player.
mechanics: Contracts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Take That

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Crimson Dynamo & Darkstar
description:
The Winter Guard arrives in Marvel: Crisis Protocol with the Crimson Dynamo & Darkstar Character Pack! Leading the way is Dimitri Bukhran, the fifth man to bear the title of Crimson Dynamo. His suit of power armor grants him abilities that make him a dedicated soldier for the Russian people. He is joined by Laynia Petrovna, known as Darkstar. Born with the power to access the energy of the Darkforce dimension, she can shape it into constructs or unleash it in powerful blasts.

Together, these characters form the backbone of the Winter Guard, Russia’s answer to the Avengers. In addition to introducing this new affiliation to Marvel: Crisis Protocol, this pack also includes three Team Tactic cards that unlock even more power within Crimson Dynamo, Darkstar, and the other members of the Winter Guard.

Contents:
2 Miniatures
‣ Crimson Dynamo
‣ Darkstar
6 Bases
‣ 2 Round Scenic (50mm)
‣ 4 Round Scenic (35mm)
2 Character Stat Cards
3 Team Tactic Cards
1 Affiliation Card
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: メイドマフィアKY (Maid Mafia KY): Battle for Yokohama
description: Maid Mafia KY: Battle for Yokohama is a standalone expansion to Maid Mafia Kai, adding in a new Factional Conflict mode.

name: Roll'n Bump: Promo Card
description:
Promo card offered for lauching events in some canadian stores. The special card add a new option for winning the game. It's a two sided card. Everyone must choose with which side the game will be played.

This is the only card that can use the white dice for taking it. And if you get the card, you instantly win the game.

One side : you must do a serial with all the numbers (1-2-3-4-5-6).
Other side : you must get 6 same numbers.

name: Galaxy Goldmine
description:
Your mission: mine the asteroid for awesome space treasure! This Galaxy Goldmine game is the out-of-this-world family card game that requires strategic thinking, memory, and a bit of luck. Players take turns exploring the asteroid's 3 layers of cards, full of surprises waiting to be revealed. Players choose from their Tool cards, each featuring a high-tech gadget with a unique capability, to uncover and collect cool space treasure worth points. Players might even find a rare Holomap Fragment leading to the greatest treasure this side of the Milky Way. But watch out for Event cards with pitfalls, aliens, and bandits! When the table draws 3 Black Hole cards, the game ends and the player with the most points wins! Or collect all 3 Holomap Fragment cards to instantly win! Humorously illustrated, this light strategy card game delivers intergalactic fun. And with an eye-catching package and built-in storage, it makes a great travel card game.

SPACE TREASURE-HUNTING CARD GAME: Mine the asteroid for space treasure! In the Galaxy Goldmine game, players rely on a little strategy, memory, and luck as they compete to collect the most cool, shiny stuff

EXPLORE THE ASTEROID WITH HIGH-TECH TOOLS: Grab that Glowtorch! Playing as a treasure-mining bot, strategically select the right Tool card to uncover and claim treasure, artifacts, and Lost Tools

COLLECT AWESOME SPACE TREASURE FOR POINTS: Compete to discover and gather Valuable cards, depicting space gems and "ancient" artifacts to earn points

2 WAYS TO WIN: When the table draws 3 Black Hole cards, the game ends and the player with the most points wins! Or instantly win this fun card game by collecting all 3 rare Holomap Fragment cards

WATCH OUT FOR PITFALLS, BANDITS, AND ALIENS: This asteroid is full of surprises! Hidden in it are Event cards that include bot malfunctions and other gamechangers that can boost a player’s luck or … not

—description from publisher

name: Minikin Berry Brawl
description:
Minikin Berry Brawl is a fast-paced, family-friendly area-control game set in a fantasy forest theme.

Play as "minikin" with cute miniatures and roll your dice to move and control biomes. Gain redberries (currency) and Brawl for Golden Berries. Get 6 Golden Berries to win!

The game allows for plenty of replayability with randomized tiles, Power Berry cards, secret Quests cards to fulfill, and an ability dice that can turn the game around.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Superclub: LaLiga 2022/23 expansion
description:
Manage 240 LaLiga players
12 players from ALL LaLiga clubs
New LaLiga draft board
Attacking and defensive midfielders
Player image and club crest on ALL player cards


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Waters Edge: Fishy Tales
description:
Embrace the coastal fishing theme of Waters Edge by introducing a collection of even more fish-related fun to your game... but watch out for those pesky critics keeping an eye on your restaurants.

This expansion contains 36 cards and a manual presented in a tuck box. A fun expansion pack to enhance and compliment the gameplay of Waters Edge - can be played alongside other expansions.

—description from the designer

name: Treasure of the Dwarves
description:
Deep in the mountains of the dwarven realm...is where you'll find the best deals! In Treasure of the Dwarves, you place treasures up for sale, then evaluate secret bids from the other players. Consider their offers carefully because once you look at a new bid, you can't go back to a previous one. Some treasure is just worth points; others provide special abilities. Only the shrewdest deal-maker will come out on top!

Everyone is involved on every turn of the game as you puzzle over how to collect coins, gems and magical treasures. Knowing what your treasure is worth is important — but so is knowing whose offer to look at first!

name: Undecim
description: Settle the new continent of Redstone over five rounds. Draft actions, carefully manage your resources, and make the most of your opportunities to score the most points in this very fast city-building game.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Hunted: Kobayashi Tower Promo cards
description:
5 new cards for Hunted: Kobayashi Tower.

1x new weapon card: Bazooka
2x new hazard cards: Fire Alarm and Duck!
2x new locations cards: Kitchen and Restaurant

Available with the crowdfunding of the Hand of Destiny.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hunted: Mining Colony – 415 Promo Cards
description:
Five new cards for Hunted: Mining Colony 415:

1x new weapon card: Grenade Launcher
2x new hazard cards: Falling Crates and Android Attack!
2x new locations cards: The Lift and Greenhouse

Available with the crowdfunding of the Hand of Destiny.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Flicking, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aurora Citadel
description:
In the depths of the cosmos, a battlefield awaits in Aurora Citadel. This gripping game seamlessly combines the elements of deckbuilding and area control, immersing players in a dynamic conflict.

With each turn, Aurora Citadel presents a captivating challenge: how will you maneuver through the battlefield? As you accumulate control, the lure of purchasing new units beckons, but choose wisely.

Prepare to engage in a symphony of warfare as Aurora Citadel unveils its diverse array of units. Infantry, swift and adaptable, prove formidable against ranged units, whose precision strikes can decimate the armor division. Yet, armored behemoths possess the resilience to withstand the relentless onslaught of infantry forces.

Enter the cosmic arena and stake your claim in Aurora Citadel. With seven unique units across three distinct categories, the possibilities for strategic mastery are endless. The path to victory lies in your hands as you command your troops, chart your course, and seize control.

—description from the designer

name: Vaturankha Island: Solitaire roleplaying game
description:
Prepare your sheet, make plot decisions, roll the dice, fight, equip, imagine what will happen, consult the oracle… because now you are the protagonist. If you are reading this paragraph, it means that you have decided to enter Black Sphynx, a collection of books designed for solo roleplaying.

This full-color book in PDF format is a visual oracle whose main purpose is to give you the opportunity to live an incredibly ‘replayable’ adventure. As such, it will be in some ways unlike anything you’ve seen before. In short, what distinguishes this oracle from many others is its ability to create a very visual story. As a result, you will travel through a world that will always be different, set against the backdrop of a goal-based adventure. So, from a starting point, you will shape the game universe by going through different pages.

As you progress, you will discover images that will present you with a variety of challenges. These may be physical, mental, social or resource-related. Successfully overcoming one of these challenges can earn you Action Points, so that you can progress from one act to the next until you reach the final challenge and end the adventure.

If you are already used to using an oracle, you will find that this one will guide you quite a lot, giving you the necessary guidelines to enter the world presented to you and live your story. To play this book, you will also need the first volume of the Black Sphynx collection, entitled The Sibyl’s Scrolls. This is an extensive collection of oracles, easy and quick to use, which will be very useful as you move through the game universe. In this way, we will use The Sibyl’s Scrolls to provide narrative, description, additional information and answers to the events of your adventure. Don’t worry if you have any questions about this now, as they will be answered throughout the rules.

—description from the designer

name: Os Desejos do Sultão: Expansão Viajantes
description:
The Travelers Expansion (Expansão Viajantes) adds new Sultan's Moods, new effects for Task Cards, and new ways to score in The Sultan's Wishes basic game, whether by bringing gifts from neighboring villages to the Sultan or even finding Relics along the paths of the desert.

It includes 7 Miniexpansions: The Favorite, Supporters, Attack of the Pigeons, Special Tasks, Sultan of Cockapoo, Snake Charmer, and The Genie.

name: Intrighi subacquei
description:
Behind the appearance and hidden among the details of an illustration of a densely populated underwater landscape with organisms, there are four adventures concealed, narrated in a booklet. As the stories unfold, players must carefully observe the illustration to find the solutions to the various questions and puzzles posed by the different characters.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Puzzle

name: Humbug: das zweifelhafte Kartenspiel – Original Edition 2
description:
This "dubious" card game is a crazy-cheeky card game ideal for cheating, guessing, bluffing and betting!
It's perfect for fun, casual game nights with friends and family!

Guess if the player whose turn it is is either describing the picture on the card or making up a scenario. Unmask the swindler and collect points in the form of betting chips.

name: Colossi
description:
A 2-4 player tactical hand-building game that gives you loads of opportunities to be clever and outwit your opponents.

You are a Colossus, battling for control of beautiful Environments. You will build hands on 3 different Environments at once because you don't yet know where the next Skirmish will happen. Each player starts with an identical deck, but you can steal / sacrifice cards to create a better deck. Each Environment and Item has special rules that create interesting and unique problems and opportunities. Colossi rewards clever tactics and thinking on your feet.

The first player to win 3 Skirmishes wins the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game

name: 九頭竜館の殺人 (Kuzuryukan no satsujin)
