description: The day after a seance held in an old mansion. In the back of the basement, the body of a psychic who claimed to have "witch's blood" was found. The suspects are a reporter, a university professor, a painter, a chauffeur, and the owner of the mansion, all of whom attended the seance and have different backgrounds. What shadow will the legend of the "monster that ruled the people in ancient times" that remains in this area cast over the case?

name: Bagarre
description:
Bagarre is an hidden roles game!

You work in one of the 3 cooperatives, and nobodies know wich one.
The goal is to sell 5 products from your cooperative!

Look what players sell, and attack them to steal the products and guess in what cooperative they are working for!

—description from the designer

name: YouBet!
description:
YouBet! is a fast-paced and strategic card game for two to four players, in which short and alternating alliances arise between the players each round. In the end, only one can be the winner. Who knows how to best play the game and their fellow players?

In YouBet!, players form a pile of a total of 12 cards each round. In advance, each player indicates the colour and the number they will play for that round. The goal of the game is to collect enough, but not too many, of your colour and number. However, you only have limited influence on the pile, so you will have to work together to earn the most points. Who you work with varies every round, and sometimes you are completely on your own.

—description from the publisher

name: Tank Crew: A Solitaire Game of WWII Tank Combat
description:
Tank Crew is a Campaign and Tactical Battle System of low to moderate complexity that focuses on a single Tank Crew controlled by the Player. The Player has the option of playing as an American or German Tank Crew. If playing as a German Tank Crew, the Player can select between a Western or Eastern Front Campaign. Can your Tank Crew survive the rigors of Combat and bring Victory to your side’s cause?

—description from the designer

name: The Realm of Shadows: Expansion Cards
description:
7 new heroes and 5 new monsters for:

The Last Stronghold;
The Hand of Destiny; and
The forgotten Road.


This is a collection of stretch goals from the 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

name: Multiplier
description:
A simple pen and paper game for two players. Beginners should use a 3x3 grid at first, so just draw a tic-tac-toe board and you're ready to go!

The game starts on an empty board. Before the match begins the players must choose a set of numbers equivalent to the number of spaces on the board. Since a 3x3 grid is 9 spaces you could use 1-9, 2-10, or 3-11 for example. The most popular sequence so far has been 2-10. To play you take turns writing a number from the set in an empty space. Each number can only be used once. The match is over when the board is full.

One player's score is the product (remember, product means multiply) of each row added up and the other player's score is the product of each column added up, so make sure you decide which player is which before you start. Highest score wins. Draws go to whichever player DOESN'T move last.

Use the pie rule for balance. Some opening moves are strong, and some are weak, try to figure out the most balanced options. The pattern of winning and losing choices is interesting.

For a co-op game try to create draws! Draws are extremely rare and difficult to create.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Superclub: Chelsea 2021/22
description:
Blue is the colour, football’s the game. Take charge at Stamford Bridge and lead Chelsea to the promised land. The faithful are holding out for someone to make them compete for the title again, someone to show them there’s a Blue Day on the horizon. Is it you?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Terror in the Night Game Supplement
description:
When the cold sun sets and the shadow of night falls across the land, terrors comes out to stalk the forests and streets of Shadowbrook. As townsfolk go missing and rumors spread, it quickly becomes clear that this brooding evil is stealing folk for a purpose, and no one is safe in the dark!

This 15-card Game Supplement for the ''Dark Gothic'' Deck Building Game is themed for the Terrors that stalk the night. It inlcudes a set of new Terror in the Night Minions, as well as new Events, Gear, Locations, and Allies. This supplement utilizes the new Roaming mechanic first introduced in the ''Colonial Horror'' Expansion.

name: Pöbbkviss 3
description:
The latest in the popular Icelandic series, Pöbbkviss 3 is a thrilling trivia game designed to provide entertainment for a broad range of social gatherings. Riding on the significant success of its predecessors in 2020 and 2021, this edition presents players with 1,000 completely new questions across diverse categories, including general knowledge, famous quotes, "fivefold," and the intriguing 'three hints' category.

Suitable for an unlimited number of participants, Pöbbkviss 3 maintains the tradition of its series, typically being played in teams with one person acting as the quizmaster. The game is flexible, supports various gameplay styles, and is guaranteed to challenge and engage trivia lovers in equal measure. Whether you're on a road trip or at a party, Pöbbkviss 3 promises a compelling blend of fun and knowledge-sharing.

name: Paladini
description:
Paladini is played on a hex board (5 or 6 spaces per side). On his turn, the two players must place a new hexagonal tile on the board, then they must put a paladin on it, moving it from another tile or playing a new one (each player have three paladins).
There are two kinds of hex tiles. The paladin played on a "knight" tile becomes a knight and it will be able to move in three directions, in a streight line, a number of hexagons he wants (but without going beyond other tiles).
The paladin played on a "duke" tile becomes a duke and can move in all the six directions, but only of one hexagon.
To move a paladin already on the board, the new tile must be on a hexagon that can be reached by him.
Furthermore, new tile cannot played on hex controlled by opposing paladins.
When one of the two players has no more moves available, the opponent will be the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: So Many Clues
description:
In So Many Clues you will have to cooperate to find the answers. During the game you will have to work out how the 20 clues are connected. Be careful, it’s easy to go down the wrong track. As you figure out the clues you will discover which five answers the clues are pointing to - hopefully before your opponents.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hvem gennemskuer først alle ledetrådene og finder svarene?

Det er nemt at se forbindelsen mellem ledetrådene Rogn, Skæg og Nytår, når I ved, at I skal finde en fisk. Men kan I finde svarene i fem forskellige kategorier, når de mange ledetråde er blandet sammen?

I So Many Clues kræver det overblik, viden og samarbejde at finde frem til svarene. I løbet af spillet skal I finde ud af, hvordan de 20 ledetråde hænger sammen, men pas på, for det er nemt at komme på vildspor. Efterhånden som I får styr på ledetrådene, vil I gennemskue, hvilke fem svar ledetrådene peger på – forhåbentligt før modstanderholdet.
Sådan har I aldrig quizzet før!

—description from the publisher

name: Biomos: Montagnes Suspendues Carte Promo
description:
A promo card for Biomos available to Ulule backers and during some events.
Add the card to the Giant Biomes deck. This card is harder to fulfill but is worth 12 points instead of the 10 poits of every other Giant Biome.

name: The Four Horsemen: Omega War
description:
In 2025, aliens make first contact with Earth. They've arrived hoping to find a rich new source of resources or advanced technological trading partners. After all, they've detected deep space probes and evidence of space travel. Needless to say they're disappointed

Now 100 years later, humanity has made a name for itself as tenacious and resourceful mercenaries. Unable to face most aliens hand to claw, they've developed powered combat armor known as CASPers, Combat Assault Systems Personal. These 8 foot tall, half ton combat suits have given humanity a serious edge, and the aliens are tired of it.

In a carefully coordinated plot, Earth has been invaded, and the human merc armies fled in order to survive. With Earth occupied, the Omega War is underway. The future of Earth, her few tiny colonies and all of our people's lives are at the stake. This is the Omega War

The Four Horsemen: Omega War is a tactical, strategic and operational competitive card game for two to four players set in the Four Horsemen literary universe created by Chris Kennedy and Mark Wandrey. It is a brutal struggle for power that rewards both careful planning and bold execution as you assume the role of a Commander for one of the various factions.

—user summary
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Biomes of Nilgiris
description:
Biomes of Nilgiris is a board game in which players venture into India's surreal Nilgiri biosphere, teeming with unique flora and fauna. As conservationists — ecologists, photographers, and citizen scientists — they aim to discover new species, address ecological issues, complete conservation missions, and earn ecology points.

Players collaboratively adapt to two ever-changing scenarios in each game, introducing fresh concepts and objectives. As specialists, they explore the vast reaches of Nilgiris, journal field entries, gain experience at the station, equip themselves with tools, conserve species in their habitat, and skillfully resolve ecological challenges. The game is intended to be an immersive experience celebrating nature's wonders and the art of conservation.

The game is set in a turn-based, mission-oriented format. Each turn, players can take three of eight actions:


TRAVEL on the modular board
EXPLORE to open up new biome cards
JOURNAL to take notes on a field guide
STUDY to gain usable XP from your notes
DISCOVER new species
EQUIP a new equipment
CONSERVE species or biomes, primarily to gain ecology points


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Legion: The Siberian Story
description: After the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk, the Czechoslovak legions were stranded in Russia in the middle of Civil war. To reach their new homeland, the Czechoslovaks had to endure a hardly believable journey across the whole Siberia to the Pacific coast. In Legions we try to capture the small stories of this odyssey. Each player leads one faction in order to dominate others. Each faction has unique set of soldiers at their disposal and each soldier’s capabilities evolves around the way – both in the positive and the negative way. The goal is simple – to outsmart the opponents playing the right cards at the right moment and to use your Order tokens, so you will always have some trick up in your sleeve.
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 6: Evil Horde Faction
description:
Of Leeches and Scorpions

Expand your battles with an exciting add-on featuring two new heroes from the Evil Horde:
Leech and Scorpia! The menacing Leech possesses the power to drain mana from his enemies,
making him an awe-inspiring adversary for all mages. Meanwhile, with her deadly stinger and
ability to control lesser minions, Scorpia is a fearsome melee fighter and a tough nut to crack.
With these new characters, you can unleash even more mayhem on the battlefield and tip the
scales of victory in your favor!

-description from publisher

Box contains:

- 1x Additional rules booklet
- 1x Manual
- 2x Character minis
- 1x Terrain accessory
- 17x Cards

name: Voice of the Arabs: A 1967 – Sword of Israel Story
description:
In June 1967, Israel needed just four days to crush the armies of Egypt and Jordan, and then two more to finish off Syria. It was an overwhelming defeat for the Arab powers, and it has shaped the power politics of the Middle East and the world at large ever since.

But that’s not the story the Egyptian public heard. The powerful radio station Voice of the Arabs, located in Cairo, pumped out an absurd set of “alternative facts” regarding the course of the war. In this tale, the Egyptians and their allies were beating the hell out of the Israelis and on their way to an overwhelming victory.

Voice of the Arabs is a Campaign Study (a short book of scenarios and history) based on the story of the 1967 Six-Day War as the radio station told it: with the Egyptians and their allies overcoming the well-trained and well-equipped Israelis. It is and it isn’t alternative history: the battles never happened, but the Egyptian-sponsored fake news said they did.

Voice of the Arabs adds 11 new scenarios to 1967: Sword of Israel, split into two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. This being an Avalanche Press product, there’s also the background story of the battles that never happened. You’ll need 1967: Sword of Israel (and only 1967: Sword of Israel) to play all 11 scenarios.

—description from the publisher

name: Cookierun Memory Battle
description:
Cookierun Memory Battle is a memory game that uses the Cookierun IP. Players find two Cookie tiles that can defeat each monster and save the kingdom!

Place the 16 tiles face down on the game board and reveal 3 monster cards. Two Cookies are shown on each monster card. Try to find a team of two Cookies on one of three monster cards. If you succeed, you win that card and the two Cookie pawns and bring them in front of you.

If a Cookie pawn is owned by another player, take it from that player. The game ends when someone has four cards, and each card and Cookie pawn counts as one point.

—description from the publisher

name: Something Wild! SpongeBob SquarePants
description:
Something Wild is a line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. The first player to score three powers wins the game.

With Something Wild: SpongeBob SquarePants, you can score a set to snag the special power of your favorite animated sponge to help you win!

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: The Underground Challenge: Paris / New York
description:
NOTE: This mini-expansion requires a copy of On the Underground: Paris / New York.

In The Underground Challenge, you will compete against real Underground lines. The map starts with multiple lines already built, and you must try to beat the Underground's score.

Much like the engineering crews of the Underground, you must be quite resourceful at building track, and at the same time divert passengers to use your own lines, rather than the official ones.

If you can beat the Underground at its own game before the Destination cards run out, you win The Underground Challenge!

Each turn:
Take four actions - with each being placing Track tokens or taking Branch tiles, as in normal gameplay.
Perform Passenger movement.
Perform Passenger movement again.
The Passenger will thus visit one or two stations, and the Destination cards matching those stations will be removed and replaced as in normal gameplay.

The Passenger then will visit another one or two stations, with the destination cards matching those stations also being removed and replaced.

Passenger movement rules are the same as in the game for multiple players, with the following exception:
If a Passenger movement is up to the player’s choice (due to an equal number of empty spaces and lines involved in each potential route), the player must choose the route that gives the Underground the most points.

If all potential routes would give the Underground and the player equal points, the player may choose any one of those lines.

If your Score tile reaches or overtakes the Underground’s tile, the game is over, and you have successfully completed The Underground Challenge!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Prized Potions
description:
In an attempt to become the most-famous, highest-paid, awesomest alchemist ever, you need to get to work.

Your lab is a mess. There is one clear set of shelves that already holds a Storage Container, little bowls for solids, and traps for focused energy. First, plan your day. Second, do something like buying raw materials or storing energy. Then, after everyone else does something, do it again, then again. Since those three projects will fill your day, clean up the lab for tomorrow.

Eventually you will have the materials required to create Compounds, then Potions. After that, you can do really cool stuff like convert a compound and use its effect to transmute raw materials, or drink a potion and alter time. Or, best of all, fulfill the requirements of a Prize to get a really cool trophy for your shelf. The first player to get three trophies on their shelf wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Tenth Edition): Starter Set
description:
Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

Take your first steps into the 41st Millennium with this Introductory Set for Warhammer 40,000. This box is a great way to get familiar with this amazing hobby, as you build and paint incredible models, then play your first games. It includes two sets of push-fit models, a set of hobby tools and paints, a game mat, helpful guides, tokens and terrain markers, plus all the dice and tools you need to play. Pick the noble Space Marines or swarming Tyranids, give control of the other models to a friend or family member, and battle it out for hours of entertainment. If you’re thinking about giving Warhammer 40,000 a try, this is your chance – it's also an excellent way to expand your existing collections.

—description form the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Quests Over Coffee: Journeys
description:
Quests Over Coffee: Journeys is a fast, easy to pick up, solo adventure card game where you explore in depth a quest from the Quests Over Coffee quest board. Each journey spans multiple cards, where the choices you make can lead you to one of multiple outcomes. Pick your favorite character, your favorite brew, and go on an adventure today!

What's included: The Base Game has almost everything you need to start playing! You just need some dice and a deck of playing cards and you're good to go. The Base Set includes a short story-based Journey (i.e. story with choices) as well as a "High Score" Journey where you just beat up on some baddies. There's a player aid and a D&D conversion card too. Oh! It also includes 6 promo Enemies my eldest, Oliver, drew.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play
